Clean and quiet hotel located between Central Park and Times Square. We walked everywhere like Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Columbus Circle, Times Square and even 911 Memorial and then took subway back. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

A last minute booking through Hotwire did not show up in the hotel’s system, necessitating calls to Hotwire and a wait that seemed very long at a late hour of the night. The front desk manager, Elizabeth Cacovic, greeted me so warmly and handled this situation so gracefully. I was eventually settled into my room, a clean, elegant space that offered a weary traveller a peaceful night of rest. In the morning all the details of my booking were fully resolved with Kemi and I was on my way. Everyone at the Park Central was kind. I highly recommend staying there for its location and lovely atmosphere which really gives one a feeling of the beauty of the city, but also the warmth of all the people working there— a true New York experience.

Centrally located hotel with a lively bar & convenient store located in the lobby. Spacious-clean guest rooms & Very helpful staff! Thank you Senia! For being attentive, resourceful & taking the time to make sure my stay exceeded expectations!
user_name:
JillG1525
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at Park Central for four nights, our first time to this hotel and New York, it is in a great position and walking distance to all the land marks. We had a king room on the sixth floor it was a little run down but a great size and the bed was large and very comfy which we much prefer than immaculate paintwork or a slight frayed carpet. We never issued any problems with the lifts as many other reviews have stated apart from New Year’s Eve just after midnight but everyone was coming back in from celebrating so understandable but they where staffed and the wait wasn’t that long. Would like to mention Carmelo the doorman who made sure our checkout was quick and simple, he had our bags ready and a taxi waiting outside at the time we asked for, go see him when you want to check out 5 stars Carmelo. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely return, thanks Park Central we had a great time and great new year..

we enjoy the stay at the hotel!the hotel is located in a great place near the Central Park.we ‏receive a great atention from the personal of the hotel.we receive special help from guest service .‏Elizabeth and jason help us a lot!they was excelent

Once a lovely spot to stay for our trips of the city, this hotel is now suffering not just from age but from pure neglect: 1) only one elevator operating for the 4th floor leaving us standing, waiting endlessly as every five minutes or so a car would stop, only to be full. Eventually we took the up elevator to the top in order to get down to the lobby (this happened more than once). 2) Torn seats in the banquets in the lounge. 3) Only one face cloth, no bathmat and a total of two towels in the bathroom; 4) No doormen at all...Thankfully, still a competent and friendly staff who seemed to be at their wits ends about the sad fall of a once lovely hotel. We do not plan to stay there ever again.

Great customer service here at this luxury hotel. Staff are super helpful and very courteous. Room was new and very clean, sitting area was a great retreat after touring around the city. location was also convenient to Broadway and 5th Ave. Will definitely be coming back again.

Vito received us at the check in and his services was amazing!! Vito made sure we felt like home and offer us different alternatives to have in NYC. Vito is the Best!! Will definitly return ti The Park Central thanks to Vito!!

Just returned from 6 nights stay at Park Central. The hotel was lovely and clean, staff were mostly friendly and the room was a good size. Would definitely stay again! The hotel is about a 10 minute walk away from Central Park in one direction and a 15 minute walk to Times Squara. Close to the subways too. Be aware that they charge $38 a day fee to cover services like gym etc and it isn't optional. It wasnt advertised anywhere on the holiday booking and was a bit of a surprise when we arrived.

Park Central Hotel provided a perfect spot for our stay in the city that never sleeps, during an immensely busy week. The staff was consistently courteous, a ticketed luggage closet was available for early arrival and checking it out prior to needing to leave for the airport. The Classic King room, was the perfect size for two. My husband and I like to workout during our vacations, and we took full advantage of the gym. This is not a typical hotel gym, in that there was a pair of Peloton bikes, several other pieces of cardio equipment, and multiple options for weights, kettlebells and plenty of space. We enjoyed drinks at the hotel bar and were tended to by friendly bartenders. And the location was excellent.... It's about a five minute walk to the entrance of Central Park and about 10 minutes the other direction, takes you right into Time's Square. My husband and I stood out in front of the hotel and we were able to see the ball drop at midnight, to ring in the New Year, which was perfect for us. There are plenty of restaurants and coffee shops in the area, as well. If you're planning to take an uber to or from the airport, it cost us on average $55 between arriving and departing. All in all, I would definitely recommend Park Central Hotel.

Return visit for the family the week leading up to Christmas. The Park Central is recommended for convenience, clean rooms (comfortable beds and good facilities), helpful staff and ambience. We had a family of four adults and took an optional upgrade for a room with a street view, which was worth the investment. Only disappointment is that at certain times you can expect to queue for lifts up and down, (and this was an issue last time we visited four years ago). But if you are looking for a cost effective family stay in Midtown, two blocks from Central Park and well connected on Subway and bus routes, then this would be an excellent choice, and to be fair, I would start here again myself if booking NYC again

I was very pleased with the level of service received during my recent stay at the Park Central hotel at the end of December 2019. I checked in with Vito and he was very helpful, friendly, and courteous. He did a fantastic job welcoming us and answered all my questions with a smile. The entire hotel staff was very friendly and pleasing down to all the maids I had interactions with. Everyone was very kind. My family has been coming to this hotel since 2012 and haven't used a different one since. Perfect location and has a very sleek/modern look inside. When you can walk out of the hotel and be at Central Park within 5 minutes or walk the other way and be in Time Square in 10-15 minutes or up to 5th Avenue shopping in 10 minutes, you know you're in a great location.

Location is very good. Rooms are average but fairly priced. When looking at pricing look at the added service fee of $40 a day. When you see hotel room price online at hotels.com, etc this fee is not included. A small case of bait and switch.

this place has giving my and my boyfriend a great experience! love the way darren vito and alex took care of us ! i felt home! ill definitely come back . i love th atmosphere, ambience and the good staff , they are so friendly

This place has been amazing, I loved the ambiance, atmosphere is perfect for couple and perfect for people who love staying and bison around , Daren , Alex and Vito give us great service and I feel like family already! Love this place I’ll definitely come back :)

We came during the holidays, firstly the location is in a really good place near Times Square and Central Park. There are lots of things to do like hiring a bike to cycle round Central Park, visiting time square, loads of eating places variety of foods, we would advise you to research and see what you would like to do it can cost but if you save there are great places to go and activities!Just be prepared to walk!.The hotel itself was not one of the most fabulous stays we have had!. Positive is that it smells nice, looks pretty when you walk in and clean. Has it’s own snack and coffee shop, the lady who cleaned our room was lovely very accommodating when we needed things. Downside there were no tea or coffee amenities, which when you are paying money I would expect it as most hotels have it. You have to ask for a kettle and fridge plus you are charged 38$ per night which is ridiculous, The rooms are ok decor was abit wear and tear, lock was broken on the window which let a lot of cold in, bathroom was freezing!.Always busy, very noisy if you stay on the road side of the hotel!.It wouldn’t be a hotel we would return too sadly. But overall it was an ok experience!

Very close to 5th Avenue and Central Park. Very close to subway station and very convenient. Within walking distance of any tourist locations that are of interest and very close to very nice experiences.

mix of business/friends during holiday time. The perfect midtown location with very friendly staff, concierge, mail/delivery desk, lounge and snack/coffee bar. Computer/printers available 24/7 off lobby. Close to banks, restaurants $-$$$ and taxi service readily available. Rooms quite spacious, very clean and upgrades available. (public parking garage around the corner)

Convenient location near Central Park and Time Square. I wanted a view and when I came to management Daren made it happen. He even gave us complimentary candy. My son was so happy and hyper lol. I wish there was a vending machine but getting water was easy if you go to management.

Booked a Times Square view room, very nice view and the room was nice. House keeping ladies were very friendly but front desk staff were rude, they nearly seemed over worked and grouchy. No hot water at 6pm.

The hotel presented very nicely with an attractive foyer and lovely Christmas decorations. The room was comfortable . The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was no fridge in the room nor was there a dining room for at least breakfast. There was only a kiosk selling coffee and pastries. The location is great, close to to Central Park and major stores. Also close to the theatre district.

I had stayed at the Park Central a number of years ago and was satisfied with the experience, so when it popped up on a travel site with a $115 a night rate for a king bed, I jumped on it. I wish I never had. The first hurdle was construction in front of the hotel with no way to pull your car up to unload. We had tried to call the hotel earlier to determine if they had valet parking, but for hours, we only got a busy signal so we decided to take chance. No luck. After parking elsewhere, we arrived to find chaos in the lobby. The people at the front desk, while not outwardly rude, seemed as if they were annoyed with having to register us. The elevator situation is awful with people crowded into a small space waiting for only two elevators. The room was comfortable enough, but the first night, the party in the next room started singing and shouting with loud music at 4:30 a.m. I called to reception to ask them to send security. A half hour later, when nothing happened, I called again. I was told they were on their way. A full hour after my first call, I called again and was again told they were on their way. I asked whether they were coming from Hoboken! At that point, my husband got dressed and went down to the front desk. Shortly after that, I heard security knock next door. The music stopped, I could hear talking, and then security left. Ten minutes later the music was back on. We later went to reception and asked to have our room changed because I couldn't go through another night like that. The man at reception waved me away to a customer service desk. After much maneuvering, another room was reserved for us but we had to check our luggage as the room wasn't ready. The second night was better but we couldn't wait to leave. I was hoping we could get a bellman to get us a cab since the street was blocked with construction, but no bellman, no doorman. We walked a block to get a taxi. I guess that's what you get for $115 a night (plus tax and hotel fees) in New York City.

First time for my mom here in NYC and it couldnt be any better. Thank goodness for the help of Emanuel at reception. He guided us to the best venues for dinner and made sure we were well taken care of whenever he was on shift.

Every time i come to New York I stay here at the PC and it’s like a home away from home. Emanuel at the front desk always tends to us and is magnificent. Can’t wait to come again next year to visit. This time with more family.

My wife and I had a short stay in the fabulous Hotel in mid December. Superb facilities and excellent location close to Times Square, Broadway Theatres and Central Park. But additionally this Hotel has superb Staff who are welcoming, polite, informative, and ready to resolve any issues - we were very impressed with the service provided by Saleem and Angela in Hotel Reception.You will not be disappointed if you book your stay in New York at this Hotelwelshman0nthem0ve

We were a family of ten traveling to NYC with two children for 6 nights. We had reservations made over booking of 3 rooms with double beds. We arrived to the hotel at 10:45 pm. When we tried to do the check in, a very rude front desk worker told us that our credit card was cancelled, so our rooms, but just two of them were cancelled and that they were sold out. She told us that our better chance was to check availability somewhere else (in Christmas, really?).Finally around 12:30pm the manager decided to look for the booking confirmation e-mail and there it was. So they change their speech, but even so, we, as costumers, had to deal between booking and the hotel. Because the manager hotel was lazy enough to make a phone call. They eventually squeezed us in 3 king sized beds (remember we were 10), so some of us had to sleep on the floor. The second day they finally give the rooms that we booked but our surprise was that when we did the check-out they charged us 200$ extra for the first night rooms. To sum up, terrible treatment and you better don’t have a trouble. Because you are going to be on your own.We won’t never repeat at this hotel

Stayed at Park Central in November celebrating my Birthday. The hotel is in an excellent location, just a 5/10 minute walk to Central Park one way and 5/10 minute walk to Times Square the other way. Metro stations are just up the road too! Rooms are clean and fairly spacious for a New York City hotel room. Staff are more than happy to help with anything you need. Only negative thing I would say is the building work taking place around the hotel, obstructing any view from the rooms. However, I imagine this is only temporary. Definitely recommend the Park Central if you’re planning on visiting NYC.

This was my first time in NY and I was very happy with the location within walking distance to both Time Square and Central Park. Rooms were small but well appointed and modern. Service at the front desk was pleasant and fast. Great value hotel in NYC! I would book again!

I’ve made this hotel my go to when I have clients in midtown. It’s the perfect location and its easy to find with a huge bar and sitting space for quick client meetings . This visit was a slightly different because of the construction around the building and some reservation changes that I needed to make due to my clients scheduling. My secretary had tried to update my reservation several times but was unable to connect with a person who could help and was connected to several voicemails or the central reservations people who said they could not help her and they justified this because the reservation was from a booking agent and not from them. This explanation didn’t resonate with me because the issue was more so not being able to get a live person from the front desk and being connected to voicemails. When I got there I was obviously shocked because of the massive roadblock and construction fencing at the entrance. At reception I told the lady of my frustrations and I’m not sure why but I was asked to wait for a manager and became frustrated because it was taking longer than I anticipated. I have stayed here before and there have been hiccups but this was annoying and I complained, the lady at reception Jet? Offered me a drink while I waited and eventually I was put in contact with Mr. Hightower who remembered me from a previous visit?? Listened to me and reassured me that he’d take care of the room request and make sure my stay would go well. He issued me his card and less than 10 minutes returned with my room keys, a gift bag and said that my preferences were noted and the room I was assigned to was away from the noise and on the side of the hotel with the faster elevators and asked me to give him my secretaries information to help her with last minute changes in the future- wow! This kid gets it! If he could only Get live people to answer the phones and speed up the elevators!!! They have my business for life.

From the first time we arrived there are no one greet us or even help us. The Front office ladies are all arrogant. There are additional cost (amenitties) you need to pay daily which they dont tell when we booked the hotel onlineThere are scafolding around the building making the hotel looks old. but the room is clean

My clients visited this hotel for a quick two-night getaway in December. They raved about the hotel's location, clean rooms, and great service during the stay. After check out on the train home, they mentioned that "Floppy," the beloved bunny of their 5-year-old, had been left at the hotel. Quimby and the hotel team not only tracked down the missing bunny in the hotel's central laundry, they mailed the beloved toy back with a huge poster of all the great places at the hotel that Floppy had visited - from the spa to the gym to a great dining experience (with fresh veggies, of course). It was a fantastic ending and it made the daughter's day to see her beloved bunny back. I can't speak highly enough about how these people went out of their way to service my clients. I'll 100% be sending guests again in the future.

I recently stayed at the Park Central Hotel in NYC. It is clear that it is under a state of transformation with major exciting exchanges to follow. I know this not only from staying there and asking questions, but most importantly from the recent interaction I've had with the hotel's upper management personnel, Erik Palmer, Managing Director of both the Park Central Hotel New York and its sister hotel, the WestHouse Hotel New York, and Linda Foster, Director of the Front Office. I want to encourage anyone staying at the hotel to reach out to these two wonderful, reactive and responsive Directors. They truly do want the customer's experience to be a positive one and will do whatever it takes to make that happen. The hotel is changing, but for the better. Of course, with any major changes, there are kinks to be worked out, so if something comes up while you are there, do not be shy to reach out to either Erik or Linda. They will help you! I can't wait to come back to this gorgeous, incredibly situated hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Don't let the facade of what is going on with the outside of the hotel deter you from all the great things that are happening inside. Once you set foot in the hotel, you won't want to leave!

I stayed at this hotel last minute for one night in March while I was in town to run the NYC Half Marathon. The location was perfect - very close to Central Park. Everyone was friendly and accommodating. There was a little coffee shop in the lobby that also sold pastries and snacks. The hotel was clean and I’d stay here again!

Nightmare from the beginning. Before arriving, we called numerous times to confirm they had valet and parking. Over the course of an entire morning, only a busy signal. When we drove up to the hotel, there was no access because of street construction and we of course had not been advised of this. When we finally checked in, the staff was not particularly welcoming. The two elevators to our floor had a long line of people and suitcases trapped into a very tight area. All of this could have been forgiven, but at 4:30 in the morning we were awakened by loud music, singing and shouting from the next room. When we called guest services asking them to send security - twice- no one ever came. Worst hotel stay EVER!

We had an amazing experience with Q at checkout. Wish we met him sooner because he was personable and accommodating. Room was new and clean, location was also convenient to Broadway and 5th Ave. Construction didn’t affect our experience at all, as it was very quiet all night and morning. Will definitely be coming back and hope to see Q and his staff again!

We recently stayed at the Park Central Hotel for two nights. We reserved the Premium Corner with two Queens. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful and open. The hotel has scaffolding around it that interrupted our room view slightly. If we had known it was under construction we wouldn’t have splurged for the view. We were very disappointed in the cleanliness of our room. There was old toothpaste splattered on the bathroom door and walls. The tub had grime inside and the shower sounded like a machine gun when turned on. There was also lipstick smeared on the door. The cabinet under the sink was corroded and peeling. The window tint in the shower was also peeling off. There was a significant layer of dust on our headboard and the desk lampshade had food splattered on it. Our comforter had black dirt on it. I expected this hotel to be of higher quality, especially for over $400 per night. I spoke with Guest Services who offered a discounted rate, waived the facilities fee and a reclean. We were happy with that and left for the day. We returned later in the day to to a clean bleach smell and clean linens. However, nothing else was really tended to. We contacted guest services again. They kindly offered to comp one night stay. We accepted the offer as we were running out of time on our trip and didn’t want to move to another room or hotel. When we received the bill, one night was comped but the facilities fee was not removed as promised. Though this hotel was convenient and Guest Services did their best, I would not recommend Park Central Hotel.

Checking in was terrible. There was one person for 20 people (at least) checking in. I understand it was a holiday week but there were many workers standing around talking to each other not trying to help, making this a 30 minute ordeal for many families. Upon entering the room, dirt was splattered on the bathroom walls with dust on all of the counter tops. At night we were woken up to the smell of cigarette smoke at least three times throughout the night although this was supposed to be a “100% non-smoking hotel.” When asking for a different room due to the unfortunate smell, we were given attitude by the woman at the front desk while another attendant was eating Wendy’s at the front desk (which is just a tad unprofessional in my book). Would not recommend this hotel. Take your money somewhere else (or at least somewhere with professionals working and smells better).

you couldn't ask for a better combination of price, location, facility, and staff--PCH has it all. It is my go-to destination in NYC for business, family trips, and recommendations to colleagues and friends. Getting to know the staff has been a real bonus in my six years of staying at PCH--and they remember YOU, too!

We stayed at the Park Central hotel Dec 19-22 and it was a nice stay with no real issues. We stayed on the fourth floor and had a view of Central Park. The location of this hotel is good if you desire to stay near Time Square without actually staying IN Time Square (5-10 min walk from there). Our check in was efficient, the individual who checked us in was fine but nothing above or beyond. Room was clean and modern, however the WiFi didn't reach our room so we both racked up hefty data usage amounts and also the phone in our room didn't work to call (we could have mentioned this in passing downstairs but there never seemed to be a good time & we also were in the room minimally). The hotel snack bar is a bit of a joke and I wouldn't recommend relying on it. If you go to the lobby for a drink it's quite nice, but the staff is rude (unless you get lucky and get Nancy who is amazing).Overall the hotel was nicely decorated, clean and in a good location but I wouldn't return due to underwhelming experiences we had with their staff.

We came all the way from England, this was our very first trip to New York and was a dream holiday for us. Well we weren’t disappointed. Had a fantastic stay at this hotel. Very clean, comfortable beds, great location, close to Times Square about 15/20 minute walk, about a 5 minute walk to Central Park, Starbucks next door and a Subway station right on the corner of the hotel, literally less than a minute walk.The house keepers were fantastic, very friendly and competent. Great job. Thank you ladies, we appreciated the job you did very much.Khianna was our concierge for the week. She was fantastic, very friendly and literally anything we wanted to know or wanted to do she was able and willing to help. From directions, what trains to take, down to booking tickets for basketball, broadway shows and even booking a table at a restaurant for us. Every time she would give us confirmations of what she had done via what’s app. So Khianna if you get to read this thank you so much. A couple of gripes, the Wi-fi didn’t work in our room on the 8th floor, eventually got sorted out. The scaffolding outside was a bit of an eye saw but not the end of the world. Also wasn’t expecting the outside noise to be quite so noticeable, again not the end of the world, I’m guessing it’s just typical New York life!One last thing could have done with some tea/coffee facilities in the room that you even get for free in most other hotels, would have been nice to start our busy New York days with a cup of tea or coffee. You could buy a tea or coffee in the downstairs market but a little over priced in my opinion. Sorry Park Central but we used the Starbucks next door.These however were minor things and didn’t change our outlook or opinion of our stay in the hotel. We would recommend this hotel highly!

this place is awful. stayed here and needed a receipt to expense room for work. been calling them for the past 5 days and no one answers the phone 97% of the time. when someone does answer, they are clueless and just push me off to other departments that also don't know how to help. had to pay for my hotel room out of pocket because I couldn't get receipt in time (still haven't got one. people at hotel don't ever answer the phone). don't stay at this place

Arrived at the hotel tired and hungry to a very very grumpy unpleasant member of staff .....Having specifically requested connecting doors to our rooms this lady told us it wasn’t possible ....she was really rude ...I explained I had contacted the hotel two days prior to our arrival and she said no call had been made ...Great start ....I said I wasn’t leaving the desk until this was sorted ....we waited about half an hour in the bar and eventually it was.Next problem was the resort tax ...we knew nothing about it ...too late at this stage ....after that we never spoke to a member of staff again for the duration of our week long stay .....The hotel us in a great location, reasonably clean and the beds are comfortable but need to up their game with customer service which Is dreadful.

Great hotel and really nice staff. Shout out to Emmanuel! He is amazing. He helped us out in every way he could. If you could train the bellman and security doorperson, that would be awesome. They only had a happy face once we tipped them. Otherwise they did not want to help us..

Staff was extremely helpful, nice, and respectful. The room was very clean and the hotel was beautiful. The location is perfect if you like to walk around with a lot of food and entertainment places close. Highly recommend this hotel for a nice stay in New York.

The hotel is beautiful. All the employees are extremely professional and courteous. The rooms have an amazing view of the city. The bar in the hotel is also amazing. Definitely will be coming back and highly reccomend you stay here!

I stayed At park central hotel in December on business.Your staff Angela, Saleem and Spressa at the desk were amazing.They helped me with every questions I had about the city,shopping and where to eat.I will only stay here again when I come back.Thank you front office agents for all your help.

Overall, pretty well pleased with this hotel! There are a few tips/thoughts I have to share about staying here...When checking in, stand between the two green boxwoods in the front of hotel and wait to be called over to the desk. We did not realize this because we were brought in from the side, where the sister hotel that connects is located, (after dropping our vehicle off for valet.) A worker behind the front desk very bluntly and rudely told us where we should be...we literally just walked in and we’re trying to figure out where to go....not a great first impression...but it got better. Carolyn checked us in and out; she was very fast and efficient and friendly. She answered every question I had and was very patient.  I booked two rooms for this stay, requested early check-in for both, not really sure if rooms would be ready early but one actually was...I was so happy about this!!! Also when booking, I requested high floors with views; the only disappointment I had is that only one of our rooms had a good view. I even asked to be moved after seeing our room...front desk was supposed to be contacted but never reached out. If you want a coffee pot and coffee in your room, simply ask! They will accommodate!!! Also, Starbucks is two doors down from hotel. The small sandwich/pastry shop in the hotel was good but is more like a grab and go. There are good restaurants nearby-The Redeye Grill has a great breakfast. Ask for extra towels daily. Elevators are a little slow but our wait was not bad to go up/down. Just research this hotel on the website and call to ask specific questions before booking, so you know more of what to expect. The bellmen/doormen were wonderful to help us get our luggage in/out and our vehicle parked and brought back to us quickly. I think Bobby helped us—cannot remember his name—but phenomenal service.The front of the hotel is under construction but it was not a problem for us. I didn’t hear noise at night either but I also brought a sound machine and have a sound app on my phone to drown out noise. The only problem we had was making a right turn to the sister hotel so we could valet the vehicle upon arrival. The street was closed and we told the policeman we had to get to our hotel so she let us by. We were asked daily during our stay if we needed anything and every request was made, with exception of room change. Thank you Kurt, Michaela, Mandenise, Erika! Location is great. Very clean & modern—Gloria was our housekeeper—what a sweetheart! All the staff who helped us have been very well trained; they work hard to accommodate, give them a raise—they deserve it. We will stay here again!

Ms. Angela was at the desk and greeted us immediately upon arrival. She not only checked us in but offered a city map for easier sight seeing. To further add her top notch service, she is gifted in both English and Spanish language making it easier to accommodate us. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

When I looked at booking new York always found the same sort of review saying different hotels where un-clean and such like. Really put me off. But park central hotel didn't let us down. Room was really clean and modern along with the friendly hotel staff. Was in a good area with walking distance of quite a few attractions. Would definitely book here again.
user_name:
Scott A
North East England, United Kingdom

review_body: On arrival i was treated very horrid by a member of staff and was told i couldn’t stay in the hotel due to my age but nobody made me aware of this before my arrival so she was willing to leave me homeless in new york myself and didn’t even try and help. Darren who was extremely lovely assisted me and got me into a room and told me what to do to make that possible. I received a facilities fee on my departure that nobody told me about so i had not left any dollars to pay this. A lady named Senia assisted me with this and she was extremely nice and made my trip worth while. She was so happy and nice and positive and made me feel so happy and welcomed. I wish i met her sooner!!!

Had a wonderful experience working with Alicia Nunez, Assoc. Dir. of Sales at this hotel. Alicia was a true professional and on top of every detail. My next stay in NY will be at this great hotel and booking with Alicia Nunez again!

We Stayed here last week .. although you hear a lot of noise from outside we slept very well .. good bed . The room was clean en spacious . We had to call for clean towels because They weren’t there after cleaning . The next day it was the same.. so we took towels from the hart in the hall . So problem solved . There were only 2 elevators and sometimes we had to wait for a long time.. especially when 1 was out of order for a couple of hours no coffee of tea in the room ..so we had to buy coffee Every morning @ the shop in the lounge . The hotel had a great location near central park and timesquare .

Our stay at Park Central was wonderful thanks to Mr Hightower with his unending energy and thoughtfulness. He is an enormous plus for Park Central and our stay would definitely have not been the same without him. Every detail was taken care of, we felt at home in a big city. Thank you so much Mr Hightower, we will come back!

Came here a second time to visit family and friends in Pennsylvania. Always stop at this hotel before our flight back home. Emanuel at the front desk took care of us again. He always makes sure we’re good. He is an asset to your hotel. Impeccable customer service.

The hotel and its staff are great. In particular I enjoy checking in and out with Saleem Hajuehia he’s very helpful, informative and genuinely provides helpful direction. The 17th floor is kept very clean by housekeeping. I will be back.

Mr. Saleem and Mrs Angela were very lovely with me.I like so much accomodation and I am very happy for stay in Park Central.The attendents are very sweet and profissionals my room was cleaned very well every day Cute markwt in lobby and pretty bar. Great location near everything. Stay here! You wont regret! I will be back. This is now my New York City place.

As soon as I walked into park central hotel I fell in love. The staff was amazing the entire time and Elizabeth (the lady who checked us in) was FANTASTIC! She was so sweet, gave us advice since this is our first time in NYC, And even gave us tickets to their market! The room was super clean and housekeeping staff was also amazing. The staff and facility was perfect and made my first time visiting NYC amazing!

Ok pretty much sums it up - good position few minutes from Central Park and Times square. Close to subway station. Reception nice but underging some building work so lots of scaffolding and unable for taxi to stop outside. First room was simply grubby and tired - complained and were instantly moved to a slightly bigger and better room so fair enough - still looks tired though. comfortable beds - lifts bit slow and small for number of guests. Had pre ordered breakfast but not realised this is just a muffin coffee a piece of fruit from the small outlet in the foyer. Was ok but otherwise buying from there pretty pricey. Had to request coffee and tea making stuff - wasnt in the room but again sorted with minimum fuss. Just would expect that as standard in this class of hotel. Overall ok sort of sums it - staff mostly pleasant and helpful but not always. Rooms ok but far from standard I was sort of expecting. Excellent position though. Would I stay again? - probably.

My friend and I stayed here from December 13th to the 16th and we absolutely loved it!Location:The location was excellent - only a few minute walk to Central Park and less than a 10 minute walk to Time Square and Rockefeller Centre. If you don’t want to walk, the subway is very close and easy to figure out. There is a cute boutique right beside the hotel along with two coffee shops (Starbucks and Tissere). There is also a little cafe inside the hotel. There are several restaurants within walking distance. If you come here around Christmas I recommend that you check out Haven Rooftop. If you are looking for a liquor store, Oak and Steele is a 2 minute walk with a good variety of liquor and wine. Room:We had a standard room (2 doubles or 1 king - we had 2 doubles). A mini fridge is available upon request and dependent on availability, however we were lucky enough to get on. The room and bathroom were both very clean and pretty. The TV allows you to cast your phone which is awesome for listening to music and watching Netflix. Our floor had an ice machine and a vending machine (for drinks) which was very convenient. Our room was restocked with towels and beds were made every day which we really appreciated. We never had to ask for anything. Overall stay:I would definitely come back and if you get a chance to speak to Elizabeth at Guest relations you should, she is wonderful. The staff is so kind and the hotel is beautiful.

First the location to everything is great. But, they have been on under construction and have not disclosed this on their website. Our driving could not even drop us off as the entrance was blocked by barricades from the street. He had to beg the doorman at the hotel around the corner to allow us to be dropped off there and walk around. It says there is food. No just a bad convenience store and a lounge, no food that only serves if you are at the bar. The rooms are dark, can't tell when daylight is. The bathrooms have no fans so if there is more than one to shower you will never see in the mirror, even if you could the bathroom is red dark red so you cant see well in the mirror if you are a woman trying to put on make up. I ended up using my mirror and putting it on while sitting on bed. No mirrors in the rest of the room. Also no doormen either. There are other hotels close by and they may cost a few extra dollars. I would say they are worth it.

i loved my time at this hotel! i did an overnight stay because i live nearby but had an early morning meeting and i ended spending most of my evening and morning just in the hotel lobby & bar area. great music, welcoming warm staff, and comfortable inviting seating area, very vibrant. the staff was incredible and i met some of the management and they were so so so attentive and concerned with how my stay was going. i loved my room, i had a great view, the bed was super comfortable and i had a great working area in the room. i felt very at home. i called down for a toothbrush and toothpaste and i had it in my hands in minutes.while in the hall looking for the ice machine i met several staff who guided and went above and beyond for me to help. i love the environment in the lobby seating area, i ended up taking several meetings that day there, because i loved the energy & vibe and didn't want to leave!! i will stay here over and over, really great experience!
user_name:
gkglovenyc
New York City, New York

review_body: I am so disappointed in this hotel. I literally couldn’t wait for our nyc weekend and thought I found a gem in the heart of NYC but I was so wrong. I called the hotel a few days prior to check in to ask about the valet parking. The morning of arrival we pulled up only to see that the front entrance is completely under renovation and there was nowhere to pull over, we pulled around to the side of the hotel and there was no one there, just a bunch of cabs. We did two laps before a valet from another hotel told us that we have to go inside to the front desk and tell them we are checking in and they will come out to get our car. Um, what the heck? First of all that is completely inconvenient and would have been nice if the person on the phone told me that. We finally go to check in, our room wasn’t ready which was fine, we were early. My boyfriend, a military vet who served three tours overseas, asks the gentleman if they offer a military discount to which he answered “yes but you would have needed to book that ahead of time.” I get it,but seriously, someone is asking and it’s something that you offer for a reason, you couldn’t have honored it? That left a really poor taste in my mouth. The only thing he could offer was an early check in for $100. When our room was finally ready, we check in and ask the bellman to grab our bags, to which he starts dragging them on the floor to bring to us. If they were too heavy please ask for help, don’t drag my stuff! We finally get to the room and it’s a room with two beds, I booked a king. I call the front desk and the concierge, she transfers me to the front desk where I am on hold for five minutes before I am disconnected. I call back, voicemail. So now I have to back downstairs and I am pissed at this point to say the least. The front desk claims I booked a “deal of the day” where there is no room assignment Until check in. I definitely didn’t book anything that said deal of the day, did I book the best available rate, yes of course I did, with a photo of a king bed. I wait to speak to a manager who literally could have cared less and sent me on my way. The only way they could help me was if I paid for an upgrade. Again, the only time they can help you with anything is if you want to pay extra. I go back to my room and check on their website and low and behold they have rooms available for tonight, at a lower rate than what I paid, and king beds available. The manager claims i was upgraded to a room with two queens instead of the two twins that I booked, I have a queen at home, these are not Queen beds. The room is tiny, the bathroom even tinier and I am looking out the window over roof top machinery. Do yourself a favor and RUN! There are a million other hotels in the area, stay at one of those. My stay isn’t even over yet, wondering what else can manage to happen here before we head out tomorrow?

I would say that the only advantage of this hotel is location as it is minutes away from Central Park, Times square, Rockefeller other than that everything is average or below average. The staff is not too friendly, cleaning was not as good, long cues to the toilet, luggage drop off and reception. Br ready to pay an additional tourist charge of around $35 per person.

Nicely located to explore the major highlights of Manhattan. Can’t rate the bar or coffee shop as we didn’t use them . Check in was rapid even though we were a bit early and the room was comfortable. There was scaffolding outside the hotel and a work platform was directly outside our window which meant we had to keep our blinds drawn causing the room to be a little dark. The scaffolding didn’t otherwise impact on the comfort of the hotel.I think our only complaint would be the additional facilities charge that was added daily to the room rate basically for using things that we are used to having included. However I think this is a common thing in American cities and not particularly this hotel.All in all this was a nice hotel and I would certainly consider booking again.

I come to NYC a few times a week and sometimes I stay overnight after late dinners and meetings. I had heard this hotel and the West House were under new management so I wanted to check it out, as the location is divine and the hotel is GORGEOUS! I stayed mid last week and from the second I walked in to the SECOND I left, I felt so loved, cared for, and like I was the only person in the room with every employee. The attention to the guest and their satisfaction with their time and stay was unlike anywhere I've ever been, and I've traveled all over the world. There was a real connection with every employee. They asked me many questions about my stay and how they could improve if needed. And I must say they all seemed so happy, that they were actually really enjoying their time on the job at the hotel (has to be the new management because that's the first thing management fixes...employee satisfaction in their job!!). It meant a lot to feel like I was "family" and not just a "head in a bed"...My room was perfect,. King bed, great bathroom, lots and lots of clean white fluffy towels, great tub. Very clean. I loved the chic beautiful bathroom hardware and lighting. I needed to take several work calls while there and the little desk area was PERFECT for me to have a separate space to do work from my "living space". It just felt like home from start to finish. I will never stay anywhere else now. GREAT JOB NEW MANAGEMENT!! I will tell everyone I know now to stay at Park Central!!

Great location, facilities and incredibly accommodating team. Exceptional experience with Quimby on morning of departing! He was terrific with helping me having to depart day early. I’ve stayed at sister property WestHouse In past visits and first time at Park Central, both very pleasant experiences. Must say that Quimby exemplifies service excellence!

Business trip to NYC. Room was beside the fitness center. My headboard was 2 feet away from the free weights and dumbbells. I was awakened every morning to the sounds of weights dropping to the floor. My request for a blanket - there were only sheets on the bed - was ignored 3 times.However, as I was checking out, the manager.saw me exhausted from lack of sleep, and I relayed the story to him. Instantly Mr Hightower leapt into action. He apologized profusely and comped the room and got a soothing drink from the coffee shop.I truly felt like I had been heard! Thank you Quimby Hightower for making my trip great!

Has to wait for a long time for the elevators I ended up now than once using the stairs from my room at the 10th floorOn the good side ,room was large and clean and the floor service (Marisa) ,outstanding

Very nice place to stay, our second. We love the location and it is very, very quiet. The neighborhood is undergoing an extensive building boom and streets and sidewalks are a mess - but the rooms are soundproofed. Wish there were a coffee machine or tea kettle. Asked for extra pillows but were never delivered. Really a 4+ rating. Will stay again

Great hotel, room was spacious and stylish and decent for a couple however no fridge no kettle which let the stay down a touch but location is great and 5 minutes from Central Park and 10 minutes from time square

Nancy in the bar is awesome, took great care for us. Great service and food. Registration went out of their way to cater to us because we had to wait in line. They are wonderful. Older hotel but awesome staff!!!

Last November I spent 5 nights at Park Central Hotel - and everything was great! 7th Avenue may have been torn up, but that did not interfere with anything inside the hotel. This hotel has been my destination for many, many years. My special compliments are to all the employees there. The desk is staffed by competent and helpful employees. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable. I specially want to mention Mr.Saleem, who is always friendly, helpful and patient, no matter what problem is presented to him! I also had an easy check in last time with Ms. Ana. I love New York and Park Central Hotel makes it the perfect experience, each and every time!

This was my family's first trip to New York and we had a blast overall! However, the hotel was our greatest disappointment as it was under construction/inspection and the room I had paid extra for was on the 6th floor (very noisy) and I was staring at scaffolding outside my window. When I tried to resolve my disappointment with the hotel by requesting a 50% refund, which I felt was a fair request, they did very little. The hotel is beautiful, the lobby/bar area is lovely and I encountered some wonderful staff such as Emmanuel who helped us decide where to eat on our last night, but I cannot rate the hotel very high if they cannot be transparent with hotel advisories. Regardless of whether it's the city's inspection or their own renovation, it affects a guests experience and I paid A LOT to stay here in December fully expecting a gorgeous hotel & gorgeous view. Highly disappointing.

Carmelo took great care of us at the hotel. He hooked us up with a cab and made sure we were all good to go to the airport. We would’ve been lost without him! 10/10 would recommend working with Carmelo

Elizabeth is a wonderful manager. When you come to ParkCentral look for her and she will certainly help you with your needs. She is kind and always try to accommodate the best to the guests. We feel like we were home.:-)

As usual, I had a great experience in this comfortable and nice hotel.Well located, very clean with a wonderful staff, mainly Elizabeth with a kind attitude and always prompt to help and make you feel at home! I recommend very much !!!

Booked and prepaid for our room in advance. Upon arrival, our room grade was not available and we were down graded. Not great start.Rooms were ok in size. As expected for NY. Beds need to be upgraded. No inner support. Shower is small, really small. Pressure was good.I would not stay here again even if we weren't down graded. The only thing we liked was the location. But there are a lot of other hotels in the same area.

A great hotel experience is not only made by good location and accomodation. It is specially made by great service. I stayed at Park Central and I want to thank the staff, specially the manager Elizabeth, who Take client satisfaction for real.

Very good location, clean room, the staff is very friendly, we found the accomodations very good, the restaurants around the hotel were excellent, like Serafina, Red Eye Grille, we would recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York

My mom and I were set to do a girls trip, her first time to NYC! However, she threw her back out and was unable to travel. I called the hotel and spoke to Tony, who was SO kind to refund us since we were unable to make the trip. It's the holiday's and we would have been out a big chunk of money if Tony hadn't been so understanding and kind. We plan to set a date in the spring/summer and will definitely be re-booking with Park Central. Customer service was excellent!

This is not my first time staying at the park central! It is my favorite hotel in all of New York City I stay there all the time and love everything about it! From the incredibly friendly and helpful staff at the front to the vibrant environment in the lobby and seating areas to the location which you cannot beat! I love it all! Everything from great restaurants to nail salons are only a few steps away from the hotel! I always stay in a king room and the beds are divine the bedding is so comfortable and the rooms are always impeccably clean. You never walk past a staff member who isn’t smiling and wishing you a good day. I’m always amazed at how happy everyone that works there always is! Says a lot about how the hotel is managed! Whenever I call down to the front desk for any need everyone is always ready to help! Best hotel in NYC!

I've been to this place several times. Love it! Specially when I'm lucky enough to check in with Salim and Angela. They are always very friendly and courteous and ready to solve any issue. It's great to arrive to a hotel but feel at home. Gina at their coffee shop is also always a pleasure to meet. Other than that, I love the spacious rooms, beautiful decoration, great quality linen, internet and printing service, coffee shop and bar in the lobby. The location is fantastic, between Central Park and Times Square.

Carmelo, the valet attendant, spent 30 mins on the phone with our friends to direct them to the hotel and safely park the vehicle. Exceptional, thank you very much for a nice welcome! All welcoming staff were great and the room very clean and nice!

The hotel was essential for my trip due to its serving as the rehearsal venue for the annual Messiah concert at Carnegie Hall which is directly across the street. the room was comfortable and the housekeeping was excellent. Wifi did not work in the room which was a negative. Appreciate the continental breakfast but was unable to use any of the other features available to guests because of my heavy concert schedule.

There is no restaurant in this wonderfully situated hotel, you should know that first. You can, however, buy good coffee and quality breakfast items in the Central Market shop just off the main lobby. These can be eaten in the stylish and comfortable main lounge. Next: don’t expect your beautiful room to have conveniences such as coffee maker, mini-fridge, complimentary water or slippers for you to use. (You can get a coffee maker or kettle brought up to you, however, and that’s what I did.) What you can expect is to be treated like a welcome and honored guest by everyone from the reception desk to the unbelievable housekeeping staff, especially on the 10th floor (hi, Marissa!). And if and when your path crosses that of the exuberantly charming guest relations manager named Quinby, you will feel like the most important guest who ever stayed at the Park Central.

I couldn’t be happier with my stay, quick check-in, friendly staff and clean room. I especially enjoyed the view. Sorry I forgot to take a picture. They were overly accommodating on such a short notice. I spoke with an Alicia Nunez-Davila and she was so helpful, kind. She really helped make a memory for my kids. The lobby was breathtaking. I would highly recommend the Park Central Hotel for a stay in NYC!!

Lovely hotel, check in was quick and had breakfast included too, this consisted a take away coffee/tea and a muffin or croissant, we didn’t bother with the pastry and went to Premier Deli next door for egg and bacon rolls to set us up for the day! Rooms were lovely, clean and warm absolutely no complaints. Hotel lounge is beautiful and very comfortable! Proximity to Times Sq and Central Park is great! Could not fault this hotel, thank you for an enjoyable stay.

My wife and I visit the Big Apple every year at Thanksgiving to visit our son and we ALWAYS stay at the Park Central Hotel! It’s been 9 years now! We especially love Nancy and John in the bar, Carmelo the doorman, Aissatou in housekeeping and Saleem at the front desk! They always take such good care of us with their friendly smiles and impeccable service. We always recommend the Park Central to friends and family who are planning a visit to NYC and we can’t image resting our heads at night anywhere else!

Stayed at the part central hotel week of Nov 24th for 4 nights.Hotel is centrally located - between Times Square and Central Park - 5 minute walk in either directionRoom is good - big enough for 2 people. Had a fridge - no coffee maker - but Starbucks is right next door.Elizabeth is great - had an issue with the room first night - Elizabeth quickly fixed it and made it right. Carmelo the Doorman - is absolutely fantastic - we needed a taxi to head back to the airport on the day of the Macy's parade - when all the streets are shutdown - but my friend Carmelo came to our aid and got us a cab - no issues. He even carried our luggage to the taxi (4 blocks away) - he's awesome!!!my only complaint - elevators - sometimes can be very slow - that was a bit of a pain.So if you are looking for something centrally located, with pleasant people - this is your place.

I enjoyed Park Central Hotel, friendly, amazing, and beautiful. Will highly recommend it to anyone. Guest Services made this vacation worth every dime. Thank you Elizabeth and Sokha on behalf of the Jean Joseph Family.

This was my first visit to NYC, so I was a little nervous about navigating through the traffic and people. The Park Central Hotel turned out to be a great place for us to stay. The check-in/check-out process was very easy. The employees were friendly and helpful; particularly Nancy Bar, who works in the lounge. She was very friendly and outgoing, and provided great service. The lounge was very comfortable, with live music a couple of nights when we were there. Overall, a great experience!!!

Amazing first trip to New York! Will never stay anywhere else customer service was on point. Thank you Saleem and Nicic for being so personable. You were always there to help even when we didn’t know what we were looking for

Elizabeth was absolutely wonderful at the front desk. Very knowledgeable, prompt, and delightful. Check-in process was seamless. Elizabeth knew the ins and outs of the hotel and is excellent. 10/10 would recommend!

Okay let me start off by saying i am 53 yrs old and have been traveling to different places my whole life.Now i want people to know if you want to feel that the Hotel appreciates your business and glad your there this is the place to stay. Also there customer sercice is the best i have Ever had.Rooms are good size clean and well put together.I will never stay anywhere else when i come to New York and i would suggest everyone to come stay here you won't be disappointed. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

On arrival had a job to find a drop off with the construction work going on , unusual check in as the guys at reception kept sending my family from one to another. The room was clean but didn’t have coffee or tea ? unusual for a hotel . There could be an information board regarding transport etc. Maybe a thank your for your custom at the end .Also have been before but needs to be more customer friendly and conscious.

The quality of our room and service were just average. They won't tell you that there is a major ongoing renovation to the hotel exterior right now so there is no pick up or drop off out front--instead you are relegated to a crowded side street. We only found this out AFTER arriving. On departure we were told the wait for our car would be 20-30 min. After over an hour wait outside in the cold diwn the street on the corner, we began to badger hotel staff to try to locate our car. It arrived after over 1 hr 15 min wait. Ill look elsewhere next time i come to NYC.

I have stayed here before when I come for New York Comic Con and always enjoyed my stay. The hostess at the bar, Nancy, is so nice. Makes you fell welcomed and happy to have stayed. Its location is great for whatever we plan to do.

Great location, you can see Times sq from the hotel doorway. Right on the door step of Central park and local to lots more. Room itself was quite basic for ideal for a short stay. Comes with shower gel, shampoooand conditioner. Towels usually for all the people in the room but one night they missed a shower mat and hand towels out so we had to use a face cloth for stepping out on to the tiled floor. Room could do with an update/refurb as well used. Swollen door on the bathroom. Great comfy beds and pillows. Check in was quite quick but abrupt, maybe need to brush up on customer service skills and a smile would be nice after all without customers you would be closed! Was told we couldn't have breakfast in the hotel as we hadn't booked direct but could have a bite to eat from the coffee/pastry bar in reception. We never visited the bar either as we went out each night. We would return as the location was great and noise was acceptable being so close to the city that really doesn't sleep!

It was our first trip to Manhattan. Park Central Hotel location was perfect for us. The staff was very polite and always helpful and the rates were affordable. My three sons and I had a great time and our stay at Park Central Hotel was very comfortable!

This is a lovely hotel for a short stay in New York. We visited for a long weekend. Shame it was covered in scaffolding updating the exterior. Was a 10-15 minute walk from times square and the main subway hub 2 blocks away. So great for getting around. The room we had was a standard king room and the bed was enormous and super comfy. The wifi in the room was a little patchy but on the whole was ok. Central park just 2 blocks away and Broadway theatres 15 mins away. The subway took 30 mins to the statue of liberty and world trade centre. Plenty of places to eat surround the hotel also. The bottom line is if you want to see the sights of New York then this hotel is ideally placed.

Near Carnegie Hall and many theaters. Walk almost everywhere we wanted to go. We really enjoyed our stay. Rooms are a bit dated however. Nancy in the bar gave great service several times during our stay!

I would like to highly Congratulate Elizabeth and Saleem that work in this hotel for their professionalism, their kind and warm way of behaving towards you as a guest. They make you feel really welcome. They do care and that makes the complete difference. Thank you very very much for making our stay again a wonderful one.

We visit NYC and stay at the Park Central Hotel several times a year and Ana (front desk) is by far the nicest, most friendly person we have ever encountered! Thanks Ana! You have made the 1st day of my birthday celebration even better!Laura

My husband and I stayed here for one night, the price was reasonable for a NYC hotel. The room was a king bedroom, it was very comfortable and clean. Staff was pleasant. Location is great, near a subway.

Great amenities. The lounge is awesome. Nancy Barr in the lounge is really cool! The Hotel is really central to Manhattan, close to Time Square and only fifteen minutes to the 9-11 Memorial. The staff really is awesome! You wont be sorry!

This is my favourite hotel to stay when visiting NYC. The hotel is beautiful and very clean, the staff is very welcoming and always pleasant and eager to make your stay enjoyable. The location is fantastic, close to all the attractions. Highly recommend this hotel for your NYC visit.

I would like to say thank you to Angela and Linda. They worked very fast getting us checked in and fixing the problem I had getting my room. Wonderful customer service and hotel.Thank you for making our stay in New York very pleasant.

Pros: well locatedCons: -lack of professionalism, lack of courtesy. The staff will only act pleasantly if your tip them. - dirty room: pillows were stained. we called housekeeping and when the cleaning lady showed up she basically told us that we should not have removed the pillow case since it was clean and that was what underneath is underneath!!! seriously? she finished by saying that if we were looking for issues in the room, we will find them!!!- loud elevator- no storage: at check out, the hotel referred to a bike shop to store our bags! they didnt store bags in lockers but shelves or on the floor. no security, no liability for lost property. why would the hotel be so inconsiderate to its customers property's safety???

This is a very nice hotel in a good location (close enough to Times Square you can do all the touristy things but also - at about ten blocks north of it - you can also completely avoid Times Square too). Its also very close to Central Park. The hotel is right on top of a subway station on the NRQW lines so you can get to most places you'd want to go from there. The hotel is hidden behind scaffolding and with major works taking place on the street you cannot get a taxi to the front door. The Premier King room was spacious - very important on an international trip - and spotlessly clean, the bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom was compact but had a great shower. Lots of street noise despite being 12 floors up. The chambermaids were friendly and did a great job. Only two lifts served the 12th floor so it could take a while to get one in the mornings.The hotel (like most in NY nowadays) charges an obscene mandatory "facilities fee" of $40 per night for things that should be included (like storing bags) and things we would never use (like local phone calls, the business centre, and gym). In fairness they are upfront about this but its still appalling.The check-in and checkout receptionists were very unfriendly and robotic (upon checkout we were told to go to the concierge desk to drop off our bags, we said there was no-one there but she told us to wait, only after five minutes when a line formed did she do anything about calling a staff member to that desk).Overall its a good hotel in a good location (if they didnt charge the "facilities fee" it may have got five stars)

I can only give this hotel 4 stars as it was not my favorite. We booked months in advance thinking we we’re getting a good deal. The final price was much higher than we were expecting but since it was under construction, we were given a discount down to what we thought the price was going to be so that was nice. The room was much smaller than we imagined. There wasn’t a view. It was worn looking as well. The wallpaper was peeling but the beds were comfy and it appeared clean. We were gone all day, everyday so the room wasn’t the priority part of our trip. It suited our needs just fine. I think we’d stay there again because the location was prime. It was a safe location. The staff were friendly. We had no issues with anyone. My only complaint would be the slow and crowded elevators as everyone here has already mentioned. Otherwise, it was a very good experience.

Just recently stayed here w/ my wife. Great location relative to where we wanted to spend time. It was perfect for us relative to price point - and the staff was great. I accidentally left my laptop in the room and didn't realize till security line at LGA... Benny Fong was GREAT - very helpful and very responsive. Staff was excellent top to bottom. I saw the comments re: the elevator... partially true, but everything else made it great IMHO

Greeted by Vito, who checked us in. He was extremely personable and very helpful. Room was very clean and housekeeping was very nice. All staff was helpful and eager to please. Concierge helped us when we described what kind of tour we wanted and we were very pleased with it. Highly recommend this hotel

I have stayed at the Park Central NYC on numerous occasions and the experience has been fabulous . The hotel front desk and service is always welcoming. A short walk to Times Square makes it ideal as well as the Subway station immediately across the street on 7th Avenue. There are so many restaurants and retail stores nearby. The access to Yankee Stadium and other attractions makes it appealing.

We stayed here for three nights for a fun, extended weekend. This is a nice hotel, and our room was very comfortable. We were on the 18th floor, so high enough so the street traffic noise did not get to us. However, the hotel is under construction and is encased in scaffolding. There was some minor disturbance because of that during the day.One issue worth mentioning - this hotel has small, slow elevators. At one point we had to wait in a line for 20 minutes to get onto the elevator. And the elevator cars are small. Eight people is a tight squeeze. Often on the way down, the elevator door would open, people were standing waiting in the hall, and the car was already full. So they would have to continue to wait.The staff was somewhat "meh". They did not seem to really care all that much about us.

This place is a great location, nice rooms. The elevator service is HORRIBLE. Lines in the lobby to wait for one to go UP, 10-12 minute waits to come DOWN, which was then further complicated by people who really want to go DOWN actually going UP so they could get on! Maddening. Made us a bit late for things until we realized we had to account for it. 17 flights of stairs didn't pull us to climb up instead.

We have stayed at Park Central several times and it is always great.The initial greeting set the tone with Kurt, he was great with checking in and following up making sure room was in order. Room was very clean neat and modern, thanks in part to Marissa, and she greeted us each morning with a great bubbly greeting.The beautiful bar was a great setting for an amazing lounge setting anchored by John, amazing man with great personality, kindness and care for detail. Also jamar, and Frankie helped create a great experience in the lounge. At customer care desk the awesome Liz, was spectacular with making sure we had all information needed and was a beautiful touch to make our stay awesome. We always look to stay at park central.

After traveling with my wife and two kids on the train, we arrived at a very busy Park Central. Despite how busy it was, Emanuel made she he took his time with his us and provided all the room options that would accommodate us. Anyone traveling with going kids knows how valuable this personalization is. Thank you Emanuel and Park Central!!

Initially, it may seem like a nice hotel, but upon a closer look of the room, this hotel is dirty. In addition, any "luxury" aspect of this hotel is cheap and fake. Although I was charged the full price for a room, the view was of scaffolding and things in the room were dirty and broken. The room smelled dusty & musty. On top of all of this, the hotel will charge a $41 "Hotel Fee" - for what reason, I don't know (that money is not going to the cleaning of the hotel).

Arrived and checked in. Things seemed a little unorganised but we were seen quickly enough. We received a nice welcome and all seemed to be going well until the lady that was assisting us picked up the phone and began to scold a colleague on the phone, she swore and had this conversation right in front of us, instead of just waiting for us to head to our room. We were asked for a credit card for a deposit - which we handed over but we got a little frustrated when we realised that no explanation to what the deposit covered or how much they had charged. We stayed on the 16th floor. The room had a huge bed which was comfortable. The only problem with the bed was that there was blood on the duvet cover which I felt was pretty disgusting. I discovered this on the morning we checked out. The rooms are outdated, old and tired. They just simply need a good clean. The carpets are tired, stained and dusty. The shower and bathrooms were small and dark. There was toothpaste all over the walls and fingernail clippings on the towel shelf. The temperature in our room we couldn’t seem to get control over. The room seemed to be naturally warm already and then the air-con blasted out warm air also. Unfortunately I fell ill during my visit to New York. Staying in a room which is at 25degrees celsius when you have a 40 degree fever and unable to open the window wasn’t an enjoyable experience. Annoying, despite there being almost 20+ floors, there are only two lifts in the hotel. So be prepared to wait at least 10 minutes for a lift to your floor. If that one doesn’t fill up. We had paid for bed and breakfast. Breakfast consisted on a stale pastry, a bottle of water or a coffee and an apple. A hotel breakfast? Obviously this was disappointing. And there is no tea/coffee or water in rooms either. I bought a bottle of water from the hotel and it cost $7. The hairdryer in my room was broken. Concierge didn’t answer the phone and didn’t return my messages, nor did they replace the hairdryer. We feel that this hotel is in a wonderful location, the neighbourhood is busy and exciting and there are local delis, tourist hotspots and so close to Central Park. Perhaps this hotel would benefit from new management that are excited about running a hotel. From our experience staff are tired and fed up. We stayed in New York for 3 days and travelled from Milan Italy. I don’t think if we are to return to New York, that we would stay in this hotel again and we don’t feel we are able to recommend the hotel either.

Stayed for 4 nights in October. Location of the hotel is the real selling point as it was 5 minute walk from Times Square and 2 minute walk to Central Park. In addition there are a couple of different metro stations just round the corner from the hotel. Hotel lobby was nice and modern and very well done with a small coffee shop/store inside. Didn't use the bar however drinks prices seemed quite expensive. Room was nice and again modern with chromecast TV which was useful. Downside was that the view from the window looks into other rooms so need to have blinds down most of time and even with them open its very dark which so need lights on all the time. Bathroom is ok, small but it is New York so as expected. There was always a delay with the Lifts and often had to let lifts go and wait however we were only 4th floor so often used stairs instead to save time. Quite an expensive hotel for what it is but again paying for prime location which does come in handy.

What an amazing hotel!!! The rooms are lovely, spacious and clean, the staff were so friendly and helpful and made our stay so amazing! Special thank you to Elizabeth for making our stay extra special and to Marissa for making our room perfect! If you are looking for a hotel that is a perfect distance from time square, Central Park, 5th Avenue and amazing restaurants and bars and easy access to the subway I would highly recommend this hotel, it was perfect for us and we will be booking again for next year! Defiantly one of the best hotels I’ve stayed in, in New York. Thank you so much again!!

I often stay at the Park Central, great location, great hotel. Each stay has been good however my most recent stay far exceeded any of my expectations. ELIZABETH is the reason why. She has it all, best service I have every received. I made her aware of our special event and she went out of her way to ensure that our stay special. My son stayed the night before his wedding and Elizabeth made sure he had a room fit for a king...and of course champange and chocolates were waiting for him. I could go on and on about the wonderful service Elizabeth provided...it was never ending. I will remember this special stay the rest of my life... THANKS SO MUCH ELIZABETH YOU ARE OUTSTANDING ....................................

We were very impressed with this hotel. The staff at the counter was very pleasant and helpful. We asked for a refrigerator and coffee pot, we were surprised to find that there was already a fridge in the room, but they were out of coffee pots so they gave us a coupon for free coffee. We had heard that hotels were having issues with elevators. We were on the 17th floor and didn't have any serious delays in service. The concierge was helpful with directions to get us to Battery Park. The room was great. We did not expect the room to be huge, it's NY after all. It was a very comfortable room, with a great bed and beautiful furniture. The only issue we had was a late wake-up call.

Everything about my experience at the Park Central Hotel New York was perfect. From the room cleanliness, amenities, staff service, and location. Couldn't have asked for too much more. Hoping to make NYC a yearly trip and will definitely plan to make the Park Central my home-away-from-home.

No door man, unfriendly desk staff,Free coffee, fruit and muffin for breakfast. Clean room, quiet hotel, dodgy elevators. Good price, great location across from carnegie hall. If price was good i would stay there again. Dont look for great service.

I had already stayed at this hotel another time. But this time has changed a lot. The rooms are still great, spacious and clean, but the service was poor. Right at the front desk while checking in the attendant barely looked at our face, she was thick and careless; Concegerie was no different, the three times we went to ask for information, we were treated with carelessness, disdain and arrogance and could not make any restaurant reservations with them because they simply said they had no information about that restaurant !! Another problem were the elevators. The hotel is quite large and there were only two working elevators which meant a long wait, especially when you wanted to get down (I was on the 15th floor !!)

It’s always great to be welcomed back , I travel to NYC frequently , I am always thrilled to be met by my favourite door man Carmelo . But I need to make a call out for an individual who works the front desk . His name is Saleem and nothing is a problem he goes out of his way to always make it easy. He is kind , professional and always remembers my preferences and needs.I appreciate these wonderful gentleman they see thousands of customers but still remember me each time I stay here .Thank you for your wonderful service ,Best,Sofia Sousse88

My husband and I made a short trip for pleasure to NYC. For the last several years, we have stayed there and definitely will again . Since the renovation , this hotel is fabulous and rates are good for a NYC hotel . This particular trip did not end well for me because I left 2 jackets in our room. It took a couple of days, but I finally got to the right person, Benny Tong, Director of Security! They located my jackets and are shipping them out to me today ! This gentleman was so kind, efficient, and helpful! Thanks to him, we will continue to stay at Park Central when in the city! I might mention Yzette in Customer Service who referred me to Benny!! Nancy in NC

We stayed for three nights- staff helpful and always available. Room very comfortable and very clean. No tea and coffee in room only fault, but cafe in lobby open early in the morning until the early evening. Location was great with bars, restaurants and tourist spots in close proximity.

I stayed at least 4 times at Park Central , I tried many other hotels in New York and many of them had good location but their rooms were really small and they did not deserve the price they wanted.Park Central is in the middle of Central Park and Times Square very convenient place , there are metro stations next to hotel. Room is clean larger then many other New York hotels. It has a 24 hours gym and was not really busy which was great !! I like that hotel and will stay again and again Thank you

I have been to NYC 21 times & I can’t believe it took me this long to stay at this hotel! We chose this hotel for our Autumn in NYC family trip and were very happy we chose this hotel. Modern, clean, and the perfect location for exploring NYC, walk to Central Park, Rockefeller, 5th Avenue, Times Square & the subway stations to get to other attractions/restaurants is close by and easy to navigate from the hotel. Great service and staff too! Shoutout to John Cavanagh at the Park Central Bar & Lounge for his exceptional service and hospitality, he is a true gem whose knowledge of the city and history of the hotel (100 years old next year!) makes for a very entertaining and fun visit to the bar! Definitely recommend this hotel, we will certainly be back!

We chose this hotel for its great location,the reception was perfect, check in fast, large bright room with magnificent views, many activities in the hotel, very nice gym with great equipment, very qualitative breakfast, great memories, we strongly advise

My family and I had a wonderful stay here starting with check in. It was a harried afternoon of flights, cabs, and luggage.
