We were warmly greeted, provided a stunning room with views of Times Square, and given a great recommendation for dinner. The location also couldn’t be beat. So many places are walkable including MOMA, Central Park, and Times Square. This will be the only place I stay in NYC.

Emanuel was great was very quick I’m checking me in and accommodating my request as best he could Definitely recommend this location. Great area easy access to the subway. Literally right in front of hotel. Bars, restaurants night life all around
user_name:
lrod042123
New York City, New York

review_body: There are good places but is difficult to see a better hotel in the world like this one. Everything is perfect, from the rooms to the restaurants passing thru the the gym. The experience the people makes you feel is extraordinary.
user_name:
Claudio S
San Pedro Sula, Honduras

review_body: The hotel is reasonable. The gym is closed for refurb. The hotel staff is very helpful. In particular, Alvin was very helpful today at the luggage desk. And Carmelo the doorman was very helpful in getting a taxi at rush hour. Thank you.

I don't write many reviews, as I feel that one experience frequently does not indicate the experience that takes place over time. However, my recent stay here was so unfortunate, that I genuinely believe it could not be an exception. Here are just a few of the low points.Unfriendly interaction x2 with the front desk when I had to go back to the lobby after check-in to inform the of a broken tv. I thought all was well with the new room until I found raisins on the floor. Even at 65 degrees, the AC couldn't cool the room. 2 meetings with an irritable cashier in the lobby coffee shop. Receiving a notification a couple of days before my arrival advising me of a $36 per day facilities fee for:1. Unlimited local and domestic long-distance calls (I have a cell phone)2. Unlimited use of fitness center (Nice. Unfortunately, the hotel gym is under construction, so you get to use the gym up the street).3. Luggage storage on arrival or departure (Have never in my life been to a hotel that wouldnt store your bags if the room was not ready).4. A few other items such as printing and bike rentalI travel extensively and understand the movement towards incidental expenses classified as resort fees.. Also, the issue is not about transparency. I received advance notice. The problem is with the usefulness of the items coupled with the poor service.In an attempt to provide some balance, the hotel has an amazing location in the city. Near everything, which makes traveling around so easy.

We visited NYC on our anniversary and wanted to be close to Central Park. We chose the Hotel because of its Location and the pictures looked fantastic. What we got was a hotel with construction around it. Our view was of scaffolding and the Hotel entrance was a construction zone. I would stay somewhere else while this is going on

This hotel is only blocks from Central Park and within easy walking distance to the Met, Moma, Frick collection, and the Museum of Natural history as well as Broadway, Times Square and the Empire State Building. As first time visitors to NYC the proximity to must see sights make this Hotel the place to stay. We stayed in a king suite and had plenty of space. It was clean and only noise was from the city traffic.

I left a few items behind, oops, they were priceless to me and one of a kind.No worries here, not only is this a beautifully remodeled hotel in a great location. Security treated me like gold and with care and respect. Benny the Director of security and Rafael his Lieutenant are two of the most kind and trustworthy individuals, making you're stay worry free. Who wouldn't want to return to that kind of family-like treatment I ask, but it didn't end there. I spoke to the maid every morning, remember how hotels used to be? They do, and treat you like if they want you to return. The desk staff are so nice too! Was this the New York that I'd heard about...then why is everyone so friendly! Yeah, stay here, you'll love it, a home away from home. Use their car service at the concierge, the guys at Presidential are so polite and professional. Not much more than cab fare and can make everything accessible and wow are they dependable. Stop at the Halal stand in front left of the hotel as you exit for 24 hour eats and a drink. What a great guy and there day and night to feed his family from afar. Make sure to leave him a good tip!

The Park Central is your generic 4-star midtown Manhattan hotel: It‘s location is very good, right across from Carnegie Hall. But our room was tiny and the bathroom even tinier. The service was fine overall and it was good to have a spacious lobby/bar to do some work.What really bothered me was the hotel‘s so-called „facilities fee“. For the paltry sum of USD 36 per night, you get some discounts, luggage storage, unlimited domestic phone calls, etc. These services are either not desirable (domestic phone calls — which traveller calls on a land line??) or I expect them to be included at any hotel (luggage storage). But there is no choice: You pay the USD 36 regardless. (The leaflet in the room says 35, but you are charged 36.) The implication is that advertised prices on comparison sites will show this hotel cheaper than it actually is. Very annoying!

We had an excellent stay. Being on a lower floor (8th) we had no issues with elevators to the room, would have been nice to have a mini fridge in the room for some snacks but everything we needed from food to the subway was so close.

We had a problem with leaving our luggage, but Alvin from the Luggage Check desk helped to solve all our problems! He is very qualified and patient worker! Thank you for your help, you saved our time and nerves!

During a recent trip to New York, we booked a flight and hotel deal with our stay at the Park Central Hotel on 7th. The location of this hotel is fantastic! It’s central to many of New York’s landmark spots including Central Park and has many transit points very close by. The hotel lobby is spacious and has a very natural and zen like feeling upon entry. The rooms are quite spacious and comfortable. Unfortunately, the hotel has not kept up with the tech times so be sure to pack your wall chargers and music speakers. The rooms do not have USB ports and the speaker that it does have on the night stand is for the iPhone 4 model (does anyone even use that one anymore?!) There are only 2 elevators for this huge hotel and they are quite small so be ready to wait when heading out or coming in. We had various disappointing encounters with staff members that were a. Not interested in serving/helping us and b. Not happy to be working there. When asking about details for the gym, the gentleman at the front desk was more concerned about his iMessage convo on his cell phone than assisting us.There is an additional daily charge of $40 CAD for WiFi (open connection, no password), gym use and who knows what else. Unfortunately, when booking there is no notice about the hotel’s gym facility being under construction. They will provide you with passes to Crunch fitness two blocks over. So there is an extra cost that you will pay daily to be an inconvenienced guest. Also, the Crunch fitness studio staff are also not friendly or helpful.The location of this hotel was the main attraction for the Park Central and I’m not sure that we would stay here again in future.

I ok xx This is an excellent hotel in the heart of midtown Manhattan. Comfortable close to everything and reasonably priced for NYC . I would not hesitate to stay here again. Elevators need improvement

Pleasant surprise. We had booked the corner room on the 8th floor. Noise from the streets you will still hear however this is Manhattan and part of the DNA of this area. Central Park is just a few blocks away and metro station 57St is just around the corner. Pret A Manger,Nordstrom and CVS are really nearby and if you need diner just go to WholeFoods at Colombus Circle. Room was clean and well maintained. Comfy beds. Will consider next time as well.
user_name:
retpanda
Berkel en Rodenrijs, The Netherlands

review_body: I don't think I have ever encountered a more impeccable and personable person than Mr. Quimby Hightower - he truly embodies this brand. Of course the amenities at this beautiful hotel and the location are ideal, but after more than one visit it's the people who make a stay here worth it. Mr.Hightower will go out of his way to ensure that you feel comfortable and exudes an air of warmth; his professionalism and hospitality is unmatched. Quite frankly, I never second guess my decision to spend my time in NYC at Park Central. I'd like to personally thank Mr. Hightower for that !

After enjoying a wonderful stay here in January, it was the first place I looked to book for my November trip back to NYC. The location is perfect: walk to Central Park or theater district, or hop the subway just steps from the hotel to Soho and lower Manhattan. Rooms are spacious and comfortable and the service is top notch. Everyone — the housekeepers, lounge staff, concierge — are unfailingly polite, friendly and helpful. Tarik checked us in upon arrival and he was extremely gracious, which was much appreciated given the late hour. Rafael at the bar is charming and fun...Rita in housekeeping came to my rescue when I locked myself out of my room early one morning. I will ALWAYS stay here when I visit New York!

So I’m a traveling actor from Pennsylvania and take the Amtrak into Manhattan for auditions and work. It’s exhausting. Elizabeth listened to my story and really accommodated me! Thank-you so much :)!!

These people up front are amazing! One that stands out is Emanuel. He was so helpful I give him 5 stars!I overall rate this hotel at 4 because our room was way to warm. Otherwise it was fabulous! The picture shows that you can see Time Square from our window.

I was in NY for a recital at Carnegie Hall. The Park Central is one block from the hall, very conveniently located. It is also well situated for Broadway shows and shopping. a perfect combination!The hotel staff were very pleasant and accommodating. The rooms are relatively spacious for NYC and in excellent condition.I would recommend this hotel for any visit to NYC.

Very helpful staff, particularly Benny Fong who returned lost property promptly. Thank you for a great stay; Central Park is just steps away....good for families, good, quiet, large rooms, larger than one would expect in NYC. Not cheap, but then it is new York and good hotels a preimium

Ok, NYC is a busy town and you get two types of hotels. The small boutique ones with small rooms and quite expensive (sometimes undergoing reno), the super big hotel chains with 300 rooms and the tourist hotels like this one that has good prices for the quality. The hotel has been redone. Groups and foreigners are the norms there. The lift situation is a little embarassing whern you have that many rooms and only 2 elevators working. No restaurant. bar is closed most of the day. Good price overall and decent size rooms for NYC

Second time there and had the bad experience of waking up with bugs in my bed. The people are aware and apologetic but no reason to go back there ever again, even though location and price sometimes good not worth it!
user_name:
giuliaflynn
New York City, New York

review_body: We choose the hotel for the location near to many of the tourist attractions and Central Park. The pluses are the room is really big for New York hotel rooms, it is clean and the staff are helpful. One huge draw back is there are two lifts that serve the whole hotel. One of the lifts broke down regularly and there was always a queue for the lifts every time we needed to use it. On several occasions we walked up and down the stairs. The hotel doesn't really have much of an atmosphere, the reception area isn't very inviting as there are barely any seats to sit on and there is no food apart from the little coffee shop.

Yes, Central Park Hotel does have a great location! Easy walk to Central Park, Time Square, Radio City, Starbucks, etc. We arrived and did have several small problems, however they were easily solved by Mr. Hightower! He went over and above to help us and make our birthday getaway the best ever! Rooms very clean and staff very helpful. Our last morning the elevator was not working properly and we got stuck on the 26th floor. Being claustrophobic, it was not a good situation! When door finally opened, kind cleaning lady took us down the freight elevator. Once down I was met by manager, Jason , with water and kind words. Thank you all. We will return to Park Central Hotel!!

I was staying in this hotel for seven days. Park Central has a magnificent position, central and near all the most important sites to visit, particularly Central Park and the great museums. Some problems for the elevators, which are only two. The bar in the lobby is extremely expensive. However, the staff at the reception is kind and helpful but the person I thank most is Elizabeth of the guest relations. She has been incredibly courteous and professional, a great value to the hotel. Thank you Elizabeth.

I’ve been at the Hotel Park central with my parents recently. Unfortunately, we had a couple of problems with our travel agency regarding an extra room. In this unfortunately situation we met Elizabeth who did everything thing she could to help us finding the best solution possible!! Highly suggested!

We found this hotel on Hotel on Hotwire. The price was $139 canadian and parking was $25 usd so we booked it. After all the taxes price somehow ended up being $220!! And on top of that there is a resort fee (i think $35usd).Upon arrival and what you dont read is that the parking is actually $60usd. We used valet for $65. There is nowhere to stop and off laod as the entire block in front of the hotel is under construction. The sidewalk is free but not the road.As for the resort fee, we were told it is for the free internet and gym - but the gym is under construction so they have made arrangements for younto go to another hotel's gym.Last, we booked on Hotwire o have our room assigned on arrival. The first lady at the front desk told my friend thatbif we wanted to beds it would be an additional $42usd per night. I however ended up checking in and saw a different lady who saw that there w ere two of us and offered us a room with two beds and no up charge.I should add, the room was clean, coffeed shop in the hotel and Starbucks next door, but for the final price we ended up paying and some of the hassels with no on site gym and the car, if you search around you can find a better deal for the $$ and convenience.

I’m always coming to the hotel and I always have a lovely time in here. This time I met the attendant Elizabeth, and as I told her about my daughter comming to visit me, she happily received my daughter at the hotel and didn’t charge any fee for it. And also, she gave me and my friend and daughter a voucher to breakfast. Thank you Elizabeth!I highly recommend the hotel!:)

This hotel is right beside Carnegie Hall and walking distance to Times Square, Broadway shows, Central Park and many, many restaurants! Walking back to the hotel after an evening performance in the crowds on the streets is magical. The rooms are clean and well appointed. The bar has nightly specials and there is a breakfast counter in the lobby. The rooms are not cheap but worth it because of the terrific location.

I quite a good experience at Park Central. I usually try to stay at the meatpacking district or soho since its much less chaos than mid town. But this time I went with my wife and 2 kids (ages 7 and 4). And for NYC touristy things, the Park Central was great.Elizabeth from guest services was great at check-in and helped us our plenty during our stay. I stayed in a corner double queen, which had a great view to times-square. the room is of a good size for NYC standards. The only thing that left a bit to be desired was the replenishing of the towels. Every night, we would have less towels than we needed, either the carpet towel, or a big town, or face towels... it seems housekeeping needed a little more attention to detail. But when called, housekeeping would immediately bring the missing towels up. Also, as any big Mid-town hotel, the elevators get quite packed at morning rush hour. But all around good hotel, good value and location.

We stayed here for our honeymoon for four days and had an excellent stay in the Park Central Hotel NY. Once we checked in, we were upgraded from a premium room to a suit, since we were on our honeymoon. I call that perfect service and a great start on our stay. The hotel is located central in New York and in a great location for attractions around the city. The rooms were spotlessly clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who will visit New York. Thanks again for a great stay, and a particular thanks to Elizabeth Cacovic for her good service.

Stayed here in Dec 2018 for our first trip to NYC. Great location real close to Central Park, near the subway and easy walking to Times Square.Room was large based upon what I read about NYC rooms.Lifts weren’t all working and bar hours were weird, which was annoying.Staff very accommodating and all in all a great stay!

Stayed for five days at Park Central Hotel , totally fantastic, biggest room size we have stayed in by far , spotlessly clean , excellent location for many attractions, thanks to all the staff who work very hard to make our stay most enjoyable, would recommend this hotel every time , thank you

Nice hotel in great location, however on check out you are hit with a facilities fee charge of 36 dollars per day. This includes use of a local gym, PCs in the lobby and a few other things that were of no use to us. Bit of a con in my eyes.

Stayed for a week last year.Excellent hotel and location.Rooms were much bigger than I expected for the price we paid and only a block from Central Park.Staff were very helpful and friendly, would definitely recommend if your staying in NYC for more than a few days

Here for a long weekend, and it was great. The location is good, the rooms were clean and quiet, and the staff exceptional. Nancy in the lounge took very good care of me, despite an exceptionally large party needing her attention. Angela at the front desk could not have been more helpful, and went above and beyond to help me with a minor problem. She gave really exceptional service. One of the managers, Linda, was also very helpful. Only drawback with the venue is limited food/dining options, but there are plenty of options in the immediate vacinity. Would definitely come back.

We came to the park central hotel after long flight and a lot of problems with our reservation with the website “hotel tonight “ , Elizabeth- the manager of the reception got us and did everything that we will feel comfortable! want to praise Elizabeth For her kindness!! She was so lovely and generous to us! excellent service =)

We stayed 4 nights. This hotel has a fantastic location, and everything else about it was really nice. I'm a mid-westerner used to staying in hotels that offer free coffee and breakfast in the lobby, so not having that was an "OK, so this is NY" moment. For $3-4 you could get a delicious cup of coffee in the lobby, which also sold some cold pastries, and juices, etc. Our standard king bed room was on the 4th floor. Our window view was of no interest to us. Our room had 2 huge windows, which let in light, which was fine for the few hours we were there during the day. Two elevators worked fine. Lots of travelers just like us. Always felt safe. Our room was plenty quiet for us; we didn't face any street. Bed was comfortable, and the room and bathroom was very clean. My only very minor beef was there didn't seem to be a working fan in the bathroom. Highly recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

This was our first stay at Park Central, and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Rooms were very quiet despite the large crowds. Within walking distance of many things, plus two subway stations a few feet away. So convenient! The only word of caution is the elevators which become overcrowded and slow at the busiest times so plan ahead a bit when on a time schedule. There is a market in the lobby with coffee, pastries and fruit that was nice. Our rooms were clean and housekeeping was very attentive to any needs. Anyone staying here will really value the location in particular. But the hotel is very good, and I would definitely stay here again.

Flew in to watch the Dallas Cowboys and enjoy some time around Central Park. My husband and I had an excellent Stay at Park Central Hotel and Alicia Nunez-Davila, Associate Director of Sales, assisted us with our hotel arrangements. Alicia was professional, and very helpful making arrangements for our visit at Park Central Hotel. The hotel is in a great location near Central Park, the lobby was decorated nicely, the staff was cheerful and ready to assist, and our room was very clean and a good size considering how small hotel rooms generally are in NYC. Thanks Alicia for all you help this past weekend!!!

My husband and I have stayed at Park Central NY for many years ! Always clean with a very professional efficient staff ! Great location for walking in the City !A shout out to Sokha Puth !She is ALWAYS on top of her game It’s just us a great place to stay !!

I was planning a trip to NY as a solo-traveller and chose this hotel to stay in. The location was fantastic. The staff at the luggage storage room were incredibly helpful, polite and friendly. My room was comfortable however, the shower/tub had some hairs which grossed me out. I had to rinse out the tub before I could use it and even then I felt like it was still dirty. I also had a really disappointing interaction with a staff member at reception who seemed totally disinterested in answering questions I had in relation to payment. I found her attitude and manner to be very off-putting and I would not choose to stay here again as a result of this.

Such a nice hotel. Cute and comfortable rooms with super comfortable bed and nice linens. Helpful and friendly staff. Perfectly situated in the middle of Manhattan. We felt very safe coming in at night.

Park Central Hotel is a wonderfully convenient place to stay in NYC. The rooms are comfortable and the hotel staff can't do enough to make sure your stay is enjoyable. They have a Central Market right in the lobby and for $1 per day you may have coffee, orange juice, a piece of fruit and a pastry if you are a hotel guest. That is the best deal in all of NYC.Quimby, the manager of guest relations, truly went out of his way to make sure any concerns of mine were taken care of.I would stay here again the next time I travel east.Many thanks to all who made my trip so enjoyable at Park Central.

Have just stayed here 3 nights, the hotel is in an excellent location on 7th Ave - 3 blocks from central park & about 10 blocks to Times square. We had a room on 5th floor with 2 double beds - it was a decent sized room & had everything we needed, other than a kettle to make tea or coffee. The room was fairly dark so could do with a few more lights and the air conditioning unit was really loud - thank god for the fan!The central market in the lobby is over priced - i would recommend the coffee shop next door (called Tissery) All of the staff we encountered were friendly & helpful. Would Definitely stay here again if i was in the city

I booked this hotel after a lot of searching, liked the location, most of the reviews and I knew about the 'resort fee'. I was however disappointed. First off when I booked I put a note asking for a park view. My husband also messaged the hotel as it was a special trip for my 40th birthday he messaged through email, and messager which took forever to get a response back from the hotel saying there was no park view because the hotel was covered in scadfolding (this would have been good to mention at booking).Anyway not to let it disappoint we left for our holiday, stopping first in Canada. While in Canada I got a confirmation email saying that I had only booked for two adults. I panicked as I had my son too. So I messaged the hotel no reply, and then had to use my mobile to phone them. I got through to central reservations who could not help and told me to phone the front desk, front desk told me to contact inhouse reservations, 5 times I was passed from pillar to post getting cut off each time! It wasn't until I got through to someone else at the front desk she was able to say it wasn't a problem as they don't charge for children. May I say tho when we got into the room it was set up for three with towels!Check in was OK, we arrived early and was given the option of getting into the room and for $90 as it was ready (no thanks). We checked our luggage in and went exploring. Came back to pick up the room key and the guy at the desk was not pleasant at all.Our room looked on to a building site and there was a note in our room saying we may wish to lower the blinds for privacy due to the work and there may be noise which would start at 8am. The first two mornings this did not bother us as we were up early, this morning after three full busy days in New York we could have done without the loud banging especially when my son was knacked.Also I got my period by suprise one day my hubby went down and asked if they had anything to hand until we went to the shop, the hotel does not keep any incidentals like that by the way and was shown the way to the nearest chemist. As for the resort fee, yes I would say its a rip off. $135 for storaging some luggage. No water or coffee in the room (Sheraton in Nigara had water and coffee), no fridge I really don't see how they can get away with charging the extra. I would not say any staff were particularly welcoming or pleasant but to he honest this time we found the most of NY like that. Also everytime you left the hotel the front was full of people trying to get you to buy the buses, and stuff. Surely this could be moved away from the door? The room was fine although a bit dark and bed comfy Yes the hotel is in a good location from the subway and times square but really I wouldnt say I felt I had good value for my money and wouldn't stay here again.

The customer service very good. Quite the place to stay for NYC visitors and business people. The breakfast system is very practical, but they should include it in the room price. They offer discounts never possible. I travelled in April 2018. So, the option for dates bellow is wrong. Sorry

Pros: LocationCafe and bar onsite Cons:No early check inNo late check out 30-min+ wait for baggage storage Hidden fees, making the two night stay in a small room with an obstructed view called “premium” $928 for two nights. Called down twice for towels. No one ever came. Staff seemed rushed in person and on the phone I would not go back and we didn’t have the best experience.

The hotel lobby is nice, the room is clean but the highlight of my trip will forever be Elizabeth!!! Arriving two hours before the person that booked my room I knew I had to wait... Then I crossed Elizabeth's path and she helped me find every solution possible to begin this journey in the best way possible. She was not only helpful & professional but also attentive to my needs in every little detail!!! Thank you for taking good care of me. Jennifer & her family!

Hotel is fine but they add charges for nothing after you've already booked. $36/night for a "facilities fee" that includes nothing that shouldn't already be in the price. Just tack on the $36 and quit scamming your guests.

The girls in the desk were fine but definitely the most helpful and nice guy was Quimby thanks for help us. Really really appreciate you take care of us. Thank you will see each other next march. We love NYC

Quimby with guest relations is such a joy to work with! He ensured we were comfortable during our last day. Our flight got delayed and when we asked for a late checkout, he went above and beyond our expectations and worked it out so that we could be comfortable in our room until we needed to leave for the airport! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the midtown area!

Quimby was an absolute treasure. He was incredibly helpful with getting us a late checkout & insuring we had everything we needed. The stay was an overall pleasant experience & the staff treated us very kind.

Brilliant location between Central Park and Times Square. Clean and actually quite a spacious room for NYC! Nicely decorated, good aircon and very comfortable beds. Really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again!
user_name:
fbivens88
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: This is my first review on TripAdvisor, but I had to post this because we had a great experience with the management at Park Central.My fiancé and I just returned from a week long trip to Manhattan, where we began our stay at the Park Central Hotel. We arrived around midnight on a weeknight and had requested a King room but were not guaranteed one. We were told that one was available with a smaller bathroom, so we went ahead and grabbed it, ready to get some rest after a long flight.After our first night in our room, we decided that while we enjoyed the hotel, we didn't like our specific room for a few reasons of our own. We approached the managers the next day to discuss what our options were. Darren helped us out and gave us some options that we could swap to within Park Central or at their neighboring sister hotel, WestHouse. He very patiently and politely walked us through each option, showed us a potential room we could move over to, and took the lead on handling the entire transition to the WestHouse the following day. I had booked through a third party, so there were a few extra steps involved, but with Darren's attentive help, things were handling very smoothly and seamlessly! He even offered us some great perks to help offset the annoyance of needing to re-pack/check-out and check-in to the new room. All in all, my fiancé and I were both thoroughly impressed! We had a great and time during the rest of our stay in NYC. Certainly very memorable, all thanks to Darren!

Thanks for excellent experience with the best service and personal treatment led by the impressive hotel manager Elizabeth that was willing to listen, check and support with relevant solutions-it’s not something you see that often!!The hotel and room were clean, great location and again the service and support were the best!! See you again soon!!

If you are looking to stay in the heart of Manhattan, this is a great option- 2 minutes walk from Central Park and 10 minutes from Times Square. But the problem is the staff, some of whom are just short of being rude. If you are from Asia, you are certainly not used to this sort of behaviour. While nothing in the US is a patch on what we take for granted in Asia, the staff at the hotel was bad by American standards as well. For instance, the woman at the front desk did not say clearly if breakfast was included in the package or not.We reached the hotel a little after noon and but there was no clarity on whether an early check-in was possible or not(we had put in a request for it). Finally, got the room at 3 pm with the staff advising checking with them periodically (the “confirmed” check-in time is 4pm).It’s an old property and the room was comfortable with the basic amenities. Nothing great.

I would like to Thank Eliizabeth.We booked on 28,sept, but in the last minute we had change of plans and arrived a day earlier. She took her time and helped us with the new reservation. The location of hotel is perfect,

This hotel is in a good location, decent size rooms and clean. However I was suprised that they charge a resort fee which was over the top at around $36 US a day - so it cost me around $450 NZD for an eight day stay on top of what I had already paid.I booked through a Travel Agent who wasn't aware of it.Anyway, I am at a loss as to what this fee paid for? No bottled water in the room , didn't get a newspaper. So must over the 'free wifi'. Dissapointing.This hotel doesn't even have room service or a restaurant by the way nor a mini bar and half of the lifts were not operating which did not help on the last day when I wanted to check out.As i said it was in a good location and clean but I wont be back.

Great location and great rooms. Even greater is the attention who make our stay to other level. We have a small baby and Elizabeth Cacovic make our visit memorable and incredible helping us giving a huge extra mile. Elizabeth proactively find a fridge and a hot water heater, essentials when you have to travel with a small baby. I'm a heavy travel and this is a very special detail. Thanks so much Elizabeth and we definitely come back again because of you. Totally recommended hotel! Thank you Elizabeth for being so great!

Location is great. Walking distance to major attractions and Central Park. The rooms are huge by NY standard. Remodeled bathrooms and the most important a cheerful staff at the front desk welcoming you to the hotel. I wanted to recognize Carolyne who has excelled customer service skills and helped us a lot . I will stay here again and will recommend the hotel

The rooms and service was no more then OK , if you come here and expecting to have a 3 star hotel expernoce and nothing more you'll be ok , the room cleaning was not good and we got towels with stains once, sometimes you could even find stains on the sheets... they also forgot to clean our room on some day..

We arrived yesterday for 5 days in this hotel at 2 p.m and they told us to come back at 4 (our check in time) because they had a problem with the computer system, so we didn’t go far away and at 4 p.m. we were there but the rooms were not available and they told us they could become available in 1 minute or in 4 hours.Results: our first afternoon in NY was ruined, I had a very important meeting at 5.30 and I was not able to change, to shower and to rest so I had to justify with my client for my appearance.When we arrived back in hotel we asked if they could do something to apologize for all these problems and they said simply : no, we won’t do anything to apologize.For the rest the room needs to be updated but it’s fine and the position is good, but I will never return here.

It’s a busy hotel. Right in the middle of everything. I left personal items behind and Benny took great care of me! Thank you Benny Fong!!The elevator line is a little crazy but always an entertaining experience with other travelers from around the world.

The Staff was friendly and the room was clean. Safe was easy to use. The location was also easy to get to by Cab or Subway. This is not the Abu Dhabi Hilton, were you step right on to the Corniche. But 7th Ave is more exciting and for the cost much better then most in Downtown NYC. The 3rd floor gym was always empty so no waiting, wasnt a 24hr fitness but worked for me. If your looking to visit the City then this will work, if your looking for a spa treatment then you need to look up market.

We decided to stay a couple of days before our cruise just to get acquainted with the city. This hotel is located in midtown and close to everything. We had drinks in the bar and enjoyed the night. We've booked here once we get off the ship and really look forward to it.

My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights. Overall it was a comfortable enough stay but definitely could have been better in several ways. Pro’s: + Great location for subway, Times Square, park central- all were walking distance + Rooms were very clean and beds very comfortable Con’s:- No tea/coffee facilities in the room, which was unexpected for this type of hotel- No mini bar or fridge in the room- The lighting in our room was very dull- this was one of my biggest issues, as the room was dark all the time! - Not many staff seen around when needed and those who were there did not seem very friendly :/- Views aren’t great as such, especially as at the time of our visit, there was scaffolding surrounding the building.
user_location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom
user_name:
SanaRana1991
The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

review_body: We chose this hotel due to its proximity to Central Park and Times Square, Broadway shows, etc. It's what I call mid-price for NYC. The rooms are large, with two double beds for 3 of us. The bathroom is roomy with a large shower/tub. The only negative is the bathroom, which has poor lighting for anyone applying makeup. There's a small fridge. No breakfast, but there's a vendor in the lobby that sells pastry and coffee. There are also stores just outside the hotel. Relatively quiet location. Elevators worked great. I always recommend staying on lower floors just in case. Nice lobby area where you can sit and read or have a snack. Hotel has been modernized many times since it was built, so it's contemporary, with lots of wall plugs, LCD TV, free wifi, etc.

Excellent place to stay, very clean, specially the coacierge Miguel very helpful with all the things we want to do.  Really close of everything like time square and other attractions, the only thing I would like my room with sight to outside

At check-in, i am told my already reserved & paid king bed was not available. Was asked if a 2 bed room would be ok. Not a problem right? I didn't mind. HOWEVER, when i asked the lady if the room would have a good view her reply was "mmmhmm". That should have been my first clue to ask for a refund and run away. Pics below of my "good view". I also had no way of knowing there was construction going on. I called the front desk to ask for the name of the lady that checked me in, because i wanted to spk to her about my view and someone stated they couldn't tell me that. Ridiculous, i didn't ask for her SS# or first born!! So i spoke to the manager- Andrew told him of my Good View & he said to go see him the next day before noon to change my room. Like i want to go back down with all of my luggage to check out & check in again. He also said that due to the construction there were no good views. THEN WHY WASN'T I JUST SIMPLY TOLD THAT?? The next morning I decided to sleep in, had my "do not disturb" sign on the door knob and as I'm getting out of the shower i hear a banging on my door!! I listen again because maybe it wasn't my door, i had the sign up. I think i heard the door trying to be opened but i always have all locks on and hear someone say "but no one is in there". I open my door with a towel on my head and one wrapped around me and the lady looks at me and says "housekeeping". I reply NO THANK YOU literally pointing at the DO NOT DISTURB sign. Then she asks if i need towels!! WTH, did the two towels i already had on my body suggest i was in need? I ordered food from Grub Hub one night and did not know the deliveryman could not bring up my food. Received a call from concierge, once i say hello i hear "you order food"!! Again, WTH?! Very professional...Not. The nicest, most helpful and professional ppl i encountered were the Bellman and the beautiful young lady at the Grab n Go (with long dark hair with what sounded like a local NY accent). I stayed four nights here and over $1200 to do so for a run down room with poor service.

I brought my wife to New York City for her birthday. The doormen are very polite and helpful. There were no problems checking in, but, the concierge was less than helpful. It was as if we were bothering her when we asked a question. She gave us a map of Manhattan (we have visited this city numerous times over 2 decades). We wanted information about going to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. The cleaning service didn’t leave wash cloths twice, and even brought up towels when asked to bring wash cloths. The computers were extremely slow and we had difficulty printing our return flight tickets. We will not be staying here again! Back to the Marriott Marquis.

I would like to emphasize how thoughtful and sweet Quimby were to us. If the whole staff were like him, the hotel would be perfect. Thank you again. You are great! See you soon! Bruna, Renata and Ifat

It’s my 3rd time in park central hotel Everything is so amazing in this hotel The location, the great room, so comfortable... But more than that- the stuff, so kind and welcoming Especially Quimby, the manager!Thank you!

In a medical emergency in NYC , Mr Quimby went out of his way to help us feel at home during our stay in Park Central. We are very grateful for his help and am sure we will be back because of people like him in your staff.Rgds,Ivette Roig

The architecture of this hotel is outstanding.This hotel is very lavish and has an amazing feel. The experience was the best. The manager Darren was very kind, out going and made us feel welcome as if we were at home. He also shared with us somr useful knowledge. Thank you so much!

It was perfect! We were four adults in a premier corner room with two queen beds. The room was clean, modern and big enough. The service was always perfect, we did not miss anything. The staff was friendly and helpful. Any criticism of this hotel meets with us on incomprehension. We had Wi-Fi, a great view and it was essentially quiet like other hotels near Times Square. Incidentally, the location is just perfect!!! We will come back. Thank you Park Central Hotel, you are incredible!

After reading some of the reviews we were not sure what to expect. But we are pleasantly surprised. From checking in to our room we are very happy. Rooms are not big but clean and serviced daily. Also the lifts did not let us down, very rare we had to wait more than a couple of minutes. For location you cannot get better, everything is at your doorstep. All in all a very good experience.

I first stayed in this hotel in 1995 for my Au pair in America orientation so was excited to go back. The hotel has had a complete renovation and is lovely. The rooms are spacious and very clean and the beds are so comfortable. Every member of staff is so friendly and accommodating although we never got to meet Quimby! The location is absolutely perfect ... in between Central Park and Times Square. It will definitely be my first choice of stay in New York in the future.

I am picky. This is a very nice hotel...period. The entrance is inviting. The lobby is elegant. While waiting in line to check-in, a young man in a suit offered us free coffee and bottled water. I chose the water. My room was clean, decent size, nice furniture, great Samsung 55" TV; DISH network; very modern and obviously updated. Lots of places to plug-in chargers. Downsides...nothing to worry about: a. no coffee pot, washcloths, or bath mat. They were at my door in 5 minutes after I called and requested them. They do charge a resort fee of $35.00. Not sure how common that is in NYC. I stay at Embassy Suites whenever I can at a good price. That said, this a very nice place to stay if you can get good pricing.

Park Central hotel on 7th avenue right next to a subway stop. Very convenient to everything in this south of the park area. Times Square and the theater district just a short walk or subway ride away. Welcoming exterior and a quick check in.Room was plenty good size. No view as it looked out onto a center area and many other windows. Bathroom was small but ok. Comfortable bed and pillows. Room was cleaned well and all the staff were pleasant.A few negatives...elevators were not working well causing some wait. Shared elevators with the Westhouse hotel next door (much more expensive property). No light in the closet for the safe. Before arrival they sent many email requests for upgrades. After check-in, some texts to see if you are happy. One is enough. Resort fee of $36 for nothing at all. Except for the elevator situation, a good place to stay.

The hotel has been renewed and is very nice and comfortable.Staff is friendlyThe only thing is that is crowded and sometimes is difficult to rest due to noiseNevertheless I recommend it.It is very well located
user_name:
PMlovestravelling
New York City, New York

review_body: O don’t think anyone could be treated better in any other hotel. The fantastic people at the front desk ! The customer relations desk. So friendly. The room impecable. The service top of the line. The Park Central situated so conveniently to everything in NYC! If not by foot , the subway only a few steps from the front door. I’ve stayed at the PC over 20 times. I’ll never go to another hotel. It’s my home in NYC. I highly recommend this hotel.

Just finished a week here and hotel has been great. Read reviews before coming and a bit nervous but couldn't be more pleased. Staff pleasant n friendly, bar a great place to relax and no dearer than local bars. Romm was superb. Large, clean with amazingly large bed. Very clean bathroom. Room cleaned daily. Read of problems with lifts but we had none even on the busy weekend. Cafe in lobby was adequate for breakfast/snacks, with plenty of variety locally as an alternative. Can't understand reviews complaining of views from room? You don't go on a visit to NYC for views from your room you go outside and experience the city! Only 2 minor gripes. Firstly safe in our room was broken and still not replaced when we left (room 665), but we worked around this so not a major issue. Secondly, the cafe seemed run out of lots of breakfast food by 8ish and then bring out same goodies about 9ish for lunch. Why they didn't just keep replenishing items as they run out in the morning without the pause? Most people are out and about for luncheon. Only a minor gripe but it meant people went elsewhere locally so hotel lost that revenue.Can recommend the Italian restaurant a block or so to the left or the Stagecoach Tavern to the right for local eating. Would also highly recommend Patsys on 56th st behind Hotel. This is Frank Sinatra's favourite place. Food was best Italian I have ever had, including that in Italy! Service first class and surprisingly for palace with such a history was cheaper than most places locally.Hotel is located above 57th St subway which has lined N,Q,R which get you to most places.Overall a brilliant places to stay!

Five star experience at the Park Central hotel from the moment we pulled onto the curb to when we left. Clean, modern, comfortable hotel room with a friendly and attentive staff. Quimby went out of his way to greet us in the morning and make sure we were ready for our appointment that we traveled here for. His friendly positive attitude got our day off to a great start!Later when we checked out we saw him again and he gave us bottles of water for our 3 hour drive home. Very pleasant stay- will stay at the Park Central when I return to NYC.

I was very pleased with my stay at the Park Central Hotel. The staff led by Darren McLeod was professional, friendly and attentive. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The location is outstanding for tourists and business people . I will stay there again.

We come to NYC for business quarterly and try to find a nice hotel that is business affordable and business friendly.This one was just okay and I probably won’t stay here again.I have meetings during the day with clients and if the meeting is canceled, I work from the hotel.There’s a usable desk and space but here’s the thing, no in room refrigerator for waters, etc. and no room service nor restaurant.If you’re a fan of really hot water for a shower this is your place, literally no cold water. I mean I had it in its lowest setting and I swear my skin felt like it was going to melt off. I’m almost willing to bet I could make boiling water from the shower and sink if I wanted tea. Oh and no amenities in the room such as snacks, tea or anything.The staff is nice so no complaints there.Oh and they have only two working lifts unless they open the secret door to the other two lifts. Otherwise you, and everyone else, are waiting a long time to get up to your room and that line gets long. Just remember to not forget anything in the room that you’d have to go back up to fetch.
user_name:
markn271
New York City, New York

review_body: We have just completed our stay at the Park Central in New York. The good part of this hotel is the location. Perfect for Central Park and Times Square. Now for the bad. The hotel rooms are very tired and could do with being refurbished. The bathrooms are on the small side and could do with being modernised. In my opinion, shower curtains should never be used in hotels. They are smelly and never stop the water from going all over the floor. Only one lift was working during our stay so we had to wait around for ages to get to and from our room on the 11th floor. There are no coffee or tea making facilities in the room which I have never ever come across before. You don’t even get any complementary bottles of water You pay enough for the room so surely you can at least give your guests some free water?Then to top it all we got hit with a $36 per night service charge for services we didn’t need or even use. When I questioned this I was told i had to pay this as all guests do.

Really enjoyed our stay here. Rooms were beautiful and spacious. Staff was very helpful, polite and accommodating. Bar area was gorgeous!!! Price was great!!! I was nervous about how the rooms were going to be considering the other hotels prices were so much higher but I was pleasantly surprised! I would recommend this hotel to friends and family traveling to NYC and would stay there again if and when I return to NYC myself.

Thank you Sokha for an amazing stay at the Park Central Hotel, New York. You made our stay pleasurable and had an amazing experience with atmosphere, professional courtesy, hospitality, food, drinks and help around the Park Central Hotel.Will be back given the kind, warm hospitality you showed us.Thank you again and see you soon.AndreLife Coach Aussie M8

Stay was fairly smooth. We had arrived at 2pm and had two rooms booked for the 4 of us. They let us have one of them early which was nice. The other one was not available till 4 which meant we ended up stuck in the lobby for a bit needing to get ready for the rehearsal dinner we were going to. Room was comfortable had a hairdryer, an iron and ironing board. And very large shampoo conditioner shower gel bottles .I am giving a 4 only because their elevator was a bit of a long wait. Only one elevator that goes down. While all the others go up. Took 20 minutes to actually come down to check out! (15th flights of stairs with a suitcase is not really my type of a challenge). I would totally stay there again. Very awesome location and also a Starbucks right beside you. Can't go wrong. Never needed longer than a minute waiting for an Uber.

This hotel has loads to recommend it, simply it’s position is enough to make it attractive. However, even with advantages someone has to do some work.The rooms are a good size, and the bathrooms clean. Linens are in good condition and clean.The odd bit starts with food ; I can honestly say that in 40 years of staying in hotels I have never stayed anywhere of this size where you don’t have anywhere to sit and eat breakfast. No room service, no coffee shop with seats, nothing.The elevators are small and you can wait ages for them, and in the morning they are wholly inadequate. The whole place needs some TLC, it’s a bit run down.The staff are all VERY polite and helpful. I was at a conference and everyone had billing issues. The agreed rate that was given was not used and we all got told to write in, nothing could be done. Peculiar experience. Very average.

It was our 5- year old’s first New York City visit. Tho we could’ve made it a day trip from NJ, We decided to stay for a night on September 1, so it wouldn’t be too tired from waking for everyone. It was a great decision, and staying at Park Centra hotel helps us achieve a wonderful experience. It’s close to subway station, couple of short rides to Hudson Yards Vessel; walkable to Time Square; the Big Bus double decker is right by the front of the hotel, was able to purchase tickets and hop on right away (double decker bus is my favorite way to see the city and off the ground away from crowds at popular sites); nice clean room for us to rest after a long but joyful day. A special thanks to Elizabeth at customer relationship. We had some trouble with our reservation through Groupon. She was so patient, helpful and pleasant while helping us resolved the issue. We were able to check in earlier, quickly refreshed from a long train ride and headed out to Hudson Yards Vessel. We will definitely stay here again, in fact Sebastian said that get to staying at the hotel was what he likes the most about this New York trip :) ! Thank you Elizabeth for helping us impress our son well!

Myself and a friend of mine stayed here for two weeks from June-July 2019. Overall the hotel is really nice as you walk in and all the staff are very helpful. A lot of people mentioned to me in the lift that they were a bit disappointed in the lack of Tea and Coffee making facilities in the room, but little did they know that if you asked at reception they could provide you with this and a fridge at your request. We were expecting to be charged for this but we weren't so take advantage of it!Being in Manhattan, be expected to pay more than usual and venture a bit out of the way for cheaper eats and drinks. The hotel itself is huge and only has two lifts which can be very frustrating at times, but people have places to go and places to be. I would say if you are feeling fit, use the stairs as there is some really nice Jazz artwork in the stairway. (Floors 3-Ground if I remember).The Room: We had a room with two double beds and it was big enough for us both. It had a few flaws which I would have expected better from a posh hotel. The drawers did not close in the chest or bed side tables. The bathroom mirror wasn't glass, but a sticker which was peeling off and the bathroom also smelt a little bit damp.Cleanliness: I am a bit of a neat and dust spotting freak so I was dusting myself most of the time. I also left a hair on the back of the toilet to see if this would be cleaned...it was there for 3 days!However, we were only sleeping in the room, so to me they are all little things to me, but could be big for others.What I also found weird (may have just been because I have never experienced this before) was that if we did not want our room cleaned for that day, reception left us a message advising that if they did not come the next day, we may be "charged"? So keep that in mind if you want a lay in!It is a bit on the pricey side for hotels, but it is worth the pennies as it is a nice hotel and the staff are always very eager to help and chat.

Overall a great place to stay, primarily for the location and staff! Syleem is a pro at the front desk - so friendly and helpful. I hope he never retires! The manager, Angela, was also very nice. Only drawbacks of our stay were: 1) Room was average size, but bathroom very small. Toilet was angled so door would close. It was hard to maneuver with our family of 3.... 2) Views are not great.... 3) Elevator were out of service so wait times were long for the elevator (rumor: apparently this has been the case for weeks/months so not getting fixed timely). Used service elevators which helped but was not pretty.Would definitely recommend based on location and price for the value!

BRILLIANT place to stay - the location is perfect, walking distance to so many things, & a minute to the subway station. Staff friendly & helpful but not OTT. Room & bathroom was a good size, bed was huge & very comfy. Could leave our bags in storage after checkout, & great back lobby area for chilling & charging (the bar opens at night). Only slight downfall was the outside noise at night - but it’s New York, so is to be expected! (And we got used to it within a night or so). So glad we stayed here, highly recommend!

First time to stay at this hotel and it ticked all the boxes for myself and a group of friends. The location is in a great area in midtown; walking distance to many attractions and restaurants/cafes. We arrived during a busy holiday but were well taken cared of by the hotel staff. Elizabeth managed to get us a room with a view of Times Square, gave each of us room keys, bottled water and a complimentary drink. The room is spacious, clean and updated. At peak times of the day, there is a bit of a wait for the elevator as it seems not all of their elevators is fully working. Otherwise, it was a great experience and I'd stay here again!

Excellent place to stay. Very welcoming staff, especially Elizabeth. My friends and I arrived quite early and she made it possible for us to check in before time. Although there were some issues with Elevator, our stay was still worthwhile. The room was spacious and was kept clean. Also, most of all we had a great view of the city as well.

Third time in New York ... this time, the best view EVER !! Watching outside all of the time, when the sun rises, when dawn. Dazzling, amazing. Our gorgeus Central Park.Staff helped us professionally in our 9 days stay. Thanks to all of you. You are the BEST !Breakfast at the Park Lane Hotel Restaurant is stunning! Fresh fruit, cereals, eggs in various forms, potatoes, pastries, bread, coffee ... you name it. People serving at breakfast, just GENTLEMEN !! Upper Class. And the views, again, amazing. Right there, 5th avenue and the shops, Times Square and the lights, all those theaters ... but resting in calm, viewing just the trees of the mythical Central Park.Harry's Bar wonderful also. Late at night, in this very same hotel, after long walks visiting the city, in a cozy quite atmosphere, we could relax enjoying the best delicatessen to eat: oh those grilled shrimps with curry sauce! Our son, 14 years old, was allowed in to enjoy a delicious burger with us, and then, in all safety, he could go up, on his own, back to our room, in all safety, while we could still enjoy New York in such a stylish place.Lovely experience. We are just longing to come back.

It’s my first time staying here but it won’t be last and I recommend this hotel to everyone. The hotel is clean and has a central location. Elizabeth was very helpful in checking us in. She was very friendly and she made us feel very welcome. Not only did she upgrade our rooms, but she also gave us coupons for free drinks at the bar. This definitely made an awesome start for our vacation. She made sure that we had everything that we needed for our stay. Next time I visit NYC, I’ll definitely stay here again.

Couldn't recommend this Hotel enough, great facilities and extremely hospitable staff. The location was also excellent. Most of all the staff were so helpful with any quires I had, even after I'd checked out they were happy to help as I lost my phone. They helped locate it and even shipped it to me with little effort on my part so cannot thank them enough!

Arrived at the Park Central Hotel for a late check-in. Upon arrival the system was down for a few minutes. The staff provided drink vouchers at the bar until the system was restored. In a matter of minutes, we were checked into our room. The daily facilities fee was also waived (Thank You!). The next morning (8/29), we were greeted in the lobby by the WONDERFUL Mr. Quimby Hightower!!! He apologized once again for the delayed check-in process and provided breakfast vouchers-kick off our day. The kind gesture was appreciated. He went ABOVE and BEYOND to ensure that we were felt VALUED as guests.Great location! Starbucks within arms length, various restaurants and shops & of course Central Park. We will certainly visit again! Thank you Quimby and staff!

I stay at the hotel once a year every year and my wife and I just love it here, specially because of Elizabeth Cacovic from guest relations. She is always available to help us with anything and everything we need. We never doubt to come back again and again because we know we can count with her to make our staying the best!!! Contact her if you need any assistance! Thanks Elizabeth!!

My husband and I have been staying at the Park Central for years and what makes it so special it’s the excellent service we always get from the guest relations, Elizabeth Cacovic. She helps us with any need we may have at the hotel besides tips from the city. She is always kind, available and helpsfull. If you are staying at park central or planing to, be sure to talk to her. She’s the best.Angela

Stay at the Park central hotel at 870 seventh Ave, NYC was bad experience for us. 1. Their computer system was down so we had to wait for the rooms which is fine but you must have another way to help us out without just telling us nothing. 2. Their elevators malfunctioned so we had to wait in line for more than half an hour to come down from 16th floor with luggage! 3. The rooms had misty foul odor and outside was horrible construction zone. The staff people were very rude!!! Worst part we we paid for a luxury hotel and saw great review and was horrified by the construction on the property, extremely loud and rude staff. Why as a business traveler ever suggest this place to anyone I know.

We enjoyed our stay at the Park Central Hotel. It's a short walk to Central Park and Time Square. The lobby and rooms were contemporary and clean and the staff were all very helpful. We left something behind in our room and they went to extra effort to get it back to us safely. I would definitely stay there again.

tony, reservation mgr most helpfulgreat stay. small but well designed roomlocation ideal near central parkmost helpful when we had personal emergencypleasant staffpricy but convenient food shop. would return

I thought PCH was What I paid for and more. The staff was nice and helpful . Our room was a decent size and the bed/pillows were comfy. The hotel had a nice smell. Also the hotel was in a great spot, within walking distance to Times Square and Central Park!

Visited NYC for the first time the weekend of August 21st and stayed at Park Central for 2 nights.Only good thing about the hotel is how close it is to Central Park.Attitude from front desk at check in. Told he system was down ( have you heard of fail over? Most reputable companies would ensure this!). Arrived early and had been told we could get the room at 2pm but of course that was not the case and the front desk girl was rude.Room was deluxe? Well if that just means 2 beds then yes but let’s be real. Sink backed up anytime you used it. No place to put stuff out (with 2 women travelling we had no place to put our things out.. like makeup and toiletries. It was the darkest room I have ever been in. Lighting was horrible. Especially bad for getting ready for a night out. No face cloths. Then when you tried to call concierge no one answered ever!A terrible experienceWould not recommend at all

The only good thing about this hotel is its location – very close to Central Park. Our problem began with the elevators - they were a big pain because out of the two, one elevator was out of service and the other one was extremely slow. Every time we had to wait for at least 10 -15 minutes to get into an elevator. Plus, the elevator would stop at every floor making it very slow and time consuming. The exteriors had scaffolding all over - presumably the building was under repairs!The room size was rather small for a Double room to accommodate four adults - we felt very cramped as there wasn't enough space to keep our luggage and move around freely. Add to it the lighting in the room was very poor and dim because there were inadequate lights! There was no brightness in the room and the dull atmosphere was depressing.The room had no view. The 1st room assigned to us had a very small - prison cell - like window which opened to a wall outside! When we requested for a change, another room "with a view” was assigned to us, but it was marginally better. The window's size was a little bigger and the view was of the terrace of the adjoining building and the scaffolding of the hotel.The hotel staff declined our one-time request for some empty plates and did not assist us by providing any connectors/sockets to charge our cell phones. Water bottles in the room were also at a charge! Some of the staff 'demanded' tips which was surprising as to tip is the guest's discretion - cannot be demanded nor should the guest be forced to tip.This was the 1st time ever and hopefully the last time that we will patronize this hotel. We had moved in from another hotel in the neighborhood where our experience was far superior and extremely satisfying. Unfortunately, we had managed to get a reservation for only one night there otherwise would not have had to change the hotel.To sum it, we were very unhappy and dissatisfied with the overall stay and experience.

A hotel that clearly trades on in its location, fine entrance foyer etc but has scant respect for its clients once they have booked. External construction work and broken elevators made they place feel more like a 2 star hotel .... despite having the ability to use the glamorous service elevators you may still wait 20 minutes plus for a lift!! The City is hot currently .... and don’t expect much respite from your in room air conditioning. My first experience of this hotel on my many visits to NYC ... sadly it will be my last. Very very disappointing despite some really nice staff who care more than their management clearly do.

As soon ass we walked into the hotel we felt taken care of extremely well by Ana at the concierge desk. Ana was fast, and caring. She really made the start of our stay amazing!! We are looking forward to a great time here at the Park Central Hotel.

Best Location in NYC. Close to Times Square and Central Park. Rooms are nice and comfortable. Good ammenities. Staff is friendly all over the hotel, especially Quimby in guest relations. Has a nice bar and jazz music.

This review is long overdue. I stayed here with two friends for my 21st birthday, but did not tell the hotel that. After checking in, they noticed the date, and upgraded our room and gave me drink vouchers to make the weekend special. Shoutout of Nancy and Ana for making it the best weekend.

We had a great first experience at this hotel. Sweet little room, helpful staff! Mister Quimby is a sweetheart, you can ask him anything, he'll find a way to help you. Thanks again for not letting us leave on an empty stomach! See you next time! Isabelle and Co

1.The elevators out of service, please you need to something with that. It’s so annoying to wait such a long time. I think you need to provide a discount for these issues. 2.The hotel under construction and outside just bikes everywhere.3.Also based on hotel stars would be nice to think about their customers more.The good things - rooms are clean and staff friendly, but these elevators and mess outside little bit ruined my trip.

At check in I had a problem(caused by myself by brining my husband's credit card) with guaranteeing my reservation. The Guest Relations Manager Elizabeth Cacovic was very helpful in finding a solution and facilitating the process. At end of trip Elvir helped my print boarding pass and check out. The location of the hotel is excellent for many destinations ion NYC or to Penn Station for LIRR

I was highly impressed with the customer service here at Park Central Hotel. I ended up having an issue with my Groupon reservation going thru for an extra day. However, Quimby went out of his way to be super professional and accommodating. Not only did i get a better rate thru the gotel but i also got a speedy check in. I would definately come to this hotel again, evreyone is super friendly and accomodating. Great housekeeping staff was also a plus!! I was in room 706.

Great room, great proximity to attractions, and most of all great service. Room was spacious and I had a nice view of the city. The hotel is within walking distance of Times Square. And the guest services was exceptional, especially Carloyn. She was a BIG help.

Elevators weren't working during my stay. It took over 25 minutes to leave the hotel each morning because you had to wait so long for an elevator that wasn't packed to capacity. Hotel did nothing to make up for this or remedy the situation.

Nice location. - very close to multiple subway stations. One being under the same building. We got the corner room with a nice view but with all the construction equipment surrounding the building it was obstructing, we however didn’t notice any sounds or inconvenience because of all that so kudos !! Lobby and helpful staff are excellent. Rooms are dated with holes in drapes, visible cracks etc but I can ignore those. Liked the $1 breakfast package (pastries, coffee/tea/water) - very convenient. Maintenance/ Housekeeping was very responsive. I read many reviews where folks were misguided by resort fees. We were charged those at the time of booking from hotel site so there were no surprises for us but the only thing I used was WiFi. It’s Manhattan. Even SF union square hotels charge such things - just location based I guess. Not a big fan of their elevator system though.Overall we had a decent stay with more positives

Good location with a comfortable room and nice atmosphere !Special mention to Elizabeth Cacovic from Guest Relations Manager for making me feel special and at home ! I will definitely be back to this hotel soon !

We’re staying in the city for 2 nights and we’re really happy we booked the Park Central Hotel. Although the space is a little bit outdated but the client service was excellent. Our third day in the city I checked out and was ready to head to the airport when we realized our flight as well as 500 other flights had been cancelled due to a storm. We could not find reservations anywhere last minute and Park Central was totally booked as well. Quimby at Park Central offered us excellent service where he first helped me look for other hotels within the area and when that didn't work out he was able to pull a few strings and booked us an extra night at Park Central. He was Kind, considerate, welcoming and very understanding. It was exactly what we needed with our travel plans getting so messed up. Quimby is a true asset at Park Central. Thank you again!

Recently stayed there for a girls weekend - shout out to the great sales service of Alicia Nunez-Davila for making us fee special! Great location to many NYC attractions: walkable to theatre district, Hell's Kitchen, Central Park, etc.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel this month. It was our first time staying here, and we will definitely stay here again. The hotel is expensive$277 per day, however it was worth it. The hotel is centrally located in close proximity to many sites, restaurants and shows. We took a tour of Manhattan and had a great time. The room was a good size, not the usual small size hotel that is typical to Manhattan. The staff was friendly and took the time to provide what we wanted in our room. The hotel is clean and I will recommend this hotel to other travelers into the city. We had a room with a city view which was awesome, especially at night looking out at the lights. This is a beautiful hotel. We arrived earlier than check-in, however they stored our luggage, while we traveled around the city and automatically checked us in because we returned after check in time.

We’re staying in the city for 18 days and we’re really happy we booked the Park Central Hotel. The only thing we weren’t really happy about was the room. It was extremely dark (even during the day) and there was no noise at all. We felt kinda depressed when we were in the hotel room. So we went to the front desk and asked if they could arrange us another room with more light. Quimby immediately helps us out and gave us another room and more importantly he made us feel home. He’s kind, problem solving and he wants to give you an unforgettable stay in the city. We would recommend this hotel!

I recently traveled to New York for business and stayed at this wonderful hotel! The staff was outstanding and went well beyond my expectations to make me feel special. The front desk staff and mangers were amazing and very helpful, the hotels Central market was perfect for my on the go busy schedule. Our room was beautiful and impeccably clean. I would have to say the highlight of my trip was the friendliest face of Mr Quimby Hightower the director of guest relations. Very professional and helpful. I would definitely be back and recommend the Park Central Hotel.

The hotel charged me $75 twice and then $116 for parking again and resort fee combined. Although I tried to correct it with the credit card company The hotel kept recharging my card. As a world traveler this was the first time any hotel did this to me. I am owed a refund and a major apology for theft.As a New Yorker I can never recommend this hotel to anyone

This is the first of my 2 reviews for Park Central. I recently coordinated a conference there with the Association of Black Sociologists and if it were not for these five individuals, I'm not sure what my experience would have been like. Quimby's attention to details, Damon and Carl's generosity, Alvin's willingness to extend help whenever/wherever, and Mr. Sanchez making sure we were fed and happy were all the foundational things that made our experience with this hotel worth remembering. Unlike some of the exchanges with other staff members (look for for review number 2), these folks, also Black/Brown, cared about us and IT SHOWED. IT MATTERS, and WE APPRECIATE US. Thank you all for taking care of us.

Hotel is encased in scaffolding and under construction. Was told it’s been like this a long time and will likely remain that way. If view is a top priority take that into account. Scaffolding and nyc not uncommon but not told under construction. The elevator issue appears to be an ongoing issue at the hotel. ( read reviews Before reserving) The elevator is not working, again and again. You must use the service elevator. There was a wait for that in excess of 15-2o minutes, more than once. If you have an appointment in the city and don’t want to be late, be Early to elevator to try to be on time. Elevator service being Out and on going issue is Not a good reflection on the hotel nor management. Perhaps Ask for a low floor so when you’re sweating after you finally walk down flights, when you just can’t wait for the elevator again, your’ll be Less of a sweaty mess. RECHECK your bill. It should match what the printed advance booked confirmation/receipt indicates. After several attempts over a week, it was corrected. Trying to get what you’ve booked should not be on anyone’s to do list, while traveling. Travelers don’t want or need the extra work. The positive, Location is good for this area of nyc and check in was fine though not told about elevator issue.

My husband and I have been travelling to NYC for weekend getaways quite often. Stayed around this area in various boutique hotels as well as UES because it’s close to Central Park. We checked in to this hotel with my husband Saturday afternoon and our worst NYC hotel experience started. When we arrived at the valet parking, there was another car pulled up in front of us, so we were ignored as if the valet boy couldn’t see a full size SUV right in front of your hotel door. We had to take out all of our own luggage, no trolley for us to use, and no help offered. We dragged our luggage inside, it’s only when we got into the line to check-in, a man hurried over and gave us a slip - which they charged us EXTRA because our car is bigger than standard. See the irony here? When it’s your turn to service us, you couldn’t us even if our car is ‘XL’, but when it’s your turn to charge us, all of a sudden our car is ‘XL’.Fine, a little bit extra, who cares, let’s move on.We dropped off our own luggage in the room, and headed out to Broadway show. BTW highly recommend To Kill a Mockingbird in Schubert. We returned to the hotel room 11:30PM. When we got into the room we heard a high-pitch squeaking noise from the bathroom. Went in to check what’s going on , turned out the shower faucet was making the constant noise. It was so loud that with a closed bathroom door we couldn’t even hear our TV. Called the Maintenance number, lady on the phone told us she put in a service ticket but no ETA for the fix, and that most likely tomorrow morning. I turned on the speaker and asked if she could hear the noise herself. She confirmed she did - so she sent a guy here around midnight. The guy checked around and said there’s nothing he could do right there then. He suggested us sleeping with a closed bathroom door. We asked him to try it himself to see if it’s possible. He realized it’s still crazy loud but he couldn’t do anything. We told him to report this to the front desk and we would need to change rooms.Then the front desk called us, saying they are 100% booked for the night, and no other room available. We offered to pay extra for an upgrade but were refused. The lady offered to waive our resort fee - which is really nice of her but didn’t solve our problem. As we were not ready to repack our luggage again and try to find another hotel room in NYC after midnight, she said she would send us some earplugs. Then a maid came with ONE pair of earplug , when on the registration it clearly said TWO guests. She whined about how she had to go back and get another pair for us , and made us wait until 1:30AM. We were both too tired with the drama for the past 2 hours so we fell asleep with earplugs and headphones of our own music.The next day around the plumber banged on our door SO loud when we were still in bed. Understood he's got his work to finish off as well, we hurried out of the room.When we returned the same night, we didn't hear the noise again so we assume it was fixed. Oh boy were we so naïve. It was only the opening to the worst hotel drama ever. 1:30AM when we were asleep, the Fire alarm went off - wasn't a loud panicking noise, and it only went for four beeps and stopped. Assuming everything was fine, my husband and I tried to go back to sleep because we didn't hear anything in the hallway. However the concierge started to speak on the broadcast saying 'Attention Please! Attention Please! Please Disregard the fire alarm.' It served as a trigger for EVERY SINGLE HOTEL guest to start running around. We could hear footsteps upstairs, screaming in the hallway all of a sudden after that broadcast. The concierge went off to broadcast the exact same message 4 TIMES within 10 minutes. Come on, obviously your message is NOT understood by the guests (otherwise they would have stopped running), say something else? Use some empathy please? Most of your hotel guests are from places where English is not their first language. All they heard is 'Attention……. Fire alarm' , of course they would run!Finally it took him 5 times of try to say 'It is a false alert'. But people were still running, and the chaos finally died down around 2:30AM.Finally we thought we would get some rest - until 4:01AM - the high-pitch squeaking noise in the bathroom CAME BACK - so loud that it scared me and I jumped out of bed.
