I went to shut the bathroom door and had to put on my headphone + earplug to sleep through the rest of the night.The next morning at 10AM AGAIN, a guy came banging on our door when we were still asleep (after only being able to sleep for 6 hours). Said he was the plumber and tried to fix the problem. My husband was polite enough to tell him that Service Request was sent on Saturday and someone already showed up yesterday - but the problem was not fixed. He immediately took off without even further examine it. Good luck to the next guests in our unit - you are going to have quite a few more nights of high-pitch squeaking noise in the middle of the night from the bathroom.In short, the reason why I wrote out my entire horrible experience is to help some other people to NOT experience it again. AVOID this hotel if you want to sleep.

Our group of 5 sisters stayed August 3-6. We had 2 rooms across the hall from each other. Our rooms though a little on the small side we’re clean and comfortable. The hotel is conveniently located near Times Square, Central Park and the tour bus stop. The staff is helpful and friendly. Quimby is an absolute gem! He helped us with a glitch and when hearing one of us was celebrating a birthday, he sent 2 bottles of champagne to our rooms and remembered my name the day we were leaving. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely come back and highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Stayed here August 1st to 5th. Great location for walking to central park, times square and Broadway. Check in and check out were a breeze. Great restaurants nearby _ black tap craft burgers for the best milkshakes! Rooms are decent size with comfortable beds. Elevators are small and slow. Staff did a great job during false fire alarm! I would stay here again! Yes there are lots of bikes on sidewalk due to free 1 hour rental free with hotel stay jyst outside of lobby. They disperse quickly. There are people outside pushing the hop on hop off tour and can be annoying after a few days. However this tour is really good (did in 2005) to see entire city.Recommend Greenwhich Ghost Tour and statue of liberty tour.Really enjoyed this trip and can't wait to visit again!

Really huge hotel with friendly staff. The hotel close to "Central Park". A lot of restaurants and coffee shops nearby, but they do need maintenance their bathrooms, I think for this price I can expect better service. Also would be awesome if they pay more attention about situation outside, it’s pretty much dirty and people with the bicycles just everywhere.

For the most part, our stay here was very good. The staff is friendly, easy check-in, and rooms are nice and clean. There is a lack of food however. There is only one small lobby snack bar. We also did have an incident where a maintenance person tried to barge into our room to fix a shower curtain which wasn't for our room.

This hotel is in the heart of so many NYC attractions. The hotel lobby is beautiful but the rooms are average and barebones. No coffee maker, no mini fridge, no microwave, only one tiny bottle of lotion. The ice machine on our floor was out of order throughout our stay and we had to go up a floor everyday for ice.The staff was very hospitable and professional. The first room we were assigned smelled like smoke and they assigned us another without incident (the cleanliness was inconsistent in the new room each day). Also, I have to give a huge shout out to Quimby at the Guest Services desk for being so amazing. It was my sisters birthday and he gave us two bottles of champagne to celebrate!! He made sure that we had everything we needed during our stay and was so hilarious and personable. Overall, the location of the hotel coupled with Quimby would be the primary reasons we stayed here again.

Perhaps our experience was a one-off (hopefully), but I’ve listed below the reasons why I’ve rated this stay so low. Keep in mind that individually, these items are not that bad but all together, they made for an unpleasant experience when we were expecting a seamless stay.1. Room change with no reason provided. We arrived in our room and promptly received a phone call from the front desk telling us that our room needed to change. No reason was given. We were told someone would be by with our new room key. We waited a few minutes.... no one came. We were just sitting there with our 4 year old, waiting to unpack.... So we called down and were told someone would be by shortly. When we met the employee, he asked us why we were moving as even he didn’t know. This was disappointing after we had waited around most of the day to check in and all we wanted to do was unpack.2. Elevator out of service. 1 of the 4 elevators was out of service for our full week stay. We understand this happens. There was no warning at the desk however and waits for the elevators were quite long every day. To make it more annoying, there was a sign on the elevators telling guests to use the service elevator unless they were carrying luggage. Quite an interesting experience when you get on the service elevator and surprise the employees who are moving dirty dishes and had no idea guests would be using the elevator. Employees we met on the elevator were very nice and we just made a joke out of it. Still, not a great experience.3. TV not initially working. When we arrived in our room and when we arrived in our second room (see point 1.), the TV’s were quite fuzzy, to the point they could not really be watched. Only after we spoke with the front desk, and they sent someone to look at the TV, were we told that they had just changed to a new service and the TV would work fine after being on for a few minutes. Would have been great to receive a warning at check in. Completely understandable if we had known in advance. 4. Under Construction. As many buildings in NY seem to be going through, this building has scaffolding everywhere. Not an ideal view. Would have been nice to have this at least acknowledged at check in. I know the staff cannot prevent this. 5. Tub drain plug kept coming out. This seems very minor, but we had to fiddle with the drain plug to get it to actually work. This was necessary for me to bath my 4 year old. This is the sort of thing I would expect to not have to deal with.6. No floor mat. Some days we would have a floor mat for the bathtub and other days, there wouldn’t be one so I used a hand towel to step on after getting out of the shower. Again, quite minor but annoying when added to other things.7. Key deactivated early. On the day we were set to check out, my husband went to the gym at 6 am. When he came back about 45 minutes later, his key did not work. I’ve never had my key deactivated prior to actually leaving the hotel. Not sure if this is normal?Overall, the hotel was clean and many of the staff we ran into were pleasant. But based on other reviews and the level of hotel, I would not have expected these items to happen or at least not be acknowledged prior to.

Stayed for about week at the hotel. Service was great, cleanliness too. Staff is nice and friendly Wanted to give shout out to Nancy at the bar - she memorized my groups drinks, was very professional, helpful, fun. She made my stay memorable. I wish she can come visit to Seattle :) Nancy is long timer, loyal and dedicated to this bar and hotel. If I go back to New York I will stop by to visit her.

I had a great stay at Park Central Hotel. The front desk people were very helpful especilaly when I was having an issue with my bank cards. A special thanks to Kemi for helping me with lunch when I was unable to transact.

Excellent stay. The room was very comfortable and well air conditioned. Staff were very helpful. The daily room cleaning service was good and flexible. The location was excellent for proximity to the subway, buses and the enchanting Central Park.

I called for help with my reservation and could not have found a more obnoxious person on the other end of the phone. I stayed there previously and sensed a bad attitude from the entire staff. I would really avoid this place at all costs.

I went these week with my soon to NY, we regularly stay in another hotel, but the price on this particular travel was very high. Anyway the rooms are very big, but they do need a lot of maintenance, the carpet wasn’t fit near the walls, the bed base was kind of bended, and it lacked lights, the elevators where a mess (out of service) so we had to use the service elevators.I can consider going back just for the size of the room and the price.

We booked online on groupon and they just charge us $50 more from the official price. From the bathroom was bad smell and poor light in the room. The staff was rude with us!!! No free breakfast, not tea or coffee in the lobby. Outside was also mess, not clean at all, bicyclist on the sidewalk , rude people. Honestly not a perfect place for visiting New York.

Still on the property and hating every bit of this. Unfriendly employees, no basic amenities even if it is a premium room. Asked for complimentary coffee machine and it took them more than an hour to get it to my room. No plates, spoons available. No restaurant. Cafe closes around 9pm.

My family and I checked into Park Central on a busy Sunday afternoon for a three night stay. We received the most excellent customer service from Quimby at the guest services desk. He was kind, helpful, and full of good energy.

We visited NYC w a friend of mine n our daughters who both just graduated from high school...we enjoyed our stay in NYC n especially enjoyed our stay at Park Central thanks to the lovely Elizabeth Cacovic!!! Above n beyond is an understatement...she’s absolutely every hotels dream employee. She helped us when we needed help...she made us feel very welcomed n made sure we were happy at all time during our stay n always had a very warm smile on her face. By the end of our trip she felt like family! Thank u Elizabeth because of u we were 110% sure we made the right hotel choice. We also loved the location n the AC was working perfectly esp because the humidity n heat outside was at an all time high during our stay...we always were relieved walking into the PC lobby!!! We enjoyed having a drink at the bar in the lobby behind the front desk every night...such a beautiful room w comfy intimate seatings everywhere u turned. Can’t wait to visit NYC n stay at PC again!!!

The front desk was very inefficient. Computers not working well and Not enough front desk employees. Poor communication. We have been here before and the service at the front desk continues to decline. You have to stand inine again to determine if a room is available to check in versus a courteous text to say your room is ready.

Friendly staff and location to park, subway and our sights In NYC Aus great. The resort fee is a little high though.We have stayed a few times now and after a few issues which have been corrected the experience is always good .

I spent a few days at the Park Central Hotel and had a delightful experience. The hotel is well kept, swank bar and my room was great. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to help and the icing on the cake was the service I received from Quimby. He was helpful and kind from the moment I checked in and even remembered my name on Day#2. My only issue was the elevators...they took forever.

I had a wonderful stay at the Park Central in New York. I was a little worried because I hadn't heard of the hotel before, however the staff was so friendly and helpful. I am especially grateful for Elizabeth who helped us get a room close to our teenage daughters. Elizabeth was so kind and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York. The location is perfect as well. Close to Central Park and Time Square.

They were very gentle and kind to me and my family and also helped in everything that we needed! The team is the best, and the accommodations at the hotel are extremely comfortable. I highly recommend

I was worried about how little time I had in NYC with my teenage daughter when we took the Amtrak from Philly (we are from Texas). I wanted a location that would allow us to walk and only use public transportation but see several highlights (Central Park, Top of the Rock, Statue of Liberty and 9/11 Memorial). We walked 1.5 miles with our backpacks from Penn Station (Amtrak) to the hotel so we could see Time Square on the way. It was totally doable. We saw all the attractions on our list (love that they give you a free hour bike rental w/ purchase of one hour from the place in the same building) and the super sweet concierge gal helped us with questions about the subway and bus (which is free in the summer!). The subway/bus to La Guardia was $5.50 for the two of us versus $60 for a cab. The hotel manager, Daron, was very present and helped when the front desk was busy and when one elevator had trouble (showing us to another). They gave us two queen beds instead of a King (which we preferred) and an end room so we had windows on two sides. Rooms are small as is customary in NYC, but I did not find them cramped at all, and in fact, felt the design was great. View was slightly obstructed by summer maintenance scaffolding, but we still people watched out of them briefly in the evenings. Sheets, bed and pillows were completely satisfactory to my picky taste. Shower was warm and water pressure was good. Thank y’all for helping our trip be a memorable one!

Came here for a long weekend stay in July. The hotel is close to Central Park and very close to the subway. All of the staff that we encountered were very friendly and accommodating. Our room was large for typical city size-this is one of the few hotels in the city that actually had 2 queen beds. The room and bathroom were clean and the beds were very comfortable with king sized pillows. The downside was that only 1 (ONE!) elevator was working to get guests up to their rooms. This became extremely frustrating as we had difficulty getting both up AND down to/from our room. (Especially in the 98 degree heat when all you want is to get to your room and relax.) They offered the service elevator for guests to use but that was glitchy also and our average wait for an elevator was ridiculous. Also, the ice machine on our floor never worked, despite letting them know it was down. However when I spoke with a manager about the situation and asked what they were doing to remedy things or to compensate guests, she made an offer that I felt was fair, which is why I'm giving them 4 stars. ( I complained, she responded appropriately and did what she could-that's what you want from decent customer service.) Because of this, I would stay here again and can recommend them.

For a fair price, we had easy access to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Columbus Circle and much more! We were traveling for work with a little sight seeing thrown in. This hotel rate was less than 50% of the training hotel rate, but right around the corner. We appreciated the smaller crowds and quiet lobby after being in the larger training hotel property. The staff were all friendly, too! The lounge is great, but a restaurant on property would have been appreciated. It appears that the public areas and rooms were all recently re-done. Nice.

Park Central was a good stay. We stayed at several hotels during our visit and it wasn’t one of my favorites, but I really appreciated the space. The rooms were larger than many of the others and ours was very clean with a bathtub! My review rating is based on the hotel itself. If I took construction into consideration and had I felt the need to sleep later it would have been a 3. We were up early every morning to sight see anyways, so it didn’t bother me so much. If you want a real room instead of a decent sized walk in closet with a shower in NY and plan to get up early I would definitely recommend staying here.

It’s just unbelievable how one of the best hotel in New York no wondering about their customers. Too noisy outside, construction workers, rude people with bicycle always blocking the sidewalk . Additional charges, daily fee for nothing.

We stayed at Park on our second week of being in NYC. It was an amazing location and amazing service! When we first arrived the bathroom was a bit funky smelling, and they took care of the situation within the half hour. Housekeeping was great and incredibly friendly. Would def. stay here again! **Elevators were having some issues for a few days, but there were workarounds.

Ahhh, it doesn’t matter if you want to wake up at 7 am to the sound of BIG Construction right outside your window, jackhammering of bricks off the hotel facade, the broken elevators, trying to squeeze into the overcrowded cargo elevator with the garbage just to get out in the morning, or the non-existence of any type of restaurant to get something to eat, this place is a real Train wreck of a hotel. The views out the old windows are of scaffolding and chicken wire that has been there for a LONG TIME and doesn’t look like it’s going anywhere soon. Just Awful, but a bit better than the sidewalk, but just by a bit. Stay anywhere else !!!

Ana from the front desk was very knowledgeable and pleasant. The hotel's room and bathroom lightening was a bit too dark, not good for applying makeup or taking a last look in the mirror before heading out. Overall, I would gladly revisit as the staff and hotel was very comforting.

We did not enjoy our stay at Park Central. The hotel is very busy and noisy. We had to wait for the elevator up to 25 minutes! and then it stops at almost every floor It is also too expensive with an extra daily fee of 36 usd + tax. The manager was very nice and flexible and let us check out 2 days earlier and reimbused us.

I was surprised when I went to take a shower and there was no shower curtain on the tub. This seemed rather odd. When I mentioned it to the front desk upon checking out, they were surprised. Amazing that housekeeping missed an item like a missing shower curtain. It makes me question the housekeeping standards of the hotel since if the cleaner cannot report a missing shower curtain, do they actually clean the room? This will be the last time I stay in this hotel.

We stayed with 2 kids and Elizabeth gave is such a great treatment. She did absolutely everything to make us feel good: from late checkout to delight our kids. She really walks the extramile to delight customers. The hotel is very nice. Location is perfect

The location of the property is outstanding. Overall the staff was helpful and friendly. The cleanliness of the hotel was lacking at best. The hallway outside our room was not vacuumed for the first three days of our stay with a dirty band-aid and other debris visible. Once inside the room it was obvious no deep cleaning had been done for quite some time. There was heavy dust visible on baseboards and behind the furnishings. There was mildew in the corners of the shower/tub and the curtain was smelly. The towels were soft and clean, the sheets were clean and fresh and the beds comfortable. The AC worked most of the time which based on other reviews I was worried about. We waited in long lines for elevators that were small and very slow.

We (three adults) recently spent 7 days at the Park Central and had a great visit. The location is top shelf and it is a popular hotel. While we saw lineups in the lobby from time to time as we came and went, we never once had to wait to speak with anyone. In short, the hotel met our expectations in all ways; the location was just about perfect for first-time visitors to NYC, the lobby was great, the staff were excellent and responsive, the room was average-sized room with adequate storage, excellent wi-fi, we had 2 very comfortable beds and consistent air conditioning. It helps to sleep well.If it matters to you, the elevators are a bit small, but they worked well and we only had to wait once or twice. Unfortunately the bathroom did not have a fan to help with managing the moisture during shower times, but it twas a good size and we appreciated the shape it was in.I should note we had one small issue with an accident involving personal property while housekeeping was cleaning the room, but customer service staff at the front end took care of that without hesitation. I appreciated how they dealt with that a great deal.We did not pick this hotel because of its proximity to a subway station, but having the 57th street and 7th avenue station so close was an unexpected bonus. It made getting around so much easier to have that station so close.In summary - thanks Park Central, and well done. You really contributed to our trip being an overall excellent experience.

Bright side:Location is excellent, close to central park, times square, 5th avenue, rock feller center, etc. The room cleaning is excellent.The bed, sheet and towels are very good. The shower is good as well.There are A/C and TV.The room is beautiful.Dark side:There is just two small elevators for all the Hotel guests, and to top it off one of them is always brake. Sometimes I had to wait 30 minutes to get an elevator to my flor or to go down, it wasn’t good at all.The receptionists were not friendly at all.There is no minibar in the room.There is no restaurant in the Hotel (just a bar to get drinks) and a convenience coffee.There is no room service to order food in the room.There is no messenger to help with the luggages.The receptionist Ana recommended us to have dinner in a restaurant named Tuscany. It was just terrible!! Poisoned food (we got stomachache), too expensive and the waiter was very friendly but a truly snake).But in the end of the day, the cost benefit is good and the location is excellent, with a lot of restaurants around, close to central park, 5th avenue and Broadway. So I recommend this Hotel.

Just spent a Sunday overnight here for the 1st time and had a great experience. You cant beat the location and the Price. $181.00 overnight parking included. Went to the CHER SHOW ( Loved it) 3 block walk. Central park was also 3 blocks and our restaurant, Marea, was 3 blocks. Staff was very friendly even though they had a BLACKOUT in NYC the night before.

i am not pleased with elevators not working and if could get any worse NYC blackout of midtown. I had to walk up stairs and stairs and stairs to my room the 15th floor. The room was nice and staff was friendly However I must stay the guy with the sling i think his name is Kareem and the lady at guest relations was very helpful and courteous during black out they made sure every guest calm. I sat in the bar for hours he walked around giving us updates and water. In the end I couldn't wait and I asked manager if I can go to my room and he got a staff to take to my room and gave me glow sticks for stairs. I would visit hotel again mainly because how professional the manager Kareem and staff handle this crazy blackout...BUT FIX YOUR ELEVATORS!!!!

I planned a trip with my family to NY every year and this year we picked a great hotel. Room was clean and staff was very polite the manager Karim at guest relations desk was helpful and followed up. We booked double beds room but my husband is in a wheelchair and at check in the room we booked cannot fit wheelchair. We came back down and spoke with Manager he helped us in changing room to one that suitable for wheelchair and followed up to make sure we settled in.

Emanuel was so helpful. He has made the stay enjoyable so far and it’s my second time staying at the Park Central Hotel. I will always stay here when I come to NYC! I will recommend the hotel to everyone!

Emanuel was extraordinary. He provided service well above my greatest expectations. I will never stay in another hotel when I visit NYC because he set the bar so high. I recommend the hotel and I appreciate Emanuel beyond measure!

Hotel is old and dirty, WiFi barely works, elevators take forever, staff is incredibly unhelpful and rude, mold in bathrooms. In response to asking when the WiFi would be functional again, I was told “not my decision”.

I checked into the Park Central Hotel on Saturday at check-in time and the agent Karim was very pleasant and helpful. Upon coming back to the hotel around 7pm, I realized the power went out in half the city. Although the power was out the staff was very calm and considerate of their guests in answering questions and trying to keep everyone calm. I would certainly recommend this hotel and the rooms were very nice and clean!
user_name:
Tmalik94
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Disappointing experience. Given the age of the building, we expected a room so small that we needed to shuffle sideways to pass from one side of the bed to the other and bathroom counter space barely wide enough for a hairbrush. But we were surprised that there was only one working elevator for our floor, which resulted in long lines in the lobby and frustrating waits in the mornings trying to get back downstairs. It was easier to walk the eleven flights of stairs or to take the elevator servicing other floors and then walk the remaining flights of stairs to get to our floor (or to do the same in reverse when returning to the lobby). The problem was compounded when the one elevator was out of service for a day. (Unrelated to the citywide blackout.) And Internet access was available for only about a quarter of our stay. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the lobby was nice, the staff was friendly and courteous, and the location was great.

Hotel is updated, clean, staff is friendly and the room and bathroom were surprisingly spacious. The location was great, walkable to Central Park and Times Square and more restaurants than you can count. I would definitely stay again and highly recommend to anyone looking for a hotel in that area of Manhattan.

Spent 1 week at this hotel with my family and booked 2 rooms. I pride myself in writing honest reviews that I hope will allow readers to make informed decisions when choosing a hotel. I personally would not recommend that you stay in this hotel if your standards are high and if cleanliness is vital to your comfort. Here are my 10 points you should consider before booking this hotel:1. Rooms are drab and dreary; very old-fashioned.2. Old, dark, dirty, dusty carpets in the rooms.3. Chipped, water damaged wood in the bathrooms.4. There is no restaurant and breakfast is minimal.5. Windows without a view, overlook, what I can only describe as a junk yard and views into other guest rooms. So had to kee p blinds down most of the time for privacy, which left the room without any natural light.6. Not enough lights in the rooms - very dark.7. Air conditioning was very noisy (huge, old floor units). 8. Location is great. Walking distance to Times Square, 5th Avenue, Macy's, Empire State Building, Central Park and other popular tourist attractions.9. Check-in and check-out was relatively straight forward.10. Hotel is way over-priced for what it is. I can only assume that some of these reviews are not genuine and are misleading as I had expected a completely different experience.Also..... housekeeping were amazing. Thank you ladies.

Came for College Tours with my son. He had stayed twice before when his school orchestra played Carnegie Hall. Excellent location! Rooms were very nice and the cleaning staff was very attentive. The entire personnel was very friendly and helpful.One bartender, John Cavanagh was especially notable. Super friendly, very helpful with restaurant suggestions and general information. If management reads these reviews, John should get an extra week of paid vacation! And no he didn't ask me to write that!

This is our third time staying at the park central hotel. Our experience is always amazing! The rooms are always very clean. Thank you so much Ana, Kemi, Karim— you made our stay worth it. The location is also very convenient, it’s only a few blocks from time square and Central Park!

The staff at Park Central is just simply amazing. Very polite and professional and eager to assist every step of the way. They go above and beyond the normal and has been the best experience out of a stay at a hotel. Location was better than I had anticipated as well. Will definitely stay here next time we are in town.

Location is perfect, only 2.5 blocks walking from Central Park; 2 blocks from best part of 5th avenue and 3-4 blocks from Columbus CircleMetro station is in the same sidewalk of the hotel and, if needs, there is another access with elevator 1 block away for strollers, for example;At the corner of the hotel's block, there is an awesome place for breakfast with great options since sandwiches till yogurt - bacon, egg & cheese with toast, it is awesome!!In addition, all the hotel staff are very attentive, and they have solved all needs I've had very fastLast, but not least, regarding the room, I've chosen good size one, with 2 bed queens, one sofa and place to work. Excellent for my wife, mydaughters and I

As soon as we arrived on the floor where our room was located, it reeked of beach towels exposed to ocean water. The area behind the table lamp was dusty and the radio/alarm was broken. Called the front desk to have it replaced but they never did. The elevators to the rooms were crowded at most times and had broken down during peak period. We had to take the stairs down twelve flights to the lobby. I’m not even sure why we pay a daily “resort fee” perhaps for the beach-like pungent reek. I would not recommend this hotel unless you cherish its location. I’m appalled that this hotel is rated four-star.
user_name:
JasRas74
New York City, New York

review_body: Pretty nice, updated hotel in the heart of NYC tourist area. I was taken aback by the fact that they added $35 to each day of my stay--a facility fee (or something to that effect). Apparently that's common in New York. Pretty slimy IMHO. The front desk seemed a little embarrassed when I called them on it and asked them to waive it, which they didn't. Other hotel details: Great room, super-comfy beds. Could hear the noise from the street (I was on the 4th floor) but still slept like a baby. The lobby bar had weird hours. Always seemed to have to wait for an elevator as the other 2 elevators were taken over by the Manhattan club, whatever that is. The location is great (near theaters and Central Park) and awful (it's a very high density of tourists, meaning you're constantly getting brochures shoved in your face as you leave the building). Not sure I'll stay there again. That facility fee is pretty unnerving.

The selling point of this property is it’s location.Only a 5 minute walk to either Central Park or in the other direction to Time Square.The rooms were ok. No windows but, we didn’t pay for that option. Bar downstairs was comfortable after a lot of walking on cold days/evenings. We will certainly return when in New York

The best things of this hotel are the location and Nancy and Q, who work here. They were lovely to us and tried to help in everything! It is not easy to find people like this. Thanks guys! Bad side of it : i missed a lot of light in the room, it is quite dark. Although we got a room changing and the second room was lighter.... but even. I missed light.

Great location on 7th Avenue and 56th street, very close to Central Park and Times Square, Subway just near the corner. 5 minutes walk to 5th Avenue.Large and clean rooms, excellent guest service.Excellent service, clean amd large room.Warmly recommended!

Absolutely the best stay I’ve had in NYC. The location is perfect...just a couple blocks from Central Park as well as Times Square. Easy access to the subway. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. The rooms are more spacious than any hotel I’ve stayed in in the City. It is very clean and all of the staff go out of their way to greet you and make sure you are happy. I will definitely book again for all my trips back to the City!!!

Came for a 1 night stay in July. Hotel is clean, staff was nice. However, they need to address the AC system in the rooms. We walked in to a hot stuffy room. Despite trying several times to reprogram the system to blow cool air, it kept reverting to an auto setting and switching off. Even when we were able to get the AC on full blast it was barely a whisp of cool air. It made for a very uncomfortable night. Also, elevators were slow, often not running. Many guests we came across said the elevators had gotten stuck many times, luckily this didn’t happen for us.

Stayed here recently for a corporate event, and this is place is pretty much a giant check the box meeting venue that benefits from a fantastic location. Everything works, beds are comfortable and rooms are fine, though the whole property feels a bit dated and there is construction outside- see bathroom pics. Much of the meeting space is in a windowless basement - fine for an offsite, bad for a wedding. There’s also an odd quirk where some elevators from the meeting space take you to a different adjacent hotel; apparently a common issue since we had it happen to us and saw it happen to others a half dozen times over 3 days. Food at meals was generally not great - greasy sandwiches, wilted salad (one meal it was just lettuce ... really just lettuce), but let’s put that on my company versus the hotel - since our one dinner there featured a surprisingly perfectly cooked filet!I valet parked on arrival and - it turns out at $60+ a night ... ouch, even for NY... and was blessed with a small scratch on my car when it got delivered after a 30+ minute wait. I get that the valet is a different company and the doorman offered to call a manager, but who has time and who can win that argument - not a great experience overall. Overall - very average monolithic hotel, very NY prices ... you can get more character and service for less.

This hotel is great. The location is a winner, within walking distance of many a wish list; including 5th Avenue, Time Square, Rockefeller Centre, Times Square, etc. The decor as you come in is immaculate, and the staff at check are good. There is a concierge on between 8-6. On arrival there was a mix up with the room. We ordered a twin accessible room and were assured by our agent that the hotel had arranged this. The room was a king and we were told by the member of staff that took our bags up that all accessible rooms were king. There were no accessible twins so they wouldnt have told the agency this so seems fault lies with agency. He went out of his way to help and arranged for a roll away bed to be brought up, for which we were not charged. The room didn't have a view but made up for by the room itself. Massive compared to other hotel rooms, a large TV, a lovely arm chair with foot rest. The accessible bathroom is great, with a choice of two different showers. There is a small step in to the bathroom, its tiny but as my dad has trouble walking he found this difficult. There is a safe and ironing board in the cupboard. The bar has some lost potential. We never found it busy and was dead on some occasions. If they were to do food here I think it would do a roaring trade.

This was our first time at the Park Central and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in a great location, easy walk to Times Square and close to the subway. Fantastic customer service, especially Benny from Security. We would definitely recommend to family and friends!

This was the second stay at the Park Central Hotel in New York. We had stayed at other hotels but came back to the Park Central because it is the perfect hotel for a visit to NYC. The location in midtown has easy access to the subway, Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center and more. We walked most places, easily, and enjoy being close enough to be part of the Times Square vibe, or the peaceful beauty of Central Park. The staff, especially Guest Services and Concierge, are very helpful and friendly. When heading out for a day of exploring the city I would ask concierge for subway directions - and have them written on a "cheat sheet" so I could navigate the transit system without looking like a total tourist. I would suggest when making a reservation, request a room with a view - some on the rooms one side of the hotel look out to a brick wall. While there is no restaurant on the property - its New York City - there is always a diner or shop open close by.

The service in this hotel is fantastic. When we explained we needed our room and fridge till 4pm on check out day for our sons medical condition Sokha immediately sorted it. We’ve had a great stay with all our needs sorted, staff are so accommodating and friendly. Will always stay here when we’re in New York

Definitely Human Resources has done a good job having CAROLYN at this beautiful hotel. Since the moment I have arrived a big smile and she make sure I was very well taken care during my stay. I will give her not 5 stars but 10, cause she deserves it. It’s hard to find people that is happy doing their jobs and she definitely should be promoted cause she impressed me. I travel a lot for work and it’s hard to find people that is happy and have the passion for what they do and for the company they work for. Good job to the costumer service team and once again, very thankful with Carolyn. I’ll be back from now on to this fantastic new hotel home for me :)

Fabulous location in midtown. Caring, friendly staff. Rooms are clean and spacious. I’d recommend this hotel for a great stay. Benny from security did an amazing job locating a piece of our lost luggage and went WELL ABOVE and BEYOND to help us out. He’s a true asset to Park Central.

Lobby was nice, staff was pleasant and room was spacious for NYC standards. The location is close to Times Square, so that's a plus. That's about all the good things I can say. I was expecting more for what we paid. Our room was mildewy - so much so that it had its own humidifier. It was not well cleaned - fingerprints all over door and door handle. Toothpaste and who knows what splattered on bathroom walls. There was soap and lotion provided, but no shampoo or conditioner. Also, no water bottles, fridge, minibar, etc. For the price and the way the hotel was advertised, I would have expected more. Overall, it felt like a run down Holiday Inn. We left and found a lovely boutique hotel for much less. I wouldn't spend your money here.

Ana at the front desk truly went above and beyond to make my stay great! She helped make my stay in this busy city like home. I was able to check in early and leave a little late. Made my stay here great!

It is my 6th time visiting New York City and this was the worst yet. Yesterday, me and my family had a flight to New York from Chicago. After a 2 hour flight we wanted to check-in our hotel. When we got to the hotel it was so noisy in the lobby. They said the hotel check-in time would be around 16.00, we waited for 2 hours to finally check-in to our room. We waited the housekeepers to “clean” our room and they said we will call you when your room is ready. (Which they never did.) After 2 hours we FINALLY checked-in and we went to our room. When we opened the door everthing seemed fine until my mom screamed. There was a lady in our bathroom, alone and without any cleaning equipments, so that made us scared a little bit. We waited for about 45 mins for our luggages. They never arrived. And after waiting 5 more minutes we decided to go downstairs to check our bags. The woman in the reception tried her best but she couldn’t manage to help us. Eventually we got our luggage (after around an hour) and because we were tired, we decided to sleep. Because the windows were not thick enough we heard every single sound in the street and New York could be the nosiest city in the whole world but It was like sleeping on the street. (My mom couldn’t sleep) All in all if you are coming to New York please don’t select this hotel.

First time in NY and it would have been an overwhelming experience if it weren't for the friendly staff. We arrived late, and left early and were constantly met with smiles and helpful individuals.Nancy from the Bar was the icing on the cake. Great interactions, and friendly conversation. She gave us several suggestions for food and activities that we close and delicious. I wasn't prepared for that sort of interaction, but Nancy personalized the trip and made it better than my expectations.Thanks!

Let's start off by saying, the one and only single positive experience was the 2 ladies at check-in!!! They were great... awesome personalities and very welcoming/helpful.... Where to begin? I guess it'll be simpler to just list them out- Room was a single/king with a shower/tub bathroom- The room was extremely dated and worn, i do mean extremely worn- Bathroom, is dated, extremely cramped, worn but functional- Bathroom, be careful with the hot water.. it is extremely HOT- No coffee/tea maker- Rooms are not very sound proof- Seems no communication between departments, requested late check out; knock on the door early asking if i was checking out; then security came by later and asked if i was checking out... all of this was prior to the 1:00 p.m. check out- Wasn't notified of the construction; woke up to drilling/cutting/grinding next door... - Heating/Cooling - the A/C unit was finicky; set them temp then set the fan to High, it'd reset after a few seconds.. did the multiple times... before it actually locked in and actually worked; adjusted temp then started the whole process againOverall first impression, definitely not great.... then again.. it could be a one off bad experience....

Great location but not good experience. I was staying in this hotel for 5 days with my family. New York is really interactive city, thousands of restaurants, great architecture, and interesting people. So, just want to say some words about the hotel, the room was kind of dirty, the check-in line was long, but the staff was nice and the location is really great. Another bad part that outside a lot of people too crowded, there’s construction and bike company on the right side always blocking the sidewalk, these things mixed up my feelings.

First off the hotel charges a ridiculous “Facility Fee”. I stayed there for 6 nights and the Facility Fee was nearly $250. That then pushes the cost of the hotel into another price tier and it just doesn’t offer enough amenities to warrant being in that tier. After a conversation with Elizabeth and Nancy at the front desk they agreed to waive it. Thank you to them both. The good: when you take the fee out of the equation there is great value for the money here. The basic room is adequate size for 1-2 people with an average hotel size bathroom. It’s nothing noteworthy but it’s very reasonable for Manhattan at the price point (excluding the fee of course). There’s a lounge area and a gym but not a restaurant or much else in the way of amenities (for instance no in room fridge) but again compared to what other nearby hotels are charging, I’m ok with those not being there. The location is perfect for exploring midtown. A 10 minute walk will get you to Times Square, Columbus Circle, Central Park or 5th Ave. There’s a good mix of restaurants within walking distance, both in terms of price range and cuisine. Carnegie Hall, Broadway, Radio City are all within walking or short cab ride distance. Were it not for the Facility Fee I’d probably give them a 5 star rating but I’m taking a star off because when you factor in the cost of the fee, the amenities and size of the room are sorely lacking for what it ends up costing. No fee: 5 star. With fee: 3 star, so I’ve split the difference and given it a 4.

The hotel is amazing, super well centered. Absolutely loved the location! The staff also, but having the chance to contact ELIZABETH to help us out with our staying was SO LUCKY. She made our NY experience great again! She helped us so much, I’m so grateful! We had to book our rooms in a rush because of an unexpected, last minute emergency. She did everything she could to ease our situation, and she even helped/guided us to solve our personal issues.Elizabeth, thank you so much! You are an amazing professional and an amazing PERSON. People like you make a diference!!!!! Park Central Hotel is lucky to have someone like you working for them and actually making their guests feeling really special. Thank you! Best Wishes,Marcela Braganca

Popped in town to attend a performance at the Lincoln Center. Found this hotel on Travelocity based on proximity to the event. It’s a beautiful property, great customer service from staff and well-appointed rooms.

We opted to spend a little more on accommodation during our trip to NYC to avoid any nasty surprises, and this one did the trick. It's well located, easy walk from Central Park and Time Square and with lots of diners around. The room was large and clean. No extras though, and the only breakfast on offer in the hotel is a small coffee counter so plan to spend money on all three meals. Also, note the extra fee of 35$ per night at the end of your stay.

The location was the best part- close to many things you want to see in NYC. The hotel was clean, the staff friendly and helpful and overall the room was comfortable except the pillows were just terrible. One other thing that was a little problem was that there was no refrigerator, coffeemaker, or microwave. Also no extras whatsoever beyond the usual soap and shampoo/conditioner set. Also, I wish I wouldn't have paid for a room upgrade because there was no view from the side window at all and there was scaffolding across both of our front windows. We did enjoy the daily inexpensive continental breakfast each morning which helped to make up for the lack of a coffeemaker in the room. Nice stay, but I'd look for hotels with more to offer in the room next time.

The location of this hotel was perfect for this trip. It is right across from Carnegie Hall and a short walk to Time Square. I have visited NYC numerous times and stayed in a lot of different hotels. The rooms at this hotel are larger than normal which makes it better for multiple people in one room. There were a lot of groups staying at this hotel. Mostly attending Carnegie Hall events. That made check in and out a little more congested and the elevator too but nothing to complain about. There is not a fridge or a coffee maker in the rooms. So if that is important to you, choose something else. The staff was not anything extra ordinary but nothing to complain about either. Overall, if you are looking for a clean room, in a great location, that offers a larger room, than this is a good option.

We loved our stay at the Park Central Hotel! The location is amazing—seriously, we lucked out on that—had no idea how good! The subway is on the corner, Starbucks is just a few doors down, Times Square is a few blocks one way and Central Park is a few blocks the other. The staff was polite and prompt to get anything we requested to our room. I gave it a 5-star review, but there were a couple things I wasn’t crazy about (definitely NOT deal breakers!). First, there were only two operating elevators to get us to our room on the 8th floor, and they were extremely small. It wasn’t a huge deal but got to be difficult a few times getting to our room; they were very crowded and not always able to get everyone on. The room was great—we did the standard with two double beds—but the bathroom didn’t have a fan and got very hot and steamy after showers—wasn’t crazy about that, either. Speaking of showers, I LOVED the bath products (C.O. Bigelow—full-size bottles of shampoo and conditioner and body wash in the shower, travel-sized bottles of lotion in the bathroom—new ones everyday!) and the housekeeping staff did a great job keeping us clean!Our stay was better than I expected, and I will definitely stay there when I go back to NYC!! Thanks, Park Central!!!
user_name:
princessCPA
New York City, New York

review_body: Booked the as the reviews looked good, but didn't expect the location to be so fantastic. Subway 20 yards away, central park on the left, Times Square on the Right. Carneigie Hall across the Road and Russian Team room round the corner. Very competent and pleasant check in staff, made all the better with great customer service. The rooms were really spacious. Very comfortable double beds that were made up with crispy clean white sheets. the bathroom toiletries were lovely - so good in fact I've bought them on line. Breakfast was included and consisted on swapping a voucher for a drink, muffin and fruit in the coffee shop. I think that was the only issue, it was often busy and is a little too small for the hotel. Other than that - lots of places to sit and enjoy your breakfast and charge up your phone - great free wifi too. Definitely recommend and am going agin so will be staying at this hotel.

For me the location was ideal. Couple of min walk away from Central Park and Times Square. Subway station for both down town and updated it uptown right out side the hotel. The hotel itself was clean and modern. Staff were friendly and even helped find a jazz band worth watching. Good size room. Having a bath instead of a shower in the room was nice. Only down side was the view looking onto the side of buildings.

Stayed here for an international music event presented at Carnegie Hall and found the Park Central to be clean, convenient, and comfy . Big hotel but room are spacious and very clean. For our stay it was Great!

When going to New York and if you need to stay in a hotel, why not consider this one? Good location, very clean, very quiet, very friendly, great service and reasonable prices ( for New York ) But $11 for a sandwich?
user_name:
Hans C
Region of Waterloo, Canada

review_body: I recommend. Modernized hotel with great rooms, excellent bed, impeccable cleanliness. Very close to Central Park, Times Be of and to major attractions in New York. We stayed a week and we were happy awui. The only point of attention, to be prepared is with regard to daily rates, but it is the practice of the city, you just have to prepare.

Thanks for a great week.. Special thanks to Mr. Quimby, who made my birthday very special and also helped w/ a surprise that was send from home and was not able to be found. He personally went to meet the courier to get it for me. Just one thing, the receptionists (ladies) should be more kind..

Groupon made a mistake with our booking dates. Quimby Hightower told us we were on vacation and to go up to the privacy of the room to call Groupon. After more than a frustrating hour of being on the phone with them and Mr. Hightower intervening, it was to no avail. It was not a pleasant start at the hotel, but Mr. Hightower did his best to save the day. He gave us a coupon for coffee and a drink and secured us another night’s stay at a better rate. His genuine warmth and compassion helped ease a difficult situation, all the while telling us, “enjoy yourselves because you’re on vacation”. Quimby Hightower, you are a breath of fresh air and a real asset to Park Central. We look forward to coming back because of you. Thank you!!Chris/Patti-Jo

Came to nyc to celebrate my birthday with my girlfriends. looking forward to coming back. Emanuel at the front desk was very accommodating. He helped us celebrate and didn’t steer us wrong. Thanks to him we made memories.

We have stayed here for 8 nights and we really enjoyed it. The hotel has perfect location, is clean and has great service. Elisabeth in the Guest Relations was extremely helpful and provided some great tips (e.g. the best bagels in the neighborhood). In this category of hotels you can’t really ask for much more. Arek & Dorota

Came into town for work and a little leisure (thanks to Emanuel). He told us about all the local areas. Vida verde was excellent. I recommend it all the way. The hotels service was impeccable. More like a home away from home.

Beautiful hotel in perfect location! Walking distance to Central Park, Times Square & lots more. Starbucks very close but the market in the lobby has good coffee too. Great drinks & service at the bar. Rooms are very nice & big. Shower water pressure could have been better and the elevator wait could take a bit at certain peak times, but I would stay here again.

Easy check in and check out. Clean room Emanuel was very helpful with the check out. Great location to some local spots in times square. I really enjoyed my time and will definitely recommend this hotel to more friends

I came from finland with friends for a bucket list trip. Emanuel at reception is amazing. His whole attitude throughout our stay was impeccable. His advice on where to go for fun was 100% on point. Cant wait to return!!

It was a lovely hotel at a reasonable price, nearly filled with other evacuees.Never making you feel like you are asking for too much and dealing with complaints rapidly. Looking really glad to see you Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

Great hotel with great people especially Elsa and Darren Great costumer service! Central Park is right up the street to, we had a good time. The trip through the airports, and flight canceled were the downer

The line for the check-in was huge, the administration gave me the wrong Room, the bedsheet smelled, spidernets in every angle, elevator didn‘t work constantly and the best: They were renovating the building and blocked the view from my window. The only good thing was the friendly staff at the baggage service. That‘s why 2 for the rating.

I recently stayed here and used the valet parking. When I got my car back they had stolen an old cell phone and a box of cigars that had been in my center console. They had visibly gone through my glove compartment and center console. When I called the hotel to complain I was hung up on. The second time I tried to call I was told someone would call me back but I am still waiting. I paid $150 for 2 nights of parking and expected that my items would be safe. Obviously I will not get my items back, but I would expect the hotel staff to at least pretend they care.

Average hotel, under renovation. Lift was issue as too much waiting but still hotel was fully sold out. Value for money as other hotel were expensive. Close to Time Square and Central Park. Area quiet busy and good.

We were very glad to stay in this beautiful hotel. It looks really nice, the rooms are great and the location is superb! Near Central Park, very close to the subway system and very near Times Square! Only drawback were the very steep prices for a glass of wine.

Despite the primary elevators going out, the stay has been fantastic. Guest relations, especially Quinby, have been super helpful including an umbrella to help deal with the rain. I’ve gotten multiple solid recommendations for places to eat within walking distance. It’s perfectly between Central Park and Times Square. The beds are ridiculously comfy and the cleaning staff does their job well. I’ve really enjoyed my time here and I couldn’t be happier. On top of it, the staff spoke at least 4 languages from what I observed (English, French, Italian and Spanish). Some of the things are a little aged, but I’d swing back by here again.

Excellent service from Quimby, one of the Guest Relations Managers- he made our stay warm and welcoming and always had a positive word to say (plus his superb style gave a great impression!). Look forward to returning.

This Stay was awesome. I checked in with my wife and 1 year old. The rooms were comfortable and the beds were nice and clean as well. Just a couple blocks away from Central Park where we had dinner at Tavern on the Green. Highly recommend this Restaurant located in the middle of central park. Make reservations close to sunset so you can enjoy the magic under the lights. Visit the Zoo and catch a ride on the Horse and Carriage that are waiting to take you on a nice 45 minute stroll through the park. So far our experience at Park Central hotel is 4.5 stars. I would have gave it a 5 star review but the elevators were so slow they were almost non functioning, so we took the stairs. Good thing we were on the 4th floor! Otherwise overall great experience and excellent location.

After a lot of “googling” we finally settled on this hotel in February 2019.The location was ideal, a stones throw from Times Square in one direction and Central Park the other way.Pretty much central for all sightseeing.First impressions and I was taken by the luxurious smell in the lobby when you walked in and the opulent decor.Our room was not a disappointment either. The room was larger than I expected after hearing numerous tales of tiny hotel rooms and it was spotless, tastefully decorated.Not the best view for some people but I rather enjoyed sitting looking out the window across at the office building and diagonal to the Carnegie Hall.The only downside would be the the lack of coffee/tea making facilities but we got up, showered and nipped out for breakfast and bought own bottled water but it wasn’t that big a deal when we were hardly in the room and more than happy going to the numerous coffee shops/Irish pub across the road.I thoroughly recommend this hotel if you just want somewhere clean and comfortable to sleep.

We Came to nyc to perform in Carnegie Hall. its was an amazing memory for us all. the hotel staff were very accomadating. Emanuel at the desk has great information to give. Only thing i ask is that carpets be cleaned better.

First time I ever stayed in this hotel. It’s a very convenient hotel. Close to everything. The staff in this hotel is great. Especially Emanuel at the front desk. He was very accommodating and pleasant.

Very expensive hotel and not worth the money.Absurdly high "sevice fees" for which you get nothing in exchange, not even a bottle of water in your room.No coffee maker in the roomHorror elevator, always malfunctioning, you never knew what would happen. It was like the elevators of horror of Disney. Rude front desk staff.Old building, the bathroom sink had a big leak and the furniture was growing mold where the water fell.Absolutely not recommended. Find somewhere else to go at a much friendly price.

Chose Park Central based on proximity to Carnegie Hall (just a 1-2 block easy walk). Very friendly guest service staff, and helpful concierge. Very nice sitting area that becomes a night lounge on the main floor behind guest services. Had a deluxe 2 queen. No "view" with scaffolding outside our window, but premier rooms avail if you want a "view". Our room faced CPark (north?) and was not noisy with a good shade. Very pleased with bed comfort and cleanliness (the bathroom was spotless). Rooms are as depicted in website pics. On line reservations and express check out easy. Great location for walking to CPark, Rockefeller Center, St Patrick's Church, Times Square and parts of Broadway. Curb side hotel staff conscientious of loading / unloading zones and pleasant. Facilities fee seems overpriced, but fitness room was nice. It was on the third floor if you want to the convenience of being on the same floor. Right by hotel same side of street / same block is a nice Deli (good omelets but one staff / owner a bit rude), Starbuck's (usually busy), Coffee Shop (less busy and great items), and Fancy Apple for bike rentals. Would definitely recommend. 4 of 5 rating based on: 1) Long elevator lines so need to plan your departure times for anything in advance; stairs were well lit as a second option for those who could; 2) Would be nice to have more option for filling water bottles but the tap water in the room tasted okay to us. Thanks for a nice stay!

I would like to thank Ángela, out ckeck-in agent on June 7, 2019 because of her efficiency and welcoming attitude. She greeted us with a smile and a welcome, then she went on to diligently checking us in. Then, she informed us of the hotel services and amenities; and restaurants nearby and things to do. After a long drive my spouse and I felt very welcomed and because of Ángela we most definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Jgmo
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Our second stay at this hotel. Located across the street from Carnegie Hall, 2 blocks from Central Park, 1 block from Broadway and about 6 blocks to Times Square. This great location saves a lot of taxi fares. Many restaurants nearby. Starbucks next door. The only real complaint that we have is there are only 2 elevators per wing and they are very slow. Rooms are a good size and very comfortable. Bathrooms a bit small.

Right at the beginning we were welcomed by this great, charismatic guy called Quimby, he checked us in and proceeded to recommend the best locations to visit. Due to it’s well placed location, you can get to The Central Park and Times Square in less than five minutes.Higly recommended.

The hotel is extremely well located, walking distance from Central Park, Time Square, Rockefeller center or even Hell's Kitchen where we eat quite often. The room was big, the bed extremely comfortable, not as noisy as expected for NY and really clean. The only thing we were not happy about was the reception. We checked in and out with two different persons, the 1st didn't welcome us and the 2nd didn't ask how our stay was ! I mean ... how hard is this ? They were absolutely not friendly or helpful... even not able to us that we needed to introduce our pass to get the elevator to the 15th floor. We were stucked like idiots on the 12th until a customer helped us.

My family and I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks. We chose the classic 2 double bed room as we are a family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids). The beds were nice and spacious. Room size is adequate. However, I must say for the price we were paying (more or less $350/day all taxes and fees included) the rooms were not well maintained. The drawers on the TV console table were all broken at the hinges, very troublesome to use. No free bottled water for daily consumption. Aside from the usual hand soap, lotion, shampoo and conditioner, no other toiletries were privided. No electric kettle in the room, we had to request for one. No chiller in the room also. Another thing I must add is that there were not enough elevators! This is a very busy hotel due to its location. There is a constant line at the elevators. Also due to the fact that the elevators can fit only a few people at a time. And most times only 1 elevator is functioning per wing. Other than its excellent location, this hotel is just mediocre when it comes to quality and service.

My daughter and I went to NYC for her birthday and we stayed at Park Central. For the price, the hotel is perfect! We loved the location. So close to Central Park and also close to Times Square, but far enough away from the craziness. Also, the metro is super close as well! We were able to get everywhere by foot and subway. We didn’t need to Uber or taxi anywhere! Regarding the hotel itself, it was great. Super clean - room was nice. Not huge, but that’s to be expected in NYC. We got the continental breakfast package which was perfect - we were able to grab our waters and a small bite before we left for the day. (Their blueberry muffin was yummy!) I was very happy with everything during our stay. I would definitely recommend Park Central.

In the mid-way between Central Park and Hollywood...not to quiet nor to busy... clean, modern and kind of modern. 10 blocks away from theaters and 5 from Cental Park. 30 min walks to American Natural Museum !! Alícia

We were very pleased with the hotel from the moment we walked in the door. Angela was the name of the friendly young woman behind the desk. We were very early and she told us about the opportunity to check in our luggage so we could begin our time in New York City. I told her it was our anniversary and she offered a free upgrade in our room as well as a coupon for two free drinks. She provided excellent customer service. When we finally checked in our room, it was a good size, had a view and was very clean. We loved everything about our stay. One day we had trouble with the TV remote not working and someone was there in less than five minutes to give us a new remote. We would definitely stay here again because of the hotel as well as the convenient location to Central Park as well as Time Square.

Great building and very clean.The staff seemed very relevant to help and where not the friendlies. Whenever we went to the bar it was either closed or we have up waiting.The building itself was smart, clean and tidy on the inside. Seemed as though there was works going on outside both on the street and the building itself making the entrance feel very claustrophobic and frustrating walking in or out especially on the busy street.  Location was great, not for from the park or Times Square! Just about worth what we paid and would hope we had nicer people next time... slightly disappointing.

I stayed with my family for 6 nights over the Easter break. We chose this hotel because of its excellent midtown location close to Central Park. It didn’t disappoint!I have to say that I’m not a fan of the NYC practice of hotels charging daily fees. It’s far simpler to include them in the room rate, paid up front. I understand it’s not just this hotel, but all NYC hotels, but nevertheless it’s extremely irritating. Park Central did include some extras though, such as a discount at the hotel bar, which was nice. The fittings are in good condition, albeit somewhat dated. If I could point out something, it’s that the shower curtain in the bathroom was too short. We enjoyed our stay in a family room with 2 double beds. The staff were pleasant and friendly, and went out of their way to make our stay easier. There are no coffee and tea facilities in room, but there is a Starbucks on the ground floor, and the hotel lobby also has a small coffee shop. The best thing about our stay was location - Central Park is 5 minutes walk away, the major museums like the American Museum of Natural History and the Metropolitan Museum of Art are reasonably walkable distances away too. So is Times Square. For anything else, the subway entrance is practically on the same block. There’s no real reason to stay in the hotel, so we didn’t really make use of any in house facilities. Nevertheless they seemed alright.

No guest relationNo welcomingReally unhappy Reception teamSo so clean. Everyday housekeeping team tidy up but not real cleaningNo minibar in the roomLocation is fineDoormans are rude and they cooperate with the taxi drivers front of the hotel. Taxi refuses you if not going to airport. They ask for money/tip. Sorry but like a gangJust thank to Concierge Girl helped us for many questions

I was staying at the hotel and the two manager ladies -Sokha & Kemi- told me that since its my first time at the Park Central, I get an upgrade to a suite!!! I was extremely grateful and happy. Super nice staff! Thank you very much, Park Central!
user_name:
juliamix7
New York City, New York

review_body: Emanuel at the front desk made sure that we were taken care of at all times. We loved our stay due to his hospitality. It was more of a home away from home. Thanks to him we celebrated a birthday to remember.

Stayed here for my birthday and were so tired from hanging out at Long Beach. We ended spending the whole day in and sleeping. The most comfortable beds and pillows ever. Emanuel was super accommodating.

This hotel is centrally located to Times Square and Central Park, yet just far enough from Times Square to avoid some of the intensity of that location. It is very convenient to the Theater District.The property is an older property but has been very well maintained and it did not feel like an older property. The rooms were clean, quiet, and more than adequate.There is no on-site restaurant, but there are many restaurants within a block or two for breakfast or lunch.The Bar area is very upscale and comfortable. The bar hostess, Nancy, made us feel very much at-home and treated us like family. Meeting her was one of the highlights of our trip!The only real negative to the property is the elevator situation. At one time it appeared that this property had a total of 8 elevators, 4 for each side. There are now only two elevators per side. One side serves the higher floors, one the lower floors. This works OK when the elevators are all working. During our visit one of the two elevators serving our floors was out of service for about a day and a half. This caused major queues to access the remaining elevator.The outside of the building is also under some sort of refurbishment, so our outside view was somewhat blocked by scaffolding and safety screening. We were not in the room much so this was not a major issue.This was our third visit to NYC and our third hotel. If this hotel is available, we will likely stay here on our next trip!

We have just returned from a week at the Park Central and after an initial issue with our room which had the potential to ruin the break the hotel came shining through. We had booked two rooms ideally adjoining or at least next door or opposite as we were travelling with our two daughters. Whilst I appreciate that these things cannot be guaranteed it was confirmed on our booking. When we arrived we was not even booked on the same floor. The hotel was fully booked and the best they could then offer was to move us to another floor but both rooms were king beds and meant my daughters sharing a bed. The lady checking us in was understanding and went to see a manager. Initially the response was well we don’t guarantee it but it was clear and then they showed us our agent who was far less helpful hadn’t actually even made the request. They offered to move us the following night into the rooms we had booked, whilst waiting only 10 minutes for our temporary rooms to be made ready they gave us complimentary drinks at the bar and vouchers for a breakfast in the morning and were really helpful.The hotel itself is lovely and it’s location is great for exploring the awesome NYC, we especially wanted to thank Nancy who oversaw the bar & took great care of us in the evenings especially our young daughter who she really looked after. We normally stay at a more expensive hotel when in NYC but this does all you need when visiting and will certainly get our business when we return.A great find.

The best thing I can say - it was some what clean. The internet was HORRIBLE. The staff was beyond UNHELPFUL and rude. Bar doesn’t serve any warm drinks (like tea or coffee). I will not stay there again.

My first time ever in New York and I love this hotel. Great location and beautiful on the inside. I was helped by the Guest clerk by the name of Quimby and he is awesome! He gave PHENOMENAL CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!!!! He made sure our rooms were ready and made sure were satisfied with our stay! My sisters and I are beyond thankful and I will only stay at the Park Central whenever we are in New York!!

Park Central Hotel is the perfect base for a NYC visit. It’s my favorite NYC hotel. Perfect placement close to Central Park. Great service. Lovely, clean and spacious rooms. Already planning my next stay...

Great location in the heart of the City - Easy walking distance to Central Park and Times Square. Hotel staff very helpful - Big thanks to Elizabeth Cacovic - Guest Relations - She was particularly helpful. Bar very peaceful

Great hotel at a great price for its excellent location, subway at front entrance and close to central park & times square, room was hot due to the great weather and air conditioning quite old but hotel provided a tower fan on asking that kept room cool really good bar / lounge to get a drink after a long day or before going for dinner

Good view n forsight. Nice food and accommodation. Would like to visit places like this and more. Goods roads and several tourist sites to explore. Good people to communicate and hang around with. Good food and drinks to go round

I have stayed at the Park Central a number of times and would not hesitate to book it again. It is a beautiful, well-kept hotel in a great location. You are minutes from Times Square without being in the middle of the chaos. A few blocks in the other direction is Central Park. The rooms are spacious, the beds comfortable and many of the rooms have great views. I love that the bathrooms have tubs and are already stocked with really nice products in large containers. If I have ever needed anything I have found the staff responds quickly and are always very pleasant to deal with. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

The rooms were very spacious and comfortable Amazing location Far enough away from hectic time square but close enough to walk there easilyRooms clean and amazingly comfortable bedsWould love to know where to get a bed like thatHappily highly recommend

I traveled to Park Central with a large, somethings demanding, group and they have been absolutely wonderful! I cannot say enough GREAT things about the guest services team, especially Quimby. He has gone above and beyond to take care of our group. The hotel itself is modern, well decorated and clean. I will be returning!

Great hotel. Would like to highlight great service of Elizabeth who works in the USPS desk. I had an urgent package and she helped me while clearly busy. She saw me in need and helped even with things that were unsolicited. Great person.

We stayed here for two nights on a holiday.The rooms are modern, clean and well appointed.I see some guests have complained that the view was restricted by scaffold due to external maintenance, but to see New York is best to leave your roomThe services and restaurant are fine.We would stay again. The subway and NYC attractions are all within reach.

From the time Judy & I walked in until the time we left The Park Central was definitely Central to say the least.The GREATEST location at the terrific all in one price including valet parking.Room was absolutely the best and cleanest.We would only stay there from now on no matter what the price!!We were treated as if we where the only ones there.Judy & Rch Levy

A few years ago every time I visited the city, I stayed here. Unfortunately this was the last time after a horrible experience (I stayed 10 days) I had to fight to get the room cleaned daily, the front desk staff was not friendly every time I had to contact them, I even talk to the Manager on duty. It is still a hotel with comfortable rooms, with a nice gym excellently located but the level in terms of quality and service declined a lot. It's a pity because there is a lot of options for less money and more service: I will not COME back

I have stayed at Park Central Hotel in past years and it never disappoints. Literally minutes after check-in on my last stay in April, I received both an email and a phone call from Guest Relations asking if everything was good with my room - it was - quiet clean, comfortable and well appointed! Director of Guest Relations Quimby Hightower helped me out with a couple small special requests that made my day! Conveniently located midtown/west, Park Central Hotel is kitty corner from Carnegie Hall, easy walking distance to Broadway, shopping and beautiful Central Park. The N&R subway stop is located at the end of the block to get you anywhere you want to go. Seventh Avenue is busy day and night so I always feel safe walking by myself. Park Central has a very international flair with an excellent restaurant lounge on the main floor and there was even live music on one of the nights I was there!

My experience in this hotel was wonderful. Service is exceptional. Elizabeth who is a manager made sure all my needs were met . I needed an early check-in, no problem. The hotel is beautiful and has a lot to offer a guest. Best of all, you can't beat the location. This is a must stay ....

Booked a standard room well in advance and having been there last year we were looking forward to our visit. We opted to upgrade to a suite. The suite was lovely, sitting room, bedroom and 2 massive bathrooms but sadly only about a foot of usable closet space, jacket/shirt/blouse length. So we moved back to a standard room,433. This was not a good room, apart from it had a closet. The area near the basin in the bathroom was peppered with other people's toothpaste yuk. The edge of the carpet has not been vacuumed for a long time. The 'fluff' was at least a centimetre thick. Noise from the fans in the atrium was loud early morning. We went to the customer service desk but people were being told the hotel was full and no chance of a move until that changed. We didn't bother to queue to complain, better things to do so we sucked it up and went and had a couple of cocktails in the bar. The hotel is in a great location being between Central Parka and Times Sq. The Consierge was a gem in helping us navigate our way around the city. The staff in general were pleasant and helpful. The bar staff made brilliant cocktails. I just wish we hadn't opted to upgrade as I feel we lost a better standard room in doing so. Hey ho you live and learn.

The Park Central Hotel is a great place to stay. The location is great, near Times Square but just far enough away to avoid the noise and congestion. It's also very close to Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center and just a 10 minute walk to central Park. The lobby is beautiful and the staff greets you with a welcoming smile. Check in was a breeze and our room was lovely and inviting! It was a nice size room and the bathroom was so fresh and clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. We were on the ninth floor. Our only disappointment was that there was construction on the street below that started at 7am which woke us up much earlier than we wanted since we were on vacation. Even though this was not the fault of the hotel, they made some concession for us even though we didn't expect them to!! We will definitely make the Park Central Hotel our hotel of choice when visiting NYC. We were also please with the room rate!! We felt it was very reasonable!!

very comfortable and central, many restaurants and bars around.the reception guys very friendly in general the staff very helpful, we had untouched included but not inside the hotel, it was in a cafeteria in which they have an agreement but just like it was simple and good

I have stayed at this hotel 3 times. I keep coming back because the staff is professional and always helpful. Great location. Rooms are spacious and well maintained. Quiet although in a busy location. I would hIghly recommended this hotel.

This hotel is excellent, clean, professional, and excellently located in Manhattan to many great venues (across the street from Carnegie Hall). Just be forewarned: There is a $35 PER DAY charge for .... who knows what. Once you made your reservation, you will get an email that says (paraphrased), "Oh by the way, you must pay this additional fee. We will automatically charge your credit card $100, and then whatever is not needed will be refunded." WHAT IS THIS??? A quick way to make money on other people's money?? This should be outlawed...As I mentioned to the staff, why don't they just put the additional charge in the price of the hotel? Not sure how NYC hotels get away with this...In Park Central's defense, when I mentioned to the check-in clerk "the additional fee is not nice (my exact words; I was not emotional, just matter of fact mentioned)," the clerk immediately wrote out a voucher for my stay, giving two complimentary breakfasts. I suppose they are used to the complaint and have a quick "consolation prize" for all who complain.
