They all arrived within 30 minutes. Impressive! The rooms each had 2 double beds and we were on the 4th floor, so we weren't high payers. We got a great package that included parking, which was important for my son. The rooms were really nice, with great bathrooms. Nothing was peeling, or broken. The beds were SO comfortable. The pillows were great! The housekeeps were some of the best we have ever met. If you stay on the 4th floor, you will have a housekeeper named Bebe, who will take care of you. She is the kindest soul there is....and so all of the housekeepers are kind because she guides them. I cannot say enough about the kindness about everyone in the hotel. There might be lines at the elevator, but they move quickly and the lines aren't all the time. Don't let it bother you. There are all sorts of restaurats within a block or 2 of the hotel. You are a couple of blocks from the park and the great playground if you have little ones. I've stayed in over 10 hotels int he area and really recommend the Park Central.

This hotel has a great location, close to the subway line just within easy walking distance of Central Park and Times Square. I can’t say much good about the service however. We arrived with 6 pieces of luggage and there didn’t seem to be anyone in sight offering to help. I know they have bellman there. Front desk didn’t offer to call a bellman to help our family of 6 and 6 pieces of luggage. We managed. Our room was clean and housekeeping service was so so. Guest services desk was helpful on the 2 occasions I asked for something. I asked the concierge about tickets to various things, she basically told me to use the computers and go to the website myself. I asked the front desk about arranging transportation to the airport before leaving. She said the concierge usually handled that and they weren’t there. So she also basically told me to look on the internet myself. The following morning I asked the bellman and he said if I wanted anything other than standard taxi I could look for a number and call. I am a seasoned world traveler and I managed all these things by myself. Maybe these things are NYC standard now, but I doubt it. This was not my first, or last, trip to NYC. I would imagine foreigners, or English second language, or no English visitors will not appreciate these attitudes.

I met Mariyam at the lounge and she was so friendly that I forgot that I was in NYC. RECEPTION STAFF WAS NOT AS WELCOMING THOUGH. room was decent but small as most in NYC. The lounge is a nice area to hang out. Not too loud not too boring

Excellent location, steps away from hop on hop off bus, Uber was very excellent and quick, the hotel was clean , staff were excellent , overall experience a good one. Their are so many choices and you never know where to book, we are glad we booked here, excellent hotel for anyone, and good pricing.

My company booked a 2-day meeting. While the hotel is conveniently located there's no breakfast, no restaurant, no room service which is a deal breaker when you travel for business.The hotel is full of families with children and I understand why. You can eat outside and just sleep there.The room was ok, relatively quiet. Hasn't been redone for decades so nothing fancy.Conclusion, good for families visiting NYC but avoid if you're traveling for business.

Nicely renovated rooms. Contemporary design I liked. Special request were taking care of immediately. Hotel management follow up, after check out. Overall I can recommended the hotel. Watch out for special deals.
user_name:
SieMatic1929
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here with my wife for 5 nights. Our 3rd visit to this amazing city. Park Central was a 5 minute walk to Central Park and 10 minutes to Times Square. Room was spacious with 2 Queen beds and spotlessly clean. Towels changed every day. A great hotel for our holiday. Concierge was really helpful and booked attractions for us. Only downside was no restaurant in the hotel, but we found a great little restaurant at 910 7th Avenue opposite Carnegie Hall for a great breakfast. We happily recommend Park Central as a great place to stay.

Stayed here for my birthday this year, the location was perfect 5 min to Central Park and 10 minute walk to Time Square. The subway is also located close to so you can catch it to downtown Manhattan and Brooklyn. The lobby is really nice and smells really good as well, it has a classy elegant feel to it and wasn't crowded. Staff at the front are friendly and polite and ensured a fast and hassle free check in which made the stay that much better.The rooms were super clean and tidy and the air-con was always super cold ahah, The beds had to be one of the best ever super comfy and warm as well as an ample amount of pillows. Bathroom was always super clean and had fresh towels daily which was good the mirror had a ring light effect which was nice as well. Beside the bed it had 2 charging ports for your phone which was good meaning you could just plug in your cord instead of using an adapter. Only thing would have been nice if there was a few more amenities as there was only really a bar of soap and some body lotion water in the room would have been good as well even though just drank from the bathroom tap and the water tasted fine. One annoying thing was the lifts, to begin with they were fine but throughout my stay they became increasingly worse and on multiple occasions had to take the stairs, at one point the lift got trapped and you could hear the other gusts inside calling for help and assistance. Apart from that the hotel is perfect really well situated has good sized rooms and tastefully decorated, definitely will be coming back

A great place to stay. Warm friendly staff. Great service. Centrally located in midtown. Close to everything I need. Keep coming back over last 3 years. Strongly recommend to either business travelers or vacationing families.
user_name:
sanjeevbhatt
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location walking distance to central park, columbus circle, lots of restaurants as well as times square and broadway shows. Safe, clean, esp updated nice bathroom, ask for street view though, guest service very helpful. Reasonable price for this location. If alone or friends andfamily very good to stay at. Highly recommended.

Stayed here recently and location of the hotel is great however it has its negatives.1 - after checking in one of the two hotel keys was not working. Went to the lobby and asked to have the key that I had at the time to have it reset or issue a new one. The person behind the desk asked for an ID which I did not have at the time and was refused service because of hotel policy. I was not offered any alternative solutions nor asked for additional information. I felt very dismissed and the experience left a sour note. So I had to wait until for the other half to return to have access to the room.2 - the room smelled musty so I had to opened up all the windows to let some fresh air in. The room my in-laws were in had the same must odor. They had to request for a new shower curtain because the smell was soo bad.3 - the windows of this hotel are not sound proof meaning get ready for some restless nights. Sound from the street carries and you can hear it from you room. If you plan on a quiet night and this hotel, don't count on it.4 - the hotel does not come with its own refrigerator. So if you need one, you have to ask for it and count on a couple of hours or more to have it delivered to your room.5 - walls not insulated. You can hear people from the other room very clearly.As I mentioned, the location of this hotel is ideal. It is within walking distance from Central Park and Times Square. Other than this plus, I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

We stayed here for six nights with our two children in a premier twin queen room which are located on the corners of the building. The room was perfectly located and looked out over Carnegie Hall. When we arrived there weren’t enough bath towels for us all so we used their text service to request more and they were delivered to the room within 5 minutes. We requested a fridge and coffee maker and there were none available on our arrival (Memorial Day weekend) but the following day they became available and were delivered to the room. For a family of four staying for six nights I was disappointed at the lack of storage space. There wasn’t sufficient drawers or storage space so we effectively lived out of cases for the week. And as some reviewers have mentioned the $35 nightly fee for “free” WiFi and gym (which we didn’t use) seemed expensive particularly if there for almost a week. That said, everything else was fine. The staff were friendly, prompt and helpful, the room clean and the location fantastic being two blocks from a subway, five minutes from Central Park and Times Square. We’d stay here again on our next visit.

They were very accommodating friendly and professional! Would definitely recommend anyone to go there. We wanted a mini fridge and all we had to do was call the front desk and they had it ready and sent to our room.
user_name:
edorlean89
New York City, New York

review_body: We recently spent a week in New York on a girls trip and stayed at Park Central. Hotel was very accommodating. Special thanks to Suzy (our concierge). She was the best ! Always greeted us with a big smile. Provided us with terrific dinner and entertainment suggestions. When we told her we were from Winnipeg, first thing she said was ...how about those Jets ! Made us feel right at home! Thanks for all your help Suzy...you were awesome !
user_name:
Kerry M
Lac du Bonnet, Canada

review_body: The staff is what makes this hotel. There is a housekeeper named Bebe who treats guests as she would treat her own family. She is friendly, efficient, and helpful. Other standouts are at the desk to the right side of the checkin desk——I think his name was James and then there is Quimby. Quimby is a star. He had a tough check-in with our group of 40+. We were not well informed ahead of time, so we all asked him the same questions one after another, and he handled it all with grace and kindness. Bravo to the three of you.

When you book this hotel through a 3rd party such as hotels.com you dont get an exact amount of the price you are going to pay. On the day you arrive there at the check in they inform you about a 'mandatory facilities fees' which would amount to 35$ + Tax /day and this is a fee that you apparently have to pay even though you decide not to use the facilities. This is an unfair transaction and you will end up paying because they make you sign a paper at the reception when you check in. If I had know about this I wound have not stayed at this hotel.. Its a business style I suppose !!

Three ladies in a deluxe queen room were very comfortable. We stayed for six nights, and walked pretty much everywhere from that location. The beds are comfortable, and the room was clean. The showers were hot and had good pressure. You have to ask for a coffee machine but that was sent up right away with enough supplies to last us the week. Our only complaint was that most of the time there was only one elevator running, so if you are rushing back to your room to use the bathroom, you aren't likely to make it! Luckily there are bathrooms that take your room key right beside the elevator bank... The other thing to be aware of as well is that this is a Wyndham property, so the stand at the front door that looks like a concierge desk, isn't...and you will be approached about time shares...argh.

Hotel was terrible. Service was lacklustre and disengaged. Room was minimalist with no coffee maker, fridge, mini-bar, bar soap or lighting. Check-in and baggage storage/retrieval took FOREVER with only one bell-hop. Guest Services too were rarely at their post. Concierge was generally unhelpful and overcharged my father for the wrong tickets to a baseball game. When he was also awoken by loud noise in the adjacent room and needed to switch rooms in the middle of the night, he was offered marginal compensation. They tried to rescue themselves late in the game but it was too little, too late. I should have taken my resident friends and VRBO'd in Greenwich Village.

We recently stayed at Park Central Hotel as part of a large group. We were very happy with the hotel overall. The rooms and bathrooms are well appointed and seem to have been upgraded recently. The bed was very comfortable. We had a room on the inside, so our view was of other rooms across the way, as it appears to have been built as a hollow rectangle, so it was very quiet. The bartender, John, was very nice and has tended bar there twenty years. Out housekeeper Bebe was also very nice and said she had been there about twenty years as well. I have given 4 stars instead of 5 as the two elevators were pretty small to accommodate a hotel that large.

Hotel was in a great location for walking to most all places - Times Square, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center, Theatre District and Central Park. Our room was a Times Square Sweet and it was spacious and clean. Front desk staff was very attentive and pleasant. Only negative thing I can say is there are not enough elevators and you may have to wait at high times. However, I would recommend the hotel and I will stay there again. There is a bar in the hotel but not a restaurant, but that was not a big deal for us because of the number of great restaurants in the area.

The hotel is well located and favors to get to all sides, it is also quite beautiful. But the service to the people is terrible. Of course, I do not talk about everyone who works at the hotel, but most of them are quite rude and their presence in an attempt to make you comfortable in the hotel does not exist. I would not stay at this hotel again.El hotel está bien ubicado y favorece para llegar a todos lados, además es bastante bonito. Pero el servicio a la gente es pésimo. Claro, no hablo de todos los que trabajan en el hotel, pero en su mayoría son bastante maleducados y su presencia en el intento de que uno esté cómodo en el hotel, no existe. No me volvería a quedar en este hotel.

Modern hotel on 7th avenue at 55th/ 56th street. Comfortable beds, very clean, nice bathroom, good toiletries.Noisy,street noise was bothersome overnight, so ask for a room on higher floor. Coffee stand in hotel lobby was unbelievably expensive.Lots of restaurants nearby.I would stay here again.

Came to NY for an event with some friends. Another member of our party booked the room.. when we arrived they asked for a 50/per night deposit on a card, First red flag, most hotels that actually care about their guests and trust them enough not to utilize advance holds. Although I didn’t book the room, I reluctantly agreed to allow the deposit on to my credit card. I will say the room was clean, comfortable, and stay was otherwise fine. The real problem came at checkout, when the front desk person then asked to put a 35/night “resort fee” on the same card where my $150 deposit hold lay. I had never been informed of this (granted I didn’t book it). The fee is supposedly justified by several amenities, such as fitness center access, but this is something I did not use, (and something most hotels don’t charge for). The place is not a “Resort” by any means, it’s a normal hotel. The combination of the deposit hold and resort fee, Felt like I was getting a little swindled. They use a barely visible after booking fee, and they take a deposit to make sure they get. Maybe I’m a little old-school when it comes to hospitality, so I don’t like the feeling of being disingenuously “nickel and dimed” by a place I choose to rest my head. I know plenty of other hotels in NY, with admittedly better quality and similar prices that don’t take the hidden fee route. I realize this practice is becoming more prevalent in the industry, but it’s usually a tell tale sign of a below average hotel with a greedy management. From this alone, will not recommend, nor will I stay again.

Very conveniently located. Small rooms. A bar is across the hotel and on the side where our room was at. Sure enough, yelling or arguing woke me up at 1:30 a.m. It's an adequate hotel. Not great, but not bad. Sure, I'd recommend it.

We have stayed at this hotel a couple of times now, in a perfect location between Times Square and Central Park.We highly recommend this hotel, although its becoming a little too expensive for us now.

Very pleasantly surprised at the extreme customer service from everyone I encountered in my 4 night visit !The rooms were very nice , large and comfy !The staff from the bellman to the concierge to housekeeping and anyone in between were all super accommodating ! Great location too !Walk to Central Park , Broadway and Fifth Ave .I highly recommend !

King bed room was spacious and comfortable. We used the bar and it is beautifully decorated and well staffed for comfort. Valet service was superb. Close to bars and restaurants. I used the small market for coffee it was very convenient. Elevator use was great due to separate elevators for higher floors.

We arrived at the Park Central Hotel expecting the all American customer service but this was sadly nowhere to be seen (which was pretty much how we found it to be on the whole in New York, not just the hotel). The lack lustre staff handed us our key card and failed to tell us that we would need this to use the lift, so after a long journey we found ourselves sailing up and and the lift wondering why it would't stop on our floor, until some kind guest came to our rescue. The hotel reception staff struggled to make eye contact and if you asked a question you were greeted with a bit of a grunt or simply pointed in a direction. Way off the mark of what you should expect of an American 4 star. We asked for coffee making facilities but did not receive them and really felt everything was a little too much trouble for the staff. On the plus side the hotel is well located and our room was pretty spacious. It wasnt the worst hotel I have ever stayed in but by far not the best. I wouldn't fall over myself to go back there.

I've been again at this hotel I still thinking its worth it's value. It's close to the subway station, close do markets, many cafes and restaurantes, 5 minutes walking to time square, it's a great choice. But some small details in the room need to receive attention and repair just like the curtain. I'd add that the service of the mail staff and bellboys should be better, I see that they have a lot of work but despite this I want to be treated as polite as possible. My overall experience was great but small details can improve our feeling of comfort and happiness.

Staff not nice when we arrive, the room didn't get clean by the staff during our first 2 days. BROWN WATER IN THE SHOWER !! !!!!! This is unacceptable. Also we ask for champagne glass and they said it was not possible. Not putting back tissue when they clean the room....

I had a great experience at the Park Central Hotel. I needed some customer assistance and Nhan was incredibly helpful and courteous. He was able to accommodate a room change request and he made me feel welcome and like a valued customer. Thank you, Nhan! Other hotel staff at the front desk, cleaning staff, and others were also super nice.

Excellent hotel rooms and hotel clean safe and tidy staff very friendly and helpful and in a good location hotel shop is a bit expensive only let down was no coffee machine in room ideal for family’s.

Spent the weekend with my wife and another couple for a get away. The location is great for Central park and Broadway. Easy access to the train system as well. We got a great rate to include valet parking for one time in, one time out deal which was fine. You don't really need your car in NYC with all the cabs/Ubers/trains. The rate included a room with 2 queen beds, would have preferred 1 king but the room was adequate. Your typical NYC hotel room but not as small as others I've stayed in. The location of the hotel is really what makes it a fantastic deal. The bar in the lobby is great as well. Lots of comfy chairs and sofas to sit in. My only complaint was that the tub in the bathroom took forever to drain. I don't understand some of the negative reviews. It's a great value!! The fees.....have you not stayed in a hotel in NYC in the last 2 years or anywhere else for that matter. Everyone has "resort fees" now.

I was here for a training last week and had a great experience. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel itself is beautiful and the lounge area downstairs is wonderful for relaxing or doing work. I highly recommend staying here if planning to visit the area.

This has been the worst hotel in terms of customer service I have ever stayed at. I think their staff don't realize the customer is paying their wage. They don't smile, they don't answer the phone at front desk, they are rude. The cable TV is off the air half the time. I tried to call down but they refused to answer. Beware of hidden fees $40/day they don't tell you about. Cleaning carts line the hallways 24/7. The housekeeping staff don't make eye contact with you, let alone smile. Do yourself a favour and don't book here. They rate it as a 4 star but it's closer to a 2 star. I've stayed in 3 star hotels in 3rd world countries that far surpass this place. NEVER AGAIN!!

We stayed for two nights at the Park Central Hotel, New York. Positives: Great bell service, great front desk assistance, great location, excellent bed (king room), good shower/tub, large bedroom space with plenty of storage. Negatives: $35/day "resort fee", which was not disclosed until after booking occurred; no restaurant on site, TV reception spotty, very small bathroom area, $65-75/night parking fee. Look for better deals that include reduced parking, no resort fee, free breakfast.
user_name:
Swendy5000
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Fab hotel, brilliant location on 7th Ave, 10 mins walk to Times Sq and 10 mins north to Central Park, perfect! Hotel is lovely, clean and comfortable for a city break, air con in room good, room and bathroom nice, clean, perfectly serviceable for a city break, T.V not that we watched any! but if you were here on business you might do. Bath and shower good, plenty of hot water, serviced daily, we never saw our housekeeper but she was thorough! Bed really comfy with nice bedding. Closet a bit small but adequate for 5 nights, a bit dark could do with a light inside maybe. We were in room 1158 and pleased with our choice of hotel. Nice little coffee shop going on for breakfast, but there is no restaurant but the bar is lovely. We had drinks here every night when we got back from dinner / sight seeing, the staff are great ! John and Alex are so professional, real slick barmen, polite and very sociable, when ever they had a moment to spare they came over to talk to us and made us feel at home. Unlike the reception staff who need a personality transplant, sorry ! With the exception of Suzie, concierge who was most helpful and sociable. We would deffinately recommend this hotel and would stay here next time we visit the Big Apple, and there will be another visit! we didn't use the coffee shop here, preferring a hot egg and bacon over the road at the Park Cafe, no relation to the hotel, but very good also.

I have stayed here twice and the first time there was blood on the sheets and it was late and I was trying to go to bed. It took them 30+ minutes to come change the sheets, I ended up passing out in the spare bed. 2nd time they hit me with a $40 resort fee, skip this place, they don’t get it.

Hi,I had the pleasure of stopping at the hotel for 5 nights in April.As my title says the location is perfect, just the right distance to Times Square, fifth Avenue etc.2 blocks away is Central Park perfect for a stroll in the morning and for waiting for the ladies to get ready.The subway station right next to the hotel let’s you get anywhere fast.After staying in NY several times before I will definitely be heading back to park central.Staff where helpful and room was clean and a good size.Only slight down side the lifts are a little slow but if that’s all there is to moan about then it’s a winner

Let’s start with the Staff.Arrived and had requested a room with two beds but told at reception in a very sharp and unfriendly manner that there was no chance to busy.Two tiny lifts which always have a queue at them and must be the lowest ever.You can’t control the heating in the room so it’s constantly warm nearly unbearable.Room was ok clean but nothing special.Location is ok little bit far from Times Square for my liking but that’s just my opinion.I wouldn’t recommend this hotel to anyone there’s a lot better ones for the same money.The heating in the room was real problem extremely hot bare this in mind.Both of us ended up feeling slightly unwell.

Checked into my room and the temperate in the room was 77 degrees. I adjusted the thermostat to a comfortable 68 degrees and started unpacking. 15 minutes later the temperature was still 77 degrees in the room and the HVAC unit was blowing hot air. I called the front desk and they sent engineering over to take a look. The engineer was very nice and stated the only way to cool down the room was to shut the HVAC unit off and open the window. What?! He explained that if the heat is on in the building A/C is not available in any guestroom. The only way to get cool air is to open a window. I've never stayed at any hotel that did not have both heat and A/C available in each guestroom. The excuse of management is the building is old. I've personally worked in turn of the century hotels and I can tell you each guestroom has heat and A/C. Completely ridiculous. Lastly, no in-room coffee. Very poor experience.

Hotel is within walking distance of Central Park, Museums, broadway, Times Square, shops, everything you could want. I asked for a coffee maker and more soap and it was brought up promptly. We had a king bed which was very comfortable, large room, good view on 12th floor, large bathroom. We will book this hotel again!

Let me first address what was good about the property: Great location - near restaurants, across the street nearly from Carnegie Hall, taxi access easy, and quite safe if you are walking around in that area - even solo and late. Spacious room - at least mine was - with 2 double beds, decent bathroom with tub/shower combo, desk, dresser, plenty of closet space. Also toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, gel, soap and lotion all very decent.) They have a blow dryer and iron - and that's good. Plenty of hangers too. And that's where the 'what's good' ends.Improvements needed: Clean up the rooms - shades soiled, carpeting dirty, walls dirty. Bath towels thin and way too small. HORRIBLE LIGHTING! For women this no-decent lighting in the bathroom pretty much means you can't see jack-all when trying to put on makeup, etc. - so you leave the hotel kinda scary looking! THEY HAVE NO RESTAURANT ON PREMISE! AGH! You cannot access any food or drink 24 hours there - not at all. They have a little market in the building that is open some hours - but NOT 24/7. NO room service. So at normal NYC time - you've got no access to anything in hotel so must leave premises to get food/drink that you want to have back in your room. Concierge NOT friendly or helpful - and the right hand mos def does NOT know what the left hand is doing. Everyone gives constantly conflicting info! First they told me that the restaurant next door, the Redeye Grill, was closed. Then they said no it's open. Then they said no it's closed. But wait there's more! Then...they told me I did NOT have to come and re-key for my 3rd/additional night in hotel. Then they told me I did need to come re-key for my 3rd night. Then they said I didn't need to. Then they said I did. My gawd - no one knows what's going on. The have no umbrellas to lend/charge to your room if needed. NO bathrobes in room. AND EVEN WHEN YOU HAVE DO NOT DISTURB ON YOUR DOOR - MAIDS KNOCK AWAY! Do not disturb in ANY hotel that I have EVER stayed means STAY OUT. But they don't care there - they knock anyway. What's more is that if you just don't want maid service at all - doesn't matter - they will NOT let you go more than one day without maid service. They call you and leave you a message that they MUST come into the room to check. Lord. I also asked for a late checkout - I don't mean hours late - I mean one hour late - and they wouldn't do it. Net is - NOT A SERVICE ORIENTED HOTEL and little to NO amenities.In the more ramble category - do NOT let the door man get a taxi for you. He's getting some payola with the taxi drivers and he won't put you in the next one - he will put you in the one where he gets his payoff. And then the other drivers start fighting and get in front of the taxi that the doorman put you in. AND! - in my case - I watched all this ensue, knew I should get out of the taxi the doorman put me in and go to the other one / the one that was next in line - BUT - it almost looked dangerous out there -- the other drivers and mine were so getting into it. And I was going from Park Central to EWR and the door man put me in a city city city taxi - teeny weeny - the plexiglass burglary bullet proof glass was RIGHT IN MY FACE - it was hella claustrophobic - and for a NYC to New Jersey drive - they should have put me in a larger taxi or SUV. And well here again - I really should have gotten out; but I followed the instructions of the door man - but never again.Also, you could die of exhaustion or starvation, and *will most definitely be late for any meeting* you have, waiting on the elevators! Geez louize! The elevators are slow as molasses.Net net net is - the hotel is grossly overpriced for a little to no service, no amenities property. No room service. No 24/7 room/drink access without getting dressed and leaving the hotel. Horrible lighting in room and bathroom. No robes. And don't let the door man get you a taxi; get one yourself. And rooms majorly need a face lift. I would say most of the clientele are not very high class - so neither the hotel or guests are elegant by any stretch of the imagination. But the hotel location is very good!

We have stayed at the Park Central a number of times with each visit being consistently excellent. From the friendly welcome of the parking valet (Carmelo), to the front desk staff, this is and will continue to be our go to hotel for stays in NYC. Great value, location and facilities.

As this was a Christmas gift to my wife I needed this to be perfect and it was, our first visit to New York was made so nice with hotel staff and the room we had on the 17th floor, with fantastic views of skyscrapers and we were very lucky as the weather was great. Will stay in this hotel again and again.

Loved this hotel, the rooms was great with everything that you could need. The business centre was really handy. All the staff were very nice. The only flaw is there was a stain on our bed sheet when we checked in and it took us asking about 3 times for the sheets to be changed.

My wife an i planned a business trip with an extended weekend and decided to give this hotel a try. Rates were low for NYC so we were a bit apprehensive. When we checked in at 3:10pm we were taken care off quickly and got to our room The room itself was very nice and well done. the biggest drawback was our view was of a brick wall as we were facing into a small light well. We went back and asked if there was a room available with a better view and the young lady was very helpful and got us a much better room with a view on the outside. sure helps to ask! An additional drawback is there is no in room coffee service though there is a nice coffee shop in the lobby and there is no in-room refrigerator for doggy bags for late night snacking. Overall, the price was great, the room decor is very nice, the lobby is modern and spacious, staff is friendly and helpful and the location on 7th and 57th cannot be beat!

Nice room, although they really need more counter space in the bathroom and one in the room by the table. Staff very friendly and helpful. Clean room. Mac computers and printer in lobby for use. Across street from Carnegie Hall. Prices were a bit outrageous. Elevators extremely small and slow. Is close to subway and Central Park.

My sister, dad, and myself stayed here for all of two nights. We got to the hotel and the lobby was nice but the staff was overly rude and seemed over stressed. We knew we were getting to the hotel early and requested an early check in (this was about 11, 11:30 AM). They said the room would take longer to be ready but they could hold our bags, which was fine. But then our room was not ready until after their normal check in time after 4 PM. After finally getting to our room, we had so many problems. The toilet broke 3 times in two days, and the phone in the room was broken so we had to go to the lobby each time to tell someone. The second guy who came to fix it said they were replacing the toilet after we left and said we should be comped a night for the issue, which never happened. Also, one of the outlets pulled out of the desk when trying to unplug the hair dryer. I would expect this out of a room costing less then 400 or 500$ for two nights, but this room was over $600 at the end. Awfully over priced, even for a good location.

This is not the good price you think it is! There is an additional $40.17 added to your bill at the end of your stay. It is called a "facilities fee," and you MUST PAY it, even if you don't use anything it covers: bag storage, business center, gym, discount on drinks in the bar, bike ride. I'd already paid for the room with Trip Advisor otherwise I'd have changed my reservation. Also, I received an email about a week in advance asking if I'd like to upgrade, for a fee: $45 for a king bed, more for a room on a higher floor, still more for a room with a view. The hotel is convenient to Central Park and is right across the street from Carnegie Hall, our destination. Room was clean, adequate space, VERY quiet, (it faced an air shaft so no view, but that helped with noise.) Bed was firm and comfortable. Clock couldn't be set, sort of strange. Staff were nice. Check-in is 4 pm. If you arrive early, use your $35 mandatory fee to store your luggage and go see the city. Check-out at noon. Again, check your bags and go sightsee until it's time to leave the city.

If you are visiting Carnegie Hall it is fantastic to look out your window and see Carnegie Hall! The convenient location is a real plus and there is a Starbucks right next door! The rooms are spacious and clean.

We stayed in this hotel for a week from 9 April 2018. This hotel is rated at 4*, I would say it is probably around 3*.The good points are its excellent location, very comfortable beds, very clean.The bad points are BE WARE there is a compulsory $35 plus tax charge per room per night for the complimentary services that we did not want to use, so the price we paid worked out around $500 more than advertised online by Hotels.com; very tired drab décor, all gloomy grey and brown colours (not a modern take on those, but closer to the 1980s), not powerful showers but they seem to have been refurbished, so are clean. The customer service is rubbish in practice but excellent in words. We wanted to change the location of our interconnecting rooms as we had a noisy bin lorry under the windows throughout the night (although we were on 11 floor, the windows are not very well insulated so can hear everything) ,so asked if anything can be done, the manager on the front desk offered to change our rooms to the opposite side of the hotel. We specifically asked if it would be possible to have interconnecting rooms (we had children with us) and not be near the lifts. So after spending an hour packing and waiting for new keys we were told our new rooms were ready, imagine our surprise when we found out that the rooms were not interconnecting, one was near the lifts and the other on the exactly the same side of the building as the original rooms and both on the lower floor, so closer to the lorry! We then spend 30 min more unpacking in our original rooms and were wondering what the manager was thinking in offering to change the rooms and offering exactly what we did not want! A waste of 2 hours of the evening.Overall a disappointing hotel as it is definitely not 4 stars and the additional compulsory charge was a real turn off.

I haven't been writing many reviews lately unless the hotel left a great or bad impression. This was the latter,Going to be as concise as one can be.Pros:Location - that's it!Cons: 1. Check-in is at 4pm. This is unheard of. I've never experienced any hotel in the world that has a 4pm check-in time. I tried checking in at 2p and 3p, my room wasn't ready. Was ready by 3:45pm.2. Rooms are OK, at least mine was. However, I did not get any sun whatsoever during my 4-night stay. The closet has no light. Rooms are very small. 3. On the day of check out, I called at 8am for a late checkout, they said they'll let front desk call me back to confirm. They never did. I called back at 9am, and they told me the same thing. They never called back. I called back at 9:45am and complained, they apologized saying they can't give me a late check out. So after waiting for almost 2 hours, I still couldn't get a late checkout. I explained how bad their service was, so they gave me a checkout till 1pm. So so generous of them.Class "A" Thieves:1. First day at the hotel, I asked guest services if I can ship packages to the hotel and they said yes. I asked if they charged, they told me it was free. (This can be verified with their phone records as all phone calls are recorded). Upon checkout, I was charged $30 storage fee. I had 3 packages come in, and it turns out they charge $10 per package. Again, I've never seen this done by any hotel whatsoever. We went back and forth about the charges for a good 5 minutes and asked them if they could waive it, they were so adamant that they wont, and never did. 2. Resort fees. Beware. They charge you $35 + tax per day per night (excluding the room rate). 90% of people won't use 90% of what is associated with those fees. I clearly explained upon checkout that I was unaware of this and it should've been mentioned clearly upon check in, and see if they can (partially) waive it. But It's like watching paint dry, they are useless. I spoke to their guest services manager (forgot her name, of Asian descent), and she was probably one of the most useless individuals I have ever came across, in the likes of which, I've never seen before. I came to find out that my friend stayed in the hotel next to Park Central who also had similar resort fees but they were nice enough to give him a one-time waiver as he was unaware of them. I paid almost $200 for resort fees and storage fees extra upon checkout. Never experienced such thing. I hope whoever reads this change their minds about staying there. I am more than willing to provide info about other hotels around the same area. Just please stay away from this.

The Good:->Location, Location and Location. 5mins walk to Times Square>Pleasantly smelling Lobby>Great welcoming Bell team>Interactive Guest Request AppThe Ugly:->I am Hospitality professional and that was the worst check in ever. Lady at the desk was unwelcoming and even though I booked through Tripadvisor, we were treated as if we got an undeserving free night. We were given 2 double beds and the alternative was "to wait and try our luck". She said that.>Room was decent in size, however, had a wall (bigger than the one between Mexico and USA) dividing the two beds. >Literally there were dust bunnies along the edges on skirting which implies either Management does not round or does not care. Pathetic room and cleanliness. Disgusting, as I could only imagine what grows inside AC grills and filter.Overall:- Stay in a different hotel, even Air BnB but definitely not this hotel if you need your money worth and want a clean room to stay in. I have lived and stayed in 3 different continents and this was possibly the worst hotel stay ever.

It is hard for me to write such an awful review of an NYC hotel as I used to be part of the management team at an NYC hotel. I know that at times, it is hard to keep up an impeccable level of service when managing a large staff that serves hundreds of rooms. However, this hotel has left me and my family impressed at how bad our overall experience was. From reception to our room to the disrespectful and dismissive manner of the manager on duty, I genuinely felt that they were trying to make our stay as bad as it was.First, when we arrived with our reservation, they told us that we had to pay a resort fee of $35 per night. When my husband asked what was the fee for, the agent said he wasn't even sure.When we tried to take the elevator, we didn't know how to use it, it would have been appropriate if someone explained this, but no big deal, we figured it out and brushed it off.The room. WOW!!! Nasty is not enough to describe, endless stains on the carpet, the walls, paint peeling off, the toilet paper holder was broken, the phone only worked on speaker mode. UNSAFE! We had our two little kids with us and they like to explore drawers, to their surprise, the drawers very easily come off to the floor towards their precious feet, not one, three of them! (make sure to scroll through the pictures on their profile, only the nice ones show up first, I guess paying yelp a monthly fee to enhance their profile goes a long way!).Even more disgusting: when we came back from our day out, I found a nasty smelly wet rag under our clothes. Obviously not ours.TWICE I had to use the stairs all the way up to 7th floor due to their failing elevator system. One morning we got stuck trying to go down to start our day and ended up waiting 30 min for the elevator (which never came). I had to use the stairs all the way down to ask for help, since I've worked in hotels I knew they must have service elevators, however, the "manager" apologized and said there was nothing they could do, she quickly blamed a guest for "pushing the wrong button and breaking the elevator " and proceeded to tell me it was gonna be 30-40 min before it was fixed and suggested we took the stairs with our two little kids and their stroller. Her manner that day was arrogant and I felt that she was very annoyed with my observations. After I ran back all the way upstairs to get my kids and husband, there was another family waiting for the elevator. Luckily, there was a staff member who overheard our situation and offered to let us use the service elevator, it was appalling to me that he quickly figured out what to do vs. his manager. The next morning I looked for the hotel manager again and tried to explain in very simple and friendly words our disappointment with the service and room. At first, her manner was again rather serious and non-empathetic, until I showed her pictures of the nasty rag we found and the drawers that easily come off potentially injuring our kids. At that point, she became very friendly, she offered a room upgrade, free breakfast, and to waive the resort fee. We didn't want to change rooms because it was more of a pain with our stuff and the kids than it was worth it, we didn't want to eat breakfast there, and she only waved 2 days worth of the resort fee instead of 3 as she said she would.When I mentioned that when we booked we weren't aware of the resort fee and kind of room we'd get, I explained we did it through Hoteltonight.com, to which she had the need to mention 3 TIMES that they had the lowest rates around. To this, I responded "do you mean that we paid for what we got?", of course, she denied it, but it was well implied. So yes, we got a cheaper rate, we still spent about $600 for 3 nights at this hotel, and we felt it wasn't worth it. These rooms are supposed to be $400 per night rooms, how do they get away with this is beyond me. Please save yourself the frustration and the extra few bucks and book elsewhere.

We had a very poor experience at this hotel.The furniture was all stained, the elevators were among the worst I have encountered (multiple other people said this as well, as we were stuck for 15 minutes at a time waiting), the drawers fell out of the dressers, nearly injuring my children on numerous occasions, a manager was extremely rude to my wife, and the molding/trim in the rooms looks like it was installed by Freddy Krueger. We also found a wet and dirty rag amongst our clothes. I do not know if housekeeping was going through our stuff or what...but this was pretty disturbing.

Fantastic location, close to Central Park and Times Square, so if you need something close to all the action, but not fussed the type of hotel - this is a great option. My feedback is:- they charged an additional $35 (plus tax) each night for 'services' like luggage hold, business lounge etc - even if you don't use them. This was compulsory but not included when I paid for the rooom online. Be warned that you will need to pay this when you check out as it's on top of the original room rate! - Cleanliness of the room was not great - the bathroom had dust and hair in it. - Didn't have the 'do not disturb' signs, so every morning the cleaners came knocking!- The bed was comfy though - but cleaning generally not great. - There were 2 lifts servicing floors 3-9, they were very small, and one kept breaking down. Which meant there were queues to use the lifts (and I am not climbing the stairs to 7th floor with bags!). - Breakfast was in the form of a little coffee shop - overpriced though. - Staff were friendly - Location was great

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights as members of a group that was performing at Carnegie Hall. Carnegie is literally across the street - we could see it from our room. We had a premier king. The room was ready when we arrived, about an hour before check-in time. It was very clean and well equipped, including a bathtub - something I've found to be increasingly rare in NYC hotels. Speaking of NYC hotels, the room was pretty big for a Manhattan property - the size would be considered adequate or better almost any place, much less in the Big Town. Check-in was quick and friendly, and the staff helped us immediately when one of our key cards decided not to work in either the room lock or the elevator (the key card is required for access to the guest floors, a good security feature). The neighborhood was very safe, and there were plenty of places to eat close by at OK prices. The hotel has a very attractive bar/restaurant, but we didn't eat there.For the record, because we were traveling in a large group (about 70 of our chorus members were staying there), we got a very favorable rate - but the rate would have been reasonable for NYC hotels in any case.We enjoyed our stay here very much and would be happy to stay here any time...
user_name:
GaNavy
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the location is the best part. It’s down the street from time square! room was spacious and had a nice view. Only small grumble was my mother in law before hand rang the concierge/reception about arranging a bottle of champagne in my room for my birthday as a surprise.. never received this and she never got a message back or anything. Quite disappointing to say it is a 4* hotel..

Good hotel. Got a secret hotel deal so seemed pretty good value given the location. Room was spacious and had everything we needed. Wifi was great and was free. Staff were helpful. Location is great - being close to so many sights we wanted to visit and with a good selection of delis, cafes and restaurants nearby. There is no restaurant in the hotel. One down side was that w did get a lot of noise from the street below but perhaps that's always the case in New York.

Perfect location for whatvwe needed. Didn't spend much time in the hotel as our schedule was non-stop. Room was clean, beds were comfortable. My only wish was there was a small coffee machine in the room as I don't like wandering about in my PJ's looking for coffee.

Amazing location; if you're reasonably fit you can get to most areas walking within an hour. Central Park and Times Square really close anyway.The tour buses also stop near the hotel.Staff all very friendly and helpful.We had a room with two double beds and there was plenty of space for three of us and would take four easily.We had an amazing time in New York and Park Central was a superb base.

This hotel was clean, service friendly and convenient. We were able to walk almost everywhere: Broadway shows, Times Square, 5th ave shopping, Central Park and so many other places we wanted to visit. It was also a quick walk to catch the hop-on/hop-off bus tours and the restaurants we wanted to hit! Would definitely stay again!

We stayed at this hotel at the end of our trip from Philly to Houston. The location was great...right across from Carnegie Hall and walking distance to Central Park. The room was very nice and roomy in comparison to other rooms I have stayed at in New York City. The restroom was very nice and roomy and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful and did everything they could to make us feel welcome and ensure we had a great night. We got a great deal on this hotel because we stayed on a Sunday night but I would definitely pay a little more to stay here. I definitely would stay here again.

I had called Park Central and talked to the Concierge a few weeks before arriving to ask about Broadway shows. She told me to purchase at the hotel as they can often get deals for us, stop by when we arrived. We did that and purchased tickets from Jemel Spand, the Concierge on staff that day. He was behind the desk next to check in with the concierge sign right there. He told us we were getting really great seats, how lucky we were. He sent the tickets via email a while later.. The tickets we paid 149.99 each for had a face value of 89 each. I asked about the 60% markup, he said they got a deal, that was not what the tickets were really selling for. I went on line and found the same row for the same price... all in it would have cost us $99 per person purchasing directly from the theater. After sending several emails, leaving voice mail and talking with him again, we went to the hotel manager who said he understood our concern and said he would check into it. Later they said the Concierge is not a hotel employee, he works for the company that purchased the tickets. By putting him behind their counter, they are endorsing his pricing. I asked the hotel to help get some of our $120 overcharge back, they did nothing. PLEASE BE AWARE, the Concierge is not employed by the hotel and WILL rip you off big time!!! We also asked for a room with a view, they put us in the inner court, we could see the other rooms in the hotel via the windows and the roof below us. Horrible view. Elevators were often packed and had lines that took 20 minutes or more to get to the 2 small elevators.

Highly recommend the Park Central for NYC visits. Very convenient to attractions, good dining and the theatre district. Rooms are very nice and comfortable. Staff is excellent.Bartenders at bar are very friendly and knowledgeable about making cocktails. Wine list by the glass is solid and reasonably priced. Cleaning staff are very good at keeping your room in tip top shape.It will be my hotel of choice when visiting NYC.
user_name:
James S
West Chester, United States

review_body: I would recommend this place if you are looking for a 'relatively' affordable place close to Central Park. The rooms are clean, but nothing special. There is no option for breakfast. The hotel has a small coffee shop on the ground floor but they charge $5 a croissant (which I find overpriced). But friendly staff, and HUGE super comfortable beds! The beds were so comfortable we are now looking to buy one.

Modern, clean, comfortable rooms. Check-in quick and easy and close to lots of great sights, museums and Central Park. Many good restaurants and breakfast options nearby. A late checkout and bag storage really helpful.

The hotel is modern and stylish. The staff is quite friendly and accommodating. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are quite spacious with a safe available in the rooms. Unfortunately there are no mini fridges in the basic rooms. It was very clean and comfortable and has a lot of amenities such as a lounge bar, computers with printer service, and a fitness facility. I think one of the best things about this hotel in particular is the location which is along 7th Ave. not far from Time Square, Central Park, and Carnegie Hall, and the Rockefeller center. There are shops, bars and restaurants all around so you have a very good selection of choices. A subway stop is right nearby the hotel making it easy to get to and from there with public transportation. One thing I really enjoyed was the complementary luggage storage which is great if you have a later departure and wish to see one more day of New York without having to worry about carrying around your luggage. The service is free and holds your luggage until 10:45PM. The area was quite safe, moderately quiet, and clean. It's a very good value for you money. Keep in mind that there is a facility fee which can cost a bit more money depending on how long you stay. All in all it was a great hotel and I would definitely stay there again.

We were able to check in a little early and were pleasantly surprised by the comfortable bed, great Carnegie Hall and Central Park view, and the clean, updated bathroom. We enjoyed watching the big tv while we regrouped and had a restful night's sleep. No problems with noise on the 6th floor too. We would definitely stay here again.

Great hotel and location. In midtown Manhattan between Central Park and Times Square. Room was not huge but clean and comfortable. They have a bar and place to order some breakfast or lunch but no true restaurant but who needs one with so many around the hotel. Staff was responsive and everyone was nice. Would stay here again.

Very nice hotel, very clean, rooms are roomy enough, beds and pillows are super comfortable. Great location, 6 minutes walk from Central Park, 12 minutes from Times Square, the area around is clean and safe, the subway station is just at the corner of the street. No restaurant in the hotel, but there are plenty of sandwicheries and restaurants in the area. We enjoyed being able to leave safely our luggage on arrival and the day of departure, which gave us 1 more day of stay in the city.Great deal for the price. But note that there is a $35 + taxes /day facility fee to add to your budget when comparing prices.

Conveniently located around the corner from the Downton Abbey Exhibition The hotel is clean & the upstairs staff friendly! The desk staff was sometimes curt.Hints of its Art Deco origins abound but modern conveniences are prevalent. No restaurant but nice snack bar and large area to sit, eat, drink and relax! No problem bringing in food from outside! Rooms nicely appointed!Would definitely return and feel good about recommending this lovely

Stayed here with friends recently. A great location. Rooms are comfortable and and large for New York City. The Park Central Hotel is within 5 minutes of Central Park, and there are many restaurants close by. The staff is helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Some friends and i stayed here for a night to celebrate a birthday and see the St. Pats parade. The room was small as expected but clean and modern. We asked for a refrigerator and coffee alert and they were brought up no problem. The bell staff was helpful and friendly. I would stay here again.

I found this hotel on Groupon. When I showed up I was pleasantly surprised. Modern, clean and right in the middle of town. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to check out NYC. I can’t wait to go back!

booked from Bor2Run (package for AU NYC Half Marathon) from Italy, this big hotel is located in a strategic position down in Manhattan, near Central Park. Big rooms but not but old fashioned ('80 style). Fast breakfast to eat on the table of the lobby not so amazing.

My husband made the reservations for this stay and paid before I had a chance to intervene. I generally try to avoid staying in (or going near) that part of Manhattan when we visit except to see a show and after this past visit I realized it was with good reason. I guess because the hotel is reasonably priced and close to Carnegie Hall and Lincoln center we experienced a constant cycling through of huge groups of teenagers who were there to perform for various events- the lobby was constantly crowded and there was almost always a wait for the elevators. We asked for a quiet room at check in and were given a 5th-floor room facing a wall with an adjoining door - we had to listen to our neighbors as though we were all sitting in the same room together. On our last night, our hall was overrun with teenage boys who seemed to be without adult supervision- it was 1AM before the manager and security were able to get them quieted down for the evening and when we left for our flight at 6AM the next morning there were pizza boxes piled up everywhere. The very comfortable bed and bedding, and spacious, clean room along with a reasonable stretch of quiet time at night on every other night made the stay bearable. Hotel is fairly priced, clean, in good repair, and close to the subway and a short work to Columbus Circle and Times Square for shows.

There are subway stations on both ends of the block & a block to the south. SO easy to get anywhere on the subway. Tons of restaurants within walking distance. Or hop on the subway & head out. This hotel is QUIET. Like scary quiet, you do not even hear other guests. Had a room right off elevators, quiet. Got to my room at the end of the hallway & could hear a gaggle of women next door being loud & thought, great. Shut the door, never heard another thing. Also I like that the windows open & you can get fresh air. Front desk really easy to work with & responsive.

The hotel is very large and there is a daily extra charge for the resort. I did not really know what it was for, except it was expensive. There are no fridges in the room and no tea and coffee facilities any where.In the lobby there is a shop where you can buy tea and coffee and snacks. The room was pleasant, with a good view. The beds were comfortable, with lots of pillows.The bathroom was small and in need of painting.The elevators are small and very slow. Often one was not working so there were long queues.

I booked this hotel for a 4 night stay with my son. It was our first visit to NYC. The hotel is in an ideal position. You can walk to Times Square (12 minutes) down the road, where the hoho buses run from and walk to Central Park (10 minutes) up the road. The subway is 2 minutes away and the area is full of eateries, with Broadway just around the corner. The hotel itself was clean. The rooms were comfortable and spacious. Overall, the staff were friendly and willing to help and advise on touristy questions. The room price was about average for NYC. But be aware, when booking you are not told about the facilities charge of $40 per night, per room. It’s a charge for some things you may or may not use during your stay at the hotel. An email informs you of this a few days before your trip and the paper bill is slipped under your door on your last night. I have checked this out on my return home and to be fair it would appear this is something most NYC hotels are now doing. Would I recommend this hotel for your NYC stay, yes I would. We had a great time in NYC.

Our room was 2 Queen on one of the upper floors. Had no problems with waiting for elevator or any noise. Love the lobby bar, albeit pricey-but everything in New York is pricey! I love the location in Midtown. Within walking distance to many sites and close to the Park. Quick cab ride from Penn Station. Was my 4th stay and I wasn't disappointed.

Unlike the other reviews my stay was a “port in the storm” as I was stranded in NYC due to the nor’easter. I come to Manhattan frequently and was caught off guard Big Time by Storm Toby.I was very grateful to get a room Wednesday and Thursday March 21st and 22nd. My room was $468 per night and very well worth it.I love the old fashion bathroom decor, the super comfortable king bed, the large windows and the spacious room. I had 11 pieces of luggage as I had been in NYC since 3/15.Dafne and Adriana were so calming and welcoming to me. I had a very stressful few days as I had to pack up from 1 hotel after 6 nights, load my car, go to another hotel and unload for 1 night, park my car and the next morning do it all over again. I’m also 54 so this was no easy feat!!Thursday morning I was outside the hotel and saw the nicest act of kindness. Carmelo at the front door turned around after assisting a guest into a cab. A man who wasn’t a guest was walking by. Carmelo stopped him and said “Sir, your backpack is open. Would you like me to zip it for you?”Carmelo thank your parents for raising you so well and for working at The Park Central. It’s nice to know you’ll have “my back” on my next visit!

Had a great stay here, staff was so nice to me and it was a nice room with a view of Times Square. Check out was easy and the neighborhood had great nightlife choices. The hotel had choices on what to eat for bed in breakfast and of course it was pricey but it’s New York and the union runs New York. You get what you pay for they say and for the price it was a good deal.
user_name:
ChefDreams
New York City, New York

review_body: When we were checking in there were only rooms with full-size beds available. Without a queen bed, my tall husband would be uncomfortable sleeping with me, and snuggling with him was my main reason to come on the trip! Anna gave us drink coupons, and we were able to relax in the bar for a little while as she arranged a double queen room. Our room was on the specific floor my husband requested and had a bathtub (I love baths and we were traveling with a child), and had multiple windows with views. I had mentioned that I often felt claustrophobic in rooms at another hotel, and this room felt so open and airy. I come to NYC once a year and have never had a better room. I am so grateful to her for making this my best NYC trip yet! Other housekeeping staff members were also unusually nice and helpful.

This is a nice hotel, the manage was really nice, the rooms clean, great location, the wifi was faultless but I have given this only three stars because of the bar staff. With the exception of John, I would get rid of them all. They have no idea how to create an atmosphere. They expect a tip just for giving you a drink even when you are sitting right at the bar. If you want a tip from me I would suggest that you at least try to engage people, make them feel welcome. John (the irish guy) was the only guy who did that. The others made no attempt whatsoever. (Thanks John - sack the rest.). Honestly they made no attempt even when sitting right at the bar, I felt it was sadly lacking in atmosphere. The bizarre thing is with such a nice bar and area, had they bothered to make you feel welcome I am quite sure the hotel takings would go up. We just went to the bar opposite.

Drew and Park Central Team were awesome in facilitating the needs of our large group (56 people). Location was prime for our schedule and the price fit our budget. I would definitely work with this team again for any future visits. Awesome experience and awesome service. Thank you so much!

I've been to this hotel many times since 2012 and this is the first time I write a review about it. I choose this hotel because the rooms are much larger comparing to any NYC hotels rooms as I've been to many. The location is great, It is close to major NY attractions like the Times sq., Fifth Avenue, Central Park and Columbus Circle. Rooms are clean but the need a little bit work on their staff as some are very nice but some aren't at all.The views on this hotel probably aren't the best if you really care about the view from the window of your room.

We visited New York from 3/17 to 3/19/18, super eventful weekend with St. Patrick Day Parade and Unite Airline Half Marathon. The hotel situates close to the parade route and right on the marathon route. Front staffs were handling big crowds efficiently, so check-in was quick. We arrived early in the morning, so our room was not available. I requested lower level of room for the reason of accessibility. However, we were given 16th floor when we came back @3 p.m. to check in. I thought that it was very busy weekend with groups, so they ran out of lower level rooms. Our room 1628 was a "cave". It locates very end of the hallway and the view from large window was literally brick walls of next building because it faces inward. Quiet... yes, because we are the end of the hallway. Dark... very much because no sunlight could come through due to the hight of next building. Even with all room lights on, we felt like the room was at night. The room seemed to be remodeled recently, but not completely, I saw chipped paints on the front door, the corner of windowsills, bathroom floor... felt like that we were assigned the left-over room. We used "Roomer" to get discount which actually was from Expedia. It was discounted, but no less than hotel's advertised rate of $175/night. Luckily, we did not stay in the room too long, and again, knowing how crowded the hotel was, I did not make effort to request for another room. Bathtub stopper did not work. Water pressure for shower was sufficient, but as many reviews mentioned, toilet water pressure was weak. Plenty of towels, but all shampoo, conditioner, body wash bottles are mounted on the bathtub wall. I prefer individual travel size bottles for sanitary reason. No plastic linings for trash bins. Overall, the room amenity did not justify the price they charge. It should be less than $100 per night for what they are.Elevators: Although there are 4 elevators, only 2 were working. As many reviews, I agree that the elevator size was small. Extra security of activate floor stop with your room key was Okay... One elevator's bottom did not light up for the floor selection, so it was confusing. The speed was sufficient. However, considering may guests, especially international guests with large suitcases, the elevator filled up very quickly. They should have a bell service to bring all large suit cases with flight elevators to each guest rooms. Billing: unknown charge appeared from hotel twice without explanation from the front staff at the time of check-in, so I had to call back and to send email to billing department.The location is vey convenient for Upper Westside tourism. Subway Q line will take you to downtown spots as well. Stay again? No for the price. We will look for other hotel near by...

Upon check-in, We were greeted kindly by Monette. She was absolutely wonderful and accommodating. Monette placed us in a room that went above and beyond our expectations. Room was in great condition and had an awesome view. Overall, amazing stay. Will definitely be returning!
user_name:
JessGWell
New York City, New York

review_body: While I thought this was somewhat pricey, the room we had was clean, comfy and quiet (9th floor, end of hallway). As other reviewers mentioned, the wait for the elevators can be long and the bathroom, while clean and updated, was dark, I thought this was a great hotel and would stay again. The staff we encountered were friendly and were able to tend to our needs. Easy walk to Central Park, Times Square, theater district, 5th Ave.

Really affordable hotel, great staff and location. The rooms are clean and are generous in size and clean. The bathroom is a bit dark as is the room however, towels and linens are of good quality. The lobby is large as is the bar area and the coffee shop is very reasonable. Over all a very good choice for clean mid price NYC hotel

Not a good value for money ($300 per night). The room is spacious but dated and not very clean. requested a quiet room and it was still very loud during the nights. No breakfast included in the rat either. The location is fantastic, you leave the hotel and have the central park on your left and it takes a few mins to get to the 5th avenue.

We stayed 4 nights at Park Central hotel. Pros: location, location, location. 4 Star Hotel that was nice. Room was nice and it was great to come back everyday to a made up room. Staff was very friendly. Cons: elevators are tiny and take forever. We took the stairs a lot. Water was often cold when taking a shower. Went downstairs at 6:05 pm to ask for an Indian restaurant recommendation. The two people at guest relations said they couldn’t help me, to go ask the concierge. I was then told by another employee that the concierge went home at 6pm. How does such a large hotel not have one person who could answer one question? That was frustrating. We ended up spending $300 on an overpriced Italian restaurant down the street. My husband and I couldn’t go have a drink at the bar until 8 pm because it was closed all day for a private event. There was a shop, but I only saw it open once the entire stay. Overall we had a great stay at this hotel. I’m torn on whether I would stay there again or try another place. If you like having a restaurant on site and room service, then it would make sense to go to another hotel. If you are looking for a nice room, perfect location, then this is a great place.

Rooms and accommodations are very nice, the room is spacious for New York. The best thing about the hotel is its location! Great for family stays. We have been coming back to this Hotel for three years, never a problem.

We stayed at this hotel for 7 days with my GF. The location is great. You can almost see Times Square after a 5min walk. Central Park is super close to it. NQWR line works really well if you are going downtown or Brooklyn. The service is pretty good. Receptionist greeted us and handled our business with professionalism, but we have had better experiences. It kinda felt that we were "just some random cheap tourist" (he was right). That being said there were exceptional customer service when we had trouble. The safe in our room went haywire and didn't accept the PIN code I put there. I notified the staff about it and they called security. The man was an lovely Italian-American older gentleman. He was super polite and was honest with us that the safes were old as God so its normal that they have issues. Super helpful!We were a bit disappointed that there was no breakfast serving. Only a snack bar that you could buy overpriced fruits, cookies and coffee. I understand that when we stepped outside there are 1000 of different breakfast places in Manhattan. But still breakfast at the Hotel is a nice way to start a day.We stayed at the cheapest room they had on the 6th floor. They didn't notify that it was a accessibility room. Meaning there were tons of empty space between the bed and TV. No complaining at least it wasn't a closet sized. The bed was nice and the noise wasn't bad from the street level.All in all it was a good hotel for its price. From what I checked a lot of Hotels with the same price were terrible in Manhattan. So I guess we picked the right one for us.

I stayed at Park Central for 3 nights on the 6th floor. It was very quiet and room was cozy. All the staff was helpful ans very friendly. Located on 7th Ave its very close to central park and times square. Also several subways stations are right around the corner. Will definitely stay again when i visit NYC again in August.

Beautiful hotel and Great location next to Central Park, across from carginie hall and a few feet from time square. The staff is professional and accommodating. I would recommend that you stay here for a peaceful and relaxing stay. The corner view is amazing.

I brought my students to New York for a Model UN conference from March 1st to 5th. Park Central guaranteed, and confirmed in writing, that all rooms would be on the same floor, and that we would have "deluxe queen" beds for our student rooms. This would allow them to share beds.It wasn't until we checked into our rooms that we realized that wasn't true. Many of the beds were double beds -- and 17-year-old high school boys particularly weren't able to double up in such a small space.The queen beds were the perk that Park Central used to persuade us to stay with them, rather than our original choice. The floor of the hotel was the same one they agreed to, in writing. And they were apparently waiting to see if we noticed the contract was broken. I let them know on March 1st, shortly after our arrival.I reminded Park Central (as per our original agreement) that we needed to be on one floor as a group, as students needed to remain near chaperones. The next morning, they told us that one of our rooms would be exchanged for an actual Double Queen room, and that the girls in it needed to move out immediately. They did -- and still hadn't been given a new room by late afternoon. That made changing and preparing for our competition throughout the day -- there were a mix of committee sessions and NYC tours -- much more difficult and rather inconvenient. Finally, in the evening, they received their room.Eleven days later, I am still waiting for a refund -- both for a discount on the cost of the rooms (as they were not the rooms we paid for) and for a room refund that we let the hotel know a month in advance (after our early payment) that we would not be booking. For each, Park Central assured us there would be a refund. Since our stay, I have not received a reply.I will be happy to update this review if we receive a reply and refund. It's unfortunate that what could have been a pleasant stay was marred by dishonesty and lack of follow-through.PS: One other thing worth noting is that the rooms, which we arranged in advance of the trip to have refrigerators, did not. We reminded the hotel before our arrival, after arrival, and on day two of our stay. By day three they all had refrigerators.

Took my daughter to NY for her 13th birthday and chose this hotel for its location and price and was SO happy with the quality of service and friendliness of the staff. The concierge was the sweetest lady who helped us maximize our trip in the city. We could easily walk to central park, times square and grand central station. The room is nice and big and the bathroom is updated and big as well. Would definitely come back to this hotel

What a busy place not enough staff for check ins ,there was always a line a mile long to Check in or out -that's terrible service to start with.We were book in at the park central for 7 nights we left after 2 days and booked into another hotel around the corner called the London which was fabulous !!Park central was noisy in the hall ways you can here everything that is happening early in the morning all night long !!!The cleaner would come nocking on the door at 7am the first morning to clean these tiny little rooms the you can't even put you luggage anywhere but under you feetThey are old rooms need a revamp just horrible I can't believe my travel agent had booked us in this place only because of there commissions I would never recommend this hotel Coming from Australia I was wanting to stay in a comfortable and lovely and clean hotel Which was not the park central

I stayed at the Park Central on a business trip. My customer chose the hotel for good ratings at a good price. He did a great job. The location is outstanding--close to Carnegie Hall, Central Park, Times Square. The room was clean and comfortable although I could have used a view other than a brick wall. There was no wastebasket in the bathroom but otherwise, everything was fine. I would have appreciated room service but they do not have a restaurant. Don't expect fancy amenities but for the price, this is a great place to stay.

My daughter enjoyed a four-day stay at the not-too pricey Park Central and were pleased with the accommodations. The room was pleasant and comfortable, and the location was so convenient and close to everything we wanted to see. We appreciated the cleanliness and appropriate upkeep of the hotel. It was a two-thumbs up, in our opinion.

Very central location near Times Square and Central Park and there are restaurants very nearby. Staff were polite and hotel room was perfectly clean. Only downsides were that breakfast is not served here and there was no refrigerator in the room.

The hotel is very good , but tied in places thread bear carpets but it clean and freindly It was in an ideal location for getting about New York , opposite was carnage hall.Next door there’s PJ carneys for food and drinks served until 3am . Central Park is only a 2 minute walk , Times Square is 10 mind the other way .

Checked in for 3 day stay. The service from the checkin was terrible. Extremely rude. We got caught in a snow storm so we had to extend our stay. They QUADRUPLED THEIR PRICE FOR THE NIGHT. Price gouged us. There were plenty of rooms and the demand was low because of the storm but they still felt they could take full advantage of their guests during the storm. They provided new room keys then called us 5 times while trying to sleep demanding we come to the lobby to re-swipe our credit card. They threatened to have us kicked out of the hotel. While I went down to deal with the front desk they sent a rude manager to bang on the door and yell at my wife while she tried to sleep. I came back up to find a manager and security guard at my door threatening to kick us out for a pre paid room. UNBELIEVABLE! Rude and no clue what customer service is. AVOID THIS PLACE!

My boyfriend and I had a wonderful stay at this facility. After deciding to take a day trip to New York from Maryland for shopping we ended up needing to find a hotel that was nice and reasonably priced. This hotel was nothing short of amazing. The room was clean as spacious and also super close to subway stops and food choices. The staff was very friendly and I will definitely be booking again when I return.

This hotel was clean and felt secure.Staff was helpful. There are fees added on as I had seen in other reviews, however, people seemed surprised. Restaurants close by for food. The hotel is an easy walk from Penn Station.

Based on the price, we weren't expecting the hotel to be as nice as it was. The location is fantastic, the hotel is beautiful and we had a great corner room with a view (albeit mostly blocked by buildings) of both Central Park and 7th Avenue. We didn't try the bakery in the hotel, but we did eat at the Red Eye Grill across the street at the hotel's recommendation. The food was out of this world, but the service was terrible. We were virtually ignored and had to continuously flag down our waiter although he was friendly and accommodating to the tables all around us. I would highly recommend this hotel, the staff was friendly, the lounge area is very pretty and the accommodations were great.
