Although we never had any problems catching the elevator Thursday through Saturday, on Sunday morning when many were leaving, we waited for over 15 minutes and had to squeeze into two different elevators because they were so full everytime they stopped on our floor, so leave early if catching a flight.

This is the third time we've booked and stayed at the Park Central Hotel with groups of international scholars on Syracuse University business. We highly recommend this superbly located hotel for individuals and groups. Riley Allen and Alicia Nunez in the sales department exceeded all expectations! And the bar was already high with our two previous stays! Kudo to them for being attentive and flexible with our diverse group of guests, and a special note of appreciation for Riley Allens who worked tirelessly with me for weeks to get the best possible outcomes for our workshop guests. With both Riley and Alicia you can expect extremely professional service, quick turn around on communications, patience, and flexibility with overall arrangements, and extremely fair and accurate accounting. The accommodations were terrific, with some of the most comfortable beds in the city. It's clear to us why we keep coming back to the Park Central.

My wife and I stayed at the Park Central Hotel New York from Feb. 28, 2018 to March 5, 2018. This is a very nice hotel in a great location. The room we had was on the 14th floor with a king bed. The staff was great! The room was SPOTLESS each day. The bathroom was SPOTLESS each day too. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever stayed in. Like most, we don’t expect hotel beds to be great and this one was great! We will stay there again. No questions asked. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

I just got back from a week's stay at Park Central, and it was perfect. I was attending a conference downtown, but I couldn't believe the prices relative to Park Central so I stayed there. It is convenient - right on the subway which was great because the weather was not. It took me just a few minutes each day to get down to E 23rd St. My room was quiet and well-appointed. Several totally wonderful restaurants in easy walking distance which was important. After a very full day I needed a very full tummy.Housekeeping did an outstanding job of keeping the room perfect. Perfect experience . No qualms or complaints. In fact, I just re-booked it for my next visit.

My wife and I visited NYC for the first time last week. We searched for hotels left, right and centre when we came across Park Central Hotel. It's located perfectly, only minutes walk from Times Square, Trump Tower and Central Park. The hotel is clean throughout, our room was lovely (we were upgraded as this was our Honeymoon) and the staff were really helpful.My only criticism is there needs to be more lifts. Two lifts between fifteen plus floors is simply not good enough. We often waited for our turn to get to the room. Bar was lovely, good selection of drinks and Barmen were friendly. The fella on the door/concierge was really friendly too. If you're looking to stay somewhere perfectly located, clean and convenient, choose this hotel. Thank you, Park Central Hotel - we will be back.

As an avid opera and ballet fan, I loved the location. It was a 10 minute walk from the hotel to Lincoln Center. Also, you could see Times Square down the street. There were two Green restaurants across the street, and a delicious Italian restaurant a couple of doors down. I will definitely stay there again!

I booked 1 night for a busines strip in March 2018. The reason to book the hotel was the location, near my client's visits.I was surprised by the service level, lounge and room. Everything very nice.Staff fron concierge were outstanding!My only negative comment is that the internet at my room was not good but the rest of the experience was perfect. I believe it happened because my room was at the inner side of the hotel.

An excellent Hotel! The staff is very professional and perfect for business. Good location, close to Central Park. I highly recommend it for vacation too.I guess it is a good option for any sort of trip.

Park Central Hotel in New York is like stepping into old world elegance with modern conveniences. Located just across the street from beautiful Central Park, there is always something spectacular to see! Old world charm and wonderful service provides a wonderful travel experience!

They retained my car for 45 minutes due to some internal issue, which made me lose my plane.I lost a flight across the world due to these people's irresponsibility and didn't even get an apology, much less some kind of compensation.The valet services are closed on weekends.The receptionists behaviour is inadequate.The peak of making me feel unwelcome.The only acceptable thing about this place is its location.

Brilliant experience from the first day we arrived at the hotel. The staff were polite, respectful and completely professional. The cleanliness of the room was amazing as was the rest of the hotel. A highly recommended hotel to stay in and it is affordable.

I stayed here for a business trip recently, where I had meetings just a block away. I was really impressed with the rooms, which were updated and very clean. Room sizes were a bit above average size for NY. The bar area was great, with a lot of room for large groups. I wish that they would have offered more food options in the hotel, but it's NY, so there are places steps away. I will definitely be returning to this hotel when in town for business.

I've been to NYC many times, but now I've finally found the perfect place to stay. This hotel is close to central park and not too far away from midtown. It is surrounded by excellent places to eat, public transporation, museums, etc. It's right near Carnegie Hall.

This hotel is located only 2 blocks from Central Park. it cannot be more convenient for any activity professional or leisure. The rooms are efficient, the bathrooms bright. I would not stay anywhere else.

This is my fourth time in NYC.I always choose Park Central Hotel for my stay.The rooms are spacious and very clean. The bed must be the most comfortable one I slept on.The location is great. Super close to Central Park, Times Square and 5th Avenue. There is a subway station on the same street to go to farther places in New York.I will definitely stay at Park Central Hotel again in my next visit.

I stayed at the Park Central Hotel for the first time and was by far the best hotel experience that I've had when visiting NYC. The staff was extremely courteous and attentive. I was very impressed by how they were accommodating to all of my needs. My luggage was taken to my room upon check in as well as taken to my car when leaving. Suggestions for restaurant and local attractions were offered by the staff in conversation without me having to ask. The hotel itself was clean and orderly. The location was fantastic and my room had a magnificent view of the city in addition to being clean. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay as I look forward to future stays.

I stayed three different times in this hotel in February. All three times, I got different rooms with varying sizes. Rooms are not very big as such, but considering that this is a Manhattan hotel, the room size was reasonable. The front desk was overall helpful. I have seen many reviews which talk about the deceptive charges. I do not hold the Hotel responsible for that. The hotel clearly mentions the administrative charges. So, before I made my booking, I was aware of this fee. Personally, I never thought that these fees are justified. But the net damage to my pocket even after this fee was not too much, because I got a good discount on room charge. The net charge I paid was comparable to any similar NYC hotel. But this hotel had an advantage of the location. Now, the two reasons I have rated this hotel as Average:1. No coffee maker in the room. I think this is a very basic amenity. They should have considered this. 2. If you order any online shopping merchandise at the hotel address, the hotel charges $10 for handling the package. I think this is outrageous. Considering that they are already charging $35 admin fees, they should not charge separately for this. Overall, if you like to be in the center of the happenings in NYC, This hotel is situated at the right place.

My fiancé and I stayed at the park central near Times Square and it did not disappoint! They upgraded us because of our recent engagement in the city and made sure that our stay was nothing but the best! Room was very clean and comfortable and you can't beat this hotels location. Thank you to Emmanuel who took great care of us and made our stay the best ever. Thank you and we will be back again!

The location is wonderful, the hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. However, you must request some amenities that you would expect in other hotels...which was a surprise because this is listed as a 4 star.

If you are booking on a web site that lists by rate, beware. This hotel imposes a mandatory additional $35/night fee for "amenities." I didn't need them, didn't want them, and didn't use them. But my protest did not move the manager in duty, who was utterly inflexible. He said it was all there in the fine print when I booked, and there was nothing he could do to reverse what amounts to an additional 30 percent tax upon customers.Well, here's what I'll do. I don't patronize companies that impose upon their customers unusual additional fees and define the by resorting to the "fine print" defense. This is no way for a business to treat a customer in the year 2018. Avoid this hotel.

Thank you guys for such a nice 8 day stay on the 16th floor! I really had a great stay here with my wife and we don’t have any complaints. I read other reviews and yes, you may wait for the elevator here and there, but it’s not that long of a wait. The hotel is nice and I spent over $300 at the little deli downstairs and another $150 at the bar. So it has some good stuff right there for you to start your day or end your evening. Spacious king bed and nice view. Get a street view when booking. It’s a classy hotel and you feel good coming back at the end of the day. Thanks again Park Central!!! I promise I will be back some day! We had a wonderful time! Until then take care!

I found that this location was fantastic. Close to where we were going. Lots of everything ( restaurant, shopping, sightseeing, etc.). The lobby was nice not great, the rooms were well setup and certainly ok size. The amenities in the hotel was fine. The staff was nice and polite. My only question is a $35.00 fee for amenities that I think should have been charged in the room fee. But I found the location was good enough to makeup for it.In general good not great.

Great location and super rate. Very pleased with the room and bathroom. Room modern and clean and excellent heating/cooling controls. And a very decent size for NYC. Great onsite facilities. Elevators are minimal and tend to be a little slow but not terribly inconvenient. I found the staff to be friendly and very helpful. Guest relations staff were very helpful when I had something I needed to take care of. Overall I would be very pleased to stay here again - best value for money I have found in Manhattan.

Nice midtown hotel convenient to Broadway and Times Square neighborhoods. Just know before you book, especially if using third party booking site, there is a mandatory amenities fee of $35 ($40 after tax) per night added to your bill for the fitness center, free local calls, luggage storage, business center use, and free newspapers. You are charged this regardless of whether you use any of these services. Why don’t they just include this in the regular room rate? Kind of sneaky way to appear low cost and then slam you at checkout. Valet parking is $65, even expensive by NYC prices. Room size is very good by NYC standards. Hotel has lobby bar and convenience shop. IMO, there are better options close by for less money.

This was my first time to New York. Because of an event, we needed to be near Carnegie Hall so booked three rooms at Park Central.I had been told the rooms in New York were small but was pleasantly surprised by the rooms at Park Central. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. The staff was very friendly and check in/check out went very smoothly. The only negative was a persistent key problem with one room. Maintenance staff responded multiple times but the problem kept recurring.The location was perfect. As stated, was there for an event at Carnigie Hall, which was across the street. Central Park is only a block away and Times Square is just casual stroll away.Given the location and the quality of the hotel, I found it to be an excellent value and would freely recommend for someone traveling to New York.

Very comfortable. Excellent location and value. Susie the concierge is always smiling. She makes you feel at home. Secure. Great employees. Very nice bar. Good value and you cannot beat the location! Clean bathrooms. Good heat and air. Very nice beds and bedding. Flat screen television with lots of options for viewing. Closet and luggage racks as well as a dresser and a desk. Tub/shower combination and so clean you will want to soak! Excellent name brand Kleenex and toilet tissue as well as very nice bath products. Iron and ironing board as well as in room safe. Extra portable heater a luxury if needed. Doorman and lots of European travelers. A real plus in my book! Grab and go breakfast is a good option to have!

This hotel is top of the line —was at New Yorker and left in 30 min of check in and went to park central Fabulous lobby bar area —gorgeous atmosphere ...loved the location of this hotel easy easy access to time square But note this hotel does not have room service or a restaurant INSIDE the hotel —they do have a market store that is in the lobby but nothing but grab and goWill return to this hotel

I booked a last minute Premier King room to celebrate my husband's birthday. As NYC residents, I wanted to book a nice hotel room to feel like we were on vacation for one night without having to leave the city-and it was all going to be a surprise! This is not the right hotel for a nice night in the city. I figured for paying over $300 for one night, the room would be at least a little special. The room was small, had no qualities that I think made it a "premier" room as it was advertised on the website, and the cushy chair in the room had a large brown stain on it. When I went to turn the TV on, half of the channels did not come through because of 'poor connection.' My premier room was also directly across from the elevators, and I could hear everyone on the floor coming and going during the few minutes I was in the room. I called down to guest services to see if we could switch rooms to another room within the same price-the guest representative said he had to speak to his manager and would give me a call back. After waiting 20 minutes and not hearing anything, I decided this hotel reservation as not worth the cost and my husband and I would be more comfortable staying at home that night even if it meant eating the money I spent on the 'surprise.' I went to guest services, and as I expected since I was cancelling my reservation within the 24 hours window before my reservation started, I would be charged for the night. I also found out when I thought I would be charged $305 for the room (as per my confirmed email from Hotels.com where I booked the room), I would be charged $395-between mandatory charges for amenities I was not even using and taxes I was way overcharged for what that room would have been.Lesson learned-don't book at Park Central Hotel when wanting a nice hotel room for the night. Very disappointed as a local in the city that a hotel would overcharge SO much and have poor customer service for a not satisfied customer.

The location is excellent, obviously depending where you need to be. Just below and close to Central Park, and close to Broadway etc. The room price seemed good value first but there is an additional fee which is mandatory, and the idea is sold as you would be getting something great additions to your visit. Well, I think getting wifi should anyway be complimentary, and also keeping your luggage few hours after your check-out at the hotel if needed. The breakfast still sounded first as something worth something. How wrong was I. It was ridiculous. You get a coupon to be used at the take-out kiosk cafe. You can have a croissant, one hot or cold drink and one more item which was specific (I don’t even remember what anymore as I didn’t want it).I did not want croissant, but sandwich. I also wanted both the orange juice and the coffee. With those three items and I had to pay almost 10 dollars extra. It was printed in the coupon, so the kiosk followed the rules. Still, just ridiculous.The room was just average. It delivered though - like a bulk business hotel does.The lounge downstairs behind the reception desks though is excellent. Big and still private tranquil oasis to work, meet or relax.With the basic amenities included in the price (even with then higher price) and better breakfast offering, and this would get one more star.

Arrived here for a business trip for 3 nights. No Valet person to take my car, not enough staff to check in guests. I was skeptical leaving my car unattended, walked in only to wait another 20 minutes to get checked in. Asked the front desk person if there was a valet person and told me to go and check at guest services..uhm? okay.. I tried to call the front desk and no one answers..so far..for the price they charge in a great location you would think they have a little more professional service.

Our trip was primarily to attend a concert at Carnegie Hall. The Park Central was across the street. The location was great! This was one of the only hotels that offered two queen size beds in a room. The room was modern, spacious for New York City, and comfortable.The only down side was spotty television service. We weren't staying in the hotel room to watch TV, however!

We had a room block for our group during a conference and were so pleased with Park Central. My room was at the end of a hall with no view but that meant it was really quiet. The rooms are larger than you would expect for NYC and the whole hotel had nice furniture and art. Also the bar area downstairs was lively and a nice place to meet with people and have a drink. Would definitely stay here again. And you cannot beat the location.

We were making a flying visit to see as much of New York as we could with our two daughters (3+7) in 2 days and spent a long time searching for a hotel to meet our needs. After making a shortlist and reading 100s of confusingly conflicting reviews, we settled on Park Central and it was perfect for our stay. We wanted a handy central location, ideally near Central Park. Tick! Park Central is one block from Central Park, enabling me to go for a morning run, adding an exciting (and freeeeezing!) post to my Strava profile and easy walking distance to Broadway, Times Square and other major attractions. It needed to be clean and well maintained. I didn’t mind about it being especially ‘fancy’ but I didn’t want to spend a special two days in an amazing city and come back with my children to a room that was grotty. I was a little concerned before our arrival about a number of reviewers that reported damp rooms, disrepair, slow/bad service, rooms not ready. I think maybe there has just been a major refurb recently if older reviews are to be believed or I don’t know which hotel they were reviewing at all! We found Park Central to be very well maintained and spotlessly clean. The whole hotel - lobby, lounge area as well as our room and bathroom - were classy and elegant, far more so than you’d get for the price in London and very spacious too. We were greeted by the most friendly, cheerful bellman/Porter/valet Parker who took all of our bags and greeted us in and out of the building every time we came and went. We were hours too early for our room so intended to leave our bags and head out to explore. However, reception staff quickly checked us in and we were shown straight up to our beautiful room in minutes. Quick turn around an we were dressed for the weather and out on our adventure. We chose a dual aspect room with views over the front corner of the hotel, towards the park and it was beautiful. We had two double beds, and armchair and footstool, desk and chair, clothing storage and a good sized bathroom with a bath and shower. There was good free WiFi, a pad and pencil and some lovely (local?) aromatherapy toiletries in the bathroom. Other than that, nothing else included in the room - no drinks making facilities and no free TV as far as we could make out. But for our visit, these things didn’t matter. The Park Market in the lobby was very well stocked with quite a good choice of breakfast items - fruit salad pots, yoghurt, pastries, cereals, juice, hot drinks and packed lunch items - crisps/chips, sandwiches... All a little pricy but everything we had was nice. We asked about bringing takeout food to our room one evening and they said it was fine and even offered to find and order what we wanted. (We stepped out ourself and found a great pizza place a few yards away on the same side.)All in All, for a very busy few days with young children, Park Central was a great location, a standard of style to make it feel really special, clean and comfortable to collapse after a long day and well looked after by professional and extremely friendly staff. Would thoroughly recommend it to couples and families. The ONLY thing I would’ve added to make it perfect was to be able to have a coffee in bed, made in our room.

Park Central I stayed at the hotel for a short 3 day City trip with a friend. The location is perfect, 2 blocks away from Central Park and 10 blocks from time Square. The room was very spacious for a New York city hotel. It was clean, equipped with modern furniture and fixtures. I would have liked a mini fridge in the room. The only complaint that I had was the size and numbers of the elevators. We had two for our block and they were very small. Often we had to use the stairs because the elevator was already full. With a hotel of at least 15 storeys that is not enough to accommodate all the guests. Check in and check out procedure went relatively smooth. Overall for the price I paid it was definitely worth it.

This was a good hotel experience. Not the best I have had but it was fine. Pros:- Location uptown was good- room was clean- Gym was good- Saw Montel Williams leaving the gym - that was a plus Cons:- Could use a face lift esp. the bathroom shower- I did not feel it was as nice as it looked online in pictures- Check in took a long time as they were having computer issues.

A better than average hotel for the price, we stayed here in October 2017 and had a lovely time. Its very close to a number of landmarks. Central Park is a short walk away as is Times Square. Rooms are of a decent size and clean. Bathrooms are quite modern.Did not eat here...why would you when you have some great restaurants on your doorstep.

Our room was better than expected. The bed was very, very comfortable. I was impressed with the beautiful bathroom and constancy of hot water. We requested a room near the elevator and our request was met without delay. We asked for help finding directions to our social destination and received immediate assistance. I'm usually hard to please, but I found Park Central Hotel to be a friendly and professional environment where guests are treated with care. If the hotel provided a sit-down restaurant, I would certainly have eaten breakfast and dinner there.

room was clean, good staff, good location and pleasant. I will recommand this hotel compare to any other one. Quiet room, modern furniture and comfertable bed. Stayed for 2 days and enjoyed the room and location.Good experiance.

Spent the last weekend in this hotel as part of a romantic getaway for Valentine's day. Selected for price as well as proximity to southern entrance to Central Park. The reservation was for Friday and Saturday in the King suite. Friday plans changed, so tried to contact the hotel several times 2 days prior to cancel the first night. The hotel phone rang 30+ times and no answer. Upon check in, requested to speak to the manager. Was surprised when the manager stated she doubted my story, and the first night was not refunded. The lobby is very LOUD, and only 2 elevators up to the top floors. During check in and check out, a bit of a wait. Elevators are very small, can fit 6 adults with luggage snugly. The hallways are narrow, with carpeting that was in need of cleaning, and walls somewhat banged up. The King Suite was a delight. Large living area, small fridge, wonderful mattress on the King bed, and 2 full bathrooms. No in room coffee set up. Large screen tv in the bedroom and the living area, and overall well lit rooms. I give the suite itself 5 stars. Had a ca, and parked. Was informed that I needed to personally come to request the car at the front desk, and took 30 minutes for car retrieval. Very high parking charge $64 for 1 night.

Stayed 3 nights at this hotel. Its very well placed between Times Square and Central Park. Only had 1 long wait for a lift and even that was just a couple of minutes. We stayed in room 1722 overlooking the atrium, there is no view but we only wanted to use the room to sleep and it was very peaceful and quiet. The room was spacious enough as was the bathroom. Lovely comfortable bed. Very responsive air con. It was clean except from the edge of the carpet near the skirting board where the vacuum cant reach - needed a nozzle running around it but no big deal. The people we dealt with were courteous and polite. We hope to come back to New York as we didn't manage to finish our sight seeing. If we do we will stay here. As for the notes on tripadvisor re facility fees they are shown on the confirmation so it was no surprise to us. Overall just what we were looking for.

Woke up to a mandatory $70 charge which I didn't even use any amenities (they don't have any other than a gym I guess, I didn't even go to the gym) breakfast isn't free, not a coffee, not a muffin, nothing. I'll post a picture of my view as you can see the business men next door watch all the naked people they want in this hotel. Oh, cable is not included, and forget them actually giving you a welcome, but you know what, they said I qualify for express check out, meaning I can leave faster than I came in, because apparently that's the service they offer. Don't book here, don't think about booking here, you're welcome for saving you the headache. You can walk to central park just as easily from any other hotel.

Location location location........ I absolutely love this hotel and the location is just perfect!!!! I run pretty much every day so the proximity to Central Park just doesn’t get any better and an added bonus is a really well equipped fitness room/gym!!! Staff is super friendly and rooms are spacious (for Nyc) and clean!!!Only ++++++s from this reviewer!!!

Perfect location for proximity to venues for music and art and Broadway! Carnegie Hall is across the Street! Concierge and Customer Service is exemplary! Comfortable rooms with quiet ambiance. Repeat visits are a must!

When we visit NYC we always stay at Park Central Hotel. Location is right in the Centre of Central Park, 5th Ave and Times Square. This time, we chose to have our room allocated on arrival, so we stayed in a 2 double Bed room, it was spacious and the bathroom was bigger compared to other rooms we have previously stayed in.

It was excellent, the Hotel Upgraded our room and put us in a higher floor with a better view of the city. I think this was our Anniversary gift from them. The location was great as we had an Anniversary Brunch at the Tavern on the Green, they gave us a table with a perfect view of the park and also an Anniversary dessert. We were also close by the Trump International Hotel and Tower for another Anniversary Lunch with a perfect table with a view of the park. The hotel was located very close to the Subway Stations that we used several times to go downtown. It was also very close to the Broadway Play "Hello Dolly". We did a lot of walking around Central Park, Columbus Circle and of course Times Square. We also walked to Massey's and to Bloomingdales, rode the Staten Island Ferry, saw NYU, Greenwich Village. It was a beautiful trip, no snow but it was cold in the morning but warmed up during the afternoon. I highly recommend the Park Central Hotel.

Scored this on Hotel Tonight for $93– huge room with sitting area and tv, queen bed and reclining chair. Pretty black and white modern decor and really big bathroom. No view but 4 huge windows made it bright. Easy check in— they add $35 “resort fee” to the bill ostensibly for exercise rooms, use of fax machines etc., which is becoming common, but still well worth it. Convenient location for Jazz at Lincoln Center and uptown venues near Columbus Circle and Central Park.

Our stay at the Park Central Hotel in New York was amazing!! The PCH location was just perfect- we were just blocks away from Time Square, Central Park, Lincoln Center, Metropolitan Opera, Radio City Music Hall, Top of the Rock, Broadway and more. It was close to a subway station, so that great for getting places to far to walk. The PCH staff was very helpful. Since this was our first time to the city we had lots of questions and a few concerns- the PCH front desk clerks and concierge were patient and answered our questions and really eased my nerves on my concerns. The room was spacious and very clean.I had booked a room with view, but our view was of a brick wall. The brick wall did provide privacy, which worked out really good for us, since there was no AC available. Per the maintenance man the hotel had already turn off air, but they had heat. The room did not have an small frig, but with the window slightly cracked we were able to keep our drinks cool.Even with the lack of a view, AC, and small frig, PCH was a great place to stay. We are already planning our next trip to New York City and we will be staying at the PCH again.

The staff was really friendly. We could walk everywhere from the hotel. There are many places to eat around the hotel. The beds were comfortable and everything smelled so clean. I will definitely return.

I was in the Park Central Hotel for 3 daysNow after the reforms - it is a very nice option. The rooms are big and beds are very good. The Wifi has a very bad set up , but you can ask for another one that works super well. Elevators are always crowded so be patience. The location is amazing in mid town. The underground is a block away and many places to eat. Be careful with the Deli’s at 7th they are super expensive. But when you check out they say you have to pay a facility fee? Never heard before . So make sure this is clear when you make your reservation. Would go again.

I went to NY in december and the hotel that i chose couldnt be better. This hotel is close to Central Park, metro station, restaurants and its location allows you to go almost everywhere by foot.Also, it provides you a great option to keep your luggage before check in time, which is perfect for people (like me) that arrive in alternative time.I do recommend!

We loved this Hotel. Room was spacious, we are glad we upgraded to a "junior suite" it was quiet, clean, comfortable and had a fabulous view. The 5-7 reception was a pleasure, we especially want to name Betty who worked at the reception as an outstanding employee, she was friendly, efficient and made us feel very welcome. We will be back as soon as we can.

Just stayed for the 2nd time - The rooms are nicely appointed and the location cant be beat. Close to Times Square, Broadway, Carnegie Hall and about 2 blocks from Central Park. Tons of restaurants nearby as well. I will absolutely be back.

Our room accommodated 4 people and was quite basic but we literally just slept there as we were on a sightseeing mission for three days. The hotel was perfectly located for us. We didn't want to be in the midst of the hussle and bussle of NYC so we stayed near Central Park. One day we walked back to the hotel clocking over 33,000 steps that day. The burger bar is fab. Concierge was informative and helpful. Drawback is no Wi-Fi in room unless you pay for it but it's free in lounge area (but that may have changed since we were there?). Would definitely recommend this as a place to stay and would definitely go back there to stay when we return to NYC.

Spent for 4 days in new york with my family and found all Americans to be rude and would only be nice if you was tipping them we got charged a extra 113 pound for a privialge we didn't want or use at all like wifi and telephone in room and to make beds. No tea or coffee in room and nothing could be done unless u tipped. Had breakfast cost lots of money in English we paid 59 pound for breakfast. I thought new york would be a dream to come to but the hotel and new york people was rude and only wanted more money even though we already paid they seemed to look down at brits.. the hotel was very dated and rooms was not the best I have been to more rated 3 out of 5. Good location but. I would not be coming back and I will take my family to good old London where we can have a tea in the room at night

I love Park Central Hotel Staff. Literally from the bellman, to the front desk Staff to the Guest Relations team I amAlways made to feel welcome. They are first class in every respect. They follow up on every detail to make sure my experience is a great one.

I stayed here with my best friend in October 2017. We stayed for seven nights while visiting New York. I'll split my review into different parts for ease of reading:The roomWe didn't spend a lot of time in the room as we wanted to maximise our stay in NYC by being out and about. The room had two double beds, a TV, fridge and a bathroom. The side tables near the bed had outlets which were handy for phone charging. The shower was a lovely pressure and the bathroom was large enough for getting ready each day. The only main issue was that there was no overhead light which we found quite strange - you had to rely on the lamps in the room to provide the light. Even opening the blind over the window did not assist as the sun was blocked by the rest of the building. However, this is not a dealbreaker - the room was wonderfully comfortable for our needs - it was always made up when we returned and the beds were super comfortable.The Location:Central. Convenient. If you are looking for somewhere convenient to stay, this is definitely it. A block from Columbus Circle/Central Park, a 10 minute walk down to Times Square and on the same block as a main Subway line, this hotel was super well located. There were always taxis waiting outside and plenty of room for an uber/lyft to pick you up. The coffee place next door made amazing coffee and was a good first stop for us each day before we headed out. The Service:The front desk was lovely and we always got assistance when needed. I ordered a pair of shoes online and had them delivered to the hotel and they held it for me BUT they charged a holding fee so beware of that. There was always a welcoming face upon our return - regardless of how late/early it was and checkout was a breeze.Extras/Hints:There is a $70+ resort fee PER day, so just a warning. There are two lifts to access and they are always busy - if you don't have bags, use the stairs it will save you so much time! (we were only on the third floor, so this was easier for us, this won't be the case if you're higher up obviously!)We did a hop on/hop off tour on our last day for fun, and the hotel has a little history we didn't realise - definitely worth googling!Overall I would likely stay here again/recommend to a friend.

Clean. Contemporary. Well appointed. Awesome and large lounge. The rooms, like MOST NYC hotels are small. We had two double beds - which are TOO small for even a family of four who are Tall (and thin). Regardless, the hotel and rooms are well appointed and brand spanking new. It’s as nice as an upscale Hilton/Sheraton/Marriot. You won’t be disappointed! It’s located midtown, close to Broadway/TimeSquare yet enough away from the noise of TS and our room was quiet even on the 4th floor. We heard NO street noise. Park Central is in the same building as The Manhattan Club and in partnership with the Redeye restaurant. - I highly recommend this restaurant (located across the street) for excellent service, steaks and lobster/oysters or just for drinks.

You can not expect a better location if you are planning to go to the Central Park and Times Square. You will be at walking distance to both, to other landmarks and really good restaurants, breakfast cafes, everything! If you are going with the family, plan on spending a couple of days st the Central Park. Definitely one of my fave parts of NYC! As for the rooms, clean and well kept, staff was very busy but cordial and speak other languages.

Great place, very clean and centric to everything. Hotel is very clean and maintained well. Great place to stay! Would definitely recommend Park Central Hotel to couples, families. Perfect place to stay not being in the center of time square but close enough to walk to it as well as others.

Attended a sales conference in New York and the park central was chosen for us .good choice ,modern rooms with all the facilities you could wish for .fine service as you would expect with nothing to much trouble for the staff .close to Central Park and 10 mins.walk to time sq.so location is very good .the bar area is very relaxing and a good space full of atmosphere .all in all a good fine at half the price of similar hotel close by .

These photos were taken tonight in my “premium room”. A picture is worth a thousand words. I won’t be back. I think the premium designation is not appropriate to the accommodations. The room is small and dirty, and they consider the eighth floor to be a high floor and the extra 25 square feet to be worthy of a surcharge.

As a repeat visitor how would you like to pay extra for two premium rooms, be assured of a quiet location in your reservation and receive assurances at check-in at 2pm that the even though the rooms weren’t ready, your requests would be met - only to be shown two smaller than usual dirty rooms with peeling paint that under no circumstances could be considered “premium”? Having stayed at this hotel several times before, we could tell the difference and are very disappointed. Add to that unspeakably rude and disinterested staff, and the dishonesty of the “assurances”, and we will be warning all our friends and relatives to stay away from this awful place. There are far better hotels in the area that offer courteous customer service and updated clean rooms.

Second year in a row staying here for a conference around the block at the midtown Hilton. At about half the price. And the rooms are in better shape. Comfy bed. Wish the room had a coffee maker though.I forget if I got a deal on Groupon, Travelzoo or here at TA, but there are deals to be found. I arrived early at 1:30pm and they checked me in within 2 minutes. Very clean room, fairly recently renovated (as opposed to the midtown Hilton when I was there 3 years ago). Location is great with the R and W subway line 30 steps from the hotel, it takes 10 minutes to get to Penn Station.

We decided to go to NYC for a weekend and unfortunately booked it during the weekend that a massive snow storm hit. When we called to cancel our 1st night due to a plane cancellation, they easily refunded our money. After a somewhat bad night’s sleep on the first night due to being located near the elevator (avoid if you’re a light sleeper) & someone smoking on our hallway, they quickly changed our room to a quieter location & took the smoking concerns very seriously as there is no smoking permitted. I was beyond happy & appreciative of their customer service to make sure my stay was perfect. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. The location was close to a lot of the main sights and was also close to the subway. The room felt modern, clean, and comfortable at a great price. We also enjoyed the hotel bar before walking to a broadway show one night as well as their grab and go breakfast in the morning.

My business takes me to NY twice a year. I have stayed at many hotels and this was my first time at Park Central Hotel. The room was very nice; the staff helpful and professional ; and the level of service was excellent- beginning from when I first booked the room through my 6 night stay. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

Hotel staff was rude. When asked what a good place to eat in the neighbourhood was they said "everything." They weren't very helpful at all. Walls were very thin and you could hear everything in the halls. Housekeeping staff started knocking on our door at 8am on our day to check out even though check out was at 12pm. They knocked on our door about 5 times. Overall not happy with the stay and would not stay here again.

When we visit NYC, we mostly also go to the MET for opera. This dictates the selection of hotels. This time we selected Park Central Hotel based location and price. The hotel has spacious, clean rooms and friendly staff. No restaurant, no breakfast, no fridge or coffee maker in room. BUT there is a taxi row outside, and subway stations nearby. The surprise came in the form of an extra FACILITIES/RESORT CHARGE of 35 dollars per room per night for perfectly normal hotel facilities and services, that generally are provided free of charge. I would like to know why a rice raise is done this way.

Location is near the Central Park where you can walk or take a carriage ride. Is a good price for an overnight stay. Is close enough to go to Broadway Venues or just to walk around the city at the south end of Central Park.

My go to (if the price is good) hotel in NYC. Perfect location, great staff and very comfy rooms. 3 blocks from 5th,3 blocks from the Park and luckily 6-7 blocks from busy Time Square.Great restaurants, theater and shoppingSo close. My first choice always.

We checked in and everything was ALRIGHT... The rooms look like they do in the pictures. It is not a NEW hotel. Some of hte furniture in the halls where missing door knobs for some reason. Our rooms got cleaned every day even the one day we left at only 2pm. The staff was fine they werent very friendly at check in but not rude either. It just seemed like they didnt care if we came or went or whatever. but the rooms were fine we :).

The hotel itself is very nice, modernly decorated and within a walking distance of central park, Broadway, times square! Its location is excellent, there is a subway stop right outside. The only criticism is that the walls are not sound proof and for three of the nights we stayed there we could here a couple arguing next door and playing the television very loudly at night time.

Booked our trip last minute and got a great deal on this hotel. Fantastic location close to Central Park. Walking distance to mos of the major attractions and everything g else was on the subway just up the street from hotel entrance. Great rooms, comfortable beds. Very helpful staff. Loved our stay here and will definitely stay here again if given the oppportnaty to come back again. Highly recommend.

Early check in (@10am) at no extra fee! Clean room with contemporary decor. Stunning bar in lobby. Steps from Central Park, and Columbus Circle (a major transport hub.) Great check in experience and gracious house cleaning service

Booked for a last minute family trip to New York in November. Having read some of the recent bad reviews I was slightly apprehensive about staying here. However, IT WAS FAB! I don’t understand the negative reviews in the slightest. Everything was as you would expect after paying a fairly high price to travel, just for 4 or so days. The hotel was clean and warm. The front desk staff were friendly and more than helpful - even down to phoning our excursions company to confirm our booking for us! Park Central is also in the perfect location, just up from Times Square - lovely to walk and see the sights. Those reviews that talk about noise - this is a hotel in the centre of New York... a city that never sleeps - it’s not going to be quiet or secluded. However, myself, my husband and my 4 month old daughter had no problems sleeping in the huge, comfortable bed! The rooms are well insulated and although we were positioned facing right onto the street, on the 10th floor, the noise was minimal! Waking up to a beautiful view of New York every morning was the best part! If I travelled to New York again I would definitely book here - our holiday was perfect and the hotel was spot on! Thank you Park Central.

The Park Central is located very close to Central Park and within walking distance to Times Square, the Rockefeller centre, the subway is very much like London underground easy to use $10 gives you about 3 trips around Manhatan. The city is always busy again like London we arrived at 01.40 we asked reception if we could have some milk and was rudely laughed and told to walk down to the deli a block away the porter sat there watching us struggling with our bags he didn't offer to help. Our first impression of the hotel was crap, the room was dated but ok the beds were comfortable we were on the 11th floor facing the street which was noisy but didn't lose any sleep over it. I don't think I'd return to this hotel because of of the price and lack of night service and late check in, must add Stephanie on front desk was fantastic nothing was to much trouble she gave advice on traveling in the city, directions, prices she was a joy to talk with.

Great location - just steps from Central Park and Times Square. Super modern, clean and larger room than most NYC hotels.Was very pleased with the check in - They have the most courteous staff. - A must if your looking for Times Square area

This my second stay at Park Central. The location is perfect for business or pleasure. You can walk to Times Swuare and most theaters. The hotel is lovely, staff superb. The rooms are small but that's typical of NY. They are well appointed with a very large flat screen TV. The conseirge is very helpful and knowledgeable. And I loved the shower with the rainfall shower head!

I have been several times in NYC and this hotel is very well located close to many attractions: from outside just few minutes walking along the 7th street you will find time square, 2 blocks more across the street the famous 5th Avenue with an amazing shopping. Don’t miss the Christmas tree in Rockefeller centre.If you wish to enjoy your vacation don’t miss Central Park with the zoo and animals.About the hotel personally I don’t like that the mini fridge is not available in my room and we choose to change room on higher floor because if you are a light sleeper like me you will ear some noise from the street.Hotel need renovation and soundproofing.If you are Italian be aware to the tourists traps restaurants, maybe have look at Barilla restaurant on 6th street ( very affordable prices) or one my favourite restaurant was bistro Milano.Thanks to guest service

Four days overlooking the street from the 8th floor and around four hours total sleep! Writing this review is a little more than a struggle. Bar and reception staff very friendly and helpful, Irish John on the bar was entertaining and a mine of information. The lady who runs the market shop (foyer coffee shop) could qualify for the most miserable sod of the year award. My room was large and clean and backed onto the bank of four lifts. Every time the elevator passed the room, there was a noise like a jet engine! The racket from drunks in the street, and the constant car horns has left me sleep deprived and not very nice to be around. Why does every body feel the need to blow the bloody horn all through the night! Perhaps NY needs a noise tax as well as a tax for everything else you seem to be charged for. Not a fault of the hotel of course, just me venting at the airport back home for me for a good night's sleep!

Great location for Central Park and Time Square.. Reception staff abrupt on arrival and advised no facility for room service or food options even when arriving late! No tea or coffee making facilities in rooms although coffee shop in the lobby! Concierge support a bit hit and miss! Hotel generally good but drinks in bar very expensive .. will always serve a double unless asking for single shot.. ! Would try another hotel if in NYC again?

Location was great. At first we could not find the concierge. However that situation improved the next day. We felt like we were on our own given the New Year's holiday. All in all, we did not find that we got value for our expense.And no coffee access on New YeaR's day.

We recently stayed here following our flight cancellation during the JFK store chaos.We booked this hotel for its price and location following a 3 day flight delay at JFK. This is a no frills very busy hotel, without restaurant. The rooms are pretty big by Manahattan stanadards, but there is no service. We have stayed in this hotel a few times over the past 4 or 5 Years and have seen the general cleanliness deteriorate. The rooms and hotel are no looking tired and are in need of a refurbishment.

I have stayed at hundreds of hotels around the world and this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at only one lift worked for a hotel this size is completely unacceptable... Asked for a couple of glasses from the bar for the room and was told no. The lighting in the rooms is completely unacceptable in particular the complete lack of lighting in the cupboards...the rooms are noisy and the service provided (or lack of) did not made for any enjoyable stay...I would not recommend staying here. Apart from the location I would strongly recommend staying somewhere else.

This is an "average" hotel. The location is excellent. Request a room AWAY from the street, as the windows are very thin and not insulated. It was cold (in December) and VERY noisy. The heating system was also kind of noisy. The bed was comfortable and bathroom nice. Had plenty of closet space and drawers. The elevator wait was ridiculously LONG most of the time. We did visit about 10 days before Christmas, so it was just a busy time...but only 2 elevators serve everyone and they are extremely slow. We spoke with the front desk a couple of times and they were helpful and friendly each time.

Check in was fast and easy. Was upgraded for free by the nice black woman at the front desk. I don't know her name, but she's so nice and excellent.Only complaint is the body wash in the shower was empty and instead we got a small bar of soap from housekeeping.

Our 15th year staying at the hotel. Room good, housekeeping good and really no waiting for elevator.Can walk p to Central Park and to MoMaand other tourist must see. Carmelo the doorman is wonderful always a greeting when you go out, gets you the taxi you need and recommended Nocello a Italian restaurant on 55th which was excellent.Looking forward to next January for year 16 at the Park Central.
user_name:
Carol C
South Bound Brook, New Jersey

review_body: Me and few of my family members stayed in this hot for few days.Room were ran today but not very private coz straight into people roo if you left the blinds open not very nice.Cleaning staff were the nicest staff we meet in this hotel.Receptions very very very helpful and bit rude as we found after a personal item went missing and we ask for there help might as well of ask a baby help no help for any member of the receptionist staff. Bar staff extremely rude would not even speak to you and just ignored you ALL THE TIME.If you like rude staff stay here, if not avoid until the staff learn some good manner.

I had really nice stay in this beautifuly located hotel . Special thanks to Adriana and Peggy at the front desk for being so friendly kind and helpful Hotel has a dining room were you can enjoy beautiful view on Central Park Over all this hotel and service made me fell special and I appreciate that

The location was the drawing point to this hotel 5 minutes walk from times square. We paid extra to have a corner facing room to the square but were disappointed in the size . It was quite small for 2 queen beds. The room was cleaned every day to a good standard with clean towels. Always nice to come back to a clean tidy room after s long day sightseeing. The staff were attentive and supplied us with a fridge coffee maker and coffee& tea supplies and no charge . It was a pricey hotel fir what it was but it’s central Manhattan so expected. There are only 2 lifts on either side so always had to wait as they were very small fitting only 8 people tightly packed .

We had reservations to stay at the Park Central this past weekend from Thursday thru Sunday (three nights) 1/4-1/7. Due to the bomb cyclone in NYC, our flight on Thursday was cancelled. I called the hotel to explain the situation. I explained that I did not want to be marked as a no show and that I was trying to get on a later flight. They offered to pre-register (or pre-check) for me so that I would not lose my room, which they did. I arrived on the hotel on Friday. SO, my stay turned out to be two nights, instead of three. When I called my credit card company (I used points to book the reservation) to ask for refund of points for first night, they contacted Park Central to confirm. The hotel DECLINED to refund the first night because it was a non-refundable reservation. I understand that policy, under normal circumstances, but this was a rare storm, my flight was canceled, and I DID make it to the hotel the next day. Very unhappy! Won't be staying here again!

Park Central Hotel exceeded my expectations. The rooms looked like they had been recently refurbished and they were very comfortable. They were also larger than I expected them to be. The staff were friendly and efficient. From the front of the hotel you can see Central Park one way and Times Square the other. It was within walking distance to many attractions including Radio City Music Hall, The Rockefeller centre, Times Square, Central park and all the shops on 5th Avenue. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the thick of it while in New york City!

This is a great hotel. the room was clean and well appointed. The location of the hotel is perfect and the price per night was fair. Even though it was very cold during our stay (-18) we still walked down to times square and the theater district (only 6 blocks) also walked up to Central park (3 blocks). Great staff and great memories.

Excellent central location, average but still very nice rooms. Staff was very friendly, hotel bar relatively expensive. The little coffee bar down by the lobby was lovely too - you can even get British breakfast tea ;) Overall we were very happy with our stay and would come again!

We stayed here for a short break in December 2017. The hotel is in a brilliant location, walking distance from Central Park and Time Square. The room was very modern and clean...and very big! Our flight landed late in the day, and after reading other reviews, I contacted the hotel to inform them of our late arrival. Another couple with us had not which resulted in them not getting the room they booked the first night and had to move room the second night. As with most places in New York, drinks at the bar are costly, and the small coffee shop also. Had a wonderful stay and would recommend to others planning a trip.

We enjoyed our stay. The staff was very accommodating and had great attitudes. The room was a nice size and the lounge was large and comfortable. The location worked well for shopping and siteseeing. We'd stay here again.

We got to stay in Park central hotel for 4 nights and we enjoyed each bit of it. The location was perfect, just 5 minutes walk from times square. It was so strategic. The pricing of the room per night also was mid range. it was worth the place as the size of the standard room also was spacious enough. The bathroom was always kept clean and the amenities were always complete. The water pressure in the bathroom was also good. The bed and pillows were comfortable. overall it was a lovely stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to NYC.

Hotel ok, price includes $31 PER NIGHT EXTRA HIDDEN FEE - BEWARE. Small print business tactic. UNFAIR. not about $31/night extra - about being honest and upfront with customers. UNFAIR BUSINESS PRACTICE.

Rooms not very spacious but the staff were very helpful and friendly and accomodated our request to be on the same floor with our family. Location can't get better, a few minutes walk from Central Park and about 10 mins to Times Square (close enough and yet far enough from the noise). Prices are relatively expensive but that's what you get for peak season in NYC. Overall enoyed our stay!

We stayed here for 5 nights in December. Our room was nice, clean with modern decor, however, it lacked modern facilities you might expect in a 4* hotel such as USB plugs or a mini fridge which was disappointing for the price we paid (about £1200). As expected, the hotel shop where you could get water/drinks/snacks was ridiculously expensive, I think we paid almost twenty dollars for a few bottles of drink and a bar of chocolate the first night! Needless to say we didn’t shop there again, there are plenty of shops locally. Another disappointment was the hotel lifts. For such a large hotel they had very few lifts, and all very slow, which always seemed to result in a lengthy wait and then letting a couple go by as they were too full.One evening we were staying we went down to the bar to find out it was shut for a private event. When we enquired when it was opening we were quite abruptly told there had been an email about it (although not everyone checks these while away) and that it was closed all evening, no apologies for any inconvenience caused or anything. However, on a different note the waitress at the bar (Nancy) was great the few times we did visit, although she always seemed to be the only one serving so service was slow, but she was always very polite despite being rushed off her feet!Overall we had a nice stay, the location of the hotel is brilliant as you are never far from anything including the subway. However, for the price we paid (including hefty facilities fees) we would stay somewhere else if we were to return to New York. We had previously stayed at a nearby hotel for example that included two hours of drinks/snacks every evening which was a nice touch.
user_name:
SH20192
Kingston upon Thames, United Kingdom

review_body: the location of this hotel is awesome. Walking distance for upper manhattan no problem. Stuff was more than helpful and kind. The only disadwantage is the heating. those electric fans are loud and noisy. overall I would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Stayed 2 nights in December. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Beautiful hotel, awesome location. Walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Broadway. Nice little area in the lobby to get coffee, drinks or snacks. Nice service to hold your luggage before and after check in.

Brought my son to New York for the first time at Christmas on getting to floor 3 it stunk of weed I mentioned cannabis to the desk but only under stood weed. When entered room it was coming thro the walls. I was staying with my 10 year old son. When I mentioned it she seemed non fussed but agreed to move me to another room and get security up. There are two facts non smoking hotel and also this is against law. It was not reassuring that this hotel is associated with not taking this seriously as when I returned up stairs no security. Also other families staying up there. We were moved to another room clearly accommodation which has n’t had an audit carried out on as bath plug did not work and we waited in total 2 hours for maintenance which ruined our evening. Plug sock lose could of got electric shock, also bathroom door handle only hand one screw in it so could of got locked in bathroom. As I could n’t even have a shower not knowing if anyone would arrive at the door I would be undressed. After 2 hours waiting I went down stairs and ruffled some feathers I’d had enough tbh. I am sure if shoe was on the other foot I am sure sorry would not suffice. No coffee machine. What’s the point asking you wait hours for anything around here. They said manager would be informed about the lacking room audit and drugs in the hotel no one contacted me so I thought I may as well post my comments now.

If I only could book a hotel in Brooklyn I would never book anything in Manhattan. Unfortunately I had to book the available hotels for me (due to business) and this one was one of these still not sold out. It has nice views if you get a high floor, as well the rooms are clean and with enough space (for NYC), the bathroom was convenient as well. The front desk stuff was very helpful and patient despite the fact they were always busy and overloaded with work! Thank you!The elevators are old, not well maintained, they make a lot of noise so you can here them passing by your room even if your room is 3 rooms away from the elevator. Its not as bad as I scored it on its own, but given the price I would expect a bit more mental space to rest - Central Park near by which helps.

this was an amazing hotel in the heart of the city. I stay in NYC often and I have to say this hotel has the roomiest rooms and the biggest bathrooms out of any NYC hotel I have ever stayed in. Close to time sq, walking distance to everything

We were first given a room at the third floor, we checked in the room and found it really noise, like if you are sleeping next to the jet engine. So we immediately went to the front desk lady and asked to change room. The front desk lady just said ‘No, we are full house’.. but we checked online they are still selling rooms (price even lower than we paid), we then talked to the lady again but she was very rude and unhelpful. Then we asked to talk to the manager, the manager just not willing to come out and talk directly to us, he hide himself in the office and just pass message through another staff. Not until we asked for the manager’s name, he finally came out and changed our room. The whole process was just so annoying, especially the attitude of the front desk staff. Disappointing. And we will not choose Park Central in our future stay in NY.

If you are going to stay in this hotel take a box of sleeping tablets - you will need them to get a nights sleep - The kitchen fans are on all night and sound like a jet engine. Front desk said they could move us - UP ONE FLOOR - that will help -- NOT

My wife and I stayed 3 nights at Park Central and were very pleased. The location was walking distance to just about everything we did, the rooms were updated and very clean and the staff was wonderful. We checked-in around 7:30pm December 13th and the lady working the desk was professional, friendly and made us feel very welcome. Great start! House keeping was phenomenal. The room was quiet and comfortable. On check-out, Vito and Emanuel gave us a pleasant good bye. Overall experience was outstanding!

Stayed at the Park Central for 4 days and was happy in general. Room and bathroom were clean and well kept. I do have to apologize to the fantastic cleaning staff who did an excellent job cleaning up the room after me and folding away discarded clothes. The staff at the front desk were polite and the experience in general was what one expects for a hotel in this price bracket.A few little niggles, first the glasses in the room were not replaced when the room was cleaned, I don't know if this is normal, or with several hundred rooms to clean sometimes forgotten. After 4 days, it gets a bit grim. Secondly, the daily facilities charge is a bit cheeky and certainly does not help create a good memory of the hotel. Whilst I was well aware of it, nobody wants to get back from holiday to see an additional payment on their statements. If a daily charge is required, then why is it not charged upfront?

My daughters and I wanted to visit NYC at Christmastime. I found this hotel through JetBlue. We "upgraded" to a premier room and a higher floor (last stay in NYC at a hotel in Times Square we had a rodent run through the room). Stayed in a room with 2 queen beds. Beds were comfortable, room was clean. For perfectionists, a few minor issues - toilet paper roll holder kept falling off, rust stains in corner of tub, no fridge (understand that's typical). Staff was friendly. Check-in truly at 4 so they stored our luggage until we could get into room. Elevators tiny and only 2 for the higher floors so many times there was a line waiting. We had a room right off the elevator but were not bothered by any noise. Not sure what time the lounge opened, but it was definitely after 3pm... would have been nice to get a drink while waiting to get into the room. Location was great - a few blocks down from the Park and a few blocks up from Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Just a tiny stand to buy limited food - muffins, donuts, sandwiches, soup. Tisserie next door had a good breakfast, and Starbucks was right next to that.

the only good thing about the hotel was location, BUT most hotels are In a good location, Oh and the room cleaners are pleasant enough nothing like the Check In / out staff. We went for two reasons 1, to celebrate my 50th Birthday. 2, to go Christmas shopping. Thank you for RUINING both for Us, NEVER AGAIN : - ( Very unhappy that you managed to spoil what was supposed to a truly magical experience

The welcome at check-in was great, everything worked and all contact with staff made you feel part of their family.Facility upgrades since we last stayed there were welcome.Only wish - is for a coffee machine in the room.

Excellent location to walk to the opera and quiet for sleeping. No "extras" like a coffeemaker or shower cap without request. Although appearing clean, I stopped running a bath when I saw a long black hair in the tub. Also, safe didn't work and elevator to 8th floor was very slow but too many flights to walk!

This 4stars hotel was very clean and everything in this hotel worked fine. We did not use any dinning in this hotel except bakery in ground floor, because in about 50 meters from this hotel are many restaurants, coffeeshops and bars. If you plan to visit more than once Central Park and Times Square, this is best location.

We have been staying at the Park Central for more than 20 years. In the past, we found it to be an affordable, well-run hotel at a very good location in Manhattan. This time, we were a bit disappointed.We had requested a King bed when we made our reservation, but were told at check-in that, despite our reservation made weeks in advance, none were available. The front desk receptionist made no effort to accommodate our request. Unlike our experience before, the front desk agent was unapologetic and condescending.We finally settled for a double queen room on the seventh floor. We were told that we had to wait until 4 pm for a room because they were all being cleaned. When we finally got to our room, we found it to be only marginally clean. The carpet had not been vacuumed. The glasses had obviously been used by the previous occupants and were not replaced. The beds were obviously made up in a hurry as the sheets did not stay in place when we retired for the night. We had to remake the beds. The bath tub hardware was broken and laying in the tub. The room attendants had made no effort to repair the tub and had not reported it to maintenance.To be fair, when we reported these inconveniences to the manager, he promptly took care of the issues and offered us compensation. We had no further issues until check-out day when our room keys were electronically deactivated an hour prior to checkout time. When we returned from a late breakfast, we were not able to access our room even though we had more than an hour before checkout at noon.We hope this was an unusual stay that will not be repeated when we return because the Park Central's location - close to Central Park, Time's Square, Rockefeller Center, Carnegie Hall and our favorite restaurants and shopping - is excellent for our purposes.

This hotel is in a great location especially if you want to be close to Broadway and Central Park.Large rooms especially for NYC, the rooms are extremely clean and serviced daily. The only downside with the room is there wasn’t a fridge (which isn’t uncommon in NY) there was an ice machine on the floor and there wasn’t a coffee machine in the room.Hotel staff were extremely friendly and we were able to store our luggage after we had checked out.Extremely good value for money in NY.

I have NEVER been so disappointed in a hotel in my life!! HERE'S WHY!On July 24th a lightning strike burned my house down. Since then life has been rough to say the least as I’m a single mother of twin 5 year old daughters. So, I booked a 4 night stay at Park Central Hotel (12/8/17-12/12/17) even though it wasn’t really in the budget because I really wanted to surprise my daughters with an amazing Christmas time trip! I thought a few days of ice skating in Rockefeller Center and Macy’s Santaland would be just what we needed to forget about having lost everything in our worlds. I thought, do it now, money is money, memories are forever. So I got down to the business of planning!I booked my stay online and specified I needed TWO QUEEN BEDS AND A ROLLAWAY. Then I called because I wanted to make sure we got a rollaway and I knew that was a request only item and this trip was VERY important to me! They confirmed all was great and the notes were on my reservations, they said “make sure you call the hotel directly just in case.” So I DID! I called the hotel DIRECTLY! Spoke to the HOTEL STAFF DIRECTLY and confirmed TWO QUEEN BEDS AND A ROLLAWAY! I felt confident and went about making reservations for the rest of the trip.Fast forward to arriving at the hotel. We walk up to the desk with my, now exhausted, twin 5 year old daughters in tow, at around 6:30pm. The RUDE woman at the desk says that she has me down for two queen beds. I remind her of the rollaway I’ve called about and she says “no way ma’am, that’s a fire hazard, you can’t have a rollaway in ANY of those rooms”. WHAT!!! I tell her I’ve called the hotel DIRECTLY and they’ve told me that it’s on my reservation and won’t be a problem at all. HERE IS WHERE IT GETS CRAZY! She says “yes ma’am I can see that you called, I have that here, but we can’t put a rollaway in those rooms so it’s not happening. It’s a fire hazard.” Again, WHAT!!!! So I tell her I need the bed and they already confirmed it, if it couldn’t be done then they SHOULD have told me ON THE PHONE. I tell her they need to put us in a room with enough space and she says “sorry, we’re fully booked.” Agaaain, WHAT!!!!! I am about to cry at this point because I’ve literally used all the money I have to take my daughters on this trip and we are now in New York and it is too late to undo anything and she says “you can have a breakfast voucher.” !!!!! WHAAAAT!!! The voucher that pays for a muffin and a juice! REALLY! The room was $450 a NIGHT!!!! So when I start to freak out she says “look I can move you to a queen bed with a pull out couch, we can fit a rollaway in there.” I tell her if that’s the case I need to have my room fee adjusted because I paid for two BEDS, not a bed and a old couch, and she smirks and says “no. That’s a suite, your lucky we can even put you in that.” I WAS SO UPSET!!! She did not care at all! NOT AT ALL! No apology! NOTHING! I asked if they could apply an active duty military discount (my travel companion had his ID present for them to view if needed) to offset costs and she laughed and ignored me! So...what? You also don’t care about the military?? I was desperately trying to fix what YOUR STAFF had ROYALLY messed up and was getting mocked in the process! I gave up and spent the next 20 minutes waiting for one of the TWO elevators that service all the floors of your hotel to have room to carry us to our 6th floor “suite” with one bed, a pullout, a rollaway and a $450 a night price tag. (Oh and I didn’t even get the “breakfast”, the RUDE woman in the HORRIBLY OVERPRICED shop said I couldn’t have “that muffin” bc it “wasn’t covered by the voucher” and I “had to choose from those ones” so I got mad and gave up.)Well, Park Central. You should be ASHAMED of yourself!! Your behavior and treatment of my family and I makes me SICK TO MY STOMACH! I hope that those among you that own and operate your facility never find yourself standing in front of your home watching everything you love and worked so hard to acquire burn to ash in front of you! And I hope than that if it does, when you finally see a crack of light peeking through the clouds, there isn’t a smirking rude monster of a business that doesn’t care about its customers AT ALL waiting to crush you even further down. You took $2000 dollars from me and I slept on a piece of garbage uncomfortable old pullout for four days.My only question:ARE YOU PROUD OF YOURSELF?!

We stayed here for a Christmas break for 4 nights and it was perfect. We arrived to a speedy painfree check in, friendly staff and the hotel was clean. It wasn't that christmassy in comparison to others we saw sadly. We got to our room which was 1403 it was a great sized room, it was a bit tight when walking past the bed to get to one side. But the room was spacious apart from that, thr bathroom was a good size but after 2 days thr shower screen smelt horrible and damp! The cleaners didn't seem to do a great job when coming in they never folded anything like pj's on thr bed they were just put on thr floor! We made a few requests and when ever we did this they always called after to make sure we were happy which was really nice touch. Location wise was so good, close enough to time square and central park but not in the insane part which was great.We used the gym which is small but is good enough for a city hotel but gets busy so just pick your time wiselym

Brought a group this past weekend to this hotel. The hotel is in a great location away from the madness at Times Square and walking distance to some of the best restaurants. The staff was very helpful and the rooms were very clean. Riley Allen our sales coordinator was wonderful to work with. I would highly recommend this hotel for business or leisure travel.

Nothing everything was great will definitely return. We make a trip tothe city every December will definitely come back here and recommend to friends/family! I love the city ansd this hotel has made it easy to enjoy and just hang out. The room size was amazing! Couldn't have asked for better room

Hotel is in a good location for Central Park, Time Sqaure and Rockafella centre etc Had a nice welcome from who I presume was the manager.. It's a shame we haven't slept yet since we've been here due to the constant street noise.. We had to buy earplugs, maybe would be better if we higher up- don't stay on floor 4 or below..My boyfriend emailed the hotel before arrival as was planning a proposal, shame no one responded to him..!!

For our annual trip to New York during Christmas we booked this hotel through Amtrack. Great hotel in great location, friendly staff, good size rooms, lobby and rooms were clean and nicely appointed. Very nice lounge in the lobby - great place to relax and have a drink. Only problem was the size of the beds - we thought a queen bed was a queen bed but it turns out there is something called a New York City queen which was quite a bit smaller than a regular queen. Plan on waiting 20 minutes or more to check in. We will definitely stay here again.

Annette at the Park Central is a genuine and warm person who made he difference for us when we had a problem during our stay. Handled perfectly and with great empathy. We will definitely recommend the hotel to friends who will visit NY soon. Many many thanks. You made our trip.

I was recommended this hotel by a friend who travels to NYC often and always opts to stay here. The rooms are adequate enough for what we needed and location is conveniently located, close to Times Square and ideally located near the subway. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but don't let that put you off as there are so many other places nearby to choose from so you won't go hungry. The hotel does have a bar and is well worth a visit :-)

After following Tripadvisor reviews prior to our trip, I was a bit worried about some aspects - staff/room/lifts.However, check-in was fine - lady who dealt with us was lovely.Room was nice and clean, and size-wise was fine for 3 adults.Only downside was very poor lighting - but that seems the norm these days in a number of hotels.Lifts were fine - but we used the ones marked for floors 3-9 so possibly we just hit lucky with less "traffic".The hotel was in a perfect spot - the fact that there's no on-site dining wasn't an issue as there's so many places close by.Would definitely stay here again.We travelled with Jet2, and the facilities charge was already included in our price.

Just returned from a long weekend in NYC. We stayed at the Park Central Hotel. Room was very nice (opted for the 2 queen bed option). The location was ideal for walking to Times Square and surrounding areas. We did have an issue with the power in our room on Sunday and I had to call the front desk 3 times to get it resolved ( the breaker needed to be reset) but they did finally resolve it. That would really be my only complaint....the speed to which it was resolved. Other than that, the hotel was great.

Staying here right now. Location is great. The hotel is nice. No restaurant or room service. If you get a room on a low floor on the street be prepared. It is very noisy all day and night. Kitty corner to Carnegie Hall and 5 min walk to the park and Columbus circle. 10 min walk the other way to Times SquareAll in all good but considering the facilities fee they charge. That's a rip off!!

Perfect location between Central Park and Time Square. Restaurants close by. There is a resort fee applied when you arrive. Hop and Hop off buses stop at the hotel for location drop off very convenient for my family and I.

We're currently staying here and aren't impressed. Firstly the hotel didn't have any king bed rooms, so our 3000$ romantic getaway to New York consists of 2 separate beds. The peep hole is broken and stuffed with a piece of toilet paper to block people from looking in. Only on the second day did we find out you could have a coffee machine in your room, but there's no fridge or microwave. Average hotel, expensive, and the staff isn't very helpful. The only thing going for it is the location, but I probably wouldn't stay in this location again. We were aware you also have to pay a 32$ fee each day for a "resort" fee. Not exactly sure what part of this hotel is a resort... they say it's to use the gym, but we didn't bring gym clothes and gyms are standard in all the hotels I stay in across the world. Not impressed.
