I put my wife and her friends in this hotel as I had stayed before. The hotel itself is ok. But when they got to checkout there was a 'facilities fee' charge of $124. This was not disclosed at check in or at time of booking through hotels.com. When we queried it with the hotel they say its for gym, facilities etc. but it is MANDATORY. Even if you don;t use the services. I spoke to the manager who basically offered no assistance other than to tell me its there in writing in the really small print! Don't stay here - there are so many other hotels in new york that don;t charge this ridiculous facilities fee
user_name:
Aidan S
Phu Quoc Island, Vietnam

review_body: Although it was pricey we thought this hotel was worth their rate. The location was perfect for Rockefeller Plaza, Time Square, plays and Central Park. The room was spacious for NY and had been recently updated. I would choose this hotel again.

I travel to NYC 2x a year and this has become my go-to hotel with an ideal location for my business needs. I love its versatile lounge area, coffee shop, help getting cabs and comfortable beds. However, this time I was given a room that felt shabby in many ways. My “view” was dark air shaft with a simple opaque window shade-no sheers to admit ambient daylight (but it was always pretty dark outside in that shaft anyway).Then, I drew a hot bathtub full of water in a hue that can only be described as yellow/brown. Made me think I shouldn’t even brush my teeth there, much less take a drink of water. Bathroom wallpaper is textured weave and exhibited many small spatter marks (floss flicks?) When at checkout I informed the desk of the “yellow water” concern, no empathy or concern was demonstrated. This experience has me thinking there are better options out there! At least better than room 325!

Stayed four nights at the Park Central Hotel. I appreciate that if you are after a hotel in a convenient location in mid-town, then the pricing is not bad. But what a price to pay. The good points: good location, it is clean, and the room cleaning staff were an absolute delight - simply lovely. That's about it on the plus side. On the negative side: the rooms are small and cramped, and the lighting is woefully inadequate - in particular the desk area where you can work is almost in complete darkness. They do not even provide shower caps, which I would have thought was standard. The plug in the bath did not work properly, but at least they provided two flannels, one of which could be used to bung it up. The lifts are very slow and do not have enough capacity, leading to long waiting times. I usually bond with the reception staff, but there was none of that here - very much lacking in any charm. Then there is piped music everywhere - you cannot get away from it. When I came to check out there was a very long queue and one person on the desk when there is provision for three. I actually thought of calling the hotel on my mobile to see if they could put more staff on to hurry things up. This hotel left me feeling cold, and despite having meetings after I checked out, I preferred to carry my luggage around Manhattan rather than having to face going back to the hotel. Bottom line, this hotel is about as short on charm as it is possible to be.

Hotel was very nice, very friendly employee's. Very Clean. The Valet advised me that there was a "pre-paid" overnight parking fee for $65.00 that could be done online, instead of the $75 i had to pay....I just didn't see it !!. Location was great, about a 3-4 minute cab ride to Time Square. We were on the 4th floor, so didn't see a view of the city. I would stay there again

Stayed here for 3 nights; what made this hotel was that it was priced on the lower side - compared to all the other hotels in the region. The room was a standard tight size for NYC; not much lighting in the room. The bathroom was extremely tight - I love having a little bathroom space.In general I'd recommend this hotel if the price point is sweet, the front desk staff was very helpful. The location is fantastic between Central Park & Time Square - you can't beat that. Lots of great eats around. They do provide high end products in the wahsroom which was a nice treat.

If you want to be in the heart of Manhattan, this is a great place to stay - minutes from Central Park, Times Square, Museum of Modern Ser, etc.The only problem is the hotel itself.The room were terriblly cramped - our room featured two queen beds, but the room was so narrow, you could barely squeeze past the wall-mounted TV to get to the second bed!Also: the lighting in the room was terrible - no light in the closet and no reading lamp; the elevator capacity was poor, creating waits both up and down; the concierge had little knowledge of nearby restaurants.The valet parking at $65 per night was a plus and not overpriced compared to local garages.I would take a look at other hotels in this area before returning to the Park Central.

We stayed here for seven nights and it was brilliant check in was fast and easy no issue using the lifts at any time all the staff here were helpful and friendly. We asked for a fridge and kettle when we checked in and within 30 minutes it was in the room we asked for a late checkout and they extended it to 1pm free of charge. The room was clean comfortable and everything we needed and every day we had fresh laundry and the ladies cleaning were really helpful and friendly. The location was perfect within a few minutes walk of Central Park, Times Square and Fifth Avenue would definitely stay here again. The only negatives were the lady working the coffee shop was awful customer service is not her strong point and Thomas cook didn’t tell us about the resort fees payable at the end of our stay.

Vito, whose picture I included in my review, greeted me. I explained the situation but he said he couldn’t find my name. I explained both names and he said that the reservation under my name had been changed to my business partner’s name. So the only person who could check in was my business partner. I was incredulous but remained calm. Vito picked up on my incredulousness and told me if I didn’t like it I should look elsewhere. I told him I had prepaid through Priceline (a mistake at this hotel) and he muttered something under his breath that I took to be profane. He left to go get a manager Five minutes or more later he came back and said the manager said to change the name on the other reservation. Wow, you’d think Vito could figure that out. The manager was never to be seen. Vito was rude — and I go to NYC at least twice a quarter — even by New Yorker standards. I would not go to this hotel Again. Vito needs personality lessons and is a poor reflection of the Park Central brand.

The majority of the staff wasn’t helpful. Nobody went out of their way to help us. Our room was late being ready upon check in, they refuse even one hour late checkout and aren’t friendly. It was a great location though, and the lobby was warm and inviting. I’ll check out another hotel next trip though.

We reserved a standard Deluxe but were upgraded to deluxe w windows. Delightful. Thank you, Emanuel! Hotel staff was gracious and very accommodating. Our room got too warm at night. They immediately sent someone up to allow us to open window and also sent a fan to our room. Very Nice room, bath updated, lobby great, location superb, wonderful staff.

Once again, the Park Central has proved to be a reliable and delightful hotel property. The location is perfect. Close to everything in Midtown. We walked to Times Square, Theaters, Central Park and 5th Avenue. The helpful door men got us taxis quickly when we needed to explore other parts of the city. Rooms were comfortable and clean. And traveling with my daughter, it was important to feel safe. And we felt very safe. This is my 3rd stay at this property. If I am lucky enough to return, I will stay here again.

We needed to spend several days preparing (rehearsing) for a Concert at Carnegie Hall (diagonally across the street from the Park Central). The location and service couldn't have been better from the moment we arrived to our departure day. New York has many fine hotels and the Park Central has earned a position as one of the finer establishments we've used.

Stayed at hotel previously and decided to return. It has been renovated since our last stay. Rooms are very nice. Elevator was broken and we had some wait times getting to our rooms. It was fix by the second night. Took a little long to get room cleaned so we could check in. Channel changer for TV was broken Little disappointed but recommend it.

So grateful to get through the horrendous wildfires here and then learn my wife’s brother is diagnosed with cancer and needs surgery in early December. Wanted to fly out (from Santa Rosa, CA) to be there for him. Confirmed the date and booked 3 nights at Park Central Hotel in Manhattan through Booking.com (a division of Priceline). This was in the 3rd week of November. The following day, got a call that surgery is moved to end of December. Called Park Central Hotel that evening (within 24 hours) to cancel and was told I had to cancel through Booking.com since they made the reservation. Went to Booking.com and clicked cancel and a popup appeared that read – Park Central charges a fee for cancellation, do you wish us to contact them on your behalf to request a waiver? OK, I thought - nice idea and I appreciate that. I clicked yes and got another popup that read they would contact the hotel and respond to me in 48 hours.Two days later received a matter of fact email that Park Central Hotel refused to change their policy and I would be charged in excess of $1,300.00 for the cancelled reservation. This is an outrageous abuse and the very worst online situation I have ever experienced. To add insult to injury, I received an email on Black Friday from Booking.com that I could book rooms at Park Central Hotel for 50% off. Please avoid these callous, impersonal, greedy businesses, they are not worthy of your time or money!

Nice welcome, fully renovated accommodations, very nice new decor all over, staff friendly and helpful. Best of all is its location! Quiet room and we had a Pink Floyd view: The wall. Really the only complain was that one of the elevators broke during our stay..

This is what I was told when I checked in. The front desk agent who’s name I believe was Vito(?) when he told me that my room that I reserved and paid for - the premier king was given away and that I was being given a room with two queen beds. No apology, no attempt at recovery - nothing. When I asked questions about options he was short and very unwelcoming. He basically told me that was my only option and the only room left as they were sold out. At one point I asked to see a manager and he pointed to his left and said oh you have to walk over there. I asked 3 times for him to have the manager assist as he was being unprofessional, unhelpful and downright rude. When I asked the front desk agent next to him to get the manager he told me that our conversation was over and marched over to where the manager was and was speaking to her about me in a raised voice and was not saying pleasant things. It was beyond unprofessional. When I met with the manager (Elizabeth?) she apologized and funny enough found the exact room I reserved in less than 2 minutes. Unbelievable. There was also 0 check back on my stay or follow up based on how uncomfortable the check in was. The room is okay, while renovated in the last few years they left the old heaters which just blow air which is either hot or cold depending on season. If the room is too hot and it is winter you have no option for cooling it down. The walls are paper thin as I heard my neighbors alarm clock go off each morning. Dream Midtown around the corner is a much better and much more hospitable way to spend your money.

I stayed here over the summer with my sibling and the stay was okay. I read reviews about the elevators but that wasn't a problem for us, the wait was pretty fast and we only had problems with the long line once. Room wise, it was comfortable but one of my biggest issue was with the AC. The room was so stuffy and humid that I woke up multiple times in the night, that was my biggest issue. It go to the point where it was uncomfortable, the air blew upwards and not towards us so there was little to no relief. Otherwise the stay was great, location wise Central Park is just blocks away, same with time square and the subway entrance around the corner.

I’ve stayed at Park Central for many years when I️ travel to nYC. It’s centrally located and close to the park and subways. The upgrade on the hotel has been a nice addition. It’s across the street from Carnegie hall allowing us to go to late performances. Many good eateries closeby.

We were not given an option about bed types, and were assigned to a room with two double beds. There was no comfortable chair, refrigerator or coffee maker in the room. The lighting was poor (one lamp on the night table) and the bathroom was small. Pictures on wall were scary looking and in poor taste. The added $30 per night resort fee was a ripoff! Location is good, and staff were helpful. We have traveled to NYC many times, and would not stay at this hotel again.

Very nice hotel with friendly staff and tidy rooms, as well as an ideal location Unfortunately our room wasn't ready by the time we were told. Not exactly what you need after travelling all day and want the welcome comfort of a shower and outfit change.

NYC hotels are expensive and the Park Central Hotel is one of them. The location is excellent though and if you are keen to walk around the city and explore, this is your stay. The staff at the reception are quite unpleasant and I would say rude. At the arrival we were welcomed by unhappy and snappy receptionist who couldn't bother to answer to our questions in a more polite way. The room was ok. We booked the larger size room which was spacious enough and clean. The bathroom was a good size also. There is no option for the breakfast but next door from the hotel there is Starbucks and a bagel place which are nice options for the take away breakfast that you can enjoy in bed while watching Good Morning America.

The Park Central puts you within walking distance of many New York happenings. It is clean, quiet and friendly. You might have a long wait for the elevators, but the rooms and staff make that seem like a small inconvenience. Be sure to stop for a relaxing drink in the bar area...comfy and friendly!

This is a nice hotel just at the base of Time Square. Within easy walking distance of all the hustle and bustle of Times Square and the busy neon lights. Just a block of two from all the Broadway shows and the Theater District. Carnegie Hall is right across the street and the central entrance to Central Park is just two blocks up the street. (Hence the name I guess). Rockefeller Center, Macy's and all the other fancy stores are really not that far away if you do not mind a short walk. Really the only way to see the city is to adventure a little on foot.The room were neat and clean with all currant amenities. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rates were well within the range of any hotel of the same quality. I would have no hesitation in recommending this to anyone traveling there. The only negative comment and I am sure all places have at least on negative thing is that the carpet on our floor (being the 3rd floor) probably should be replaces soon. It is nearing the end of its life span in my opinion. Otherwise a great place to stay if you like the night life of Times Square.

Lovely lobby design, friendly, courteous staff. 1 Block to Central Park, close to subways.Rooms very clean, modern. Beds are fine. Safe in room.Rooms have NO bathroom exhaust fans, a basic for an upscale hotel! You can "turn down heat", but very ineffective, so it stays 73-74 at nite, uncomfortable for us to sleep. Maintenance man came quickly to our room to explain the heat situation.Very dark in rooms, inadequate lighting- we were unable to see into suitcases, so it was necessary to take into BR. No refrigerator, no Coffee pot (but you may request one)No Breakfasts; a small shop has coffee, donuts at 3x the prices of those all around streets.We stayed here 5 nites but would Not stay here again, as the Prices are $300+ per nite with these annoying issues. It appears lovely but cheaply done in rooms. Much loud street noise- horns, trucks, sirens. If you stay here- go up high!

The Park Central has a great location, right in the heart of Midtown. The rooms have been renovated but upkeep could be better as paint was peeling and carpet was ripped in corners. This hotel is missing some amentias such as bellhops and doormen which would have been nice when it was cold and we had tons of luggage. Also, please be aware that they charge a "resort fee" that other hotels in the area do not charge.

I have been here for 5 days and I found a good hotel, quality rooms, clean, new and big.Hotel is very well located between Central Park and Times Square, close to subway, it is in a strategic position to reach many touristic places such as MoMA, Empire, Rockfeller, Metropolitan, 5th Ave etc.Value for money well balanced, so I definetely suggest this hotel.

We visited New York for the first time and we had to do all the standard things that you do when you visit NY for the first time. This hotel helped a lot! The hotel is on a very good location in Manhattan with every important site nearby. Central park, 5th av and the metrostop that brings you almost everywhere, all on walking distance. The room was also nice and clean and the bed was very comfortable, handy for have a good night rest after busy days!

The facilities fee was an ASTONISHING rip-off. Charging $40 plus tax per night basically to be able to store luggage for a few hours (other facilities included printing which no-one needs anymore and using the gym which I didn't want and I have never before been mandatory charged for before). So effectively I was paid $130 to store luggage!!! Even hostels can do that for free! Perhaps this is normal practice in NYC but I certainly wouldn't recommend it based on that. Everything else about the place itself was average. Location was great - walking distance from Times Square, Central Park and lots of subway stations.

Stayed at this hotel for the first time and was impressed with the check in process and the staff at the Coffee Shop. Very helpful and pleasant. Room was very nice and convenient to the theater district and Central Park.

It is a big hotel in a very good location of the Big Apple, a walking distance of everything.. the bedrooms are comfortable and very clean, the bathroom is clean and the shower is great.I didn’t give 5 stars because of the staff, it must be difficult to deal with so many guests, I totally understand, but they could find a better solution than being impatient with people in the check in, after hours of flight and traffic If you find a real good deal, stay there!!!

After comparing prices, facilities, locations etc, I decided to reserve 2 rooms at this hotel. Accordingly I submitted my credit card info, only to discover on the reservation confirmation email that I have to pay an additional amount of about USD 33 per night per room as ‘facility charge’ when I check out!This is outrageous!! Why didn’t they mention this additional cost upfront, why did they inform about it only when a non refundable pre-paid reservation had already been made? It is one kind of cheating, isn’t it??

Great hotel, great location, have stayed each year for the past 3 years and I will go back. Only have two, very small, elevators so be prepared to wait. Staff were friendly and responsive, especially the cleaning staff, wonderful service. Drawer in room would fall out when I tried to open it, happened to see engineer in hallway and mentioned it, he fixed it right away, also bathroom light was flickering. Very helpful. Called front desk 1 month prior to arrival to let them know we would be a late arrival and needed hypoallergenic bedding on one bed. They had the note about late arrival but not about the bedding. Waited until 1:00 a.m. for my bedding to arrive. I do understand they are short-staffed at that hour. Everything in bathroom worked find but wallpaper seems old and just outdated. But, overall, a very good experience each year and I will go back next year.

We stayed from November 8-12, combining a conference with pleasure. The hotel is just a few blocks from Central Park. There are subway stations within a block to take you anywhere you want to go. It's also a short walk to the theater district and Times Square. I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room and the king bed was very comfortable. The room was clean and in great condition. Inside our room, we heard no noise coming from adjacent rooms or above us. Soon after getting to our room, I called guest services to ask for an extra blanket. It was delivered within 15 minutes. Then I got a call back from guest services to make sure I'd received it. Nice touch. The concierge was very friendly and helpful with suggestions for the subway and places to eat. We loved our stay!

This is my 12th trip to NYC and my 4th stay at the Park Central. I love the location and used to find that it offered a good balance of price and quality. Until they introduced their "resort" charge. The "resort" charge covers the gym, luggage storage and other things provided at hotels as part of the room charge. Simply put it is the Park Central's way of offering a low rate when you search for hotels and then adding the balance afterwards.On top of that the quality has dropped as noted by others the concierge service was pretty substandard and their is no food service in the hotel. It didn't add to the experience to have a drunk passed out by the now defunct elevator bank close to our room.Park Central is not the only place to implement this resort charge strategy but it is dishonest - the surest way to prevent these charges proliferating is to boycott them.

In September I spoke to concierge she was so very helpful. I wish I can remember her name. Well any how when I checked in Carol was the front desk receptionist she was so rude and called me slow, after yelling at me i asked for map. Carol said I am not the concierge do I look like I am. I am front desk ALL i do is check you in. you get over on that side for your map. I later on spoke to a Robyn the concierge she was asking for cash for tickets because her company #cityexperts had outrageous fees. She said if I give her cash she will buy it herself and she was asking for $20 fee. For fees . I went to the box office later after. The concierge the next day was nice but very slow. All around I loved the hotel great location and nice snacks at the cafe. Great lounge but horrible staff you may want to reevaluate who you hire.

The hotel is in an excellent location! Walking distance to Times Square and even further to Central Park. Staff are very friendly and always willing to help answer any questions. Please note that there is no refrigerator in the room and instead of a closet there is a room with one shelf where the safe is also located. There is no dining room at the hotel but a paid restaurant and a salads bar serving as a breakfast buffet for guests. The bathroom and shower are large and comfortable and the shower has constant water power and can not be adjusted. The hotel offers taxi services that work with them to the airport.

Stayed here for 2 nights after being spoiled at a nearby hotel and wow it was considerably less impressive. From the attitude at checkin - luggage checkin to the no sleep for 2 nights. Paper thin windows, walls and doors. We heard jack hammering all night and the second night we were awoke by the group of French speaking guests next door at 4:00am till they finally went quiet at 8:00am ugh .Seriously they need ear plugs and masks for all guests.

Wonderful location on 7th Avenue - close to Time Square, right by Central Park, one block from subway. Room looks very nice - upon closer look you realize the paint is a little chipped, etc. The bathroom was very clean, nice decor, but small. Overall I would stay again.

I stayed there for one night after running the NYC Marathon recently. It was the Tuesday morning and we were due to check out and I fell ill. I was bed ridden and was in no real state to move. The hotel were very good to us and without any question allowed us to extend our check out twice. With two young children this was a god send as otherwise it would have been a very long day. We had to leave eventually to make it to the airport for our short flight back to Montreal (which was awful). The hotel in general was very tidy and in a great location. The staff very obviously very understanding and it was really appreciated. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and especially families as you never know when you may need that sort of understanding.

Hotel was clean and nice. Hotel was a bit worn in (rooms had wall paper peeling in spots). But overall the hotel was clean including rooms. The only complaint I have is their two tiny elevators; they only had two accessible and both days were working on one or the other during the morning rush.

Loved this hotel. Never stayed here before but found a great rate on-line. When checking in, we asked for a quiet room, where would wouldn't hear people coming and going from the elevator, or hear the ding from it. The woman checking us in, took a few minutes but then gave us the key. The room was an inside room with no view, but it was the perfect location and just what we wanted. Thank you so much for really listening to my needs! The young lady in the gift shop was as sweet as could be and so personable. Everyone we encountered was wonderful. The room was clean, everything worked properly, and I highly recommend!

We stayed here October 28-30, 2017 for work. You could smell weed as you come off the elevator on the 7th floor! Our room was hazy and smelled like weed at 9:00 pm at night when we came in from being out working a photo shoot. Called the front desk and they brought us a fan. Called security after midnight about the smell and music from next door. It quietened for about 1 hour and then it was back on. The next door folks were throwing things at our connecting door. We called security again at 4:00 am. Security came up and requested "back up". We called security a 3rd time at 4:45 am because the next door party people were out in the hall and we couldn't leave. No one came to escort us down to the lobby. I reported all this to the front desk as we were leaving and if we hadn't been leaving I would have checked out! If I had known security didn't care about our safety I would have called 911. The NYPD would have definitely done something about the weed/drug/music/club! The manager, Lilly, acted Ike she didn't know we had called security 3 times! The girl at the front desk had an attitude and said "we followed protocol". Lilly, the manager, would credit the night when all this happened. I didn't ask for a complete credit for the stay just the night we were made to listen and stay next to a drug den. Lilly gave me a $62.00 facility fee credit and a $100.00 credit for inconvenience. Not enough!! This is reportedly a very nice hotel with 3 decades of service experience. And to top it off - it is a Non-Smoking hotel! What a joke! Don't EVER stay at Park Central. Your life is in danger. They allow anything and everything to go on. I want a credit for the 2nd night!! Next I'm calling the Hotel Director and the BBB. I can't say enough about how awful, terrible, horrible the staff and security are at this hotel.

We stayed for 4 nights in November 2017. Hotel was clean and smart. Room was clean, a good size with a very large and comfortable bed. Brits beware though, there is no kettle in the room so you’ll have to go down to the lobby shop to get your tea and coffee. The hotel bar was reasonably priced and John the bar man was very friendly and helpful. I recommend the Brooklyn Lager. In all it was a very pleasant stay.However, you will be charged a $31 plus $2.75 tax per night “Facilities” fee. Apparently there is a gym/fitness centre on site and you will be charged for its use, even if you never use it or have any intention of using it, like us. This seems like a sneaky way to squeeze extra money out of the guests. A fairer way would be to ask if guests wished to use these “Facilities” on check in or at the point of booking and only charge those who want to use them. This did not detract from out enjoyment of our stay but I do think it is a little money-grabbing. Save for this point it would be 5*s

Hotel was ok. It was clean but quit dated. Disappointed it didn’t offer shuttle to the airport but on the upside they did have parking. Bar didn’t open until 5 but David the doorman was fantastic. Good location in the middle of everything

I returned to this hotel last weekend, having had a lovely experience here in January 2016. We arrived on Friday evening, following a 77 degree day in November. When we reached our room, which we had booked over a month in advance, it was approximately 78 degrees inside the room. While there is both a thermostat and a fan unit of some sort in the room itself, nothing we attempted caused a change to the room temperature. When we went to the front desk to inquire about the in-room air conditioning, which is an advertised amenity on the hotel website, the clerk behind the desk advised that it was 62 degrees outside and "it would be stupid to be running the air conditioner." Her appalling lack of customer service and inappropriate conduct aside, it doesn't take a great deal of wisdom to determine that the outside temperature does not necessarily dictate the temperature of an interior room, on the fourth floor of a large hotel. I made several phone calls attempting to reach a manager both that evening and the following evening, was told each time that a manager would get back to me shortly and I never received such a call. What was ultimately "explained" was that, despite their advertisement to the contrary, the hotel runs on one, old pipe, so, it's either air conditioning or heat or nothing at all for everyone in the building at the same time with no variation or individual room control. We were offered another room; however, given that there was no air circulating anywhere in the hotel, the room change made absolutely no difference. At more than $400.00 per night, this was an absolutely unacceptable experience and we will never be back.

I have stayed at this hotel many times in the last 20 years, even when it was till called Omni Park Central. It's well located, the staff is friendly and the price is fairly reasonable for NYC. The rooms are old, the bathrooms too but when I am in NYC I spend very little time in my hotel room, the beds are very comfortable, the most important, really. I recommend the Park Central.

Great central location. Walking distance to shopping, Times Square, Central Park and metro stations to get you elsewhere. Great hotel at a great price. I can highly recommend. Helpful friendly staff and beautiful spacious room
user_name:
Rachaelqueenmummy
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Have stayed here many times, and it is a favorit hotel in NY. The location is great. The rooms are very good, with comfy beds and good storage room. Bathroom is clean and big. The staff is very helpfull and polite. Very nice bar with great bar staff. The only thing I have to question is why they do not have more staff at the storage room on check out time. The hotel has no restaurant, but you can buy food and beverage including beer and wine in the lobby store. But there are hundreds of restaurants and stores within 5 min walk.

The hotel has been refurbished but is quite old and you hear everything from the room next door as if your neighbors were sharing your room. No decent breakfast available. Very good situation but You don’t get value for your money.

Check in was quick and easy, especially as we had read on the hotel website about fees due at check in so were prepared for these. The lifts are small but there was never a time when we had to wait. The hotel is really well situated for getting out and around New York city. Just a five minute walk to Times Square and with a subway station just around the corner, the rest of New York is easily accessible. Would highly recommend.

We have stayed here several times. The location is great, short walk to Central Park, Carnigie Hall, close to Time Square, FIfth Avenue and a subway just outside the hotel. A lot of good restaurants and bars close. Rooms has a normal size. Befare we have had to wait for the elevators but this time they seemed to have solved this problem. The bar in the hotel is a nice spot to relax and enjoy a glas of wine or a drink.

You can't beat the location next to Central Park, close to Times Square, etc. Rooms were nice and rate was very fair for the area. Has a very nice bar with great bartenders.The negatives are the service at the front desk. It was spotty. Some attendants were great, others need to consider another industry. Another negative is we left something in our room. I called the lost and found extension 4 times and two weeks later still have not received a call back. I called customer service and they supposedly checked with the security department within the couple minutes of being on the phone with me and found nothing. I don't believe anyone ever checked with housekeeping. I believe I was just being told something quickly to get me off the phone. Still no call back from the security manager who handles lost and found.

What’s not to like. Fab location. Out the front door turn left and 1 block 3 min walk to Central Park. Turn right and 10 mins to Times Square. Subway station on corner. No restaurant but that didn’t bother me. Corner room with stunning views. Loads of cracking diners and pubs within walking distance. Spotlessly clean. Really friendly concierge and front of house. Make sure you ask for a fridge and kettle. I was hear in 2013 for a couple of landmark birthdays and it just as good if not better.

I stayed at the hotel with my son as an early celebration for his 16th birthday! We had planned our trip to New York and chose this hotel due to its location. After reading mixed reviews I was a little worried, however I need not have!! From the moment we arrived at check-in we were greeted very well and the lady acknowledged that we had booked through a travel agent in the UK and confirmed we had the room we had requested and explained the resort fee, even though we had been made aware of this. We had a lovely experience at the hotel, staff were friendly and if I had a question I was always greeted in a friendly manner by the ladies on reception and Guest Relations. Our room was clean and quiet even though it was on the 5th floor! I look forward to returning to New York again in the future and this hotel would always be my first choice.

2nd time in New York, thought I'd stay a bit closer to the action and wasn't disappointed with this hotel! Fantastic location, large, clean room with very comfy beds. If like me you want a cuppa in the morning, ask at the desk when checking in and they will send a coffee maker for your room. We were on the 17th floor and had great nights sleep. Again, the location is perfect, direct subway from Jamaica street station, ideal!

The Hotel is very well located, good room, good bed, but not trustable. I forgot my shirt in the closet but I realized it only 3 days later, when I returned there to pick it back. How was my surprise when the Customer Service said that they hadn’t found any shirt in my room?!Very expensive hotel for this kind of service!

I've been to NYC several times, and lately I have witnessed a surge in "trendy" hotels that are expensive but the rooms ridiculously small.The Park Central is one of the older properties that have managed to stay alive and thrive. The hotel is spotless, the hotel looks and feels recently refurbished in a classy modern style. There is a subway stop on the corner which takes you downtown in mere minutes... And you're 2 blocks away from a morning jog through Central Park.My only gripe with the hotel is the loud cleaning staff.. We could here them arguing loudly every morning. It was a real nuisance.Besides that, I HIGHLY recommend staying at the Park Central.

Park Central is a great hotel. Good location. All of the staff including the doorman are helpful and friendly. The hotel is very clean and reasonably priced compared to other nice hotels. I stay there every time I visit NYC

We stayed here for a few nights on our return trip to New York, from the minute we checked in the staff could not be more helpful, we travelled with our 15 month old and we were given a great room. Rooms are modern, clean and maid service was great. Huge tv and very comfy bed. Had great breakfasts in all the local cafes. A great hotel and would highly recommend.

I chose Park Central Hotel for the location and at the end it was right!Unfortunately the room was not so good as much as expected from an hotel like Park Central!!!!Very small bathroom for a single... try to image for a couple! Old shower, no light switch near the bed.... Ok that I need a good bed to sleep, and it was good, but after a day in New York it would be nice to be back in a full confortable room!

Park Central Hotel went above and beyond in how they treat their guests. I was overly impressed that whenever I needed something, they truly were at my service. Made life a lot easier when I was in NYC for business and needed to have certain amenities and services. I stayed 6 nights and at first didn’t have a mini fridge. I asked and they delivered. I also had a very important package delivered - my wedding dress - and it was well taken care of and I didn’t have to worry. I lived close by when I lived in NYC a few years back. The area is perfect and easy to get to all the transit options. Being so close to Central Park and Columbus Circle are a plus and not far at all away from Times Square but far away enough from the craziness. I was upgraded and my room had a nice view from the 14th floor. The room was large for any standard let alone New York. The room and bathroom were stylish. The hotel did a nice renovation. The bed was huge, King size, and plush. Wonderful to sleep and felt rested. The area wasn’t very loud at all. The staff is great, absolutely professional and friendly. I really loved my experience and would highly recommend. Only a couple of inconveniences: no restaurant on property. There is a cool lounge for drinks though. They also do not offer room service. These are not that much of a problem when there are many options close by. There are great convenient stores/delis next door if you want a less expensive option for wine, breakfast or lunch. I look forward to staying at Park Central again in the future.

It‘s generally an ok place. However as a guest you are treated like numbers. I feel like being at an Airport Security Check. Elsewise things were ok. I did not check the facilities. However they charge for it.

The location of this hotel is ideal, near theatres, subway stations, Central Park. I won't complain about the high room prices because they are average for upper mid-town Manhattan. The reception, concierge and cleaning staff were courteous and helpful and our room was larger than we were expecting, with a fantastic view of the skyscrapers on 7th Avenue. The room was a bit dark but all other aspects were fine. We didn't book breakfast and instead tried several of the cafes and delis within easy walking distance.

Bonita Morales was wonderful. She helped us a lot since we were not familiar with New York City. She was there for us and very patient. The Hotel was beautiful and would stay there again when we come back to New York. Thank you, Bob & Julia

I recently stayed at this hotel for the first time and really loved it. Being a runner, it is the perfect location for joggers in that it is only a few blocks away from beautiful Central Park. There is also a subway station close by. My room was very spacious and quite comfortable. For New York standards, the hotel rates are great. The staff are very warm and friendly. I plan to come back here again and I have already recommended this hotel to friends and colleagues.

Our stay at the Park Central was very pleasant and we would stay there again. Staff were very nice and helpful, it was clean and the location was perfect for getting around the city. A lobby restaurant would be nice, but you have many choices just by going out the front door. Plus the little market in the lobby is great for picking up a quick snack or a cup of coffee. We were surprised at the size of our room as we had expected something very small. Park Central is a good value and we recommend it.

We have been staying at The Park Central for more than fifteen years and have never been disappointed. In that time it has been updated and refurbished more than once and is always presenting it best face. It is a grand old New York Hotel which still holds the charm and echoes of an earlier, and in many ways, more distinctive day. And yet is has all of the desirable modern appointments. Its location in midtown, just above the Times Square area, is ideal for very many reasons. We use the valet parking and it is quick and easy both arriving and leaving. There are ample places to get food and many rooms look out at Carnegie Hall. One could imagine oneself back in the glory days of the 1920's. We never stay anywhere else, for we find no reason to be enough to venture elsewhere.

We choose this area to be near the park and it was a short 3 blocks away. The hotel is extremely clean and our room was large. There are only two elevators and in the evening can be a little challenging to get on one. I personally thought they understaffed the front desk there were always long lines. If I had any complaints about the hotel it would be they have no restaurant. It is a busy part of the city over there but you are about as centrally located to everything as you could be. We really enjoyed our stay here

Was pleased with the Park Central Hotel. The hotel lobby smelled really nice and the rooms were clean and a decent size. Was very close to Central Park and close to Times Square as well as good restaurants.The hotel didn’t have much to offer except a small bar, but that was ok because we were exploring NY. I think the resort fee for $31 plus tax per day is a bit much since they have nothing to offer. Other than that I was happy with my hotel choice and would stay there again and would recommend to friends.

Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights for our honeymoon visit to NYC. The location is great, a couple of blocks to Central Park, close to Times Square and Rockefeller and directly on the subway for easy access to Financial District. You expect to pay a lot of money in NYC and generally speaking the hotel was good but there are a few small touches they could do to make it better value for money. Bigger towels, coffee facilities in the room without having to ask, cleaning staff not standing chatting outside the room early in the morning are a few examples of things that could change. The reception and check in process was totally disorganised and make sure you check your bill before paying anything, they tried to put extra breakfast payments on our room. All in all I would stay here again though as the rooms were clean and comfortable and location made it.

Alyssa and Jacob were great during my check in. Definitely worked with me to make sure my night was fantastic. Got free drink vouchers for my birthday! Bar had great drinks. Try to get a corner room. The view is absolutely gorgeous.

This is an excellent facility. It is located near Central Park, Broadway and shopping. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. We found the staff was not very knowledgeable about nearby stores, etc. A drawback was the lack of a mini fridge.

The Park Central Hotel is Beautiful, immaculate and the staff are friendly and courteous ! The location of hotel is perfectly located in the middle of every wonderful sight imaginable. I will definitely be back again.

Just checked in last night at the low floor of the hotel , is was extremely Noisy !!Trucks sounds non stop from 6am !! And shower water pressure low .Other than that is fine, room and location is good.

Just spent 3 nights at this hotel. I'll start out by saying it was a good location... it is close to Cental Park, Times Square and the financial district (I was there for work).The rooms are pretty standard for NY, small and renovated modern decor. Typical for an older hotel, the air conditioning/heater was very loud and kept me awake at night. Room was freezing when I arrived and no extra blankets in the room.Walls are thin... luckily I was at the end of the hall and nobody beside me but I could easily hear the room across the hall.There were several things that I assumed would be available that were not. Now it's on me to check but I travel a fair bit and usually these things are.There is a bar but no restaurant in the hotel. This means no in room dining! I'm a social person but sometimes I like the option or eating alone, in my room. There is no mini bar in the room, no bottled water, no coffee machine. Because the location is good, there are places near by where you can buy super expensive water, drinks and take away for your room (Starbucks on corner). After having travelled, the very least I expect is a bottle of room temperature water!I bought a bottle of wine to enjoy in my room one evening. There was a tiny ice bucket but no cork screw... I called the front desk to have one brought up to my room and was told because there was no in room dining, there was no cork screws! But the bar would open my wine if I took it to them. The bartender happily did so but it was an inconvenience.The first day I arrived there was no bath matt, the final day of my stay there was no hot water so I was forced to take a cold shower!Seeing that what I consider the basics are missing and the hotel is still pretty expensive, I wouldn't stay here again.

We stayed here for 3 nights in early October. It was close to everything, Central Park, restaurants , a mall,and we walked to two different plays on Broadway. The concierge was helpful in leading us to great food at 2 close by restaurants and to several sights to see. Could use a mini bar in room. Should we return we will definitely stay here again.

Hotel is located within a few minutes of central park and times square. Hotel is nice (2nd time I've been here) but parts of the room were falling apart. One of the electrical outlets in the bathroom didn't work, the shelving that held the shampoo etc fell off. We had a nice view out the window to times square area. Now, the staff.... They could have been replaced with a computer because they weren't helpful at all. They seemed like they were miserable and didn't want to be there. We asked concierge for directions to the 9/11 memorial and she almost sighed and slammed the map down on the table. She was terrible (wish I remembered her name) and she gave us wrong directions. When we went to ask the front desk how much it would be to stay an extra night (we should have just looked for another hotel but didn't want to move all of our stuff) as we wanted to extend our honeymoon and they told us to look for prices online and were of no help. So we called another hotel (the NYLO) and they kindly found a room for us for a very great price. Having been my second visit, I won't be returning. There are better hotels out there so look around first before you book here.

Our room was very nice , a little expencive but thats New York City, Had a great time ,we went for 1 1/2 hr. ride in a 3 wheel bike with a great tour guide and driver , his name was Mike a super nice guy with great knowledge of the city and park . We taraveled all around Central Park ,seen all the sites , listened to some great tunes on his radio and just had a fantastic time . Its was a bit expensive I thought at first but after i would never have been able to see all the things we did and learn so much in such a short period of time. The Hotel is central to just about anywhere, the Subways are right there ,its a block from Time Square and the staff was great and very helpful .

I travel a lot. Stay in a lot of hotels. I picked this one on my most recent visit (40th wedding anniversary) simply because of the location. Hotel is just a short walk to Central Park or Times Square and there are great restaurants close by. That said there is something missing. My wife and I arrived at 7am due to red eye flight and room not ready which is totally understandable. But waiting until 3 pm for a room? I mean, no one checked out before then so that I could get a room? NY is a great place but not when one is dead tired from an overnight flight. I had called ahead to alert them of the special occasion and I wanted it to be nice but this was not a good start. Finally got a room because I kept insisting at the front desk. the room I did get looked out to other rooms so I could see other people in their rooms and forcing us to keep shades closed. I am not used to dark rooms. we were given vouchers for breakfast at their store which provided us with our choice of 2 breads, 2 fruit, and one coffee. ONE COFFEE for 2 people? Really? On top of that, one elevator broke down and stayed that way for the entire visit. there are only 2 elevators for this hotel so you can imagine the wait to get up or down when there is only one elevator with a hotel of this size. Would I come back? The answer is obvious. Did I enjoy NY for 40th anniversary? Absolutely! Greatest city in the world. Go see "Beautiful"-Carol King. Wonderful show.

Great location for a visit of the different entertainment of the city. Very heavy traffic and line for registration can get confusing (unorganized), otherwise, okay some other times. First room assigned had a strong mildewish smell that gave me a headache and nausea. Was lucky to be assigned to another room in a quick manner. Don't know about New York 'high end' hotels but most this type has fridge and coffee makers already in the room; we had to asked for them especially staying for 4 nights. Rooms were small and 'crampy' and could use some more lighting. Otherwise, some (not all)staff are very friendly and professional.

The hotel was lovely. Our staff was made more pleasant by the wonderful staff. Everyone from the front desk to the concierge serve was the most helpful and kind. The room was clean. When we first checked in our room was quite noisy, but the front desk gave us another room the next day. My husband and I would definitely stay there again.The hotel was within walking distance to most of the tourist sites. The only negative thing that I would have to say is that we were not happy with the $30 a day fee for internet, spa, and services that really should be complementary. There was no coffee maker or refrigerator in room. But overall the stay at Park Central was very pleasant.Thank you to the staff.

We stayed at the Park Central on the evening before our cruise left the New York Cruise Terminal. Our first experience after dropping off our luggage with the bellman was while waiting for the restroom near the luggage storage room. We were given a key pass to use this rest room; one of 3 (single occupancy) restrooms available near the elevators.... and found a line of 4 others waiting. One of the restroom doors finally opened and much to my disgust what appeared to be a prostitute and a John walked out together. Additionally while waiting for my family to check out the next morning I saw a hotel employee escort what appeared to be a shoeless drug addict out of the first floor lounge. This hotel has NO security. Though the room was not especially clean what really irritated us was that one of the two elevators to our floor was disabled as new flooring was being installed. This hotel cost us over $400. for one night and was a tremendous disappointment.

We stayed at the hotel last weekend we thought everyone in the hotel was super friendly and nice the location is great it is a great value for the city I think it does not supply robes I don't think the towels are great and there is no room service but if you can get past that it's a great Hotel

This hotel is within easy walking distance of Central Park, Times Square and other attractions. A subway entrance is steps away from the hotel entrance. Taking the subway from the hotel to Flushing for the U.S. Open is not too difficult, with only one transfer. The hotel is very nice, with sleek and attractive decor, clean and comfortable rooms, and an accommodating staff.

Stayed here on 10/7/17. Hotel is dark and dingy. We didn't get our upgrade that we requested. Rooms were small and cramped. Good luck getting to a high floor on an elevator--huge wait times.But, most significantly, when I approached the "Guest Relations" desk about my lack of upgrade, I was treated horribly by a woman who would only provide her name as "Sandy." When I expressed frustration with the lack of upgrades available, she told her colleague to cancel my room. When I asked for her name to report her to her manager, she wouldn't give her name. When I calmly approached her to speak to her further, she pretended to take a phone call and refused to speak to me. I suspect that this is not the first problematic guest interaction that "Sandy" has had since working in "Guest Relations." I will NEVER go back to this hotel. I have emailed the management twice about this situation, and they won't even respond. There are lots of great places to stay in New York. Don't waste your money here.

This hotel suited us nicely. The room was very quiet despite the hotel being pretty busy, the bed was very comfortable and the whole room was clean. We had a not-so-lovely view of the heating/cooling system on the roof, but for us that didn't make a difference. Staff was nice and check-in/check-out was super-quick. Most folks will really appreciate the location since it's a short walk North to Central Park and short walk South to Times Square. As soon as you step out of the hotel you know that you are in bustling NYC. A few subway stops are within a block of the hotel so you can get pretty much anywhere. I'll echo what others have said about the elevators in that you often have to wait quite a while, and they are smaller than more modern elevators so you may have to wait through at least one load if you aren't first in line. We were on the 3rd floor so we always took the stairs down, never the elevator--saved us a ton of time (and the stairwells are clean and just fine). If you are mobile enough to do walk the stairs, consider that option since it allows you to feel more in control of the day.

First of all location is great. Short walking distance to subway stops, restaurants, shops and Times Square/Central Park. Rooms were clean and hotel was very nice. Elevators were always busy but hey its a busy city and area so that was expected. Highly recommend staying at this hotel, you won't be disappointed.

We stayed here several nights attracted by the close proximity to Central Park ,Times Square and the subway stations.We were surprised that the main desk had no tourist information and in particular no map of Central Park.One did appear on our final day.Our room was clean.The extractor fan did not work in our bathroom.On enquiry Reception told me none of the extractor fans worked in any of the bathrooms:not impressive.The hotel does nor serve food ,even breakfast.There is a small food shop in the foyer where coffee cakes and sandwiches can be bought and there are plenty of food outlets in the street.Our room overlooked the front of the hotel and even 15-20 stories up there was noise from the street at night .I understand that this is typical of Manhattan .The hotel sports three rest rooms in total in the foyer.Once you have checked out there is quite a wait to use one. In a future visit I would consider staying off Manhattan Island and close to a subway accessing the island by public transport as the roads are so congested.

Stayed for 3 nights in a 2 double bed room. For NY it was very modern and clean and a good size compared to others I have stayed in. Staff very friendly. Bar downstairs is nice. We didn't spend much time in the hotel as you do in NY so never ate breakfast etc but excellent stay and would return again

Smooth process from check-in with friendly staff at the front desk helping me as first timer in New York! The Guest Relations Staff were very nice giving recommendation of places to see in NYC. Not to forget to mention the bar and deli were amazing! The hotel was nice, clean, luxury and beautiful view from my room. Location was excellent, has subway access in Manhattan, it's highly recommended and will stay over again in the future!

The hotel is indeed in a great location as it is close from everything. However, location is the only positive thing in this hotel. It starts with a broken mattress and the process of changing it. Then, they don't clean the rooms as any 4 stars or even 3 stars hotel. I believe they don't vacum as some breadcrumbs from previous nights still there. Also, the sheets are never changed no matter how many nights you stay ( I stayed for 4 nights). The staff is not friendly despite the long wait to ask simple question in the reception. Also, I never met the concierge as they work for short hours. Finally, It is indeed not a family freindly hotel. They only have two small elevators that hardly fit the stroller and the wait time is crazy. The rooms doesn't have fridge or kettle as you have to order everything from the hotel. Indeed am not coming back to this hotel.

Stayed here for the first time with our family and were very pleased by everything about this very well located hotel.Lovely and modern with everything you could wish for.Rooms were nice and bright and immaculate. All the staff were very helpful and the public areas were very good. We would certainly stay here again as it was just a stroll away from Central Park one way and Times Square the other.Cant fault it.

First time in the Big Apple, unfortunately, the hotel was not as wonderful as I had hoped it would be. One week. Room very basic (room only) literally, not even a complimentary cup of tea or coffee which I thought was on tap in New York. Staff were friendly enough, but not very helpful. One night we got a knock on the door asking if we wanted a kettle, to which we replied, we don't have anything to make a drink with, the man then said, do you want a cup of Tea. We said we had no tea, he then took the kettle away??? Most odd. But great trip just the same, will not stay at Park Central again, over priced and despite being very central, overrated.

Recently had a 3 night girls getaway stay at the Park Central Hotel in NYC. Not my first stay at the Park Central, I love the location and the hotel is reasonably priced, clean and has nice amenities. Very easy, safe walk to Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Museums and Theater District. Our room layout was great. A wardrobe between the beds provided some privacy. The room we stayed in was reasonably large for a NYC hotel room. The 12PM check out was greatly appreciated and we were even able to extend to 1PM. Will definitely stay here again.

We spent four nights last weekend at Park Central and everything was just fine! Have been staying there for many, many years and love the location, the price, the friendly employees..... the hotel is clean and comfortable - safe - and I always feel welcome. I am crazy about Mr. Saleem at the Front Desk, who makes travelers feel welcome at the hotel and tries to help in many ways to make our stay enjoyable. The Concierge staff is also very helpful, which would be especially needed by first-time visitors to the Big Apple. It's fun to relax and meet friends at the nice bar and enjoy a drink or have a perfect breakfast in the restaurant. It is close to Central Park (of course) and there are many good restaurants nearby. We really like Molyvos across the street - Greek - and delicious!

As you enter, Carmelo is the "welcome agent," probably their best asset! Friendly always in front to making sure that we have everything we need actively welcoming and greeting all passersby!The Hotel itself is in the ideal location In the theater district, two blocks from Central Park and a brisk walk to stock exchange, UN and Rockefeller Center, etc!Things to know ahead of time:1. Beautifully redecorated rooms2. It's basic asset is clean and well situated! 3. No coffee makers in the room Starbucks is next-door and the fabulous Café Europa is down the street4. You're going to be charged extra service charges to cover the Internet the gym and all the extras in the facility whether you use them or not- $32/person/ Day 5. No restaurants on site but a small bar and a little place to get light snacks is available

Just got back from a 3 night stay Park Central Hotel . The room was very nice and the beds were comfortable. The hotel is in a great location. Computers in the lobby for you to use to print out your plane ticket. Storage area for your luggage if need to store hem upon arrive or check out. Lots of complaint about the elevator wait times. We never waited once. I think you have to push the bottom button first. So it will come down to the lobby area. Minutes from Time square, Central Park. Rockefeller Centre. Very helpful staff. I would definitely book this hotel again

Had yet another fantastic stay at the Park Central Hotel this August. My partner and I were there for 4 days and can only say good things about this hotel. Great location, fun lobby bar, clean, and one of the nicest staffs you will find in the hospitality business.I have stayed at this hotel many, many times over the past 10 years and have never been disappointed. It was my partners first and he was very impressed. The room/s are very well kept, super clean, and spacious. The hotel is far enough away from all the tourist noise in Times Square that you can really relax at the end of the day.I would highly recommend this hotel (and have) to friends and family and it has always been a really good experience. You will love the atmosphere at the hotel-lots of great people from around the world and everyone is having a good time.Enjoy!

Just returned from 1 weeks stays at this hotel, our first visit to the US from the UK. We originally booked a different holiday (Mexico) as a package holiday and decided to change this back in June to New York because we booked it through a travel agent we were limited to what hotels were available for the dates. We chose this based on location mainly and very happy with our stay. We arrived to a lovely receptionist who was friendly swiped our card and gave us information on WiFi and our room cards. There are only 2 lifts which on 3 occasions were either busy or 1 out of order I had to walk up 11 stairs one day which wasn’t the best Our room was spacious, the bed was amazing comfiest ever queen size! We had a side street view, sometimes noisy at night with sirens and cars but we were always that tired from the day we would fall asleep straight away. Shower was great and what I loved is that they have a bath in the room which you rarely get in city hotels it was nice to get in from the day and relax in a hot bath! Room was always cleaned daily fresh towels and bedding and friendly staff.Hotel is close to everything; subway, Central Park on your left, Times Square on your right. Food places all around and bars. In the room is a ice holder and down the hall is an ice machine which we used for water and drinks in our room. We used the market on most mornings, fruit cup, yoghurt and croissant will cost around $12. Starbucks next door is cheap for morning drinks. On our last night we gave the hotel bar a try, cocktails are $15 excluding tax & tip 3 drinks set us back almost $50.. We bought New York passes before arrival and picked them up down the road just before Times Square which I would recommend if it’s tourism your going for and for a week+ gets your moneys worth out of them! We had a lovely stay, it depends what your going for and what your expectations are but I would defiantly recommend this hotel and would return in the future.

Pros:- Affordable- Good location and convenient to subway- Nice bar in the lobbyCons:- AC in room didn't work very well- Bathroom had an odd smell- Alarm clock in room was set for 6am and was woken up earlier than exepcted- The maid attempted to enter the room (without knocking) at 9am while I was getting dressed. With check out at 11am, they should not do this.
user_name:
Sean C
New York City, New York

review_body: Rooms were spacious enoough for a New York Hotel and it was clean although the linens were a little wrinkled. There were not many amenities in hotel except a "market" store that closed at 8:30 PM. There is an afiliated restaurant across the street, but none in the hotel. The internet was easy to sign on and was fast enough for email and web searching. My main complaint was that the room desk was too small to work comfortably and there was no electrical outlet that worked, although several were on the desk. My 12th floor room was quiet. I never did solve the mystery how there were 4 elevators on the 12th floor going down but only two in the lobby going up. I would stay here again as it is a good value for a NYC hotel.

First of all, check-in is at 4:00 pm. So late! So many people hanging around, storing their luggage. I had just returned from a flight from Europe and was tired, but had to stick around in the lobby for 2 hours because the room was not ready. At least have a 3:00 pm check-in like other hotels. Reception. Not nice. They acted like they were doing me a favour. For almost $400 a night? Even in New York. The concierge was nice, but had a fakey smile - I knew that he was dealing with lots of volume and lots of angry guests. There are all these fees tacked on. The mandatory fees, which gives you free local phone calls. WTF? The room was ok - it was spacious and the shower was great. But there was something a bit skanky about this hotel. The public restrooms on the ground floor were only accessible by a key - such long queues and they only had to open the restrooms up for the public - like a regular hotel.

Just booked in today into the Central Park excited to visit NY for the first time. We arrived circa 1pm and ask the friendly receptionist for a room on a high floor (as I am a very light sleeper... we had requested this on the hotel website twice and I phoned asking for same yestetday). The receptionist indicated we had a room on the 15th floor but it wouldn't be ready for a couple of hours and we asked if we could return at 3pm... no problem. We left our bags in the luggage room and went out for a meal. On returning at 3.30pm a Concierge person served us... no smiles or warmth, she eventually told us we were on the 10th floor - we reiterated that her colleague had told us 2.5 hours earlier we were on the 15th floor, only to be told that room would not be ready for sometime (possibly 5pm). Eventually after much angst a room on the 17th floor was provided by a manager/supervisor. As a previous reviewer has commentated the Concierge staff need to make customers feel welcome and a smile and some warmth would be appreciated.

My husband and I come here every year for my birthday. We first stayed back in January 2016 when he surprised my with Wicked tickets *(massive Wizard of Oz fan) and then to top it off, have a hotel RIGHT next to Central Park. Literally, you walk out, take a left, and BAM there you are. It is an amazing hotel. The staff is amazingly friendly, the hotel itself is spotless, the beds are so comfy, and the room just smells clean when you walk in. We love how there is a bar downstairs and there is a Starbucks! I will be coming back for many more birthdays to come! Thank you!!!

My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for three nights over this past weekend during a trip to NYC from Florida. I'm a military veteran and had just graduated college; my commencement ceremony took place in New Jersey and we decided to spend the rest of the weekend and Monday in NYC to celebrate. First the positives... hotel was nice, very conveniently located in midtown and offered easy access to many subway stations, restaurants and Times Square (which is literally just down the street). Room was clean, we had our own private bathroom and the staff was generally very pleasant (with the exception noted below). Unfortunately, I was caught by surprise by the "mandatory" facilities fee; this is disclosed to you upon check-in and I was forced to have $150 debited from my card before even receiving my key. What were we to do at that point, cancel the reservation and try to find another room in the middle of NYC on a moment's notice? I had made the reservation weeks in advance and felt we were stuck either paying up or finding a bench in Central Park to sleep on. Their notion of "mandatory" is, in my opinion, fraudulent practice and an easy way to bilk guests out of more money regardless of what amenities they use. I don't know if this is just the way hotels do things in NYC in general but I was not prepared for it. Unlike many of their guests (presumably), we are not extremely well off, even booking this trip really strained our budget to begin with. But we wanted to do it because we love NYC and hadn't been there in years. We did not use a single extra amenity during our entire stay - we used the room to sleep, shower and dress before going out into the town, that's it. Upon checkout, I asked the clerk if there was any flexibility on that mandatory charge since we literally didn't use anything and she rudely replied that its mandatory, no exceptions. So this hotel basically took $104 from me in exchange for absolutely nothing. Regardless of whether or not this is common practice with NYC hotels, in my world I call that stealing. Furthermore, the "amenities" described by their disclosure are mostly things that other hotels simply include in the nightly rate (i.e., fitness center, parking, use of computers, etc.). We didn't even use the hotel's wifi. I paid nearly $800 for our 3-day stay only to be charged another $100+ for absolutely no reason whatsoever. If we had used any of those things, fine - but we didn't. Yet it is still somehow mandatory. This facilities fee is a complete scam. Perhaps those guests who are a bit more affluent aren't bothered by this but folks like us who stretched our budget quite thin already in order to experience a much more comfortable stay in NYC are getting ripped off it. I left feeling very aggravated and disappointed overall with this hotel. It put a damper on our enjoyment of the city overall and those extra charges prevented us from doing a few of the things we had wanted to do while there. I feel that charging for extra services that a guest actually uses is fair, but to charge them regardless simply because somewhere it's hotel policy that it be "mandatory?" Theft. Plain and simple. They took money from me and for things I or we never used or even touched. It should be illegal, this policy. Should we ever go back to NYC this hotel will NOT be on our list of places to stay. We will find someplace that doesn't bilk us out of additional money in exchange for nothing.

Pros: The rooms were clean and spacious, housekeeping staff were friendly. The hotel location is great, near to subways. Definitely a good hotel for those who likes to venture the city.Cons: Service is way below the average, receptionists were unwelcoming. Honestly, I feel that the service staff at the concierge and guest relation counter did not go the extra mile to help the guest, for example when I was standing at the empty guest relation counter, the conceirge staff was just there at his own counter pretending not to see us. We did not expect him to serve us but atleast just acknowledge our presence or to assure that someone will be assisting us soon.Twice on different occasions, we were being directed from one counter to another just to receive our parcel from amazon that were being charged for handling fee per item. (There is no information and clause on this. We ended up paying US$50 just like that. If we have known, we would have asked the deliveryman to call us directly instead)And this may sound surprising but for a big hotel like Park Central, I have observed and experienced myself that different guests were being treated differently in term of customer service. As long as you look asian or tanned looking, you will not be treated equally like other guests, which is very disappointing.Overall, I was happy with my one week stay in New York but the service experience of the hotel is definitely not my top five. It would be a waste for a nice hotel like this to be tarnished by staff that are not well-groom with customer service knowledge and skills. Whether a guest is wearing a well tailored suit or a baggy t-shirt with bermudas, all guests needs to be treated fairly.

Hotel overlooks Central park. Great location, good service. Quiet hotel.Main areas could do with updating but hotel rooms are good quality. Sarabeths restaurant is a couple of doors away with stunning food.Watch out for the expensive add on resort fee - we didn't use any of the benefits of the resort fee so rather a waste.

The rooms are big and comfortable for New York standards, they were also clean and the views where very midtown NYC! Familiar scenes from so many movies. If this is a business trip its not a bad choice. Important detail: no breakfast or other dinning area in the hotel premises. The location is very central, between Times Square and Central Park, but if this is your first trip to NYC its the wrong place to stay. All the charm of NYC is to be able to step outside your door and be in one of its neighbourhoods, with a cafe, a bistro, a Chinese laundry and a bodega at the corner, interesting shops, beautiful houses and architecture, and the different ethnic elements... all that colour its varied environments.This midtown area is full of big hotels, food chains and tourist traps. One has to know where to go! I don't know if Park Central is good value for money because I didn't pay for my stay.

Great location, near Central Park! Suitable hotel for few nights stay at NYC. Clean room, smooth and quick check in/out. Drinks at lobby bar quite expensive. It would be nice if room have minibar and coffee or tea facilities.

I stayed here for ten nights on business and found the hotel to be very clean, accommodating and friendly staff, great location next to the subway and a convenient Starbucks right next door. Coffeemaker available upon request as well. Lots of restaurants nearby and Times Square is just a few blocks south of the hotel.

This hotel would have been spectacular in 1973 but it is seriously dated now and needs a complete refurbish. $360 per night plus tax plus a $31 charge for the opportunity to use the gym and make local calls.....honestly, get real. The room has a to, one bar of soap and one bottle of shampoo. No tea, no coffee, no water....all for $360 plus tax. They should be ashamed of themselves

So as not to bury the lead I'll say upfront that I don't believe we'd stay at the Park Central Hotel again.The issue is not that the Park Central Hotel is bad, its not. It's just that in the same price range, there are so many hotel choices in mid-town Manhattan, and so many that are better in many ways.First, there is a lot to like about the Park Central Hotel. The property is centrally located to all things mid-town. The theaters, Central Park, Times Square, Carnegie Hall, and several museums. The property is very well maintained. The public areas are newly appointed, modern and accessible. We had a room on a lower floor so I can't comment on views, but I can say an interior facing room is quiet, unlike what I imagine with street facing rooms. So, we appreciated the quiet. As with the public spaces, our room was also very clean, upon arrival and after every day's housekeeping.In one way the Park Central Hotel was a standout. Service. We were guests for four nights so we had many occasions to interact with a variety of staff. To a person they were helpful, professional, accommodating, informative and simply nice people. And I'm referring to housekeepers and maintenance men on up to the desk agents and managers we encountered. The staff is well trained and it seems like they enjoy working at the Park Central Hotel, or at least they don't hate it to the point where guests suffer from their annoyance with management.The reason I wouldn't consider the Park Central Hotel for a return visit seems down to management actually. Or at least management policies and practices that directly impact guests. When we arrived we immediately noticed the room lacked several amenities one would expect at this price point. There was no coffee/tea maker, no refrigerator and no self-service food/bar items. And the ice maker on our floor was inoperable upon our arrival. To their credit, the machine was quickly repaired.Also, several lamps were missing from the room. There was a reading chair, but no accompanying reading lamp. And there was no reading lamp on the bedside table of one of us. I immediately requested a coffee maker and lamps. The coffee maker was delivered immediately. The reading lamp came the next day. It took quite a bit longer to get the bedside lamp. Only after requesting it several times, and after the personal assistance of a maintenance person was the lamp delivered. We learned that lamps are often broken and thus swapped around from room-to-room. I put this issue down to management not supplying a sufficient numbers of lamps and not keeping sufficient replacements on hand.The other troublesome issue that I also put down to a management practice is the "mandatory facilities/resort fee" of $31.00 per night. For the mandatory fee guests receive:1. Unlimited domestic phone calls2. Unlimited use of the nearby 24 Hour Fitness Center3. Luggage storage upon early arrival or late departure4. Use of computer workstations in the lobby5. Daily USA Today newspapers6. Printing, scanning and faxing available through Guest RelationsRather than comment on these "amenities", I'll leave it to the reader to determine if there is value in these items.Room service is not available at the Park Central Hotel. This was the most surprising deficiency.

This hotel is Uninhabitable!! I booked this hotel for 3 nights but I had to leave after 2nights because the room I stayed is truly disgusting and uninhabitable!! The room had very nasty mold smells and I could barely breathe. Also room was really dark there only one tiny window that I felt like I was check into county jail. So I wanted to change the room but a guy at front desk was told me he never hear about it and I had to wait until tomorrow noon. I was getting frustrated and wanted to check out. I asked him for my money back but he said I had to call travelocity as I booked through them. Sevice was a horrible!!
