I gave up and checked out one night earlier but they still charged three nights with resort fee($30 a day). so it end up coast me about$650 per night. What a ripped off!

Clean and quiet rooms and friendly staff. Great location close to almost anything you want to visit. Restaurants are close at hand and if you want to just unwind at the end of the end of the day, take a walk in Central Park and forget about being in the middle of the most wonderful city in the world

Nice clean, modern hotel close to Broadway and Time Square at a reasonable priceI went onto hotel.com to look for a reasonably (New York) priced hotel. Pod 39 and the Roosevelt Hotel are usually the lowest priced places to stay that are clean and efficient. However we thought we would try someplace new. As of the time of this stay, September 23, 2017, the park Central Hotel was one of the lowest price hotels.

We stayed here for 4 nights and were very happy. It is about 10 min walk from Times Square and 5 min walk from Central Park. There are lots of eating places nearby. We came from JFK using the Air Train and the E subway and were able to walk a few minutes from the subway to the hotel. On the final day we were able to leave our luggage in storage after checking out as we had a late evening flight.The room was very clean, comfortable and a good size. We were on the 3rd floor and there was a bit of noise outside during the night, but hey ho, we were in New York, what do you expect?Checking in was a bit slow and the staff weren't very welcoming but we were pleased to be able to get into our room even though we arrived a few hours before the official check in time. We asked for a fridge which never came but there was an ice bucket in the room and an ice dispenser outside in the corridor which was quite satisfactory. Many people mention the facilities charge which does feel unfair when we are told there is "free" wifi. However, we factored this into the price when we booked and the actual charge ended up being less than expected. Overall I was very satisfied and would return and recommend it to my friends.

We stayed at pc for five days last month. First timers manhattan. Couldn't believe our luck. What a great hotel and staff. Definitely want to return and maybe we can get a discount ha ha hotel is lovely, old school charm but high end Reno. Couple blocks to south gate of park, cross street to Carnegie, several blocks up 7th and you're standing in Times Square! Amazing! Broadway all around you. Short walk to radio city and top of the rock. Starbucks literally steps away, great delis,pizza and Irish pubs. Big bus tour right out front. Fast elevators, ice machine steps away in all floors. Nice. On our last day we loaded our phantom $25 drink souvenir mugs with what was left of the red wine, stepped outside, strolled idyllically through the park on a Saturday sipping and watching the real manhattan lounging peacefully on their sunny day off till we arrived at the Met and enjoyed the art experience of a lifetime. Only unicorns could have made it better lol :) Thanks park central, we hope to return one day

We usually visit this hotel once or twice a year. This year we weren't satisfied at all. We had no NYC view, we stayed on the third floor and had "backyard" view. We just saw a wall and loud AC systems. It was really dark in the room. We tried to get another room, without success. Furthermore the front desk staff was conceited to us. We won't come back.

I did not book this hotel myself; I was booked here by a company I had a business meeting with. I would have never booked this place if I had the choice. The hotel on the outside and the inside look visually appealing. It looks like a nice hotel. It's when you settle in and start looking closer at the hotel when you start to see the problems. The checkin person wasn't rude, but they also were not nice/welcoming. The checkout person was much nicer. The elevators were small and slow to operate. I wasn't in a rush, so it didn't bother me much, but it was still an inconvenience. The room: when I walked in, I initially felt pleasantly surprised at how nice it appeared. However, when I opened the closet door, there was a soiled towel on the shelf. It was still wet. There was dust and debris all along the baseboards that were both visible to the naked eye and visible when standing. The floors were dirty all over and it immediately made me worry about my belongings. This was the first time I've ever felt an urgent need to protect my luggage from pests/bugs and the hotel environment in general (above and beyond how I normally protect my stuff when traveling). I sealed everything tight and put it all in the tub hoping that nothing got in. The air conditioner also did not work at first, but after a call to the front desk, maintenance came and fixed it. All in all, I wanted to like this place because it looked really nice, but I was left with an overall sense of disgust and some worry. Also, I wanted to give his hotel a less than"average" rating, but I didn't feel like it fit with the "poor" category.

We booked into this hotel for 3 nights in January. No complaints about room but we arrived early in the morning,7am. after a cruise and couldn't check in which was fine but there were 4 of us, so lots of luggage. We were able to use the luggage room which was camera monitored and locked with staff always present so we decided to leave everything, including valuables. when we returned that night and went up to our room my son noticed money missing from his backpack so I decided to check my passport wallet and money was also missing. Jewellery was still intact. total $US 700.The interesting thing was that only some money was taken from each wallet. We immediately reported this to management and filled out appropriate forms and were told luggage room footage would be reviewed. Despite approaching staff several times, nothing was sorted before we left and the security team said they were not permitted to tell me what they found on cameras. To add to this we also had a delivery of a kindle and $400 headphones to the hotel which the hotel said never arrived, We liased with management for rest of our trip,phone calls and emails back and forth, hotel insurance company involvement but at the end of 3 months we were told that it was not the hotels responsibility and the case was closed. would not recommend staying here EVER

I had a one night stay for 4 people, I got a premium corner room with two queen beds. I was expecting to be in this cramped area with us all over each other, but it was surprisingly spacious. The room was quiet and with the blinds, we were able to make the room quite dark. We were across an apt complex and definitely people watching was interesting... The bathroom was a little small but not tiny, there was a good shower and soap/shampoo. It's in a fantastic location. Very walkable to Times Square to see our show, and then we walked to Central Park the next day. It's right next to Rockefeller / Carnegie Hall, any cool thing near midtown that you could want to do. Will defo look to stay in this location again.

We had one night here and our room was on the 4th floor facing 7th avenue. You get a bit of traffic noise but nothing too bad. Beds were OK and the bathroom was small but clean. It's easy to get to and in a good location for Times Square and the theatre district. Just be aware that this is a big tourist area and prices for food and drink are bumped up. The lifts are quite small and you can wait quite a while in the lobby. Check out lines were really long but you can also check out at the concierge desk, which we did. Overall the hotel was OK and better than our next hotel (Washington Jefferson) which was a joke !

Not impressed. Room was not very clean (stains on lampshade, carpet deterioration) asked for late check out since we had a late flight & all they could do was one hour later so we sat in the lobby w our luggage for 2 hours & had to use a key card for restrooms that were filthy. Wanted to try somewhere new in NYC but won't do this hotel ever again.

This was not the first time we have stayed here but we will not be going back after our last stay yesterday. It started off well with a room upgrade but when we entered the claustrophobic room, we wondered what the room would have been like if not upgraded. The bathroom was so small you could barely close the door when inside and only 2 towels, really????? No amenities such as water or coffee machine. Plastic cups in bathroom. For what they charge, they should be ashamed of themselves. So many places to stay in the city, cross this one off your list. The only reason why 2 stars instead of 1 was the nice reception we received when checking in and her upgrading us. At least I hope she did.

The location itself is what makes this hotel a first choice and a place we would return to again. A very short walk to Central Park, 2 mins from 57th street subway station, numerous restaurants and an easy walking distance to 5th avenue. Of all the places we visited in NY it was our ideal place to stay, in the heart of everything, easy to access the whole city via the subway but also away from the bustle of Times Square and other more busy areas. A simply perfect location. For us personally, being located right next to Central Park was a priority and you can wake up and run round the park each morning as a perfect start the day. If not run, you can walk or cycle (bikes for hire) and just enjoy the beauty and atmosphere of the park. The best bits:Amazing location! See above. The rooms are very clean, the housekeeping staff are very efficient. All staff are friendly and helpful.Rooms are very comfortable- large comfortable bed, large TV, clean adequate bathroom and decent shower, overall very clean and well maintained. Wifi is accessible everywhere in the hotel.Great selection of Diners and other food options very close by. We liked the diner directly across the road (Park Cafe) best for a quick breakfast or lunch - fast service, good value and decent American style menu. Views of Central Park (however you must pay extra for a street facing room).Great gym facility in the hotel.Central Park is a 5 minute walk and has everything you'd expect. It has a dedicated running and cycling track if that's your thing and endless footpaths for walking. A great place to start your day or simply escape the hustle and bustle of the city streets. To be aware of: Upselling - The daily room rate advertised is not the total price you will pay. They add taxes plus facilities charges of $31 for each night you stay. Make sure you book and pay for a street facing room, or you will face internally into a block and see no natural light and the room is dark. The upgrade fee for a street facing room is approx $40 per night but worth it. If you arrive before 4pm and want to check in to your room, you'll be charged an upgrade fee for early check in at approx $61, again worth it if you've been on a long flight and want to shower and freshen up. They do offer a bag drop service also to store your bags if you are happy to wait.The hotel is approximately 1 hour from JFK airport, approx $55 in a yellow taxi. There is a lot of traffic on the way, be prepared with water and snacks if you've come off a long flight. There are no fridges in the room but you can request one. Stock up with water and other drinks at a shop nearby.There isn't a coffee machine in the room either but they sell coffee in the shop downstairs in the hotel lobby and there's numerous coffee shops close by.

Rooms with views (premium) are very good. Excellent position, three blocks from Central Park and close to Times square We have stopped before and the room was dark looking onto a brick wall. you have to ask when checking in if you want a coffee machine (no kettles available) or fridge, but these are not always available. There is no restaurant attached to this hotel, but they do sell snack & pastries in a kiosk. Good diners close by for breakfast and good restaurants for dinner. The bar/ lounge is nice but the prices for drinks are very expensive, forcing us to drink elsewhere. We stopped last year and the drinks at happy hour were reasonable but they seemed to have doubled this year. $20 for 2 beers. Down the road it was $10. Overall a very nice place and any problems we had were sorted immediately with no fuss.

The Park Central hotel could not be better located. 5 mins away from Central park on the left and 5 mins away from Time Square on the right. From my experience the hotel was immaculate, we had a room on the 8th floor with 2 double beds for four people and it was comfortable and spacious enough. Large tv, decent showering facilities, and the beds are super comfy. The only downside is the noise outside, I would recommend ear plugs for a decent sleep as it can get pretty loud, the drinks at the bar were pretty pricey too. Would recommend for great service and lovely hotel!

The service was terrific, they helped with all our needs. I would highly recommend Park Central hotel. Great location, everything easily accessible. Will definitely stay here again and tell friends about this hotel.

This was my second time staying at the Park Central my first time was in August 2015 and than August of this year and I have to say both times I had a fantastic experience from start to finish. The location is brilliant right in the heart of New York City just walk out the door and turn left and you can see Central Park just less than a 2 min walk. If you turn right outside the hotel door you'll be looking down into the centre of Times Square just a 5 min walk down to it! The hotel itself is lovely and modern, very clean, lovely modern lobby, fantastic bar and the rooms are beautiful, modern, spacious, clean and the beds are extremely comfortable so expect a great nights sleep!! The bathrooms and great too the Housekeeping staff do a outstanding job keeping the rooms clean and the reception and the concierge are very nice and very welcoming. The concierge was also extremely helpful to us with getting directions and how to use the subway system. I also have to say that my room had a fantastic view looking down into Times Square. Thank you so much to all the staff in the Park Central and I can't wait to return again. Kind regards Jonathan Morgan

Pluses:Great location! Super close to Central Park and subway. Walking distance (or 2 Subway stops) from Time Square. Close enough to enjoy but far away enough to avoid the craziness. You can access the 57th Street Subway Station without leaving the block.Cleanliness was good enough. Location and cleanliness were my priorities when searching reviews prior to booking hotels and this lived up to the reviews I viewed.Lovely bathroom with really hot water and a shower plus bathtub. Superb Wi-Fi which was heavenly for contributing to a great holiday: easily able to locate venues and services, book tickets, checkout opening times…When I had a problem with the bath plug, there was a service man there within minutes. He said they work 24/7. Extra glasses and towelling were not a problem.Included: iron and ironing board; Hairdryer; Reasonably quiet air conditioner.Fairly quiet for sleeping. There were the regular sounds of sirens and car horns, intermittently, but only a few times in the week were they really loud. We were on the 7th floor facing the street – so all in all, pleasant. Fabulous lounge behind the foyer. Good for getting away from the family. Booths for eating in if desired as the rooms were a bit too small for all of us to eat in.Considering you are in the heart of the city, the room is really well organised and quiet.Minuses:No fridge or any coffee making facilities in the rooms. If you and those with you like a couple of cups of coffee a day, be prepared to purchase from cafes or the many Starbucks nearby. Could not keep any leftovers from meals or have something as a middle of the night snack.A microwave for general use would have been great on many occasions. While there are decent pull down blinds, these did not completely block out the bright lights of outside well enough for me. I only slept well when I was wearing my eye mask.In regards to the lighting within the room, there was definitely not enough. Only a couple of lamps and a faint picture light. Not good enough for reading unless you were right under one of the lamps. Luckily we had a window with some natural light during the day.A gorgeous bar but way too expensive: almost $15 each for a small glass of red (after tax and gratuities). It’s no wonder it’s mostly empty. (There’s a lovely little liquor store diagonally opposite the Starbucks downstairs that sells great wines, some between $15-$20 a bottle.)

It was my first time staying the hotel property. I was very impressed from cleanliness, to accessibility to subways, to customer services and location was perfect. Rooms were comfortable and bathrooms were clean.

We stayed for a week and had the best week ever.The hotel is located between Times Square and Central Park and it is so easy to walk to many places, we didn't need to use the subway or über for the first 4 days! Although we didn't need to ask many questions during our stay the staff were helpful whenever we went to the desk and even provided a coffee machine to the room on request. There is a bar and a small coffee shop which sells pastries etc although we were out each morning so only really used this to grab drinks in the afternoon. The rooms and bathrooms were spacious and clean, huge beds and TVs. Great place to stay

We stayed two nights at the hotel on a Travelzoo Voucher, It was a bargain. The hotel is located near Central Park and Tavern On the Green restaurant where we had an excellent dinner. The room was large, clean and comfortable, especially the beds. The staff were friendly and helpful..

Stayed here for 5 nights while on a site seeing trip too NY. The location is very good between Time Square and Central Park and is handy for a number of Subway stations and a good selection of bars and restaurants. Got a very good headline rate for the area, however this did exclude the facilities fee (although I did get a couple of emails highlighting this) even with this added the price was still fairly good.Arrived mid evening to discover that the room (king size) which I had booked a couple of months earlier was not available although I was offered a twin queen with the facilities fee waived, which softened the blow. The room itself was pretty good, had a view of an internal court yard, which while initially disappointing was probably a blessing in disguise as it was free from the usual NY chorus of taxi drivers sounding their horns! There were no facilities for making tea or coffee in the room (not sure if that is the US norm?) and there was only a little shop in the hotel for drinks and breakfast. The lounge is very pleasant with excellent staff, they are missing a bit of a trick not doing food, particularly breakfast, which even the ropiest UK hotels will have a go at, and after a hard day doing the sights one or two quiet evenings eating in the hotel might have been nice.All in all I would recommend Park Central if you can get a good deal, but wouldn't recommend paying over the odds.

This is a nice hotel in a fantastic location. Within walking distance of Central Park, 5th Avenue and Times Square. The room was clean and a decent size, but the bathroom was probably the smallest I've ever seen in a hotel. Also, catching an elevator in the morning was next to impossible. We were on the fifth floor and by the time the elevator reached us it was always packed. Most mornings we used the stairs. There was no issue with check in or out, but we were surprised by a hefty facilities tax.

A the end of August / beginning of September 2017 we stayed in the Park Central hotel for 7 nights. Our overall impression of the hotel with its correct and professional, but not always friendly, personal and staff is very positive. We had a room on the 9th floor at the hotel backside. Consequently our view below was a kind of inner court (roof of hotel spaces) with hotel installations on top of it. The installations made a monotonous noise, but we didn’t consider that as annoying. The room with perfect beds and many wall sockets was spacious enough and was perfectly cleaned daily. The same counts for the bathroom with a shower in the comfortable low bath, that made it easy to get in. A point of improvement is the poor lighting in the rooms.The location of the hotel couldn’t be better. A subway station is around the corner and at about 400 meters there is the south entrance of the Central Park as well as the Columbus Circle subway station with many main subway lines. Attractions like Times Square, Museum Mile (incl. MOMA), 5th Avenue Rockefeller Building and even Bryant Park and the Empire State Building are at walking distance (if you like to do some walking). The Circle Line Cruises at the banks of the Hudson river is also at walking distance getting you through the Hell’s Kitchen neighbourhood with some nice restaurants, which are much cheaper than restaurants near the hotel. To get to other neighbourhoods/ attractions like Coney Island, DUMBO / Brooklyn Heights, 9/11 monument, Brooklyn Bridge, Lower East Side, etc. the nearby subway is perfectly suited. By the way, we bought the NY Explorer Pass online and built our own attraction pass which worked perfectly (skipping the ticket lines!!). Two final remarks: (i) the hotel breakfast, if you booked it, is just 'grab and go';(ii) at arrival 300 dollar is put on hold on your credit card and refunded 4-5 days after checking out (we had never experienced this at a prepaid trip)
user_location: Nieuwerkerk aan den Ijssel, The Netherlands
user_name:
MvdL1952
Nieuwerkerk aan den Ijssel, The Netherlands

review_body: Hotel is nice and clean staff are friendly the hotel is in a good location short walk to Times Square, central park and 5th avenue for shopping the only this is there is only two elevators so at busy times you can be waiting a few minutes for them. I would return if staying in New York again in the Future

Overall, the whole stay was pleasant. The location is very convenient to go to many places, near to a few subway stations. The hotel is clean and big (as compared to other hotels in nyc).However, there are some negative points for the hotel.1) there are 2 lifts but they can take very long to come down. We have to take the stairs for a couple of time as the wait was long and lift was full. 2) One of the last few nights, we actually didn't ask for housekeeping and put a do-not-disturb at the door knob. However, our room was cleaned despite putting the sign. Yes, it's nice of them to clean but there's a reason why we left the sign outside in the first place. 3) Housekeeper cleared the plastic cups and didn't replace it with new ones. The body shampoo was emptied but not refill throughout the stay. 4) Almost one month after checking out, we realised that our card was charged with a fee. We were told at the reception that it's a refundable hotel deposit. Insisted that we have to use a credit card instead of cash if not we'll need to put a larger amount of cash instead of the original amount. During the last night, we received a piece of paper that said credit the amount, so we assumed that it's the refund of the money. Until a month later, we noticed that our card is being charged and there's a fine print that said we agreed to pay some facilities fee (though nothing was being signed). We felt cheated since we were unaware of the facilities fee and nothing was mentioned; other than the deposit for the hotel. It's not a small amount, 30usd per night, which can total up to be about 270usd for our 9 nights. I think it's about being honest and informed correctly. Not telling us that it's refundable deposit and yet being charged after the stay.

We're a family of 4 with 11 & 13yr old children and visited at the end of August 2017. We booked very last minute and struggled to find anywhere offering better than 2 x Queen Beds in one room, so chose this hotel based on cost and location. When we checked in the staff were really helpful and offered us an accessible room which had much more space and they added a roll away bed so the children had a bed each to sleep in. Fantastic - the man who brought the bed up couldn't have been more helpful.We found all the staff to be friendly, helpful and approachable. The hotel was clean and comfy. I'd stay again, but another time would contact the hotel to see about interconnecting rooms - easier to do when not booking 12hrs before the flight I imagine!!

Highly recommended! I got married in Central Park...and it was an easy walk to the park...as well as Trump Tower, St Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center & Times Square. Rooms were clean & staff was awesome! Study the elevators & floors tho...that can be confusing. God Bless!

We were in any for the NYNOW show and after an early flight and busy day, this very busy hotel was able to check us into our rooms early.The hotel is efficiently run, no lineups and in a great location.The rooms were clean and attractive, as were the lobby and hallways.Staff were Friendly and helpful.There isn't a restaurant on site but the Lobby Market had drinks and food and a large lounge behind the lobby to sit and eat or relax. I have stayed in many Nyc hotels, and recently most of them in Times Square, but I much preferred he location of Park Central for quiet and sleep quality.We had easy access to the shuttle for the Javits Center and so many good Restos.

Took my daughters to a girls weekend in NYC for the first time and we stayed at the park central hotel. I found the hotel through Groupon and so incredibly glad I did! This hotel is amazing. Gorgeous, clean, modern, with kind and helpful staff. The pictures on their website really does capture its beauty and it reflects what you get in the hotel. Not a bait and switch like some. The location was perfect as multiple subway stations very close by as well as only blocks from both Central Park and Times Square. We will definitely plan on staying here again next time we're in the city.

Upon entering my room on Thursday, August 10, I noticed a lamp on the bedside night table was missing. I had very little time to unpack and freshen up before heading to dinner and the theater. Therefore, on my way out I explained the problem to the front desk and was expecting to see a lamp in place when I returned in the late evening. There was no lamp.The next morning, Friday, August 11, I telephoned Guest Services from the room while preparing to go out for the day to inform them a lamp had not been delivered. They apologized and assured me a lamp would be placed in the room. Upon my return in the late afternoon, a lamp was still missing. The message light flashing on the room phone was from Guest Services. They wanted to confirm the delivery of a lamp and make certain everything was to my satisfaction. Frustrated, I telephoned Guest Services. They were surprised to learn a lamp had not been delivered. They assured me they would send a lamp right up. A few hours later I again received a call from Guest Services to confirm delivery of a lamp. I told them that a lamp had not been delivered and asked if there was another Room 1010. At this point I was extremely furious, as I had waited for delivery and missed getting a quick nap before showering and going out for the night. I was now told a lamp would be sent up as soon as one became available. Became available? I told the representative I had checked on-line and there were available rooms from which they could have an available lamp. I also stated that housekeeping should have noticed the missing lamp and reported it when the room was being prepared for my arrival. I would presume the duties of housekeeping is to ensure all furnishings are present in a room and functional.After this conversation, there was no further communication with Guest Services. This saga shows a lack of professionalism and organization within the hotel. Who is telling whom a lamp has been delivered? Who is responsible to ensure a guest’s request. I wrote a letter to the hotel, but to date have not had a response. I frequent this hotel and absolutely love the location to my favorite restaurants and the theater. I highly recommend the Park Central

Great property, nice room, friendly and helpful staff. Very convenient laction! Beautiful lobby and lovely lounge. Our room was nice with a great view. Comfortable bed, nice sized tv and bathroom was clean and pleasant.

Minutes from Central Park, close 5th Avenue and the Upper West Side. Subway is nearby to all of Manhattan and the boroughs. For the location, the price is reasonable. Keep in mind that "reasonable" in NYC is anywhere from $175 - $250 a night (depending on the night). You could find lower prices, and definitely will find higher, but for the location, this is pretty good. The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet (relatively speaking). There is a $35 resort fee (though they called it something else) per night that includes the gym and WiFi.Staff are very accommodating, will hold luggage for early arrivals and until 10pm on check out day.

Loved the hotel and for the most part a very friendly helpful staff. Very clean and a nice view. Perfect location in mid town Manhattan. We could walk almost anywhere. The only surprise is that they had no coffee in the room I guess to help boost sales in the lobby.

The location is awesome, right by Central Park and close to many amazing restaurants. The rooms were clean and the hotel generally very well run. The views depend on where your room is. Ours looked out at an interior courtyard/mechanical area, so we just kept the blinds down.The price was right, but, booking on priceline there was a major hidden cost in the $30/night fee that is automatically added on to your bill for use of the "facilities". That is my biggest btch about the hotel.

In the heart of Times Square and Central Park for a reasonable price! Clean spacious rooms! Friendly staff and of course they hold your luggage after you check out! If you have children, there is a playground area right in Central Park

This hotel is a perfect location, right by the park and just up from Time Square. The staff were so helpful and nothing was too much trouble. We stayed four nights, and the rooms were refreshed by housekeeping everyday. The rooms were large, modern, clean and tidy. I would definately stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Using a Groupon coupon we booked this hotel because of its location in mid-town, near Central Park and other sites we had on our wish list. Check-in was a breeze, and we checked our bags til the room was ready so we could start exploring Central Park. The concierge was very helpful with restaurant recommendations and reservations. Based on TripAdvisor reviews, we asked for a room as high as possible, and got a room on the 10th floor. Perhaps because we had the Groupon coupon, the room was tucked away in a far corner at the end of a hall, with a view of the inner courtyard. No matter, we spent most of our time out of the room enjoying the city. We had a late afternoon flight out so we again checked out bags after check-out, explored some more, then got our bags for the trip to the airport. Overall, a nice hotel for our purposes, nothing spectacular.

Stayed at this hotel for one night in August 2017. Hotel was in the perfect location. Close to Times Square and Central Park. Parking was steep (75 bucks) but that's the norm for NYC. Check in and out was easy. Room was beautiful and comfortable. Bar in the lobby was gorgeous and bartender was super friendly. Also the bell hops were all really helpful and nice.

We were very comfortable at our Park Central Hotel room. The location is amazing. Close to Broadway, nice restaurants, and museums. The room was comfortable, we were on the 9th floor, and although it was somewhat noisy, we expected that since we were in the middle of N.Y. city. The only complaints are that I wish there had been a coffee maker in the room, or that you at least could get hot water or coffee in the lounge. The other problem is that there are only two elevators serving a lot of rooms, so some mornings we did have to wait a while for an elevator. But these were minor things, basically, the hotel is clean, the staff very pleasant, and the location is fantastic.

We stayed for one night while in town for a show. The hotel was in a great location and was really a great place to stay. Check in and check out was very quick. The front desk staff was very professional. Elevators were quick. There is a small shop to purchase a quick bite to eat in the lobby. They also had a huge bar in the lobby. The room was clean, bed was very comfortable, bathroom was a good size, shower was big and water pressure was great. The offer their toiletries already built into the shower to use (similar to how a cruise ship does), rather than the standard little bottles. The only small bottle you get is lotion. We heard no noise from the hallway or other rooms. Our room had no view other than the rest of the hotel rooms windows. Seems to have been built in a courtyard/atrium type of configuration but with no outdoor area. They do have WiFi, but you also pay a $32-$33/day resort fee for that privilege as well. I think a lot of NYC hotels and other big city hotels charge this feel anyway. The only thing that we felt was a little off was the lighting was very dim in the room. Not a big deal if you're just there to shower and sleep, but if you're there to do any kind of work it would be a problem. There isn't any type of lamp on the desk where you would be working either. Just two lamps, one on each side of the bed. This wouldn't deter me from staying here again, but it was just something we noticed. Overall, this is a great hotel and very close to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, lots of places to eat and the subway is nearby too.

I have stayed at the hotel several times with members of my family, and my daughter and granddaughter stayed there a couple of weeks ago. We've always liked it (which is why we kept going back). But the current situation leads me to decide none of us ever will again. I used the website on Aug. 23 to reserve a room for myself, Sept. 6-13. The rate was $177 per night, plus the usual taxes etc. I didn't get a confirmation, so I phoned and left a message about having one sent to me by e-mail. No response for a couple of days, so I phoned again. After a runaround, being switched from one office to another, being promised a call-back that never came, I finally got some information. Apparently, Reservations had booked me for a stay on Aug. 23, and made no record of the Sept. dates that I actually wanted. Then they marked and charged me as a no-show for Aug. 23, a date on which I never wanted to stay there -- in fact, the date on which I made the reservation from my home on the West Coast. They agreed to cancel that. Because they had neglected to reserve the room I wanted for a week in September, they were willing to make that reservation now -- at a charge of more than $320 per night. I remonstrated that the reservation I had made and they messed up was at the much lower rate, and the answer -- put very politely, but in effect meaning: tough luck.If this is their idea of customer service, that I should pay through the nose for their error, I want none of it for myself or my family in the future.

I stayed at this hotel with my daughter in July 2009. Yeah, a while ago, but I copied this from a review I made on another site. I was on the 11th floor room 1153 (I think) it was a corner room with a view of 7th avenue. I managed to get a good deal (with breakfast) on Expedia for about £95 a night (a steal, wow) a four night for three night deal. This hotel was in an absolutely perfect location. It was a five minute walk to Central Park (hence the name) and a ten minute walk to Time Square. If I hadn't been there with my teenage daughter I probably would have stayed in the Soho/Greenwhich area which is more my style but I enjoyed the buzz of this area. The hotel was very smart and the room we ended up with was big, clean and spacious with a view of 7th Avenue. The bed itself was also very, very comfortable. We were originally given a room facing some inner square looking opposite other bedrooms but after a quick word with the receptionist we were switched to a room with a view.Online it listed breakfast as continental so I was not expecting much. In fact it was a full and very tasty breakfast with bacon, eggs, pancakes and lots of fresh fruit and yoghurt. The breakfast room was bright and airy with huge windows with a view of the New York streets lined with yellow taxis. A perfect start to the day!!The staff around the hotel and in the breakfast room were really nice and polite. The rooms were also cleaned adequately every morning to a high standard.My only criticism is the lifts were VERY slow. Being on the 11th floor this was quite irritating. We were told by reception they had installed some new system which gives priority to people going up but it seemed like they forgot about the people going down! We soon worked out you have to press to go up for the lift to arrive (sometimes empty) then when you are in you hit the ground floor button, crazy I know!! I wonder if that is now fixed. These days I use Air BnB but if I were to book a hotel I would consider coming back here again.

Whenever we come to NYC we try to see as many Broadway shows as possible, and as a result are always after a hotel that is close to the theatre district and at a reasonable price. While we have a usual hotel we book, this time we discovered that the Park Central Hotel was a little bit cheaper, and a whole lot swankier than where we usually go, and since we’d be celebrating my birthday while in town decided to try it out.I’ll be honest, having read the reviews here just prior to departure to NYC I was a bit nervous about my decision, but I have to say that I didn’t experience the major issues other reviewers have note.The hotel itself is very nice, with a large open concept lobby and a big open lounge/bar area behind reception. The staff are friendly enough, but we did find the person who greeted us at reception to be a bit short and wasn’t offering the friendliest of welcomes. We also discovered upon checking in that there was a $31(USD)/day “resort facilities fee” we would be required to pay - why this wasn’t simply included in the price I’m not entirely sure, but it did mean that when all was said and done we probably weren’t saving that much money by staying here instead of our usual place. It should be noted the website we booked on did mention this fee, but it was listed in a sidebar and easily overlooked - again why it wasn’t simply included in the price, I’m not sure.Checking luggage wasn't an issue, both on the day we checked in and the day we checked out. In fact, the nicest staff we encountered was in the luggage room.The rooms are quite nice - we had a room on the 8th floor by the elevator with two queen beds. The room itself was pretty spacious, with enough room for the four of us and our luggage. Despite the proximity to the elevator, it wasn’t noisy. The beds were very comfortable, with excellent pillows (sometimes a rarity in hotels). The bathroom was quite spacious, and the shower nice and clean. We didn’t have much of a view, in fact our room looked directly at the office building opposite us. The rooms don’t feature a minibar/fridge so if you get leftovers you won’t be able to save them for the next day, but there are ice buckets if you need to chill a beverage. There’s also free WiFi, which is always nice, though in 2017 is somewhat expected. Perhaps the only major annoyance about the hotel are the elevators. There’s only two of them and they are slow and they are small. Expect to wait. There are stairs, and being on the 8th floor meant it wasn’t too much of a hassle to just walk downstairs if we got sick of waiting (but wouldn’t exactly want to have to climb them).There’s a small little store downstairs that sells sandwiches, fruit, pastry and beverages, albeit at a fairly inflated price. You’re likely better off going to the Starbucks that is basically right next door.The reality is we were here for the location, and the price. The hotel was a place to sleep, and it was more the sufficient for that purpose, especially with such comfortable beds and pillows. You are literally steps away from Carnegie Hall, and minutes away from Central Park, Times Square, and Broadway. In terms of location, it’s pretty much perfect, but you can probably find a place just as convenient at a better price.

We were really looking forward to the New York leg of our trip. By the end of or stay - we couldn't wait to leave this hotel. Please take heed of ALL reviews here - as these are accurate and I wish we paid attention to more reviews rather than focusing on the positive reviews. I can imagine if you stayed for one or two nights - you could have a positive experience but our whole experience left a lot to be desired and the least positive by far out of 8 X Hotels we stayed in across the country. In the beginning....Check in experience was cold and impersonal - like most interactions we had in NYC - I can deal with this but when we got to our room after a full day traveling things went downhill...Our first room was on 7th floor - We made a few calls and laid on the bed to relax for a few minutes - this is when we noticed the NOISE from 7th Avenue - I figured the window was left open. Went to close - nope it's closed already. With 5 nights booked for this hotel - this was not tenable! We immediately went to 'Hotel Services' to complain and request a different room... They seemed surprised that we thought it was noisy - surely we are not the only ones to complain about this!? They commented that NY was a 'big city' and we should expect some noise....come on! I bet they wouldn't pay money to sleep in that room. Eventually they were accommodating but informed us they couldn't change our room until the following day...which was better than nothing we figured....Well that night I literally had no more than 2 hours sleep total. The street noise (cars, trucks, sirens, buses etc) was beyond a joke, I cannot over emphasize this enough - but what what took the cake was being able to hear a full conversation between 2 X people at 4am from our room from street level. Needless to say this ruined my next day due to the serious lack of sleep. Thankfully - the next day our room was ready by 3pm (we effectively checked out and in again) and this time was on 12th floor - facing the courtyard. No problems sacrificing a view to avoid the street noise. This room was much better, but only relatively speaking. We still had to deal with the sound and vibration from the room above us - think opening scene of Jurassic Park with the water rippling in the glass as the T-Rex approached. This literally happened. No cell phone service in room either. To be clear: I'm not a noise freak - but have never experienced a hotel like this, EVER! It was like a 4D amusement ride - not the good kind. The bed was terrible, my side of the bed sat at a downward angle like the springs were completely shot. Further to this - The room was tired and fittings were shabby - the toilet roll holder was broken and ignored by housekeeping daily. The fabric used in the bathroom makes the room almost impossible to keep clean. The elevators are ridiculously small and slow. Imagine the cartoons with the 50 x clowns getting out of the single clown cars!! Allow 5-10 minutes to get to the lobby. We requested a fridge - we were given one within about 2 hours of requesting - which was useful. Probably the most positive aspect of our experience! As for the location - which admittedly is good/central but bear in mind this comes with lots of tourist foot traffic. But it is NYC so this comes with the package. But - If I ever stay in NYC again, I wouldn't put too much emphasis on location as the NYC subway system is awesome and so cheap/easy to get around Manhattan (once you get your head around how the lines work and uptown vs. downtown etc). Finally - the 'Resort Fees' - absolute joke! This is simply a way for hotels like this to appear cost effective on the booking sites. We learnt our lesson on this twice on our trip, thinking our prepaid visit was all inclusive.... We got caught with another hotel with this 'tax' but honestly had no problem paying for it in Vegas given the quality of the hotel, room, amenities and staff at the Venetian.

Having been to NYC several times, decided on this hotel because of its location and a great price on Groupon. The service, location (a short walk to Central Park on one side and Times Square on the other) and rooms were perfect. I was pleasantly surprised with the staff as I had some reservations after reading Trip Advisor reviews. However, they were very friendly and aimed to please. Service was top notch. My only complaint was that they charge $33 USD per day for resort/hotel fees for things that were basic in virtually any hotel, including basic or budget hotels. These things were use of phone, computers, baggage hotel and use of gym ( for which only 3 out of 100 people use the front desk man told me, who uses a gym while in NYC anyway, you walk so much there's no need or time!. Or if you have a gym it should be pay per use. There were no restaurants, bar only opened at 5, no extras in the room such as mini fridge, coffee maker, etc.. And forget using their little snack bar in the lobby as it is outrageously expensive. Just step out the door and get your snacks anywhere for much less! Aside from this daily hotel fee, which is definitely not warranted, I would certainly recommend this hotel if you are looking to see the sights of NYC without wasting time travelling to them.

Nice hotel and conveniently located to everything. Will stay here again but will make sure to ask for a coffee pot at the front desk. Able to walk to Central Park, the Met, Times Square and many other places.
user_name:
TammyR355
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Initial impressions is nice... everything else is average... my main gripe is the the carpet looks like it has never been washed ever and there is no kettle or fridge.. why?But it's does earn point for being next to the subway station and you can get fresh air by opening the windows...

Stayed at Park Central hotel in a party of three. Arrived at the hotel at approximately 11pm. Initial thoughts were positive based on the location of the hotel, with Times Square in our sights. The hotel is situated in the main artery of Manhattan between Times Square and Central Park so it's ideal for first time travelers to experience the hustle and bustle of New York City. As we walked in we were greeted by a very stoic faced receptionist. Being used to over enthusiastic greeters in most of the hotels I've stayed at, I have to say this was slightly underwhelming. However she processed us through fairly quickly and were unpacking before we knew it. The room itself is clean and the beds comfortable, but not much more than that. The views out of the room were shocking, facing a brick wall and other rooms on either side. Not great when the room adjacent to you has an old man who has no issues getting changed in the full view of the general public. However given that we just needed a bed to sleep on this did not bother us too much. Do not buy from the tuck shop in the lobby. Prices are massively inflated, charging $7 for a bottle of water, I hope the water was sourced from the Himalayas itself. I am not surprised the USA is undergoing a massive health and fitness crisis with those prices. However again given the location there are grocery stores nearby who thankfully do not sell goods at extortionate prices. The gym was okay, fitness gurus would be screaming at the lack of barbells. Frankly you're better off getting a 2 hour cardio bike ride in at Central Park every morning.It was raining on the Friday, I was surprised that the hotel did not have any umbrellas for guests but you can purchase any amenities nearby. Again it didn't help having another receptionist who was not helpful.Room service woke us up once, however in fairness to them it was 9am and we didn't have a "do not disturb" sign on our door. So make sure you get the door signs if you're not an early bird.I think this is the main takeaway from this review is, it's a decent budget hotel with a great location. Would I stay here again? Probably, but better customer service could work wonders for this hotel.

Welcome to New Your City stayed in the Central Park Hotel on 7th Av one of the oldest hotel in New York, great location to the City center, Shopping and restaurants.The Hotel was clean and tidy the front desk staff were very helpful, you can book your tours from the front desk, the only but the bar could stay open longer and service hot bar food, apart from that nice hotel and we would return.

I had read some reviews that made me skeptical about our stay. But our room was very clean and very comfortable. Super comfy bed and everything looked new. Lines at check in and luggage drop off were a smidge long, but it was no big deal. Great location too.
user_name:
Joan D
New York City, New York

review_body: My daughters, aged 21 and 19 years old, stayed for two nights this weekend. I contacted the concierge team about organising a basket of fruit and goodies on their arrival, explaining it was a once in a lifetime trip for them. I was emailed back almost immediately both by Melissa from the team and the director of guest experience, Mr Hightower, offering a free upgrade to a Preferred Room and assurance that the girls would be looked after. The fruit basket was gorgeous, but more importantly, the girls had a wonderful time, were given the utmost of attention and couldn't rave more about their stay. Just a wonderful hotel in a perfect location, with guest attention second to none.

We stayed at Park Central for 3 nights and were overall really happy with the hotel. It was a long weekend break from the UK for my partners' Birthday and our first time in NYC. The really big selling point for this hotel is the prime location - a short walk away from both Times Square and Central Park with excellent links to MTA. The hotel is well presented and the decor smart and modern. Staff were polite, friendly, helpful when required and efficient. The room was really spacious - but the bathroom a little on the tight side - and clean, well equipped and generally smart to the eye. The bed was a big plus - paid a little extra for a big double but, boy, was it worth it! Soft, comfy, big pillows and more sleeping space than I think I've ever had. As a base to explore for three nights it was perfect - the adjustable air con was a plus in August. Good Wifi once we got the right info - and that was really the only niggle, there was no guide to the hotel and it's services available in the room, meaning we had to ask at concierge/reception a lot, e.g. Wifi instructions. But we always got a helpful answer so no real issue there. All in all a really great location that helped make a memorable weekend.

Great hotel in a great location only minutes away from Times Square . Everything you need for a Manhattan hotel. Hotel is situated right next to subway stop giving you easy and quick access to all the city. Would highly recommend to anyone on a business or leisure trip!!

Great place! It was nice, clean and the staff was friendly. It is a great location between Times Square and Central park with the subway around the corner. I would recommend this location because of its proximity to other sights as well.

We had booked a Time Square room at the Park Central Hotel for 4 nights in August. Upon arriving at the hotel, it was quite impressive, nice entrance and lounge, this is as far as our good experience goes unfortunately.We left our bags with the storage room as check in wasnt until 4pm. We returned at 4:00pm, lined up as everyone else did and was told our room was not ready until 4:30pm and to wait in the lounge and someone will come and get us when it is ready. No problems, we got a drink and waited. At 5:00pm I hop back into the line to get an update, and was told she needed to speak with the manager. Approximately 30 minutes later she comes back and says there is a problem with one of the beds in our room. She says she can give us an upgraded room to a Junior Suite (a room on the 18th floor) with 1 king bed and a fold out sofa which is the same size as a queen. I said no problem, we will do that and please give us an update on our Time Square Room which we had paid for. We got given complimentary breakfast at this point (which was only a pastry or fruit and a drink). Went up to room, was not happy with the 'upgrade' as it really was just a fold out sofa and a normal bed. Went back down to reception to let me know we were ok to take that room for the 1 night, however we were not happy to have that room for the entire 4 nights as it is definately not what we had paid for and was a limited view of time square also.The following day, I went to the managers desk and was told there was a room, however we would need to hold our bags in storage, come back at 4pm again and re check in. Said thats fine but we really only have 4 days in New York and we had already spent so much time wasted on this room issue. We got upstairs and started packing when I got a phone call to meet the manager on the 12th floor to see if a room was good to move to. At this point, we just wanted 2 separate normal beds to sleep on. Got to the room, even more limited view of Time Square (legit no view), a king bed and a double bed (we were supposed to have 2 queens) and later realised there was no fridge, no hair dryer, and no body wash left. The manager did advise that he would be waiving the facilities fees for the stay. In the mean time, I had called Laundry services to enquiry about getting our washing done, and they advised me there is no service on the weekends, however if you are wanting just wash and dry (no dry cleaning) that is complimentary and can be arranged at 7am Monday and dropped off at 4:00pm that day.So I called the reception on Sunday night and asked for a hair dryer, body wash and for someone to pick up our bag of washing at 7am. Again I confirmed with them that it was a complimentary service as it is not dry cleaning. I woke up at 7:45am and had to call again for someone to pick up our washing. Someone arrived and advised that the bag of washing would cost a substantial amount, to which I replied no it is complimentary. She very bluntly advised there is no such thing and this bag would cost a lot to have washed. I asked for the bag back and proceeded to call a manager. The manager I spoke to was extremely rude, kept talking over the top of me and challenged me to come downstairs to have "this conversation" with him face to face. After being extremely frustrated and shocked with the disgusting treatment we have had to endure over the 3 days of our 4 night stay, I hung up and was in tears for the rest of the day. When we returned that afternoon, a fridge had been delivered to our room (completely too late) and the pump the conditioner bottle was jammed so we couldn't use it. By this point, we had had enough communicating with the staff at this hotel, so decided not to even bother asking for it to be fixed.Upon check out, the only staff member who actually treated us with some-what respect, Nancy checked us out and could probably sense that we were seriously not happy. By this point I was drained, as the entire experience had really affected my trip. She said sorry for our experience, by that point I just wanted to get out of there.We were on a trip with approximately 10 other people, and ended up spending time at the Novatel Hotel at Time Square. We didnt spend any time in their rooms, however they have a roof top bar with the most amazing view of Time Square. After all, thats the whole reason why we came to New York and booked with this hotel for that view, so next time we will be staying there instead.

Recently spent 4 nights at the Park Central NYC with a family of 4. The location was excellent! Minutes walk to Central Park, Broadway theaters and Times Square. Room was very spacious for NYC standards and exceptionally clean. Elevators were a bit slow but we had no problem using the stairs. We opted for the $1 breakfast package and found that it was perfect for us. I required a refrigerator for medication and guest relations were very accommodating. Very friendly staff throughout the hotel. We would definitely stay at the Park Central again.

Located centrally close to Central Park and Times Square. Many subway stations close by. Many eateries also close by. Price is mid-range for Manhattan. Rooms are clean. We had 2 queen bedside beds for us and the kids. Rooms are not big, as one would expect in Manhattan. Sometimes the wait at the elevator was too long. Small elevators and stops on every floor. If you are staying on the side with elevators going to 3-9 it is better to be on the lower floors so you can walk down since you will be facing a brick wall anyway. Beds are comfortable. No amenities in the room; no coffee maker, no refrigerator. Make sure you buy enough water for your stay.

Check in was quite long. There were 18 people ahead of us and staff standing around chatting instead of helping us. We finally got to the room. I immediately took a shower ( long day of traveling) and went to do some banking. The room was tiny and pretty blah. My window looked into the center of the building. No view. Tried to login with the instructions I was given. Could not login. After spending a ridiculous amount of time trying I finally gave up. The next morning I went to the front desk to get help. Ah ha, the person who checked me in misspelled my name preventing me from logging in. Nice one. My name is not complicated in the least and very common, so I was baffled. No apology. The hotel also charged a $64 "fee" for amenities I had no use for. Will I stay here in the future? Probably not. Convenient location but that's about it.

I stayed in this hotel in 2008 and was just there from 7/8 to 13/8It was wonderful then and even better now.My kids enjoyed every minute of our stay.Everyone was wonderful.Benita and Christine (concierge) were very helpful even before I arrived.The hotel was close by to Times Square ,Central Park walking distance to almost everything.I will be back and will recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit New York.My only complain is the sound of police cars and ambulances can be heard through closed Windows

Very friendly staff from the start of my reservation. Nice room--a bit tight, but good. Comfy bed, clean bathroom plenty of towels, etc. Nice rain shower head. Staff is helpful and courteous. Housekeeping staff is very friendly, too. But I have found that no matter where I go, if I am friendly people are friendly back.

This is a nice hotel, good standard with excellent location. If you are considering New York for a first visit, this is great location to chose, primarily because it is close to relevant subways, away from the noise and hustle of Times Square and midtown, and close enough to enjoy the lovely Central Park.It's a busy and popular hotel, no doubt. This manifests itself more mornings and evenings when guests are leaving and returning to their rooms as there are not enough elevators to handle so much traffic due to one set of elevators not being operational. If there were more elevators operational I would rate this a 5 star.

I have been a travel agent for 40 years and have stayed in many hotels, this time I wanted to book a central hotel of a decent standard with sufficiently large rooms for 4 people and this is what the Park Central provided. very handy for Times Sq and Central Park.

Our family stayed here for 4 days and it could have not been any better, it's close to Times Square, Central Park and 5th ave; we had everything we needed close to us, places to shop, a place to relax and amazing nightlife. Definitely would recommend.

I needed a room for 2 nights and this hotel came up on groupon so I decided to take a chance. I travel often and have stayed at many different types of hotels. I was pleasantly surprised by the outstanding service. From the front desk to housekeeping every interaction was positive, even though it is a big hotel you feel comfortable. The room was lovely and the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was a nice size. The bellman were helpful and super friendly making sure you knew where you were going and you were taken care of. I needed more pillows and was taken care of right away, the gentleman that delivered them made sure I needed nothing else. I have to say I enjoyed my stay and it is in a great area, in the middle of everything.

It was an average hotel (very friendly staff!) - with an additional $31 USD / night that we weren't aware of until we got there unfortunately. It does mention the fees on the website - but not through Expedia. So if you book (anywhere) with Expedia - check the hotel FAQs website for hidden fees! From the website: "The mandatory Facilities Fee of $31 plus tax per room per night provides guests with the following amenities: - Unlimited Local and Domestic Long Distance Calls - Unlimited use of the 24-hour state-of-the-art Fitness Center - Luggage storage on arrival and/or departure up until 9:00 PM - Apple workstations with printing, faxing and scanning offered through our Guest Relations Team." We didn't end up using any of those services so it was kind of a bummer having to pay the fees. Lastly, skip the little store in the hotel lobby - you'll find much cheaper drinks/bagels outside of the hotel!

stayed there 5 nights in early august ..location is too good .. nothing to compare with it ... but the AC in the room kept going to heater , and this happened 3 times during our stay there ... and we had to wait minimum one hour for someone to come and fix it ... staff , generally good and courteous, but one of their THAI managers , despite being from thailand, which is a very polite and courteous country , is very rude.rooms and beds are cleaned and comfy ... no complaints about this ...but they don't have a fridge included in the room, u must ask for one , and if it's available, then u get it ...( that's my first time having this experience)overall ... i personally feel .. better pay 50$ extra per night , and stay hilton or sheraton .. name brands , much better .

This was my second stay. First time, a couple of years ago, the service was great and they had just remodeled the hotel. This time around, it was a disappointment. First off, there are many people in the lobby in lines like to leave their luggage (at least 10 people everytime I passed), there front desk is missing personnel and their attention to detail is nonexistent. I got a good deal so I decided to let it pass that I was in line to get checked in for at least a half hour. The rooms are a great size but you can tell they havent been maintained. The bathtub was a bit broken and some outlets didnt work. I had some packages delivered and couldnt belive they charge 10 usd per package and they are not even sent up to the room. I had to wait in one line and then rudely told I had to go back later because they were not on hand and then that another package was in guest services which had no one so again I waited a half hour even though at that time there was no one at the front desk waiting and someone could have helped. Another thing that surprised my was that the cleaning cart was outside my room all day long and even the night! They dont store it. Overall I love the location (right near Carnegie Hall and the subway entrance is on the corner) and got a good price but would not stay here if you are going to need any help from the staff.

The Park Central is located just two blocks from Central Park and three blocks from Time Square. It's easy to walk to the theater district or the subway. The rooms are clean. The elevators are small and not too fast. The staff is helpful. There is a nice area behind the lobby for computer use.

Great location - a terrific launching point to take in all NYC has to offer. The rooms were modern, clean, and the staff friendly. Walking distance to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's, Time Square, and the Theatre District.

Located in Midtown Manhattan within walking distance to Times Square and Central Park, with eateries and parking lots all very close, this large hotel accommodated dignitaries such as Eleanor Roosevelt, Mae West, Jackie Gleason, and even me! (lol) Staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and courteous. Check-in and check-out lines can sometimes be long, but they try to keep things going quickly. Interior rooms don't have a scenic view (unless you consider AC units scenic).(Room AC worked well and allowed individual control) I'm guessing the outer rooms afford more pleasant views of the city and the Hudson. The room and bed were clean and inviting--however, we did not have the ubiquitous coffee maker, microwave, or refrigerator that one might find in other hotels---luckily, we didn't need them. Our room was in a far interior corner, so we experienced no noise from elevators, ice machines, or guest traffic---don't know if that's an issue at this hotel.Didn't get a chance to check out any of the amenities, such as the gym. Lower rates can be had by checking Groupon, Trivago, and other sites. If you haven't stayed in New York City before, be prepared to pay state, city, occupancy taxes, as well as a mandated facilities fee.Would certainly consider another stay here.

We were very happy with our stay at the Park Central Hotel. Came all the way from JFK on the E Train arriving within 2 blocks...even at rush hour this was so easy! Rooms are clean and well-appointed, staff friendly and knowledgeable and concierge especially helpful. Lots of great dining in the area, especially a few blocks away near Columbus Circle. Would definitely stay here again on our next visit!

My wife and I traveled to NYC for our son's marriage proposal. We booked our stay at the Park Central Hotel through Groupon. We read many of the reviews beforehand so we were aware of the "complaints" of other guests. (no refrigerator in the room, the facilities fee, etc.) We also did some research on the hotel's website so we knew what to expect and how to overcome what others viewed as negatives. I must say that from the moment of our arrival to our check out, we had nothing but a wonderful experience. The rooms were very nice, clean and for the most part, good-sized. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The location was perfect. We could not have asked for better service. So, as you're reading the comments of others, keep in mind that some folks are always looking for a way to be critical. I almost let the negatives that I had read in the reviews of others scare me away from the Park Central Hotel. But I can assure you, you will not be disappointed in your visit. I have nothing but wonderful things to say about this hotel. I will definitely consider the Park Central when planning my next trip to NYC.

Great position, between Time Square and Central Park , a Subway Station just round the corner , nice facilities along the street!The hotel is plain but clean, the staff is generally kind, the congierge and the guest attendants are exceptional , I can't say the same thing for the receptionist.....The rooms are a bit noisy but clean enough.

Great hotel, really good location (near Central Park and Times Square). NO fridge in the room, which is a disappointment. Elevators are fine if you are below the 9th floor. Bed is comfortable.Staff is okay, but not really welcoming.

The location is great - very close to the south end of Central Park and a short walk to Times Square and the theatre district. The rooms are clean and comfortable but very basic - no mini-fridge or coffee maker, no bathrobes, bathroom was clean but dated. No restaurant on-site though they are affiliated with one just down the street where they guarantee reservations for guests at the hotel. It would have been nice to have a place to eat breakfast on site. There's is a little market with baked goods, fresh fruit, etc, but no hot food. The concierge was helpful, but there is only one on duty at a time so the wait to speak to her was often lengthy. In addition to providing information about the hotel and the city, she sold tourist packages for attractions, and explaining them could be a very long process. Once the package was purchased, we still had to go to a tourist help centre to redeem the vouchers, which was another fairly long wait. I felt this was an inefficient process. Overall, the hotel itself is fine, but I felt the customer service could be improved.

Had pre-payed for 2 adjoining rooms, one king and the other 2 queens.After travelling near on 15 hours we arrived to a very snotty receptionist who informed us that due to the hotel being busy, they only had king beds in both rooms - not acceptable for my children who are male and female! Snotty didn't apologise and stood waiting for us to agree - don't think so. In the end we had a roll away bed put into the room until the next day when they just about put us on the same floor (completely at the end of the hall from ea h other).The rooms themselves were in need of decorating and the furniture needed replacing.If you have a car, don't bother with the valet as they charge $75 per day - the parking garage they use is on the side road and they charge $40 when the hotel stamps your ticket!

This was our second stay and we like the hotel's location. It is clean. Staff is friendly but our stay this time was less than satisfactory because the outside noises at night are very loud and continued til at least 3 am. We were on the 9 th floor and it felt like there was construction, banging and yelling right beside us. Even with ear plugs it was hard to sleep. Maybe a higher floor or different location would help but it was disappointing

My collegues and I always stay in Park Central Hotel at least once a year. This time was our second visit at the hotel in 2017 and we were pleased with our stay.The location is wonderful, the staff were friendly and the rooms were clean and confortable as always.

Stayed here for four nights on a trip with the Iron Maiden Fan Club. This was my first trip to America. The location is excellent and easy to get to by subway. The rooms are huge, very clean, free internet and great air conditioning. The beds are really comfy and you have lots of hanging/drawer space. The bar is lovely. The staff were all really friendly. Only a few minute's walk from Times Square and the Broadway Theatres. The Rockefeller Centre and Empire State Building are close by as well. Plenty of restaurants and pubs in the vicinity. Couldn't have asked for a better hotel location.There was a heatwave in New York when I was there so I didn't manage to do everything I had planned so I hope to be visiting the Park Central again soon.

Happy with the room and would stay again. Great location, clean, friendly and helpful staff. My only disappointment was no coffee pot in the room but experience tells me this is very common for hotels in other large cities also.

I booked a room here back in late April for May. We were visiting NY for my girlfriend's birthday. It was an amazing stay! The room was very clean and spacious. There was 2 things that could have been better.. the lightening in the room. I get that it's supposed to be intimate. However, it was really dark next to the full body mirror. Also the bathroom , the door blocks the tub. You have to squeeze pat and close it if you want to get in the shower. Other than that, the stay was amazing. The front desk was super helpful. They held my girls friends flowers for me so I could surprise her. As well as writing her a note and left cupcakes. I mean the stay was amazing. The view was pretty decent as well. I would definitely stay in the Times Square room next time!!!

Updated friendly hotel in the heart of the Theatre District. Minutes to Broadway, Times Square and the Park. Elevators are not fast or large but it works at an affordable price. No real dining experience but steps to some of the best restaurants in Manhattan.

We spent the 4th of July weekend at the Park Central. The rooms were decent and the hotel location was fantastic. Walking distance from central park as well as Times Square without being in the most crowded parts. The hotel could add a few extra elevators as the wait gets too long.But overall good value for money!

I expected New York City hotel rooms to be cramped and expensive. The Park Central Hotel proved me wrong. I was WOWED by the roomy accommodations, the nicest bath in two months of traveling, and a remarkably comfortable bed. All of this was located three blocks from Central Park and just a block from Carnegie Hall. While the price wasn't cheap, it was surprisingly affordable. I decided that an hourlong horse drawn carriage ride through Central Park was called for. The price for that was the same as I had paid for ten minutes in a helicopter over Sedona, Arizona. Both were worth it.

Our stay at this hotel was wonderful. We has a lovely, big and cozy room with a city street view. We enjoyed our time there and the room. Trust-worthy staff and workers.The morning we left the hotel, we forgot our Tablet in the hotel room. We called the hotel that evening, and they kept it save and secure for us. They were able to mail it to us, and it arrived in two days. Great people.

I booked this for a bit of sight seeing whilst on the way to Washington DC. It was a nice and comfortable hotel, with a good situation. I paid a little extra for a higher floor, which was worth it I think though I was facing away from the park, so perhaps not as great a view as it could have been!The staff in the bar were very friendly and chatty and gave that 'authentic american bar tender' view you often see on TV and in films.There were a couple of things that didn't make my visit great though. There was a 'compulsory' facilities fee I had to pay, which they say covered the costs of using the fitness suite, and the business centre etc. As I had no intention of using those, I felt quite conned. Surely, if it's compulsory and everybody has to pay it then it should be included in the room rate. If not, then people should only have to pay it if they actually want to use those facilities. It just ends up making the price look more attractive to get you to book it.The front desk staff were not the friendliest. I went to the Concierge desk to ask a relatively convoluted question. After I had asked, the staff member just said, oh i'm not the concierge, I work the front desk I'm just waiting for my colleague to finish' and wandered off... Never mind...There was no restaurant which seemed a bit weird, but plenty of places to eat nearby. The $1 breakfast was acceptable, though only filter coffee, so I couldn't have decaf. I was hungry one morning and went for another croissant which cost me nearly $10...Overall, it's a nice comfortable place to rest your head. Don't trouble the front desk staff and budget an extra $30-$40 per night, and you'll be fine.

The hotel is a 5min walk from central park and 15 min walk from Times Square. As there are so many activities and restaurants within easy access of this hotel, it is less relevant therefore that the hotel's amenities are very basic. There is no breakfast offering and no gym. It generally lacks soul. However the rooms are well appointed (although no coffee facilities), quiet and modern, with strong wifi connectivity. This is a comfortable stay.
user_name:
GarethKZN
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: After reading the mostly positive reviews for Park Central, I thought I would give it a try for 3 nights, part business, part leisure. Unfortunately, my husband and I were less than impressed. Park Central is very much a no-frills hotel, which would be fine except that they charge a $35/night resort fee that does not include anything more than what other hotels provide for free (wifi, fitness center, and business center) along with some services that might only be of value to international travelers (free local phone calls from the room). There is no bottled water in the room (free or for purchase), no pen, no note paper. No nothing. We purchased 2 beverages in the market downstairs, a Coke and a lemonade. $9! My husband walked to Duane Reade to purchase water. The room was very poorly lit and showing signs of wear. The toilet paper holder was broken and the paper was just hanging off of one working side. Instead of calling maintenance, I decided to see what would happen if I pulled the roll off so housekeeping would have no choice but to notice. Housekeeping put the roll right back on the broken holder! There was a stain on one pillow case and I took the pillow off of the bed and placed it on the floor, stain prominently showing. Housekeeping put it back on the bed! The paint on the walls was chipping and the carpet had lots of light colored stains. I did not feel comfortable taking my shoes off. Also, at all times in the day or night, if the street noise from our 11th floor room was not enough, the hallway was extremely loud, with every sound and conversation traveling into our room. For the positives: The bathroom was otherwise clean and the water pressure/temperature was good. Location was great for walking and also convenient to several subway lines. The front desk staff seemed indifferent but the concierge staff was very friendly and helpful. Based on this experience, I would not return to this hotel.

This was a great location for walking around lots of Manhattan. The room was clean and had lots of outlets, a big plus. The basic amenities were all provided. We did not use any additional services - food, etc. There are plenty of options close by. Its a very easy walk to Central Park.

This is a Classic hotel with modern comforts style and amenities. In walking distance to all of midtown. Helpful,friendly staff. Only slow elevators and an added resort-type charge keep it from another star.

The Park Central has a great location - within walking distance of the theater district, Carnegie Hall, Central Park and more. There's a nice variety of restaurants, souvenir and other shops nearby. Tour buses and subways are just steps from the front door. The hotel updates are attractive and very comfortable. The staff are exceptional from the front door to the concierge to housekeeping and maintenance staff. Two suggestions for the hotel. I was with a group staying there, and we all liked the hotel but commented on the poorly positioned lighting in the bathrooms which makes it difficult to see for shaving or makeup application. Lights over or beside the mirror are needed. An extension mirror with a lighted frame would be an inexpensive interim solution. There are no refrigerated mini-bars in the rooms to keep medications, etc. The $75 per day cost to rent a small refrigerator was prohibitive, and the ice buckets were poor insulators. Fortunately the staff found a way to freeze the cold pack for me for the next leg of my trip.
